40 1:1 The book of the generation of Jesus Christ, the Son of David, the Son of Abraham. 40 1:2 Abraham begot Isaac, and Isaac begot Jacob, and Jacob begot Judah and his brethren. 40 1:3 And Judah begot Perez and Zerah by Tamar, and Perez begot Hezron, and Hezron begot Ram. 40 1:4 And Ram begot Amminadab, and Amminadab begot Nahshon, and Nahshon begot Salmon. 40 1:5 And Salmon begot Boaz by Rahab, and Boaz begot Obed by Ruth, and Obed begot Jesse, 40 1:6 and Jesse begot David the king, and David the king begot Solomon by her who had been the wife of Uriah. 40 1:7 And Solomon begot Rehoboam, and Rehoboam begot Abijah, and Abijah begot Asa. 40 1:8 And Asa begot Jehoshaphat, and Jehoshaphat begot Joram, and Joram begot Uzziah, 40 1:9 And Uzziah begot Jotham, and Jotham begot Ahaz, and Ahaz begot Hezekiah. 40 1:10 And Hezekiah begot Manasseh, and Manasseh begot Amon, and Amon begot Josiah. 40 1:11 And Josiah begot Jechoniah and his brethren, about the time they were carried away to Babylon. 40 1:12 And after they were brought to Babylon, Jechoniah begot Shealtiel, and Shealtiel begot Zerubbabel. 40 1:13 And Zerubbabel begot Abiud, and Abiud begot Eliakim, and Eliakim begot Azor. 40 1:14 And Azor begot Zadoc, and Zadoc begot Achim, and Achim begot Eliud. 40 1:15 And Eliud begot Eleazar, and Eleazar begot Matthan, and Matthan begot Jacob. 40 1:16 And Jacob begot Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ. 40 1:17 So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations, and from David until the carrying away into Babylon are fourteen generations, and from the carrying away into Babylon to Christ are fourteen generations. 40 1:18 Now the birth of Jesus Christ happened this way: After His mother Mary was betrothed to Joseph before they came together, she was found with child from the Holy Spirit. 40 1:19 Then Joseph her husband, being a just man, and not willing to make her a public example, was minded to put her away privately. 40 1:20 But while he thought on these things, behold, the angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, "Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take to yourself Mary your wife, because that which is conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit. 40 1:21 And she will bear a Son, and you shall call His name JESUS, because He will save His people from their sins." 40 1:22 So all this was done that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying: 40 1:23 "Behold, a virgin will be with child, and will bear a Son, and they will call His name Immanuel," which being translated is, "God with us." 40 1:24 Then Joseph being raised from sleep, did as the angel of the Lord had commanded him, and took to him his wife, 40 1:25 and did not know her until she had brought forth her firstborn Son. And he called His name JESUS. 40 2:1 Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of Herod the king, behold, wise men from the east came to Jerusalem, 40 2:2 saying, "Where is He who has been born King of the Jews? Since we have seen His star in the east and have come to worship Him." 40 2:3 When Herod the king had heard these things, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him. 40 2:4 And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he demanded of them where Christ would be born. 40 2:5 And they said to him, "In Bethlehem of Judea, because, thus it is written by the prophet: 40 2:6 'And you Bethlehem, in the land of Judah, are not the least among the rulers of Judah; because out of you will come a Ruler that will rule My people Israel.'" 40 2:7 Then Herod, when he had privately called the wise men, diligently inquired of them what time the star appeared. 40 2:8 And he sent them to Bethlehem and said, "Go and search diligently for the young Child, and when you have found Him, bring back word to me, that I may come and worship Him also." 40 2:9 After they heard the king, they departed; and behold, the star which they had seen in the east, went before them, until it came and stood over where the young Child was. 40 2:10 When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceedingly great joy. 40 2:11 And when they had come into the house, they saw the young Child with Mary His mother, and fell down, and worshiped Him. And when they had opened their treasures, they presented gifts to Him: gold, frankincense, and myrrh. 40 2:12 And being warned by God in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they departed into their own country another way. 40 2:13 Now when they had departed, behold, the angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying, "Arise, take the young Child and His mother, flee into Egypt, and wait there until I bring you word; because Herod will seek the young Child to destroy Him." 40 2:14 When he arose, he took the young Child and His mother by night and departed into Egypt, 40 2:15 and was there until the death of Herod, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying, "Out of Egypt I have called My Son." 40 2:16 Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked because of the wise men, was exceedingly angry; and he sent forth and killed all the children who were in Bethlehem and in all of its districts, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had diligently inquired of the wise men. 40 2:17 Then was fulfilled that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet, saying: 40 2:18 "A voice was heard in Ramah, lamentation, weeping, and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children, and would not be comforted, because they are no more." 40 2:19 But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt, 40 2:20 saying, "Arise, and take the young Child and His mother, and go into the land of Israel, because those who sought the young Child's life are dead." 40 2:21 Then he arose, and took the young Child and His mother, and came into the land of Israel. 40 2:22 But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning in Judea in the position of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there. However being warned of God in a dream, he turned aside into the region of Galilee. 40 2:23 And he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophets, "He will be called a Nazarene." 40 3:1 In those days John the Baptist came preaching in the wilderness of Judea, 40 3:2 and saying, "Repent, because the kingdom of heaven is at hand!" 40 3:3 Because, this is he who was spoken of through the prophet Isaiah, saying: "The voice of one shouting in the wilderness: 'Prepare the way of the LORD; make His paths straight.'" 40 3:4 Now John himself was clothed in camel's hair, with a leather belt around his waist; and his food was locusts and wild honey. 40 3:5 Then Jerusalem, all Judea, and all the region around the Jordan went out to him 40 3:6 and were baptized by him in the Jordan, confessing their sins. 40 3:7 But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism, he said to them, "O generation of vipers! Who has warned you to escape from the wrath to come? 40 3:8 Therefore bear fruits worthy of repentance, 40 3:9 and do not think to say within yourselves, 'we have Abraham as our father.' Because, I say to you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones. 40 3:10 And even now the axe is laid to the root of the trees. Therefore every tree which does not produce good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire. 40 3:11 I indeed baptize you with water for repentance, but He who is coming after me is mightier than me, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire. 40 3:12 His winnowing fan is in His hand, and He will thoroughly clean His threshing floor, and gather His wheat into the storehouse; but He will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire." 40 3:13 Then Jesus came from Galilee to John at the Jordan to be baptized by him. 40 3:14 But John prevented Him, saying, "I need to be baptized by You, and are You coming to me?" 40 3:15 But Jesus answered and said to him, "Permit it to be so now, because it is fitting for us to fulfill all righteousness." Then he allowed Him. 40 3:16 And when He was baptized, Jesus came up immediately from the water; and behold, the heavens were opened to Him, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove, and lighting upon Him. 40 3:17 And behold a voice from heaven, saying, "This is My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased." 40 4:1 Then Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil. 40 4:2 And when He had fasted forty days and forty nights, afterward He was hungry. 40 4:3 Now when the tempter came to Him, he said, "If You are the Son of God, command that these stones become bread." 40 4:4 But He replied and said, "It is written, 'Man will not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceeds from the mouth of God.'" 40 4:5 Then the devil took Him up into the holy city, and set Him on a pinnacle of the temple, 40 4:6 and said to Him, "If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down. Because it is written: 'He will give His angels orders concerning You,' and, 'in their hands they will hold You up, lest at any time You strike Your foot against a stone.'" 40 4:7 Jesus said to him, "It is written again, 'You shall not tempt the LORD your God.'" 40 4:8 Again, the devil took Him up onto a very high mountain, and showed Him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory. 40 4:9 And he said to Him, "I will give You all these things, if You will fall down and worship me." 40 4:10 Then Jesus said to Him, "Leave Satan! Because it is written, 'You shall worship the LORD your God, and Him only shall you serve.'" 40 4:11 Then the devil left Him, and behold, angels came and ministered to Him. 40 4:12 Now when Jesus had heard that John had been thrown into prison, He departed to Galilee. 40 4:13 And leaving Nazareth, He came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is by the sea coast, in the regions of Zebulun and Naphtali, 40 4:14 that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying: 40 4:15 "The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, by the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles: 40 4:16 The people who sat in darkness have seen a great Light, and upon those who sat in the region and shadow of death Light has dawned." 40 4:17 From that time Jesus began to preach, and to say, "Repent, because the kingdom of heaven is at hand." 40 4:18 And Jesus, walking by the sea of Galilee, saw two brethren, Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea; because they were fishermen. 40 4:19 And He said to them, "Follow Me, and I will make you fishers of men." 40 4:20 And they immediately left their nets, and followed Him. 40 4:21 And going on from there, He saw two more brethren, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in a boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets, and He called them. 40 4:22 And immediately they left the boat and their father, and followed Him. 40 4:23 Then Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all types of sickness and every kind of disease among the people. 40 4:24 And His fame went throughout all Syria; and they brought to Him every sick person who was afflicted with various diseases and torments, and those who were possessed with demons, those who were insane, and paralytics; and He healed them. 40 4:25 And large crowds of people followed Him from Galilee, and from Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and beyond the Jordan. 40 5:1 And seeing the crowds, He went up on a mountain, and when He was seated His disciples came to Him. 40 5:2 Then He opened His mouth and taught them, saying: 40 5:3 "Blessed are the poor in spirit, because theirs is the kingdom of heaven." 40 5:4 Blessed are those who mourn, because they will be comforted." 40 5:5 Blessed are the meek, because they will inherit the earth." 40 5:6 Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, because they will be filled." 40 5:7 Blessed are the merciful, because they will obtain mercy." 40 5:8 Blessed are the pure in heart, because they will see God." 40 5:9 Blessed are the peacemakers, because they will be called the children of God." 40 5:10 Blessed are those who are persecuted for righteousness' sake, because theirs is the kingdom of heaven." 40 5:11 "Blessed are you when men revile you, persecute you, and say all kinds of evil against you falsely, for My sake." 40 5:12 Rejoice, and be exceedingly glad, because great is your reward in heaven, because they also persecuted the prophets who were before you." 40 5:13 "You are the salt of the earth; but if the salt has lost its flavor, how will it be salted? It is then good for nothing but to be thrown out and to be trampled underfoot by men." 40 5:14 "You are the light of the world. A city that is set on a hill cannot be hidden." 40 5:15 Nor do men light a lamp and put it under a basket, but on a lampstand, and it gives light to all who are in the house." 40 5:16 Let your light shine like this before men, that they may see your good works and glorify your Father who is in heaven." 40 5:17 "Do not think that I came to destroy the law or the prophets. I did not come to destroy but to fulfill." 40 5:18 Because, truly, I say to you, until heaven and earth pass away, one jot or one tittle will by no means pass from the law, until all is fulfilled." 40 5:19 Whoever therefore breaks one of these least commandments, but teaches men so, he will be called the least in the kingdom of heaven; but whoever does and teaches them, they will be called great in the kingdom of heaven." 40 5:20 Because, I say to you, that unless your righteousness exceeds the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees, you will by no means enter into the kingdom of heaven." 40 5:21 "You have heard that it was said by those of old times, 'You shall not murder, and whoever murders will be in danger of the judgment.'" 40 5:22 But I say to you that whoever is angry with his brother without a cause will be in danger of the judgment. And whoever shall say to his brother, 'Raca!' will be in danger of the council. But whoever says, 'You fool!' will be in danger of hell fire." 40 5:23 Therefore if you bring your gift to the altar, and there remember that your brother has something against you," 40 5:24 leave your gift there before the altar, and go your way. First be reconciled to your brother, and then come and offer your gift." 40 5:25 Agree with your adversary quickly, while you are on the way with him, lest at any time your adversary deliver you to the judge, and the judge deliver you to the officer, and you be thrown into prison." 40 5:26 Truly, I say to you, you will by no means come out of there until you have paid the last penny." 40 5:27 "You have heard that it was said by those of old times, 'You shall not commit adultery.'" 40 5:28 But I say to you that whoever looks on a woman to lust after her has committed adultery with her already in his heart." 40 5:29 And if your right eye offends you, pluck it out, and cast it from you; because, it is more profitable for you that one of your members should perish, than your entire body to be thrown into hell." 40 5:30 And if your right hand offends you, cut it off and cast it from you; because, it is more profitable for you that one of your members should perish, and not that your entire body be cast into hell." 40 5:31 "It has been said, 'whoever puts away his wife, let him give her a certificate of divorce.'" 40 5:32 But I say to you, that whoever puts away his wife for any reason except sexual immorality, causes her to commit adultery; and whoever marries a woman who is divorced commits adultery." 40 5:33 "Again, you have heard that it has been said to those of old times, 'You shall not swear falsely, but shall perform your oaths to the Lord.'" 40 5:34 But I say to you, do not swear at all: neither by heaven, because it is God's throne;" 40 5:35 nor by the earth, because it is His footstool; nor by Jerusalem, because it is the city of the great King." 40 5:36 Neither shall you swear by your head, because you cannot make one hair white or black." 40 5:37 But let your communication be, 'yes,' 'yes,' or 'no,' 'no.' Because whatever goes beyond these is from evil." 40 5:38 "You have heard that it has been said, 'An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.'" 40 5:39 But I tell you that you should not resist a wicked person. But whoever slaps you on your right cheek, turn the other to him also." 40 5:40 And if anyone wants to sue you at the law and take away your coat, let him have your cloak also." 40 5:41 And whoever compels you to go one mile, go two with him." 40 5:42 Give to him who asks you, and from him who wants to borrow from you do not turn away." 40 5:43 "You have heard that it has been said, 'You shall love your neighbor and hate your enemy.'" 40 5:44 But I say to you, Love your enemies, bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who spitefully use you and persecute you," 40 5:45 that you may be the children of your Father who is in heaven; because, He makes His sun to rise on the evil and on the good, and sends rain on the just and on the unjust." 40 5:46 Because, if you love those who love you, what reward do you gain? Do not even the tax collectors do the same?" 40 5:47 And if you only greet your brethren, what do you do more than others? Do not even tax collectors do so?" 40 5:48 Therefore be perfect, just as your Father in heaven is perfect." 40 6:1 "Beware that you do not do your charitable deeds in front of men, to be seen by them. Otherwise you have no reward from your Father who is in heaven." 40 6:2 Therefore, when you do your charitable deeds, do not sound a trumpet before you, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory from men. Truly, I say to you, they have their reward." 40 6:3 But when you do charitable deeds, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing," 40 6:4 that your charitable deeds may be in secret; and your Father who sees in secret will Himself reward you openly." 40 6:5 "And when you pray, you shall not be like the hypocrites are. Because, they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen by men. Truly, I say to you, they have their reward." 40 6:6 But you, when you pray, go into your room, and when you have shut your door, pray to your Father who is in secret; and your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly." 40 6:7 But when you pray, do not use vain repetitions, as the heathen do. Because, they think that they will be heard because of their many words." 40 6:8 "Therefore do not be like them. Because, your Father knows the things you have need of before you ask Him." 40 6:9 In this manner, therefore, pray: Our Father who is in heaven, hallowed be Your name." 40 6:10 Your kingdom come. Your will be done, on earth, as it is in heaven." 40 6:11 Give us this day our daily bread." 40 6:12 And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors." 40 6:13 And do not lead us into temptation, but deliver us from evil. Because, Yours is the kingdom and the power and the glory forever. Amen." 40 6:14 "Because, if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you." 40 6:15 But if you do not forgive men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses." 40 6:16 "Moreover, when you fast, do not be like the hypocrites, with a sad countenance. Because, they disfigure their faces, that they may appear to men to be fasting. Truly, I say to you, they have their reward." 40 6:17 But you, when you fast, anoint your head, and wash your face," 40 6:18 so that you do not appear to men to be fasting, but to your Father who is in that secret place; and your Father who sees in secret, will reward you openly." 40 6:19 "Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and rust corrupts, and where thieves break in and steal;" 40 6:20 but store up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust corrupts, and where thieves do not break in nor steal." 40 6:21 Because, where your treasure is, there will your heart be also." 40 6:22 "The light of the body is the eye. Therefore if your eye is single, your entire body will be full of light." 40 6:23 But if your eye is corrupt, your entire body will be filled with darkness. Therefore if the light that is in you is darkness, how great is that darkness!" 40 6:24 "No one can serve two masters; because, either he will hate the one and love the other, or else he will be loyal to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and mammon." 40 6:25 "Therefore I say to you, do not be anxious about your life, what you shall eat or what you shall drink; nor about your body, what you shall put on. Is not this life more than food and the body more than clothing?" 40 6:26 Look at the birds of the air, because, they neither sow nor reap nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not of much more value than them?" 40 6:27 Which of you by being anxious can add one cubit to his stature?" 40 6:28 "So why do you worry about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow: they neither toil nor spin;" 40 6:29 and yet I say to you that even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these." 40 6:30 Now if God clothes the grass of the field like that, which today exists, and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, will He not much more clothe you, O you of little faith?" 40 6:31 "Therefore do not worry, saying, 'What shall we eat?' or, 'What shall we drink?' or, 'What shall we wear?'" 40 6:32 (Because, the Gentiles seek after all these things.) Because your heavenly Father knows that you have need of all these things." 40 6:33 But you, seek first the kingdom of God and His righteousness, and all these things will be added to you." 40 6:34 Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, because tomorrow will be concerned for the issues of itself. Sufficient for the day is its own evil." 40 7:1 "Judge not, that you be not judged." 40 7:2 Because, with the judgment you judge, you will be judged; and with the measure you use, it will be measured back to you." 40 7:3 And why do you look at the speck that is in your brother's eye, but do not consider the plank that is in your own eye?" 40 7:4 Or how can you say to your brother, 'Let me remove the speck from your eye'; and behold, a plank is in your own eye?" 40 7:5 You hypocrite! First remove the plank from your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother's eye." 40 7:6 "Do not give that which is holy to the dogs; nor cast your pearls before swine, lest they trample them under their feet, and turn again and attack you." 40 7:7 "Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you." 40 7:8 Because, everyone who asks receives, and he who seeks finds, and to him that knocks it will be opened." 40 7:9 Or what man is there among you, who if his son asks for bread, will give him a stone?" 40 7:10 Or if he asks for a fish, will he give him a serpent?" 40 7:11 If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask Him?" 40 7:12 Therefore, everything you would like men to do to you, so likewise you do to them, because this is the Law and the Prophets." 40 7:13 "Enter in through the narrow gate; because, the gate is wide and the way is broad that leads to destruction, and there are many who go in through it." 40 7:14 Because, the gate is narrow and the way is narrow that leads to life, and there are few who find it." 40 7:15 "Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep's clothing, but inwardly they are ravenous wolves." 40 7:16 You will know them by their fruits. Do men gather grapes from thornbushes, or figs from thistles?" 40 7:17 Likewise every good tree bears good fruit, but a bad tree bears bad fruit." 40 7:18 A good tree cannot bear bad fruit, nor can a bad tree bear good fruit." 40 7:19 Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire." 40 7:20 Therefore by their fruits you will know them." 40 7:21 "Not everyone who says to Me, 'Lord, Lord,' shall enter into the kingdom of heaven, but he who does the will of My Father who is in heaven." 40 7:22 Many will say to Me in that day, 'Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in Your name, cast out demons in Your name, and done many wonderful works in Your name?'" 40 7:23 And then will I declare to them, 'I never knew you; depart from me, you who practice iniquity!'" 40 7:24 "Therefore whoever hears these sayings of Mine, and does them, I will liken him to a wise man, who built his house on a rock:" 40 7:25 and the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew and beat upon that house; and it did not fall, because it was founded on a rock." 40 7:26 "But everyone who hears these sayings of Mine, and does not do them, will be likened to a foolish man who built his house on the sand:" 40 7:27 and the rain descended, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat upon that house; and it fell. And great was its fall." 40 7:28 And so it happened, when Jesus had ended these sayings, that the people were astonished at His doctrine, 40 7:29 because, He taught them as one having authority, and not as the scribes. 40 8:1 When He had come down from the mountain, large crowds followed Him. 40 8:2 And behold, a leper came and worshiped Him, saying, "Lord, if you are willing, You can make me clean." 40 8:3 And Jesus put out His hand, and touched him, saying, "I am willing; be cleansed." And immediately his leprosy was cleansed. 40 8:4 And Jesus said to him, "See that you tell no one; but go your way, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them." 40 8:5 Now when Jesus had entered into Capernaum, a centurion came to Him, pleading with Him, 40 8:6 saying, "Lord, my servant is lying at home paralyzed, afflicted terribly. 40 8:7 And Jesus said to Him, "I will come and heal him." 40 8:8 The centurion replied and said, "Lord, I am not worthy that You should come under my roof. But only speak a word, and my servant will be healed. 40 8:9 Because, I also am a man under authority, having soldiers under me. And I say to this man, 'Go,' and he goes; and to another, 'Come,' and he comes; and to my servant, 'Do this,' and he does it." 40 8:10 When Jesus heard it, He marveled, and said to those who followed, "Truly I say to you, I have not found such great faith, no, not even in Israel!" 40 8:11 And I say to you, that many will come from the east and west, and will sit down with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, in the kingdom of heaven." 40 8:12 But the children of the kingdom will be cast out into outer darkness. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth." 40 8:13 And Jesus said to the centurion, "Go your way; and as you have believed, so let it be done for you." And his servant was healed that same hour. 40 8:14 Now when Jesus had come into Peter's house, He saw his wife's mother lying down, and sick with a fever. 40 8:15 So He touched her hand, and the fever left her. And she arose, and ministered to them. 40 8:16 When the evening had come, they brought to Him many who were possessed with demons. And He cast out the spirits with His word, and healed all who were sick, 40 8:17 that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying, "He Himself took our weaknesses, and bore our sicknesses." 40 8:18 Now when Jesus saw large crowds around Him, He gave orders to depart to the other side. 40 8:19 Then a certain scribe came and said to him, "Teacher, I will follow You wherever You go." 40 8:20 And Jesus said to Him, "The foxes have holes and the birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay His head." 40 8:21 Then another of His disciples said to Him, "Lord, firstly permit me to go and bury my father." 40 8:22 But Jesus said to him, "Follow Me; and let the dead bury their dead." 40 8:23 Now when He got into a boat, His disciples followed Him. 40 8:24 And behold, a large tempest arose on the sea, so much so that the boat was covered with the waves. But He was asleep. 40 8:25 Then his disciples came to Him, and woke Him, saying, "Lord, save us! We are perishing." 40 8:26 But He said to them, "Why are you fearful, O you of little faith?" Then He arose, and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a great calm. 40 8:27 So the men marveled, saying, "What type of man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey Him?" 40 8:28 And when He had come to the other side, to the country of the Gergesenes, there met Him two demon possessed men, coming out of the tombs, exceedingly fierce, so that no one could pass through that way. 40 8:29 And behold they shouted out, saying, "What have we to do with You, Jesus, You Son of God? Have You come here to torment us before the time? 40 8:30 Now a long distance away from them there was a herd of many swine feeding. 40 8:31 So the demons begged Him, saying, "If You cast us out, permit us to go away into the herd of swine." 40 8:32 And He said to them, "Go." So when they had come out, they went into the herd of swine. And, behold the entire herd of swine ran violently down the steep place into the sea, and drowned in the waters. 40 8:33 Then those who kept them fled, and they went away into the city and told everything, including what had happened to the demon possessed men. 40 8:34 And, behold, the entire city came out to meet Jesus. And when they saw Him, they begged Him that He would depart from their region. 40 9:1 So He got into a boat, crossed over, and came into His own city. 40 9:2 Then behold, they brought to Him a paralytic lying on a bed. And Jesus seeing their faith said to the paralytic, "Son, be of good cheer; your sins are forgiven you." 40 9:3 And, immediately some of the scribes said within themselves, "This Man blasphemes!" 40 9:4 But Jesus knowing their thoughts said, "Why do you think evil in your hearts?" 40 9:5 Because which is easiest to say, 'Your sins are forgiven you,' or to say, 'Rise up and walk?'" 40 9:6 But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins," then He said to the paralytic, "Rise up, take up your bed, and go to your house." 40 9:7 And he rose up, and departed to his house. 40 9:8 Now when the crowds saw it, they marveled, and glorified God, who had given such authority to men. 40 9:9 And as Jesus passed on from there, He saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax office. And He said to him, "Follow Me." So he rose up, and followed Him. 40 9:10 Now it happened, as Jesus sat at the table in the house, behold, many tax collectors and sinners came and sat down with Him and His disciples. 40 9:11 And when the Pharisees saw it, they said to His disciples, "Why does your Teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?" 40 9:12 But when Jesus heard that, He said to them, "Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick." 40 9:13 But go and learn what this means: 'I desire mercy and not sacrifice.' Because, I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance." 40 9:14 Then the disciples of John came to Him, saying, "Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples do not fast?" 40 9:15 And Jesus said to them, "Can the children of the bridechamber mourn, as long as the bridegroom is with them? But the days will come, when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast." 40 9:16 No man puts a piece of new cloth on old clothing, because, that which is put in to patch it rips away from the clothing, and the tear is made worse." 40 9:17 Neither do they put new grape juice into old wineskins, or else the wineskins break, and the grape juice spills out, and the wineskins perish. But they put new grape juice into new wineskins, and both are preserved." 40 9:18 While He spoke these things to them, behold, a certain ruler came, and worshiped Him, saying, "My daughter has just died, but come and lay Your hand upon her, and she will live." 40 9:19 So Jesus rose up, and followed him, and so did His disciples. 40 9:20 And, suddenly a woman, who had a discharge of blood for twelve years, came from behind Him, and touched the edge of His clothes. 40 9:21 Because she said within herself, "If only I may touch His clothes, I will be made well." 40 9:22 But Jesus turned around, and when He saw her, He said, "Be cheerful daughter; your faith has made you well." And the woman was made well from that hour. 40 9:23 And when Jesus came into the ruler's house, and saw the musicians and the people making a noise, 40 9:24 He said to them, "Make room, because the girl is not dead, but is sleeping." And they laughed and mocked at Him. 40 9:25 But when the people were put outside, He went in and took her by the hand, and the girl arose. 40 9:26 And the fame of this went out into all that land. 40 9:27 And when Jesus departed from there, two blind men followed Him, shouting, and saying, "You, Son of David, have mercy on us!" 40 9:28 And when He had come into the house, the blind men came to Him. And Jesus said to them, "Do you believe that I am able to do this?" They said to Him, "Yes, Lord." 40 9:29 Then He touched their eyes, saying, "According to your faith let it be to you." 40 9:30 And their eyes were opened. And Jesus firmly warned them, saying, "See that no one knows it." 40 9:31 But when they had departed, they spread the fame about Him in all that country. 40 9:32 As they went out, behold, they brought to Him a mute man possessed with a demon. 40 9:33 And when the demon was cast out, the mute spoke. And the crowds marveled, saying, "It has never been seen like this in Israel!" 40 9:34 But the Pharisees said, "He casts out demons by the ruler of the demons." 40 9:35 Then Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people. 40 9:36 But when He saw the crowds, He was moved with compassion for them, because they were exhausted, and scattered everywhere, like sheep having no shepherd. 40 9:37 Then He said to His disciples, "Truly the harvest is plentiful, but the laborers are few." 40 9:38 Therefore pray the Lord of the harvest that He will send out laborers into His harvest." 40 10:1 And when He had called His twelve disciples to Him, He gave them authority over unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all kinds of sickness and all kinds of disease. 40 10:2 Now the names of the twelve apostles are these: The first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother; 40 10:3 Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew the tax collector; James the son of Alphaeus, and Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus; 40 10:4 Simon the Canaanite, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed Him. 40 10:5 These twelve Jesus sent out, and commanded them, saying, "Do not go into the way of the Gentiles, and do not enter any city of the Samaritans." 40 10:6 But rather go to the lost sheep of the house of Israel." 40 10:7 And as you go, preach, saying, 'The kingdom of heaven is at hand.'" 40 10:8 Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, raise the dead, cast out demons. Freely you have received, freely give." 40 10:9 Provide neither gold nor silver nor copper in your money belts," 40 10:10 nor bag for your journey, nor two coats, neither sandals, nor staffs; because a worker is worthy of his food." 40 10:11 "Now whatever city or town you go into, inquire who is worthy in it, and abide there until you go from it." 40 10:12 And when you go into a household, greet it." 40 10:13 And if the household is worthy, let your peace come upon it. But if it is not worthy, let your peace return to you." 40 10:14 And whoever shall not receive you nor hear your words, when you depart from that house or city, shake off the dust from your feet." 40 10:15 Truly, I say to you, it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city!" 40 10:16 "Behold, I send you out as sheep in the midst of wolves. Therefore be wise as serpents, and harmless as doves." 40 10:17 But beware of men, because, they will deliver you up to councils and they will scourge you in their synagogues." 40 10:18 And you will be brought before governors and kings for My sake, as a testimony against them and the Gentiles." 40 10:19 But when they deliver you up, do not worry about how or what you shall speak. Because, it will be given to you in that same hour what you will speak;" 40 10:20 because it is not you who is speaking, but the Spirit of your Father who speaks in you." 40 10:21 "Now brother will deliver up brother to death, and the father his child; and the children will rise up against their parents and cause them to be put to death." 40 10:22 And you will be hated by all people for My name's sake. But he who endures to the end will be saved." 40 10:23 But when they persecute you in one city, flee to another. Because, truly, I say to you, you will not have gone through the cities of Israel, before the Son of Man comes." 40 10:24 "A disciple is not above his teacher, nor the servant above his master." 40 10:25 It is enough for the disciple to be like his teacher, and the servant as his master. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub, how much more will they call those of his household!" 40 10:26 Therefore do not fear them. Because, there is nothing covered, that will not be revealed, and hidden, that will not be known." 40 10:27 "Whatever I tell you in the dark, that speak in the light; and what you hear in the ear, that preach on the housetops." 40 10:28 And do not fear those who kill the body but cannot kill the soul. But rather reverence Him who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell." 40 10:29 Are not two sparrows sold for a copper coin? And not one of them falls to the ground without your Father's knowledge." 40 10:30 But the very hairs of your head are all numbered." 40 10:31 Do not fear therefore; you are of more value than many sparrows." 40 10:32 "Therefore whoever confesses Me before men, him I will also confess before My Father who is in heaven." 40 10:33 But whoever denies Me before men, him I will also deny before My Father who is in heaven." 40 10:34 "Do not think that I came to bring peace on earth. I did not come to bring peace, but a sword." 40 10:35 Because, I have come to 'divide a man against his father, and a daughter against her mother, and a daughter in law against her mother in law,'" 40 10:36 and 'a man's enemies shall be those of his own household.'" 40 10:37 He who loves father or mother more than Me is not worthy of Me. And he who loves son or daughter more than Me is not worthy of Me." 40 10:38 And he who does not take up his cross, and follow after Me, is not worthy of Me." 40 10:39 He who finds his life will lose it, and he who loses his life for My sake will find it." 40 10:40 "He who receives you receives Me, and he who receives Me receives Him who sent Me." 40 10:41 He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a prophet's reward. And he who receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man will receive a righteous man's reward." 40 10:42 And whoever gives one of these little ones just a cup of cold water to drink in the name of a disciple, truly I say to you, he will by no means lose his reward." 40 11:1 And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished commanding His twelve disciples, that He departed from there to teach and to preach in their cities. 40 11:2 Now when John had heard in the prison about the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples, 40 11:3 And said to Him, "Are You He who should come, or do we look for another?" 40 11:4 Jesus answered and said to them, "Go and show John again those things which you hear and see:" 40 11:5 The blind receive their sight and the lame walk; the lepers are cleansed and the deaf hear; the dead are raised up and the poor have the gospel preached to them." 40 11:6 And blessed is he, who is not offended because of Me." 40 11:7 And as they departed, Jesus began to say to the crowds concerning John: "What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?" 40 11:8 But what did you go out to see? A man clothed in fine clothing? Behold, those who wear fine clothing are in kings' houses." 40 11:9 But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I say to you, and more than a prophet." 40 11:10 Because, this is he, of whom it is written: 'Behold, I send My messenger before Your face, who will prepare Your way before You.'" 40 11:11 "Truly I say to you, among those born of women there has not risen one greater than John the Baptist; but he who is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than him." 40 11:12 And from the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven suffers violence, and the violent take it by force." 40 11:13 Because, all the prophets and the law prophesied until John." 40 11:14 And if you are willing to receive it, this is Elijah who was to come beforehand." 40 11:15 He who has ears to hear, let him hear!" 40 11:16 But to what shall I liken this generation? It is likened to children sitting in the marketplaces, and calling to their friends," 40 11:17 and saying: 'We played the flute for you, and you did not dance; we have mourned to you, and you did not lament.'" 40 11:18 Because, John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, 'He has a demon.'" 40 11:19 The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, 'Behold a gluttonous man, and a wine drinker, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!' But wisdom is justified by her children." 40 11:20 Then He began to rebuke the cities in which most of His mighty works had been done, because they did not repent: 40 11:21 "Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! Because, if the mighty works, which were done in you, had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes." 40 11:22 But I say to you, it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the day of judgment than for you." 40 11:23 And you, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, will be brought down to hell; because, if the mighty works, which were done in you, had been done in Sodom, it would have remained until this day." 40 11:24 But I say to you that it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment than for you." 40 11:25 At that time Jesus responded and said, "I thank you, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because You have hidden these things from the wise and prudent, and have revealed them to babes." 40 11:26 Even so Father, because in this manner it seemed good in Your sight." 40 11:27 All things are delivered to Me by My Father, and no one knows the Son, except for the Father. Neither does anyone know the Father, except for the Son, and to the one whom the Son wills to reveal Him." 40 11:28 Come to Me, all you who labor and have a heavy burden, and I will give you rest." 40 11:29 Take My yoke upon you, and learn from Me, because, I am meek and lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls." 40 11:30 Because, My yoke is easy, and My burden is light." 40 12:1 At that time Jesus went through the grainfields on the Sabbath day. And His disciples were hungry, and began to pluck the heads of grain and to eat. 40 12:2 But when the Pharisees saw it, they said to Him, "Look, Your disciples are doing what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath day!" 40 12:3 But He said to them, "Have you not read what David did when he was hungry, and those who were with him:" 40 12:4 how he entered into the house of God, and ate the showbread, which was not lawful for him to eat, nor for those who were with him, but only for the priests?" 40 12:5 Or have you not read in the law, that on the Sabbath days the priests in the temple profane the Sabbath, and are blameless?" 40 12:6 But I say to you that in this place there is One greater than the temple." 40 12:7 And if you had known what this means, 'I desire mercy, and not sacrifice,' you would not have condemned the guiltless." 40 12:8 Because the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath day" 40 12:9 Now when He had departed from there, He went into their synagogue. 40 12:10 And behold, there was a man who had a withered hand. And they asked Him, saying, "Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath days?" That they might accuse Him. 40 12:11 And He said to them, "What man would there be among you, who has one sheep, and if it falls into a pit on the Sabbath day, will not lay hold of it and lift it out?" 40 12:12 How much better then is a man than a sheep? Therefore it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath days." 40 12:13 Then He said to the man, "Stretch out your hand." And he stretched it out, and it was restored as whole as the other. 40 12:14 Then the Pharisees went out and held a council against Him, how they might destroy Him. 40 12:15 But when Jesus knew it, He withdrew Himself from there. And large crowds followed Him, and He healed them all. 40 12:16 And commanded them that they should not make Him known, 40 12:17 that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying: 40 12:18 "Behold! My Servant, whom I have chosen, My beloved, in whom My soul is well pleased! I will put My Spirit upon Him, and He will show judgment to the Gentiles. 40 12:19 He will not strive, nor shout, nor will anyone hear His voice in the streets. 40 12:20 A bruised reed He will not break, and smoking flax He will not quench, until He sends forth judgment to victory; 40 12:21 And in His name shall the Gentiles trust." 40 12:22 Then one was brought to Him who was possessed with a demon, blind and mute; and He healed him, so that the blind and mute both spoke and saw. 40 12:23 And all the people were amazed and said, "Is not this the Son of David?" 40 12:24 But when the Pharisees heard it, they said, "This one does not cast out demons, except by Beelzebub, the ruler of the demons." 40 12:25 But Jesus knew their thoughts, and said to them: "Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation, and every city or house divided against itself will not stand." 40 12:26 And if Satan casts out Satan, he is divided against himself. How then will his kingdom stand?" 40 12:27 And if I cast out demons by Beelzebub, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges." 40 12:28 But if I cast out demons by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God has come to you." 40 12:29 Or else how can one enter a strong man's house, and plunder his goods, unless he first binds the strong man? And then he shall plunder his house." 40 12:30 He that is not with Me is against Me; and he that does not gather with Me scatters abroad." 40 12:31 "Therefore I say to you, every type of sin and blasphemy will be forgiven men, but the blasphemy against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven men." 40 12:32 And whosoever speaks a word against the Son of Man, it will be forgiven him; but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit, it will not be forgiven him, neither in this age, nor in the age to come." 40 12:33 "Either make the tree good, and its fruit good, or else make the tree bad, and its fruit bad: because the tree is known by its fruit." 40 12:34 O generation of vipers, how can you being evil, speak good things? Since out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks!" 40 12:35 A good man out of the good treasure of the heart brings forth good things, and an evil man out of the evil treasure brings forth evil things." 40 12:36 But I say to you that every idle word that men will speak, they will give account of it in the day of judgment." 40 12:37 Because, by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned." 40 12:38 Then some of the scribes and Pharisees responded, saying, "Teacher, we want to see a sign from You." 40 12:39 But He replied and said to them, "An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, and no sign will be given to it except the sign of the prophet Jonah." 40 12:40 Because, as Jonah was three days and three nights in the whale's belly, so will the Son of Man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth." 40 12:41 The men of Nineveh will rise in judgment with this generation and will condemn it, because they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and behold, a greater than Jonah is here." 40 12:42 The queen of the south will rise up in the judgment with this generation and will condemn it, because, she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, a greater than Solomon is here." 40 12:43 "When an unclean spirit goes out of a man, he goes through dry places, seeking rest, and finds none." 40 12:44 Then he says, 'I shall return to my house from which I came out.' And when he has come, he finds it empty, swept, and put in order." 40 12:45 Then he goes, and takes with him seven other spirits more wicked than himself, and they enter in and dwell there; and the last state of that man is worse than the first. Even so will it be to this wicked generation." 40 12:46 While He was still talking to the people, behold, His mother and His brethren stood outside, wanting to speak with Him. 40 12:47 Then one said to Him, "Look, Your mother and Your brethren are standing outside, wanting to speak with You." 40 12:48 But He replied and said to him who told Him, "Who is My mother and who are My brethren?" 40 12:49 And He stretched out His hand toward His disciples, and said, "Behold, My mother and My brethren!" 40 12:50 Because, whoever does the will of My Father who is in heaven, that one is My brother and sister and mother." 40 13:1 That same day Jesus went out of the house, and sat beside the sea. 40 13:2 And large crowds were gathered about Him, so that He got into a boat, and sat; and the entire crowd stood on the shore. 40 13:3 Then He spoke many things to them in parables, saying: "Behold, a sower went out to sow." 40 13:4 And as he sowed, some seeds fell by the way side; and the birds came and devoured them." 40 13:5 Some fell on stony places, where they did not have much earth; and they immediately sprang up because they had no depth of earth." 40 13:6 But when the sun was up they were scorched, and because they had no root they withered away." 40 13:7 And some fell among thorns, and the thorns sprung up and choked them." 40 13:8 But others fell into good ground and bore fruit: some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty." 40 13:9 He who has ears to hear, let him hear!" 40 13:10 And the disciples came and said to Him, "Why do You speak to them in parables?" 40 13:11 He answered and said to them, "Because, it has been given to you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it has not been given." 40 13:12 Because whoever has, to him more will be given, and he will have abundance; but whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him." 40 13:13 Therefore I speak to them in parables, because, seeing they do not see, and hearing they do not hear, nor do they understand." 40 13:14 And in them the prophecy of Isaiah is fulfilled, which says: 'By hearing you will hear, and will not understand, and seeing you will see, and will not perceive;" 40 13:15 because the hearts of this people have grown dull, their ears are dull of hearing, and their eyes they have closed, lest they should see with their eyes and hear with their ears, and should understand with their hearts and would be converted, so that I should heal them.'" 40 13:16 But blessed are your eyes because they see, and your ears because they hear;" 40 13:17 because truly, I say to you, that many prophets and righteous men have desired to see those things which you see, and did not see it, and hear those things which you hear, and did not hear it." 40 13:18 "Therefore all of you, hear the parable of the sower:" 40 13:19 When anyone hears the word of the kingdom, and does not understand it, then the wicked one comes and snatches away what was sown in his heart. This is the one which received seed by the wayside." 40 13:20 But he who received the seed on stony places, this is the one who hears the word and immediately receives it with joy;" 40 13:21 yet he has no root in himself, but endures only for a while. Because when tribulation or persecution arises because of the word, immediately he stumbles." 40 13:22 Now he who received seed among the thorns is he who hears the word, and the worries of this world and the deceitfulness of riches choke the word, and he becomes unfruitful." 40 13:23 But he who received seed on the good ground is he who hears the word and understands it, who also bears fruit and produces: some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty." 40 13:24 He put before them another parable, saying: "The kingdom of heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field;" 40 13:25 but while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat and went his way." 40 13:26 So when the grain had sprouted and produced a crop, then the tares also appeared." 40 13:27 So the servants of the householder came and said to him, 'Sir, did you not sow good seed in your field? How then does it have tares?'" 40 13:28 He said to them, 'An enemy has done this.' The servants said to him, 'Do you want us then to go and gather them up?'" 40 13:29 But he said, 'No, lest while you gather up the tares you also uproot the wheat with them." 40 13:30 Let both grow together until the harvest, and at harvest time I will tell the reapers, "First gather together the tares and bind them in bundles to burn them, but gather the wheat into my barn." '" 40 13:31 He put before them another parable, saying: "The kingdom of heaven is like a grain of mustard seed, that a man took and sowed in his field," 40 13:32 which indeed is the least of all the seeds; but when it is grown it is greater than the herbs and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the air come and nest in its branches." 40 13:33 He spoke another parable to them: "The kingdom of heaven is like leaven, which a woman took and hid inside three measures of flour until it was all leavened." 40 13:34 Jesus spoke all these things to the crowds in parables; and He did not speak to them without a parable, 40 13:35 that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophet, saying: "I will open My mouth in parables; I will utter things which have been kept secret since the foundation of the world." 40 13:36 Then Jesus sent the crowd away and went into the house. And His disciples came to Him, saying, "Explain to us the parable of the tares of the field." 40 13:37 He replied and said to them: "He who sows the good seed is the Son of Man." 40 13:38 The field is the world, the good seed are the children of the kingdom, but the tares are the children of the wicked one." 40 13:39 The enemy who sowed them is the devil, the harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are the angels." 40 13:40 Therefore as the tares are gathered and burned in the fire, so it will be at the end of this age." 40 13:41 The Son of Man will send out His angels, and they will gather out of His kingdom all things that cause offense, and those who practice iniquity," 40 13:42 and will throw them into the furnace of fire. There will be wailing and gnashing of teeth." 40 13:43 Then the righteous will shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. He who has ears to hear, let him hear!" 40 13:44 "Again, the kingdom of Heaven is like treasure hidden in a field, which when a man finds, he hides; and for joy over it he goes and sells all that he has and buys that field." 40 13:45 "Again, the kingdom of Heaven is like a merchant man seeking choice pearls," 40 13:46 who, when he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had and bought it." 40 13:47 "Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a dragnet that was cast into the sea and gathered some of every kind," 40 13:48 which, when it was full, they drew to shore; and sat down and gathered the good into vessels, but threw the bad away." 40 13:49 So it will be at the end of the age. The angels will come forth, separate the wicked from among the just," 40 13:50 and will cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth." 40 13:51 Jesus said to them, "Have you understood all these things?" They said to Him, "Yes, Lord." 40 13:52 Then He said to them, "Therefore every scribe which is instructed concerning the kingdom of heaven is like a man who is a householder who brings out of his treasure things new and old." 40 13:53 Now it came to pass, when Jesus had finished these parables, that He departed from there. 40 13:54 And when He had come to His own country, He taught them in their synagogue, so that they were astonished and said, "Where did this Man get this wisdom and these mighty works? 40 13:55 Is this not the carpenter's son? Is not His mother called Mary? And His brothers James, Joses, Simon, and Judas? 40 13:56 And His sisters, are they not all with us? Where then did this Man get all these things?" 40 13:57 So they were offended at Him. But Jesus said to them, "A prophet is not without honor except in his own country and in his own house." 40 13:58 So He did not do many mighty works there because of their unbelief. 40 14:1 At that time Herod the tetrarch heard about the fame of Jesus, 40 14:2 and said to his servants, "This is John the Baptist; he is risen from the dead, and therefore mighty works display themselves in him." 40 14:3 Because, Herod had laid hold of John and bound him, and put him in prison because of Herodias, his brother Philip's wife. 40 14:4 Because, John said to him, "It is not lawful for you to have her." 40 14:5 And when he wanted to put him to death, he feared the crowds, because, they considered him to be a prophet. 40 14:6 But when Herod's birthday was celebrated, the daughter of Herodias danced before them and pleased Herod. 40 14:7 So he promised with an oath to give her whatever she might ask. 40 14:8 So she being instructed beforehand by her mother said, "Give me John the Baptist's head here on a platter." 40 14:9 And the king was grieved: nevertheless because of the oath's sake and those who sat with him at the table, he commanded it to be given to her. 40 14:10 So he sent, and beheaded John in the prison. 40 14:11 And his head was brought on a platter, and given to the girl, and she brought it to her mother. 40 14:12 Then his disciples came, and took away the body, and buried it, and went and told Jesus. 40 14:13 When Jesus heard this, He departed from there by boat into a deserted place by Himself. But when the crowds heard of it, they followed Him on foot from the cities. 40 14:14 And Jesus went out and saw a large crowd; and was moved with compassion for them and He healed their sick. 40 14:15 Now when it was evening, His disciples came to Him, saying, "This is a desert place, and the hour is already late. Send the crowds away, that they may go into the villages and buy sustenance for themselves." 40 14:16 But Jesus said to them, "They do not need to leave. You give them something to eat." 40 14:17 And they said to Him, "We have only five loaves, and two fish with us." 40 14:18 He said, "Bring them here to Me." 40 14:19 Then He commanded the crowds to sit down on the grass. And He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, He blessed and broke, and gave the loaves to His disciples; and the disciples to the crowds. 40 14:20 So they all ate and were filled, and they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments that remained. 40 14:21 Now those who had eaten were about five thousand men, besides women and children. 40 14:22 And immediately Jesus made His disciples to get into a boat and go before Him to the other side, while He sent the crowds away. 40 14:23 And when He had sent the crowds away, He went up on a mountain by Himself to pray. Now when evening came, He was there alone. 40 14:24 But the boat was now in the midst of the sea, tossed by the waves, because the wind was contrary. 40 14:25 Now in the fourth watch of the night Jesus went to them, walking on the sea. 40 14:26 And when the disciples saw Him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, "It is a spirit!" And they shouted out through fear. 40 14:27 But immediately Jesus spoke to them, saying, "Be cheerful! It is Me; do not be afraid." 40 14:28 And Peter replied to Him and said, "Lord, if it is You, tell me to come to You on the water." 40 14:29 And He said, "Come." And when Peter had come down out of the boat, he walked on the water to go to Jesus. 40 14:30 But when he saw the wind was strong, he was afraid; and beginning to sink, he shouted out, saying, "Lord, save me!" 40 14:31 And immediately Jesus stretched out His hand, and caught him, and said to him, "O you of little faith, why did you doubt?" 40 14:32 And when they got into the boat, the wind ceased. 40 14:33 Then those who were in the boat came and worshiped Him, saying, "Truly You are the Son of God." 40 14:34 And when they had crossed over, they came into the land of Gennesaret. 40 14:35 And when the men of that place recognized Him, they sent out into all that surrounding region, and brought to Him all who were sick, 40 14:36 and begged Him that they might only touch the edge of His clothes. And as many as touched it were made perfectly well. 40 15:1 Then the scribes and Pharisees who were from Jerusalem came to Jesus saying, 40 15:2 "Why do Your disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? Because they do not wash their hands when they eat bread." 40 15:3 But He answered and said to them, "Why do you also transgress the commandment of God by your tradition?" 40 15:4 Because, God commanded, saying, Honor your father and mother; and, He who curses father or mother, let him be put to death." 40 15:5 But you say, 'Whosoever says to his father or his mother, "Whatever profit you may have received from me has become a gift," 40 15:6 and does not honor his father or his mother, because he will be exempt.' Thus you have made the commandment of God of no effect by your tradition." 40 15:7 You hypocrites! Isaiah correctly prophesied about you, saying:" 40 15:8 'These people draw near to Me with their mouth, and honor Me with their lips, but their heart is far from Me." 40 15:9 But in vain they worship Me, teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.'" 40 15:10 Then He called the crowds and said to them, "Hear and understand:" 40 15:11 Not what goes into the mouth defiles a man; but what comes out of the mouth, this defiles a man." 40 15:12 Then His disciples came and said to Him, "Do You know that the Pharisees were offended when they heard this saying?" 40 15:13 But He answered and said, "Every plant which My heavenly Father has not planted will be uprooted." 40 15:14 Leave them alone. They are blind leaders of the blind. And if the blind leads the blind, both will fall into a ditch." 40 15:15 Then Peter replied and said to Him, "Explain this parable to us." 40 15:16 And Jesus said, "Are you also still without understanding?" 40 15:17 Do you still not understand that whatever enters into the mouth goes into the stomach, and is cast out into the drain?" 40 15:18 But those things which proceed out of the mouth come from the heart, and they defile a man." 40 15:19 Because, out of the heart comes evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies." 40 15:20 These are the things which defile a man, but to eat with unwashed hands does not defile a man." 40 15:21 Then Jesus went out from there and departed to the region of Tyre and Sidon. 40 15:22 And behold, a woman of Canaan came from that region, and shouted to Him, saying, "Have mercy on me, O Lord, You Son of David! My daughter is severely tormented with a demon." 40 15:23 But He did not reply one word to her. And His disciples came and asked Him, saying, "Send her away; because, she shouts out to us." 40 15:24 But He replied and said, "I am not sent except to the lost sheep of the house of Israel." 40 15:25 Then she came and worshiped Him, saying, "Lord, help me!" 40 15:26 But He replied and said, "It is not good to take the children's bread, and throw it to dogs." 40 15:27 And she said, "True, Lord, yet the dogs eat the crumbs which fall from their masters' table." 40 15:28 Then Jesus replied and said to her, "O woman, great is your faith! Let it be to you as you desire." And her daughter was healed from that very hour. 40 15:29 Then Jesus left there, and came near to the sea of Galilee, and went up on a mountain, and sat down there. 40 15:30 And large crowds came to Him, having with them those who were lame, blind, mute, maimed, and many others; and they laid them down at Jesus' feet; and He healed them. 40 15:31 So the crowds marveled when they saw the mute speaking, the maimed made whole, the lame walking, and the blind seeing; and they glorified the God of Israel. 40 15:32 Then Jesus called His disciples to Himself and said, "I have compassion on the crowd, because, they have continued with Me for three days now and have nothing to eat. And I do not want to send them away fasting, lest they faint on the way." 40 15:33 And His disciples said to Him, "Where could we get enough bread in the wilderness to fill such a large crowd?" 40 15:34 And Jesus said to them, "How many loaves do you have?" And they said, "Seven, and a few small fish." 40 15:35 And He commanded the crowd to sit down on the ground. 40 15:36 And He took the seven loaves and the fish and gave thanks, then broke them and gave to His disciples; and the disciples to the crowd. 40 15:37 So they all ate, and were filled, and they took up seven large baskets full of the fragments that were left. 40 15:38 Now those who ate were four thousand men, besides women and children. 40 15:39 And He sent the crowd away, got into a boat, and came into the region of Magdala. 40 16:1 The Pharisees also with the Sadducees came, and testing Him asked that He would show them a sign from heaven. 40 16:2 He answered and said to them, "When it is evening, you say, 'It will be fair weather, because the sky is red';" 40 16:3 and in the morning, 'It will be foul weather today, because the sky is red and overcast.' O you hypocrites! You can discern the face of the sky, but can you not discern the signs of the times?" 40 16:4 A wicked and adulterous generation seeks after a sign; and there will be no sign given to it except the sign of the prophet Jonah." And He left them, and departed. 40 16:5 Now when His disciples had come to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread. 40 16:6 Then Jesus said to them, "Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees." 40 16:7 And they reasoned among themselves, saying, "It is because we have not taken bread." 40 16:8 Which when Jesus perceived it He said to them, "O you of little faith, why do you reason among yourselves because you have brought no bread?" 40 16:9 Do you still not understand, or remember the five loaves of the five thousand and how many baskets you took up?" 40 16:10 Nor the seven loaves of the four thousand and how many huge baskets you took up?" 40 16:11 How is it that you do not understand that I did not speak this to you concerning bread, but that you should beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees?" 40 16:12 Then they understood that He did not tell them to beware of the leaven of bread, but of the doctrine of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees. 40 16:13 When Jesus came into the region of Caesarea Philippi, He asked His disciples, saying, "Who do men say that I the Son of Man, am?" 40 16:14 So they said, "Some say that You are John the Baptist, some, Elijah, and others Jeremiah, or one of the prophets." 40 16:15 He said to them, "But who do you say that I am?" 40 16:16 And Simon Peter answered and said, "You are the Christ, the Son of the living God." 40 16:17 And Jesus replied and said to him, "Blessed are you, Simon Bar-Jonah, because flesh and blood has not revealed this to you, but My Father who is in heaven." 40 16:18 And I also say to you that you are Peter, and upon this Rock I will build My church; and the gates of hell will not prevail against it." 40 16:19 And I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven, and whatever you will bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you will loose on earth will be loosed in heaven." 40 16:20 Then He commanded His disciples that they should not tell anyone that He was Jesus the Christ. 40 16:21 From that time forward Jesus began to show to His disciples how that He must go to Jerusalem, and suffer many things from the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised again the third day. 40 16:22 Then Peter took Him aside, and began to rebuke Him, saying, "Let this be far from You Lord; this will not happen to You!" 40 16:23 But He turned and said to Peter, "Get behind Me Satan! You are an offense to Me, because, you are not thinking things that are of God, but those that are of man." 40 16:24 Then said Jesus to His disciples, "If anyone desires to come after Me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow Me." 40 16:25 Because, whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever desires to lose his life for My sake will find it." 40 16:26 Because, what does a man profit if he gains the entire world, and loses his own soul? Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?" 40 16:27 Because, the Son of Man will come in the glory of His Father with His angels, and then He will reward everyone according to his works." 40 16:28 Truly, I say to you, there are some standing here who will not taste death, until they see the Son of Man coming in His kingdom." 40 17:1 Now after six days Jesus took Peter, James, and John his brother, and led them up on a high mountain by themselves; 40 17:2 and He was transfigured before them, so His face shone like the sun, and His clothes became as white as the light. 40 17:3 And behold, Moses and Elijah appeared to them there, talking with Him. 40 17:4 Then Peter responded and said to Jesus, "Lord, it is good for us to be here; if you want to, let us make three tabernacles here; one for You, one for Moses, and one for Elijah." 40 17:5 While he still spoke, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them; and suddenly a voice came out of the cloud, saying, "This is My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased. Hear Him!" 40 17:6 And when the disciples heard it, they fell on their faces and were greatly afraid. 40 17:7 But Jesus came and touched them and said, "Arise, and do not be afraid." 40 17:8 And when they had lifted up their eyes, they saw no one, except Jesus only. 40 17:9 Now as they came down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them, saying, "Tell the vision to no one until the Son of Man is risen again from the dead." 40 17:10 Then His disciples asked Him, saying, "Why then do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?" 40 17:11 So Jesus answered and said to them, "Truly Elijah is coming first, and will restore all things." 40 17:12 But I say to you, that Elijah has come already and they did not know him, but did to him whatever they desired. Likewise the Son of Man will suffer by them also." 40 17:13 Then the disciples understood that He spoke to them about John the Baptist. 40 17:14 And when they came to the crowd, a certain man came to Him, kneeling down to Him and saying, 40 17:15 "Lord, have mercy on my son, because, he is crazy, and suffers greatly; because he often falls into the fire and often into the water. 40 17:16 And I brought him to Your disciples, but they could not cure him." 40 17:17 Then Jesus responded and said, "O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I put up with you? Bring him here to Me." 40 17:18 And Jesus rebuked the demon, and he came out of him; and the child was cured from that very hour. 40 17:19 Then the disciples came to Jesus privately and said, "Why could we not cast him out?" 40 17:20 And Jesus said to them, "Because of your unbelief; because, truly, I say to you, If you have faith as a grain of mustard seed, you shall say to this mountain, 'Move from here to there,' and it will move; and nothing will be impossible for you." 40 17:21 However this kind does not go out except by prayer and fasting." 40 17:22 Now while they were staying in Galilee, Jesus said to them, "The Son of Man will be betrayed into the hands of men," 40 17:23 and they will kill Him, and the third day He will be raised again." And they were exceedingly sorrowful. 40 17:24 And when they had come to Capernaum, those who received tax money came to Peter, and said, "Does your Teacher not pay tax?" 40 17:25 He said, "Yes." And when he had come into the house, Jesus came before him, saying, "What do you think, Simon? From whom do the kings of the earth take customs or taxes, from their own children, or from strangers?" 40 17:26 Peter said to Him, "From strangers." Jesus said to him, "Then the children are free. 40 17:27 Nevertheless, lest we should offend them, go to the sea, and cast in a hook, and take up the first fish that comes up. And when you have opened its mouth, you will find a piece of money; take that, and give it to them for Me and you." 40 18:1 At the same time the disciples came to Jesus, saying, "Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?" 40 18:2 And Jesus called a little child to Himself, and set him in the midst of them, 40 18:3 and said, "Truly, I say to you, unless you are converted, and become as little children, you will not enter into the kingdom of heaven." 40 18:4 Therefore whoever humbles himself as this little child, they are the greatest in the kingdom of heaven." 40 18:5 And whoever receives one little child like this in My name receives Me." 40 18:6 But whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in Me to stumble, it would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck, and that he were drowned in the depth of the sea." 40 18:7 Woe to the world because of offenses! Because, offenses must come, but woe to that man by whom the offense comes!" 40 18:8 So if your hand or your foot offends you, cut them off and throw them away from you. It is better for you to enter into life lame or maimed, rather than having two hands or two feet, to be thrown into everlasting fire." 40 18:9 And if your eye offends you, pluck it out and throw it away from you. It is better for you to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes, to be thrown into hell fire." 40 18:10 Beware that you do not despise one of these little ones, because, I say to you that in heaven their angels always behold the face of My Father who is in heaven." 40 18:11 Because the Son of Man has come to save that which was lost." 40 18:12 "What do you think? If a man has a hundred sheep, and one of them goes astray, does he not leave the ninety nine and go to the mountains to seek the one that has gone astray?" 40 18:13 And if he happens to find it, truly, I say to you, he rejoices more over that sheep than over the ninety nine that did not go astray." 40 18:14 Likewise it is not the will of your Father who is in heaven that one of these little ones should perish." 40 18:15 "Also if your brother sins against you, go and tell him his fault between you and him alone. If he hears you, you have gained your brother." 40 18:16 But if he will not hear you, then take with you one or two more, that 'by the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.'" 40 18:17 And if he refuses to hear them, tell it to the church. But if he refuses even to listen to the church, let him be to you as a heathen and a tax collector." 40 18:18 "Truly, I say to you, whatever you will bind on earth will be bound in heaven and whatever you will loose on earth will be loosed in heaven." 40 18:19 "Again I say to you that if two of you agree on earth concerning anything that they ask, it will be done for them of My Father who is in heaven." 40 18:20 Because, where two or three are gathered together in My name, I am there in the midst of them." 40 18:21 Then Peter came to Him and said, "Lord, how often shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? Until seven times?" 40 18:22 Jesus said to him, "I do not say to you, until seven times, but until seventy times seven." 40 18:23 Therefore the kingdom of heaven is like a certain king who wanted to settle accounts with his servants." 40 18:24 And when he had begun to settle accounts, one was brought to him who owed him ten thousand talents." 40 18:25 But since he had no means to pay, his master commanded him to be sold, with his wife and children and all that he owned, and that payment be made." 40 18:26 So the servant fell down and worshiped him, saying, 'Master, have patience with me, and I will repay everything to you.'" 40 18:27 Then the Master of that servant was moved with compassion, released him, and forgave him the debt." 40 18:28 "But the same servant went out and found one of his fellow servants, who owed him a hundred denarii: and he laid hands on him and took him by the throat, saying, 'Pay me what you owe!'" 40 18:29 So his fellow servant fell down at his feet and begged him, saying, 'Have patience with me, and I will repay everything to you.'" 40 18:30 And he would not, but went and put him into prison until he should pay the debt." 40 18:31 So when his fellow servants saw what had been done, they were very grieved, and came and told their master all that was done." 40 18:32 Then his master, after he had summoned him, said to him, 'O you wicked servant! I forgave you all that debt because you begged me." 40 18:33 Should you not also have had compassion on your fellow servant, just as I had pity on you?'" 40 18:34 And his master was angry, and delivered him to the torturers until he should pay all that was due to him." 40 18:35 "So likewise will my heavenly Father also do to you if each of you, from his heart, does not forgive his brother their trespasses." 40 19:1 Now it came to pass, when Jesus had finished these sayings, that He departed from Galilee and came to the region of Judea beyond the Jordan. 40 19:2 And large crowds followed Him, and He healed them there. 40 19:3 The Pharisees also came to Him, testing Him, and saying to Him, "Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife for just any reason?" 40 19:4 And He answered and said to them, "Have you not read that He who made them in the beginning 'made them male and female,'" 40 19:5 And said, 'For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife, and the two will be one flesh?'" 40 19:6 Therefore they are no longer two but one flesh.
