Therefore what God has joined together, let not man separate." 40 19:7 They said to Him, "Why then did Moses command to give a certificate of divorce, and to separate from her?" 40 19:8 He said to them, "Moses, because of the hardness of your hearts, permitted you to put away your wives, but from the beginning it was not so." 40 19:9 And I say to you, whoever puts away his wife, except it be for sexual immorality, and marries another, commits adultery; and whoever marries her who is put away commits adultery." 40 19:10 His disciples said to Him, "If this is the situation of the man with his wife, it is not good to marry." 40 19:11 But He said to them, "Not all men can accept this saying, except those to whom it is given:" 40 19:12 Because, there are some eunuchs who were born so from their mother's womb, and there are some eunuchs who were made eunuchs by men, and there are eunuchs who have made themselves eunuchs for the sake of the kingdom of heaven. He who is able to accept it, let him accept it." 40 19:13 Then little children were brought to Him so that He might lay His hands on them and pray, but the disciples rebuked them. 40 19:14 But Jesus said, "Permit little children to come to Me and do not forbid them; because, of such is the kingdom of heaven." 40 19:15 And He laid His hands on them and departed from there. 40 19:16 And, behold, one came and said to Him, "Good Teacher, what good thing should I do that I may have eternal life?" 40 19:17 And He said to him, "Why do you call Me good? No one is good except One, that is, God. But if you want to enter into life, keep the commandments." 40 19:18 He said to Him, "Which ones?" Jesus said, "'You shall not murder,' 'You shall not commit adultery,' 'You shall not steal,' 'You shall not bear false witness,' 40 19:19 'Honor your father and your mother,' and, 'You shall love your neighbor as yourself.'" 40 19:20 The young man said to Him, "I have kept all these things from my youth. What do I still lack?" 40 19:21 Jesus said to Him, "If you want to be perfect, go and sell what you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come and follow Me." 40 19:22 But when the young man heard that saying, he went away sorrowful, because he had many possessions. 40 19:23 Then Jesus said to His disciples, "Truly, I say to you, that it is hard for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of heaven." 40 19:24 And again I say to you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God." 40 19:25 When His disciples heard it, they were greatly amazed, saying, "Who then can be saved?" 40 19:26 But Jesus looked at them and said to them, "With men this is impossible, but with God all things are possible." 40 19:27 Then Peter replied and said to Him, "Look, we have left everything, and followed You. Therefore what shall we have?" 40 19:28 And Jesus said to them, "Truly, I say to you, that in the regeneration when the Son of Man sits on the throne of His glory, you who have followed Me will also sit upon twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel." 40 19:29 And everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or wife or children or lands, for My name's sake, will receive a hundredfold, and will inherit everlasting life." 40 19:30 But many who are first will be last, and the last will be first." 40 20:1 "Because, the kingdom of heaven is likened to a man who is a householder who went out early in the morning to hire laborers for his vineyard." 40 20:2 Now when he had agreed with the laborers for a denarius a day, he sent them into his vineyard." 40 20:3 And he went out about the third hour, and saw others standing idle in the marketplace," 40 20:4 and said to them, 'You also go into the vineyard, and whatever is right I will give you.' So they went their way." 40 20:5 Again he went out about the sixth and ninth hour, and did likewise." 40 20:6 And about the eleventh hour he went out and found others standing idle and said to them, 'Why have you been standing here idle all day?'" 40 20:7 They said to him, 'Because no one has hired us.' He said to them, 'You also go into the vineyard, and whatever is right that you will receive.'" 40 20:8 So when evening had come, the master of the vineyard said to his steward, 'Call the laborers and give them their wages, beginning from the last to the first.'" 40 20:9 And when those came who were hired about the eleventh hour, everyone received a denarius each." 40 20:10 But when the first came, they supposed that they would receive more; and they likewise received a denarius each." 40 20:11 And when they had received it, they murmured against the good householder," 40 20:12 saying, 'These last have worked only one hour, and you have made them equal to us who have endured the burden and heat of the day.'" 40 20:13 But he responded to one of them and said, 'Friend, I am doing you no wrong. Did you not agree with me for a denarius?" 40 20:14 Take what is yours, and go your way. I desire to give to the last, the same as you." 40 20:15 Is it not lawful for me to do what I want with my own things? Is your eye corrupt because I am good?'" 40 20:16 So the last will be first, and the first last. Because many are called, but few are chosen." 40 20:17 Now Jesus, going up to Jerusalem, took the twelve disciples aside on the road, and said to them, 40 20:18 "Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be betrayed to the chief priests and to the scribes; and they will condemn Him to death," 40 20:19 and will deliver Him to the Gentiles to mock and to scourge and to crucify Him. And the third day He will rise again." 40 20:20 Then the mother of Zebedee's children came to Him with her sons, worshiping Him, and asking something from Him. 40 20:21 And He said to her, "What do you desire?" She said to Him, "Permit that these two sons of mine may sit, one on Your right hand and the other on the left, in Your kingdom." 40 20:22 But Jesus answered and said, "You do not know what you ask. Are you able to drink of the cup that I will drink of, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?" They said to Him, "We are able." 40 20:23 So He said to them, "You will indeed drink My cup, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with; but to sit on My right hand and on My left is not Mine to give, but it will be given to those for whom it is prepared by My Father." 40 20:24 And when the ten heard it, they were moved with indignation with the two brethren. 40 20:25 But Jesus called them to Himself, and said, "You know that the rulers of the Gentiles dominate over them, and those who are great exercise authority over them." 40 20:26 But it will not be so among you; but whoever wants to be great among you, let him be your servant." 40 20:27 And whoever wants to be first among you, let him be your servant," 40 20:28 just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give His life a ransom for many." 40 20:29 Now as they departed from Jericho, a large crowd followed Him. 40 20:30 And, behold, two blind men sitting by the road, when they heard that Jesus was passing by, shouted out, saying, "Have mercy on us, O Lord, You Son of David!" 40 20:31 And the crowd rebuked them, that they should keep silent; but they shouted all the more, saying, "Have mercy on us, O Lord, You Son of David!" 40 20:32 Then Jesus stood still and called them, and said, "What do you want me to do for you?" 40 20:33 They said to Him, "Lord, that our eyes may be opened." 40 20:34 So Jesus had compassion on them, and touched their eyes. And immediately their eyes received sight, and they followed Him. 40 21:1 Now when they drew near to Jerusalem, and came to Bethphage, at the mount of Olives, then Jesus sent out two disciples, 40 21:2 saying to them, "Go into the village opposite you, and immediately you will find a donkey tied, and a colt with her. Loose them, and bring them to Me." 40 21:3 And if anyone says anything to you, you shall say, 'The Lord has need of them,' and he will immediately send them." 40 21:4 All this was done that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophet, saying: 40 21:5 "Tell the daughter of Zion, 'Behold, your King is coming to you, humble, and sitting on a donkey, a colt, the foal of a donkey.'" 40 21:6 Then the disciples went, and did as Jesus commanded them, 40 21:7 and brought the donkey and the colt, put their clothes on them, and they set Him on them. 40 21:8 And a very large crowd spread their clothes on the road; others cut down branches from the trees and spread them on the road. 40 21:9 And the crowds who went before and those who followed shouted out, saying: "Hosanna to the Son of David! Blessed is He who comes in the name of the LORD! Hosanna in the highest!" 40 21:10 And when He came into Jerusalem, the entire city was moved saying, "Who is this?" 40 21:11 Then the crowd said, "This is Jesus the prophet from Nazareth of Galilee." 40 21:12 And Jesus went into the temple of God, and drove out all those who bought and sold in the temple, and turned over the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of those who sold doves, 40 21:13 and said to them, "It is written, 'My house shall be called the house of prayer,' but you have made it a 'den of thieves.'" 40 21:14 Then the blind and the lame came to Him in the temple, and He healed them. 40 21:15 But when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonderful things that He did, and the children shouting in the temple, and saying, "Hosanna to the Son of David!" they were very annoyed 40 21:16 and said to Him, "Do You hear what they are saying?" And Jesus said to them, "Yes. Have you never read, 'Out of the mouth of babes and nursing infants You have perfected praise'?" 40 21:17 Then He left them, and went out of the city to Bethany; and He stayed there. 40 21:18 Now in the morning as He returned to the city, He was hungry. 40 21:19 And when He saw a fig tree beside the road, He came to it, and found nothing on it but only leaves, and said to it, "Let no fruit grow on you ever again." And immediately the fig tree withered away. 40 21:20 So when the disciples saw it, they marveled, saying, "How did the fig tree wither away so suddenly!" 40 21:21 Jesus answered and said to them, "Truly, I say to you, If you have faith and do not doubt, you will not only do what was done to the fig tree, but also if you will say to this mountain, 'Be removed, and be cast into the sea' it will be done." 40 21:22 And anything, whatever things you ask in prayer, believing, you will receive." 40 21:23 Now when He came to the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people confronted Him as He was teaching, and said, "By what authority are You doing these things? And who gave You this authority?" 40 21:24 But Jesus answered and said to them, "I will also ask you one thing, which if you tell me, I likewise will tell you by what authority I do these things." 40 21:25 The baptism of John, where was it from? From heaven, or from men?" And they reasoned among themselves, saying, "If we shall say, 'From heaven,' He will say to us, 'Why then did you not believe him?' 40 21:26 But if we shall say, 'From men,' we fear the crowds, because everyone counts John as a prophet." 40 21:27 So they answered Jesus, and said, "We do not know." And He said to them, "Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things. 40 21:28 "But what do you think? A certain man had two sons, and he came to the first and said, 'Son, go, work today in my vineyard.'" 40 21:29 He replied and said, 'I will not,' but afterward he repented, and went." 40 21:30 Then he came to the second and said likewise. And he replied and said, 'I will go, sir,' but he did not go." 40 21:31 Which of those two did the will of his father?" They said to Him, "The first." Jesus said to them, "Truly, I say to you, that tax collectors and prostitutes enter the kingdom of God before you. 40 21:32 Because, John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you did not believe him; but tax collectors and prostitutes believed him; and you, when you saw it, did not afterward repent that you might believe him." 40 21:33 "Hear another parable: There was a certain householder who planted a vineyard and made a hedge around it, dug a winepress in it and built a tower. And leased it out to farmers, and went into a country far away." 40 21:34 Now when the time of harvest drew near, he sent his servants to the farmers, that they might receive its fruit." 40 21:35 But the farmers took his servants, beat one, killed one, and stoned another." 40 21:36 Again, he sent other servants more than the first, and they did the same to them." 40 21:37 Then last of all he sent his son to them, saying, 'They will respect my son.'" 40 21:38 But when the farmers saw the son, they said among themselves, 'This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, and let us seize on his inheritance.'" 40 21:39 So they took him, and threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him." 40 21:40 Therefore when the owner of the vineyard comes, what shall he do to those farmers?" 40 21:41 They said to Him, "He will viciously destroy those wicked men, and will lease out his vineyard to other farmers who will present to him the fruits in their seasons." 40 21:42 Jesus said to them, "Have you never read in the Scriptures: 'The stone which the builders rejected has become the chief cornerstone. This was the LORD'S doing, and it is marvelous in our eyes'?" 40 21:43 "Therefore I say to you, the kingdom of God will be taken from you and given to a nation bearing the fruits of it." 40 21:44 And whoever falls on this stone will be broken; but on whomever it falls, it will grind him to powder." 40 21:45 Now when the chief priests and Pharisees had heard His parables, they perceived that He spoke about them. 40 21:46 But when they sought to lay hands on Him, they feared the crowds, because, they counted Him as a prophet. 40 22:1 And Jesus responded and spoke to them again by parables and said: 40 22:2 "The kingdom of heaven is like a certain king who arranged a marriage for his son," 40 22:3 and sent out his servants to call those who were invited to the wedding; and they would not come." 40 22:4 Again, he sent out other servants, saying, 'Tell those who are invited, "Behold, I have prepared my dinner; my oxen and my fatted cattle are slaughtered, and all things are ready. Come to the marriage." ' 40 22:5 But they made light of it, and went their ways, one to his farm, another to his business." 40 22:6 And the rest took his servants, treated them spitefully, and killed them." 40 22:7 But when the king heard about it, he was very angry. And he sent out his armies, destroyed those murderers, and burned up their city." 40 22:8 Then he said to his servants, 'The wedding is ready, but those who were invited were not worthy." 40 22:9 Therefore go into the highways, and as many as you can find, invite to the marriage.'" 40 22:10 So those servants went out into the highways, and gathered together everyone they could find, both bad and good. And the wedding was filled with guests." 40 22:11 "But when the king came in to see the guests, he saw a man there who did not have a wedding garment on." 40 22:12 And he said to him, 'Friend, how did you come in here without a wedding garment?' And he was speechless." 40 22:13 Then the king said to the servants, 'Bind him hand and foot, take him away, and throw him into outer darkness; there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.'" 40 22:14 "Because, many are called, but few are chosen." 40 22:15 Then the Pharisees went, and plotted how they might entangle Him in His speech. 40 22:16 And they sent out to Him their disciples with the Herodians, saying, "Teacher, we know that You are true, and teach the way of God in truth; nor do You gratify anyone, because You do not regard the person of men. 40 22:17 Tell us, therefore, what do You think? Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?" 40 22:18 But Jesus perceived their wickedness, and said, "Why do you test Me, you hypocrites?" 40 22:19 Show Me the tax money." So they gave a denarius to Him. 40 22:20 And He said to them, "Whose image and inscription is this?" 40 22:21 They said to Him, "Caesar's." Then He said to them, "Therefore render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's." 40 22:22 When they had heard these words, they marveled, and left Him and went their way. 40 22:23 The same day the Sadducees who say that there is no resurrection, came to Him and asked Him, 40 22:24 saying: "Teacher, Moses said, that if a man dies, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife, and raise up offspring for his brother. 40 22:25 Now there were with us seven brothers. So the first died after he had married a wife, and having no offspring, left his wife to his brother. 40 22:26 Likewise the second also, and the third, until the seventh. 40 22:27 Then last of all the woman died also. 40 22:28 Therefore in the resurrection, whose wife of the seven shall she be, because they all had her?" 40 22:29 Jesus answered and said to them, "You are mistaken, not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God." 40 22:30 Because, in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are as the angels of God in heaven." 40 22:31 But concerning the resurrection of the dead, have you not read what was spoken to you by God, saying," 40 22:32 'I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob'? God is not the God of the dead, but of the living." 40 22:33 And when the crowds heard this, they were astonished at His doctrine. 40 22:34 But when the Pharisees heard that He had silenced the Sadducees, they were gathered together. 40 22:35 Then one of them, who was a lawyer, asked Him a question, testing Him, and saying, 40 22:36 "Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the law?" 40 22:37 Jesus said to him, "'You shall love the LORD your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind.'" 40 22:38 This is the first and great commandment." 40 22:39 And the second is like it, 'You shall love your neighbor as yourself.'" 40 22:40 On these two commandments hang all the Law and the Prophets." 40 22:41 While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them, 40 22:42 saying, "What do you think of Christ? Whose Son is He?" They said to Him, "The Son of David." 40 22:43 He said to them, "How then does David in the Spirit call Him 'Lord,' saying:" 40 22:44 "The LORD said to my Lord, 'sit at My right hand, until I make Your enemies Your footstool?'" 40 22:45 If David then calls Him 'Lord,' how is He his Son?" 40 22:46 And no one was able to answer Him a word, nor did anyone ask Him any more questions from that day on. 40 23:1 Then Jesus spoke to the crowd and to His disciples, 40 23:2 saying: "The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses' seat." 40 23:3 Everything then, whatever they tell you to observe, that observe and do, but do not do according to their works; because they preach, and do not practice." 40 23:4 Because, they bind heavy burdens, hard to carry, and lay them on men's shoulders; but they themselves will not move them with one of their fingers." 40 23:5 But they do their works to be seen by men. They make their phylacteries broad and enlarge the edges of their garments." 40 23:6 They love the best places at feasts, the first seats in the synagogues," 40 23:7 greetings in the markets, and to be called by men, 'Rabbi, Rabbi.'" 40 23:8 But you, do not be called 'Rabbi'; because, One is your Teacher, that is, Christ, and you are all brethren." 40 23:9 And do not call anyone on earth your father; because One is your Father, who is in heaven." 40 23:10 Nor be called teachers; because One is your Teacher, that is, Christ." 40 23:11 But he who is greatest among you shall be your servant." 40 23:12 And whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted." 40 23:13 "But woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because, you shut up the kingdom of heaven against men; because you neither go in yourselves, nor do you permit those who are entering to go in." 40 23:14 Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because, you devour widows' houses, and for a show make long prayers. Therefore you will receive the greater damnation." 40 23:15 Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because, you travel land and sea to make one proselyte, and when he is converted, you make him twice as much the child of hell as yourselves." 40 23:16 "Woe to you, you blind guides, who say, 'Whoever swears by the temple, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gold of the temple, he is obligated!'" 40 23:17 You fools and blind! Because which is greater, the gold or the temple that sanctifies the gold?" 40 23:18 And, 'Whoever swears by the altar, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gift that is on it, he is obligated.'" 40 23:19 You fools and blind! Because which is greater, the gift or the altar that sanctifies the gift?" 40 23:20 Therefore whoever swears by the altar, swears by it and by all things on it." 40 23:21 And whoever swears by the temple, swears by it, and by Him who dwells in it." 40 23:22 And he who swears by heaven, swears by the throne of God and by Him who sits upon it." 40 23:23 Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because, you pay tithe of mint and anise and cummin, and have omitted the weightier matters of the law: judgment, mercy, and faith. You should have done these, without leaving the others undone." 40 23:24 You blind guides, who strain at a gnat, and swallow a camel!" 40 23:25 "Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because, you clean the outside of the cup and dish, but inside they are full of extortion and excess." 40 23:26 You blind Pharisee, first cleanse that which is inside of the cup and dish, that the outside of them may be clean also." 40 23:27 "Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because, you are like whitewashed tombs which indeed appear beautiful outwardly, but inside are full of dead men's bones and all uncleanness." 40 23:28 Even so you also outwardly appear righteous to men, but inside you are full of hypocrisy and iniquity." 40 23:29 "Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because, you build the tombs of the prophets and decorate the tombs of the righteous," 40 23:30 and say, 'If we had been in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.'" 40 23:31 "Therefore you are witnesses against yourselves that you are the children of those who killed the prophets." 40 23:32 Fill up then the measure of your fathers." 40 23:33 You serpents, you generation of vipers, how can you escape the damnation of hell?" 40 23:34 Therefore, behold, I send to you prophets, wise men, and scribes: and some of them you will kill and crucify, and some of them you will scourge in your synagogues, and persecute them from city to city," 40 23:35 that upon you may come all the righteous blood shed on the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Berechiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar." 40 23:36 Truly, I say to you, all these things will come upon this generation." 40 23:37 "O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kills the prophets, and stone those who are sent to you! How often I wanted to gather your children together, just as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you were not willing!" 40 23:38 Behold! Your house is left to you desolate;" 40 23:39 because, I say to you, You will see me no more until you shall say, 'Blessed is He who comes in the name of the LORD.'" 40 24:1 Then Jesus went out and departed from the temple, and His disciples came to Him to show Him the buildings of the temple. 40 24:2 And Jesus said to them: "Do you not see all these things? Truly, I say to you, there will not be left here one stone upon another that will not be thrown down." 40 24:3 Now as He sat on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to Him privately, saying, "Tell us, when shall these things happen? And what shall be the sign of Your coming, and of the end of the age?" 40 24:4 And Jesus answered and said to them, "Beware that no one deceives you." 40 24:5 Because, many will come in My name, saying, 'I am Christ,' and will deceive many." 40 24:6 And you will hear of wars and rumors of wars. See that you are not troubled; because, all these things must come to pass, but the end is not yet." 40 24:7 Because, nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. And there will be famines, pestilences, and earthquakes in various places." 40 24:8 All these are the beginning of sorrows." 40 24:9 Then they will deliver you up to be afflicted, and will kill you, and you will be hated by all nations for My name's sake." 40 24:10 And then many will be offended, will betray one another, and will hate one another." 40 24:11 Then many false prophets will rise up and will deceive many." 40 24:12 And because iniquity will abound, the love of many will go cold." 40 24:13 But he who endures to the end, they will be saved." 40 24:14 And this gospel of the kingdom will be preached in all the world as a witness to all nations, and then the end will come." 40 24:15 "Therefore when you see the 'abomination of desolation,' spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing in the holy place," (whoever reads, let him understand), 40 24:16 "then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains." 40 24:17 Let him who is on the housetop not go down to take anything out of his house," 40 24:18 nor let him who is in the field return back to take his clothes." 40 24:19 But woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing babes in those days!" 40 24:20 And pray that your flight may not be in the winter nor on the Sabbath day." 40 24:21 Because, then there will be great tribulation, such as has not been since the beginning of the world until this time, no, nor ever will be." 40 24:22 And unless those days were shortened, no flesh would be saved; but for the sake of the elect those days will be shortened." 40 24:23 "Then if anyone says to you, 'Look, here is Christ,' or 'There!' Do not believe it." 40 24:24 Because, false christs and false prophets will arise and will show great signs and wonders; so much so that, if it were possible, they would deceive even the elect." 40 24:25 Behold, I have told you in advance." 40 24:26 "Therefore if they say to you, 'Look, He is in the desert!' do not go out; or 'Look, He is in the secret chambers!' Do not believe it." 40 24:27 Because, as the lightning comes out of the east and flashes to the west, so also will the coming of the Son of Man be." 40 24:28 Because, wherever the corpse is, there the eagles will be gathered together." 40 24:29 Immediately after the tribulation of those days the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give her light; the stars will fall from heaven, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken." 40 24:30 And then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in heaven, and then all the tribes of the earth will mourn, and they will see the Son of Man coming in the clouds of heaven with power and great glory." 40 24:31 And He will send His angels with a large sound of a trumpet, and they will gather together His elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other." 40 24:32 "Now learn this parable from the fig tree: When its branch is still tender and grows out leaves, you know that summer is near." 40 24:33 So you likewise, when you see all these things, know that it is near, even at the doors!" 40 24:34 Truly, I say to you, this generation will not pass away, until all these things are fulfilled." 40 24:35 Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will not pass away." 40 24:36 But of that day and hour no one knows, no, not the angels of heaven, but My Father only." 40 24:37 But as the days of Noah were, so also will the coming of the Son of Man be." 40 24:38 Because, as in the days that were before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ark," 40 24:39 and did not know until the flood came and took them all away, so also will the coming of the Son of Man be." 40 24:40 Then two will be in the field: the one will be taken and the other left." 40 24:41 Two women will be grinding at the mill: one will be taken and the other left." 40 24:42 Therefore watch, because, you do not know what hour your Lord is coming." 40 24:43 But know this, that if the master of the house had known what hour the thief would come, he would have watched and not allowed his house to be broken into." 40 24:44 Therefore you likewise be ready, because the Son of Man is coming at an hour you do not expect." 40 24:45 "Who then is a faithful and wise servant, whom his master made ruler over his household, to provide them with food in the appropriate season?" 40 24:46 Blessed is that servant, whom his master, when he comes, will find doing that." 40 24:47 Truly, I say to you, that he will make him ruler over all his goods." 40 24:48 But if that evil servant says in his heart, 'My master is delaying his coming,'" 40 24:49 and begins to beat his fellow servants, and to eat and drink with the drunkards," 40 24:50 the master of that servant will come on a day when he is not looking for him and at an hour that he is not aware of," 40 24:51 and will cut him in two, and appoint him his portion with the hypocrites. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth." 40 25:1 "Then the kingdom of heaven will be likened to ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom." 40 25:2 Now five of them were wise, and five were foolish." 40 25:3 Those who were foolish took their lamps and took no oil with them," 40 25:4 but the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps." 40 25:5 While the bridegroom was delayed, they all slumbered and slept." 40 25:6 "And at midnight a shout was made, 'Behold, the bridegroom is coming; go out to meet him!'" 40 25:7 Then all those virgins arose, and trimmed their lamps." 40 25:8 And the foolish said to the wise, 'Give us some of your oil, because, our lamps have gone out.'" 40 25:9 But the wise replied, saying, 'No, lest there shall not be enough for us and you; but rather go to those who sell, and buy for yourselves.'" 40 25:10 And while they went to buy, the bridegroom came, and those who were ready went in with him to the wedding; and the door was shut." 40 25:11 "Afterward the other virgins came also, saying, 'Lord, Lord, open to us!'" 40 25:12 But he replied and said, 'Truly, I say to you, I do not know you.'" 40 25:13 "Watch therefore, because, you know neither the day nor the hour in which the Son of Man is coming." 40 25:14 "Because, the kingdom of heaven is like a man travelling into a far country, who called his own servants and distributed his goods to them." 40 25:15 And to one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one, to each according to his own ability; and immediately he went on a journey." 40 25:16 Then he who had received the five talents went and traded with them, and made those into another five talents." 40 25:17 And likewise he who had received two, he gained two more also." 40 25:18 But he who had received one went and dug in the earth, and hid his lord's money." 40 25:19 After a long time the lord of those servants came and settled accounts with them." 40 25:20 "And so he who had received five talents came and brought another five talents, saying, 'Lord, you distributed to me five talents; look, I have gained five more talents besides them." 40 25:21 His lord said to him, 'Well done, you good and faithful servant; you have been faithful over a few things, I will make you ruler over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.'" 40 25:22 He also who had received two talents came and said, 'Lord, you distributed to me two talents; look, I have gained two more talents besides them.'" 40 25:23 His lord said to him, 'Well done, good and faithful servant; you have been faithful over a few things, I will make you ruler over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.'" 40 25:24 "Then he who had received the one talent came and said, 'Lord, I knew you to be a hard man, reaping where you have not sown, and gathering where you have not scattered seed." 40 25:25 And I was afraid, and went and hid your talent in the ground. Look, there you have what is yours.'" 40 25:26 "His lord replied and said to him, 'You wicked and lazy servant, you knew that I reap where I have not sown, and gather where I have not scattered seed." 40 25:27 Therefore you should have deposited my money with the bankers, and then at my coming I would have received back my own with interest." 40 25:28 Therefore take the talent from him, and give it to him who has ten talents." 40 25:29 'Because, to everyone who has, more will be given, and he will have abundance; but from him who does not have, even what he has will be taken away." 40 25:30 And cast the unprofitable servant into outer darkness. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.'" 40 25:31 "When the Son of Man comes in His glory, and all the holy angels with Him, then He will sit on the throne of His glory." 40 25:32 And all the nations will be gathered before Him, and He will separate them one from another, like a shepherd divides his sheep from the goats." 40 25:33 And He will set the sheep on His right hand, but the goats on the left." 40 25:34 Then the King will say to those on His right hand, 'Come, you blessed of My Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world:" 40 25:35 because, I was hungry and you gave Me food; I was thirsty and you gave Me a drink; I was a stranger and you took Me in;" 40 25:36 naked, and you clothed Me; I was sick, and you visited Me; I was in prison, and you came to Me.'" 40 25:37 "Then the righteous will reply to Him, saying, 'Lord, when did we see You hungry and feed You, or thirsty and gave You a drink?'" 40 25:38 When did we see You a foreigner and take You in, or naked and clothe You?" 40 25:39 Or when did we see You sick, or in prison, and come to You?'" 40 25:40 And the King will answer and say to them, 'Truly, I say to you, inasmuch as you did it to one of the least of these My brethren, you did it to Me.'" 40 25:41 "Then He will also say to those on the left hand, 'Depart from Me, you cursed, into everlasting fire, prepared for the devil and his angels:" 40 25:42 because, I was hungry and you did not give Me food; I was thirsty and you did not give Me a drink;" 40 25:43 I was a foreigner and you did not take Me in, naked, and you did not clothe Me, sick, and in prison, and you did not visit Me.'" 40 25:44 "Then they also will reply to Him, saying, 'Lord, when did we see You hungry or thirsty or a foreigner or naked or sick or in prison and did not minister to You?'" 40 25:45 Then He will answer them, saying, 'Truly, I say to you, inasmuch as you did not do it to one of the least of these, you did not do it to Me.'" 40 25:46 And these will depart into everlasting punishment, but the righteous into life eternal." 40 26:1 Now it came to pass, when Jesus had finished all these sayings, He said to His disciples, 40 26:2 "You know that after two days is the Feast of the Passover, and the Son of Man will be betrayed to be crucified." 40 26:3 Then the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders of the people assembled together to the palace of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas, 40 26:4 and plotted how they might seize Jesus by deception and kill Him. 40 26:5 But they said, "Not on the feast day, lest there be an uproar among the people." 40 26:6 Now when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper, 40 26:7 a woman came to Him having an alabaster flask of very precious ointment, and poured it on His head as He was sitting at the table. 40 26:8 But when His disciples saw it, they were indignant, saying, "For what purpose is this waste? 40 26:9 As this ointment might have been sold for much and given to the poor." 40 26:10 When Jesus knew this, He said to them, "Why do you trouble the woman? Since she has performed a good work towards Me." 40 26:11 Because, you have the poor with you always, but Me you do not have always." 40 26:12 Because, in pouring this ointment on My body, she did it for My burial." 40 26:13 Truly, I say to you, wherever this gospel is preached in the entire world, there also will this, what this woman has done, be told as a memorial to her." 40 26:14 Then one of the twelve called Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests 40 26:15 and said to them, "What will you give me, and I will deliver Him to you?" And they covenanted with him for thirty pieces of silver. 40 26:16 So from that time he sought opportunity to betray Him. 40 26:17 Now on the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread the disciples came to Jesus, saying to Him, "Where do You want us to prepare for You to eat the Passover?" 40 26:18 And He said, "Go into the city to a certain man, and say to him, 'The Teacher says, "My time is at hand; I will keep the Passover at your house with My disciples." '" 40 26:19 So the disciples did as Jesus had directed them; and they made preparations for the Passover. 40 26:20 Now when the evening had come, He sat down with the twelve. 40 26:21 And as they were eating, He said, "Truly I say to you, that one of you will betray me." 40 26:22 And they were exceedingly sorrowful, and each of them began to say to Him, "Lord, am I the one?" 40 26:23 And He answered and said, "He who dips his hand with Me in the dish, he will betray Me." 40 26:24 The Son of Man goes just as it is written of Him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been good for that man if he had not been born." 40 26:25 Then Judas, who betrayed Him, replied and said, "Rabbi, am I the one?" He said to him, "You have said it." 40 26:26 And as they were eating, Jesus took bread, blessed it, and broke it, and gave it to the disciples and said, "Take, eat; this is My body." 40 26:27 Then He took the cup, and gave thanks, and gave it to them, saying, "Drink from it all of you." 40 26:28 Because, this is My blood of the new testament, which is shed for many for the remission of sins." 40 26:29 But I say to you, I will not drink of this fruit of the vine from now on until that day when I drink it new with you in My Father's kingdom." 40 26:30 And when they had sung a song, they went out to the Mount of Olives. 40 26:31 Then Jesus said to them, "All of you will be made to stumble because of Me this night, because, it is written: 'I will strike the Shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.'" 40 26:32 But after I am raised up again, I will go before you to Galilee." 40 26:33 Peter replied and said to Him, "Even if all men are made to stumble because of You, yet I will never be made to stumble." 40 26:34 Jesus said to him, "Truly, I say to you, that this night, before the rooster crows, you will deny Me three times." 40 26:35 Peter said to Him, "Even if I have to die with You, yet I will not deny You!" And all the disciples said likewise. 40 26:36 Then Jesus came with them to a place called Gethsemane, and said to the disciples, "Sit here, while I go and pray over there." 40 26:37 And He took Peter and the two sons of Zebedee with Him, and began to be sorrowful and deeply troubled. 40 26:38 Then He said to them, "My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to death. Stay here and watch with Me." 40 26:39 And He went a little further, fell on His face, and prayed, saying, "O My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass from Me; nevertheless not as I will, but as You will." 40 26:40 Then He came to the disciples and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, "What! Could you not watch with Me one hour?" 40 26:41 Watch and pray, that you do not enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak." 40 26:42 He went away again the second time and prayed, saying, "O My Father, if this cup cannot pass away from Me unless I drink it, Your will be done." 40 26:43 And He came and found them asleep again, because their eyes were heavy. 40 26:44 So He left them, went away again, and prayed the third time, saying the same words. 40 26:45 Then He came to His disciples, and said to them, "Sleep on now and take your rest. Behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of Man is being betrayed into the hands of sinners." 40 26:46 Rise, let us be going. See, My betrayer is at hand." 40 26:47 And while He was still speaking, behold, Judas, one of the twelve, and with him a large crowd with swords and clubs, came from the chief priests and elders of the people. 40 26:48 Now His betrayer had given them a sign, saying, "Whomever I kiss, He is the One; seize Him." 40 26:49 And immediately he went up to Jesus, and said, "Greetings Rabbi!" and kissed Him. 40 26:50 But Jesus said to him, "Friend, why have you come?" Then they came and laid hands on Jesus and took Him. 40 26:51 And suddenly, one of those who were with Jesus stretched out his hand and drew his sword, and struck a servant of the high priest and cut off his ear. 40 26:52 Then Jesus said to him, "Put your sword in its place, because all those who take the sword will die by the sword." 40 26:53 Or do you think that I cannot now pray to My Father, and He will provide Me with more than twelve legions of angels?" 40 26:54 But how then shall the Scriptures be fulfilled, that it must happen this way?" 40 26:55 In that same hour Jesus said to the crowds, "Have you come out as against a thief with swords and clubs to take Me? I sat with you daily, teaching in the temple, and you did not seize Me." 40 26:56 But all this was done that the Scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled." Then all the disciples forsook Him, and fled. 40 26:57 And those who had laid hold of Jesus led Him away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were assembled. 40 26:58 But Peter followed Him at a distance to the high priest's courtyard and went in and sat with the servants to see the end. 40 26:59 Now the chief priests, elders, and all the council sought false testimony against Jesus, to put Him to death, 40 26:60 but found none. Yes, although many false witnesses came forward, yet they found none. But at last two false witnesses came forward 40 26:61 and said, "This Man said, 'I am able to destroy the temple of God and to build it in three days.'" 40 26:62 And the high priest arose and said to Him, "Do You answer nothing? What is it that these witness against You?" 40 26:63 But Jesus kept silent. And the high priest responded and said to Him, "I adjure You by the living God, that You tell us if You are the Christ, the Son of God!" 40 26:64 Jesus said to Him, "You have said it, nevertheless I say to you all, after this you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming in the clouds of heaven." 40 26:65 Then the high priest tore his clothes, saying, "He has spoken blasphemy! What further need do we have of witnesses? Look, now you have heard His blasphemy! 40 26:66 What do you think?" They answered and said, "He is worthy of death." 40 26:67 Then they spat in His face and beat Him; and others struck Him with the palms of their hands, 40 26:68 saying, "Prophesy to us, You Christ! Who is the one who struck You?" 40 26:69 Now Peter sat outside in the courtyard. And a servant girl came to him, saying, You were also with Jesus of Galilee. 40 26:70 But he denied it before them all, saying, "I do not know what you are saying." 40 26:71 And when he had gone out to the gateway, another girl saw him, and said to those who were there, "This man was also with Jesus of Nazareth." 40 26:72 But again he denied with an oath, "I do not know the Man." 40 26:73 And after a while those who stood by came up to him and said to Peter, "Surely you also are one of them, because your speech exposes you." 40 26:74 Then he began to curse and to swear, saying, "I do not know the Man!" And immediately the rooster crowed. 40 26:75 And Peter remembered the word of Jesus, who said to him, "Before the rooster crows, you will deny Me three times." So he went out and wept bitterly. 40 27:1 When the morning came, all the chief priests and elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put Him to death. 40 27:2 And when they had bound Him, they led Him away and delivered Him to Pontius Pilate the governor. 40 27:3 Then Judas, who had betrayed Him, observing that He was condemned, was remorseful and returned the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and the elders, 40 27:4 saying, "I have sinned by betraying the innocent blood." And they said, "What is that to us? You see to it!" 40 27:5 Then he threw down the pieces of silver in the temple and departed, and went and hung himself. 40 27:6 And the chief priests took the silver pieces and said, "It is not lawful to put them into the treasury, because it is the payment for blood." 40 27:7 And they took counsel and bought with them the potter's field, to bury strangers in. 40 27:8 Therefore that field has been called, the Field of Blood, to this day. 40 27:9 Then was fulfilled what was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet, saying, "And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the value of Him that was priced, whom they of the children of Israel priced, 40 27:10 and gave them for the potter's field, as the LORD directed me." 40 27:11 Now Jesus stood before the governor. And the governor asked Him, saying, "Are You the King of the Jews?" And Jesus said to him, "It is as you say." 40 27:12 And while He was being accused by the chief priests and elders, He did not reply. 40 27:13 Then Pilate said to Him, "Do You not hear how many things they testify against You?" 40 27:14 But He answered him not one word, so that the governor marveled greatly. 40 27:15 Now at that feast the governor was accustomed to release to the people a prisoner, whoever they desired. 40 27:16 And at that time they had an infamous prisoner called Barabbas. 40 27:17 Therefore, when they had gathered together, Pilate said to them, "Whom do you want me to release to you? Barabbas, or Jesus who is called Christ?" 40 27:18 Because, he knew that they had handed Him over because of envy. 40 27:19 While he was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent to him, saying, "Have nothing to do with that just Man, because, I have suffered many things today in a dream because of Him." 40 27:20 But the chief priests and elders persuaded the crowds that they should ask for Barabbas and destroy Jesus. 40 27:21 The governor responded and said to them, "Which of the two do you want me to release to you?" They said, "Barabbas!" 40 27:22 Pilate said to them, "What shall I do with Jesus who is called Christ?" They all said to him, "Let Him be crucified!" 40 27:23 And the governor said, "Why, what evil has He done?" But they shouted out all the more, saying, "Let Him be crucified!" 40 27:24 When Pilate saw that he could not prevail at all, but rather that an uproar occurred, he took water, and washed his hands before the crowd, saying, "I am innocent of the blood of this just Person. You see to it." 40 27:25 Then all the people replied and said, "His blood be upon us, and upon our children." 40 27:26 Then he released Barabbas to them; and when he had scourged Jesus, he delivered Him to be crucified. 40 27:27 Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the common hall and gathered the entire garrison of soldiers around Him. 40 27:28 And they stripped Him and put a scarlet robe on Him. 40 27:29 And when they had platted a crown of thorns, they put it on His head, and a reed in His right hand. And they bowed the knee before Him and mocked Him, saying, "Hail, King of the Jews!" 40 27:30 Then they spat on Him, and took the reed and struck Him on the head. 40 27:31 And after they had mocked Him, they took the robe off Him, put His own clothes on Him, and led Him away to crucify Him. 40 27:32 Now as they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name. They compelled him to carry His cross. 40 27:33 And when they came to a place called Golgotha, that is to say, Place of a Skull, 40 27:34 they gave Him vinegar to drink mixed with gall. But when He had tasted of it, He would not drink. 40 27:35 Then they crucified Him, and divided His clothes, casting lots, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophet: "They divided My garments among them, and for My clothing they cast lots." 40 27:36 And sitting down, they kept watch over Him there. 40 27:37 And they put over His head the charge written against Him: THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS. 40 27:38 Then two thieves were crucified with Him, one on the right, and another on the left. 40 27:39 And those who passed by reviled Him, shaking their heads 40 27:40 and saying, "You who destroy the temple, and build it in three days, save Yourself! If You are the Son of God, come down from the cross." 40 27:41 Likewise the chief priests also, mocking Him with the scribes and elders, said, 40 27:42 "He saved others; He cannot save Himself! If He is the King of Israel, let Him now come down from the cross, and we will believe Him. 40 27:43 He trusted in God; let Him deliver Him now, if He will have Him; since He said, 'I am the Son of God.'" 40 27:44 The thieves also, who were crucified with Him, reviled Him with the same thing. 40 27:45 Now from the sixth hour until the ninth hour there was darkness over all the land. 40 27:46 And about the ninth hour Jesus shouted out with a loud voice, saying, "Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?" that is to say, "My God, My God, why have You forsaken Me?" 40 27:47 Some of those who stood there when they heard that, said, "This Man is calling for Elijah." 40 27:48 And immediately one of them ran and took a sponge, and filled it with vinegar, they put it on a reed, and offered it to Him to drink. 40 27:49 The rest said, "Leave Him alone; let us see whether Elijah will come to save Him." 40 27:50 Jesus shouted out again with a loud voice and gave up His spirit. 40 27:51 Then, behold, the veil of the temple was torn in two from top to the bottom; and the earth quaked, and the rocks split open, 40 27:52 and the graves were opened; and many bodies of the saints who were asleep were raised up, 40 27:53 and came out of the graves after His resurrection, and went into the holy city, and appeared to many. 40 27:54 So when the centurion and those with Him, who were guarding Jesus, saw the earthquake and the things that occurred, they feared greatly, saying, "Truly this was the Son of God." 40 27:55 And many women who followed Jesus from Galilee ministering to Him, were there watching from afar, 40 27:56 among whom were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of Zebedee's children. 40 27:57 Now when the evening had come, there came a rich man from Arimathaea, named Joseph, who himself was also Jesus' disciple. 40 27:58 He went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be given. 40 27:59 And when Joseph had taken the body, he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth, 40 27:60 and laid it in his own new tomb which he had cut out in the rock; and he rolled a large stone against the door of the tomb, and departed. 40 27:61 And Mary Magdalene was there, and the other Mary, sitting opposite the tomb. 40 27:62 On the next day, which followed the Day of the Preparation, the chief priests and Pharisees gathered together to Pilate, 40 27:63 saying, "Sir, we remember, while He was still alive, how that deceiver said, 'After three days I will rise again.' 40 27:64 Therefore command that the tomb be made secure until the third day, lest His disciples come by night and steal Him away, and say to the people, 'He is risen from the dead.' So the last deception will be worse than the first." 40 27:65 Pilate said to them, "You have a guard; go your way, make it as secure as you can." 40 27:66 So they went and made the tomb secure, sealing the stone and setting the guard. 40 28:1 At the end of the Sabbath, as the first day of the week began to dawn, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to see the tomb. 40 28:2 And behold, there was a large earthquake; because, the angel of the Lord descended from heaven and came and rolled back the stone from the door, and sat on it. 40 28:3 His countenance was like lightning, and his clothing as white as snow. 40 28:4 And the guards shook for fear of him, and became like dead men. 40 28:5 But the angel responded and said to the women, "Do not be afraid, because I know that you seek Jesus who was crucified. 40 28:6 He is not here; because He is risen, as He said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay. 40 28:7 And go quickly and tell His disciples that He is risen from the dead, and behold, He is going before you into Galilee; there you will see Him. Behold, I have told you." 40 28:8 So they went out quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, and ran to tell His disciples. 40 28:9 And as they went to tell His disciples, behold, Jesus met them, saying, "Greetings." And they came and held Him by the feet and worshiped Him. 40 28:10 Then Jesus said to them, "Do not be afraid. Go and tell My brethren to go to Galilee, and there they will see Me." 40 28:11 Now while they were going, behold, some of the guard came into the city, and reported to the chief priests all the things that had happened. 40 28:12 When they had assembled with the elders and took counsel, they gave a large amount of money to the soldiers, 40 28:13 saying, "Tell them, 'His disciples came at night and stole Him away while we slept.' 40 28:14 And if this comes to the governor's ears, we will persuade him and protect you." 40 28:15 So they took the money and did as they were instructed; and this saying is commonly reported among the Jews until this day. 40 28:16 Then the eleven disciples went away into Galilee, to a mountain where Jesus had appointed for them. 40 28:17 And when they saw Him, they worshiped Him; but some doubted. 40 28:18 And Jesus came and spoke to them, saying, "All authority has been given to Me in heaven and on earth." 40 28:19 "Go therefore and teach all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit," 40 28:20 teaching them to observe all things that I have commanded you; and behold, I am with you always, even to the end of the age." Amen. 41 1:1 The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God. 41 1:2 As it is written in the prophets: "Behold, I send My messenger before Your face, who will prepare Your way before You." 41 1:3 "The voice of one shouting in the wilderness: 'Prepare the way of the LORD; make His paths straight.'" 41 1:4 John came baptizing in the wilderness, and preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins. 41 1:5 And all the land of Judea, and those from Jerusalem, went out to him and were all baptized by him in the Jordan River, confessing their sins. 41 1:6 Now John was clothed with camel's hair and a leather belt around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey. 41 1:7 And he preached, saying, "He who comes after me is mightier than me, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to stoop down and loose. 41 1:8 I indeed have baptized you with water, but He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit." 41 1:9 And it came to pass in those days that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized by John in the Jordan. 41 1:10 And immediately, coming up from the water, He saw the heavens opened, and the Spirit descending upon Him like a dove. 41 1:11 And there came a voice from heaven, saying, "You are My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased." 41 1:12 And immediately the Spirit drove Him into the wilderness. 41 1:13 And He was there in the wilderness forty days, tempted by Satan, and was with the wild beasts; and the angels ministered to Him. 41 1:14 Now after John was put in prison, Jesus came to Galilee, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God, 41 1:15 and saying, "The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand. Repent, and believe the gospel." 41 1:16 Now as He walked by the sea of Galilee, He saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea; because they were fishermen. 41 1:17 And Jesus said to them, "Follow after Me, and I will make you become fishers of men." 41 1:18 And immediately they left their nets and followed Him. 41 1:19 And when He had gone a little farther from there, He saw James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, who also were in the boat mending their nets. 41 1:20 And immediately He called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired servants, and went after Him. 41 1:21 Then they went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath day He entered into the synagogue and taught. 41 1:22 And they were astonished at His doctrine, because, He taught them as one that had authority, and not as the scribes. 41 1:23 Now there was a man in their synagogue with an unclean spirit. And he shouted out, 41 1:24 saying, "Leave us alone! What have we to do with You, Jesus of Nazareth? Have You come to destroy us? I know who You are, the Holy One of God!" 41 1:25 But Jesus rebuked him, saying, "Be quiet, and come out of him!" 41 1:26 And when the unclean spirit had convulsed him and shouted with a loud voice, he came out of him. 41 1:27 Then they were all amazed, so that they questioned among themselves, saying, "What is this? What new doctrine is this? Because, with authority He commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey Him." 41 1:28 And immediately His fame spread throughout all the region around Galilee. 41 1:29 Now as soon as they had come out of the synagogue, they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John. 41 1:30 But Simon's wife's mother lay sick with a fever, and they quickly told Him about her. 41 1:31 So He came and took her by the hand and lifted her up, and immediately the fever left her. And she ministered to them. 41 1:32 And at evening, when the sun had set, they brought to Him all who were sick and those who were demon possessed. 41 1:33 And the entire city was gathered together at the door. 41 1:34 And He healed many who were sick with various diseases, and cast out many demons; and He did not permit the demons to speak, because they knew Him. 41 1:35 Now in the morning, having risen a long while before daylight, He went out and departed to an isolated place, and prayed there. 41 1:36 And Simon and those who were with Him searched for Him. 41 1:37 And when they had found Him, they said to Him, "Everyone is looking for You." 41 1:38 And He said to them, "Let us go into the next towns, that I may preach there as well, because for this purpose I have come forth." 41 1:39 And He preached in their synagogues throughout all Galilee, and cast out demons. 41 1:40 Now a leper came to Him, begging Him, kneeling down to Him and saying to Him, "If You are willing, You can make me clean." 41 1:41 Then Jesus, moved with compassion, stretched out His hand, and touched him, and said to him, "I am willing; be cleansed." 41 1:42 And as soon as He had spoken, immediately the leprosy left him, and he was cleansed. 41 1:43 And He strictly warned him and immediately sent him away, 41 1:44 and said to him, "See that you say nothing to anyone; but go your way, show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing those things which Moses commanded, as a testimony to them." 41 1:45 However, he went out and began to proclaim it freely, and to spread the matter abroad, so that Jesus could no longer openly enter into the city, but was outside in deserted places; and they came to Him from every direction. 41 2:1 And after a few days He entered into Capernaum again, and it was told that He was in the house. 41 2:2 And immediately many were gathered together, so that there was no room to receive them, not even near the door. And He preached the word to them. 41 2:3 Then they came to Him, bringing a paralytic who was carried by four men. 41 2:4 And when they could not come near to Him because of the crowd, they uncovered the roof where He was. So when they had broken through, they let down the bed upon which the paralytic was lying. 41 2:5 When Jesus saw their faith, He said to the paralytic, "Son, your sins are forgiven you." 41 2:6 However some of the scribes were sitting there and reasoning in their hearts, 41 2:7 "Why does this Man speak blasphemies like this? Who can forgive sins but God alone?" 41 2:8 But immediately, when Jesus perceived in His spirit that they reasoned like this within themselves, He said to them, "Why do you reason these things in your hearts?" 41 2:9 Which is easier, to say to the paralytic, 'Your sins are forgiven you,' or to say, 'Arise, take up your bed and walk'?" 41 2:10 But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins," He said to the paralytic, 41 2:11 "I say to you, arise, take up your bed, and go to your house." 41 2:12 And immediately he arose, took up the bed, and went out in front of them all, so that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, "We never saw anything like this!" 41 2:13 Then He went out again by the sea; and all the crowds came to Him, and He taught them. 41 2:14 And as He passed by, He saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax office, and said to him, "Follow Me." And he arose and followed Him. 41 2:15 Now it happened, as Jesus was dining in Levi's house, that many tax collectors and sinners also sat together with Jesus and His disciples; because there were many, and they followed Him. 41 2:16 And when the scribes and Pharisees saw Him eating with tax collectors and sinners, they said to His disciples, "How come He eats and drinks with tax collectors and sinners?" 41 2:17 When Jesus heard it, He said to them, "Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick. I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners, to repentance." 41 2:18 And the disciples of John and of the Pharisees used to fast. Then they came and said to Him, "Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but Your disciples do not fast?" 41 2:19 And Jesus said to them, "Can the children of the bridechamber fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them they cannot fast." 41 2:20 But the days will come, when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast in those days." 41 2:21 And no one sews a piece of new cloth on old clothing; or else the new piece that took its place rips away from the old, and the tear is made worse." 41 2:22 And no one puts new grape juice into old wineskins; or else the new grape juice bursts the wineskins, the grape juice is spilled, and the wineskins are ruined. But new grape juice must be put into new wineskins." 41 2:23 Now it happened that He went through the grainfields on the Sabbath day; and as they went His disciples began to pluck the heads of grain. 41 2:24 And the Pharisees said to Him, "Look, why do they do what is not lawful on the Sabbath day?" 41 2:25 But He said to them, "Have you never read what David did when he had need and was hungry, he and those who were with him:" 41 2:26 how he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest, and ate the showbread, which is not lawful to eat except for the priests, and also gave some to those who were with him?" 41 2:27 And He said to them, "The Sabbath was made for man, and not man for the Sabbath." 41 2:28 Therefore the Son of Man is also Lord of the Sabbath." 41 3:1 And He entered into the synagogue again, and a man was there who had a withered hand. 41 3:2 So they watched Him, whether He would heal him on the Sabbath day, so that they might accuse Him. 41 3:3 And He said to the man who had the withered hand, "Stand in the midst." 41 3:4 Then He said to them, "Is it lawful on the Sabbath days to do good or to do evil, to save life, or to kill?" But they kept silent. 41 3:5 And when He had looked around at them with anger, being grieved because of the hardness of their hearts, He said to the man, "Stretch out your hand." And he stretched it out, and his hand was restored as whole as the other. 41 3:6 Then the Pharisees went out and immediately took counsel with the Herodians against Him, how they might destroy Him. 41 3:7 But Jesus withdrew Himself with His disciples to the sea. And a large crowd from Galilee and from Judea followed Him, 41 3:8 also from Jerusalem and Idumea and from beyond the Jordan; and those from Tyre and Sidon, when they heard about the many things He was doing, a large crowd came to Him. 41 3:9 So He told His disciples that a small boat should be kept ready for Him because of the crowd, lest they should swarm Him, 41 3:10 because, He had healed many, so that as many as had afflictions swarmed about Him to touch Him. 41 3:11 And unclean spirits, whenever they saw Him, fell down before Him and shouted out, saying, "You are the Son of God." 41 3:12 But He warned them strictly that they should not make Him known. 41 3:13 And He went up on a mountain and called to Him those whom He wanted. And they came to Him. 41 3:14 Then He ordained twelve, that they might be with Him and that He might send them out to preach, 41 3:15 and to have power to heal sicknesses and to cast out demons: 41 3:16 And Simon He surnamed Peter; 41 3:17 James the son of Zebedee, and John the brother of James, to whom He surnamed Boanerges, which is, "The Sons of Thunder"; 41 3:18 Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, Thaddaeus, and Simon the Cananite; 41 3:19 and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed Him. And they went into a house. 41 3:20 And the crowd came together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread. 41 3:21 But when His friends heard about this, they went out to lay hold of Him, because they said, "He is out of His mind." 41 3:22 And the scribes who came down from Jerusalem said, "He has Beelzebub," and "By the ruler of the demons He casts out demons." 41 3:23 So He called them to Himself and said to them in parables: "How can Satan cast out Satan?" 41 3:24 And if a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand." 41 3:25 And if a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand." 41 3:26 And if Satan has risen up against himself, and is divided, he cannot stand, but has an end." 41 3:27 No one can enter into a strong man's house and plunder his goods, unless he first binds the strong man. And then he shall plunder his house." 41 3:28 "Truly, I say to you, all sins will be forgiven the sons of men, and whatever blasphemies they may speak;" 41 3:29 but he who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal damnation," 41 3:30 because they said, "He has an unclean spirit." 41 3:31 Then His brethren and His mother came, and standing outside they sent to Him, calling Him. 41 3:32 And the crowd sat around Him; and they said to Him, "Look, Your mother and Your brethren are outside seeking You." 41 3:33 But He replied to them, saying, "Who is My mother, or My brethren?" 41 3:34 And He looked around at those who sat about Him, and said, "Behold My mother and My brethren!" 41 3:35 Because, whoever does the will of God is My brother and My sister and mother." 41 4:1 And again He began to teach by the sea side. And a large crowd was gathered to Him, so that He got into a boat and sat in it on the sea. Then the entire crowd was by the sea on the land. 41 4:2 Then He taught them many things by parables, and said to them in His doctrine: 41 4:3 "Listen! Behold, a sower went out to sow." 41 4:4 And it happened, as he sowed, some fell by the wayside, and the birds of the air came and devoured it." 41 4:5 And some fell on stony ground, where it did not have much earth; and immediately it sprang up because it had no depth of earth." 41 4:6 But when the sun was up it was scorched, and because it had no root it withered away." 41 4:7 And some fell among thorns; and the thorns grew up and choked it, and it yielded no fruit." 41 4:8 But the other fell on good ground, and yielded fruit that sprang up, increased, and produced: some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some a hundred." 41 4:9 And He said to them, "He who has ears to hear, let him hear." 41 4:10 But when He was alone, those around Him with the twelve asked Him about the parable. 41 4:11 And He said to them, "To you it has been given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God; but to those who are outside, all these things come in parables," 41 4:12 so that 'Seeing they may see and not perceive, and hearing they may hear and not understand; lest they should be converted at any time, and their sins be forgiven them.'" 41 4:13 And He said to them, "Do you not understand this parable? How then shall you understand all the parables?" 41 4:14 The sower sows the word." 41 4:15 And these are those by the wayside where the word is sown. But when they have heard, Satan comes immediately and takes away the word that was sown in their hearts." 41 4:16 And likewise these are those which are sown on stony ground who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with gladness;" 41 4:17 but they have no root in themselves, and so endure only for a time. Afterward, when affliction or persecution arises for the word's sake, immediately they stumble." 41 4:18 Now these are the ones sown among thorns; those who hear the word," 41 4:19 but the cares of this world, the deceitfulness of riches, and the desires for other things entering in choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful." 41 4:20 But these are they which are sown on good ground, those who hear the word, receive it, and bear fruit: some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some a hundred." 41 4:21 And He said to them, "Is a lamp brought to be put under a basket or under a bed? Is it not to be set on a lampstand?" 41 4:22 Because, there is nothing hidden which will not be revealed, nor has anything been kept secret but that it should come to light." 41 4:23 If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear." 41 4:24 Then He said to them, "Take heed what you hear. With the same measure you use, it will be measured to you; and to you who hear, more will be given." 41 4:25 Because, whoever has, to him more will be given; but whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him." 41 4:26 And He said, "The kingdom of God is like as if a man should scatter seed on the ground," 41 4:27 and should sleep by night and rise by day, and the seed should sprout and grow, he himself does not know how." 41 4:28 Because, the earth yields crops from itself: first the blade, then the head, after that the full grain in the head." 41 4:29 So when the grain ripens, immediately he puts in the sickle, because the harvest has come." 41 4:30 Then He said, "To what shall we liken the kingdom of God? Or with what comparison shall we compare it?" 41 4:31 It is like a grain of mustard seed which, when it is sown on the ground, is smaller than all the seeds that are in the earth;" 41 4:32 but when it is sown, it grows up and becomes greater than all herbs, and shoots out large branches, so that the birds of the air may nest under its shade." 41 4:33 And with many such parables He spoke the word to them as they were able to hear it. 41 4:34 But He did not speak to them without a parable. And when they were alone, He expounded all things to His disciples. 41 4:35 And the same day, when evening had come, He said to them, "Let us cross over to the other side." 41 4:36 Now when they had sent the crowd away, they took Him in the boat just as He was. And there were also with Him other little boats. 41 4:37 And a large windstorm arose, and the waves beat into the boat, so that it was already full. 41 4:38 But He was in the back of the boat, asleep on a pillow. And they awoke Him and said to Him, "Teacher, do You not care that we are perishing?" 41 4:39 Then He arose and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, "Peace, be still!" And the wind ceased and there was a great calm. 41 4:40 But He said to them, "Why are you so fearful? How is it that you have no faith?" 41 4:41 And they feared exceedingly, and said to one another, "What type of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey Him!" 41 5:1 Then they came over to the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes. 41 5:2 And when He had come out of the boat, immediately there met Him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit, 41 5:3 who had his dwelling among the tombs; and no one could bind him, not even with chains, 41 5:4 because he had often been bound with shackles and chains. And the chains had been pulled apart by him, and the shackles broken in pieces; neither could anyone tame him. 41 5:5 And night and day he was always in the mountains and in the tombs, yelling out and cutting himself with stones. 41 5:6 When he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and worshiped Him. 41 5:7 And he shouted out with a loud voice and said, "What have I to do with You, Jesus, You Son of the Most High God? I beg You by God that You do not torment me." 41 5:8 Because He said to him, "Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!" 41 5:9 Then He asked him, "What is your name?" And he answered, saying, "My name is Legion; because, we are many." 41 5:10 And he begged Him earnestly that He would not send them out of the country. 41 5:11 Now a large herd of swine was feeding there near the mountains. 41 5:12 And all the demons begged Him, saying, "Send us into the swine, that we may enter into them." 41 5:13 And immediately Jesus gave them permission. Then the unclean spirits went out and entered into the swine (there were about two thousand); and the herd ran violently down the steep place into the sea, and drowned in the sea. 41 5:14 And those who fed the swine fled, and told it in the city, and in the country. And they went out to see what it was that had happened. 41 5:15 Then they came to Jesus, and saw the one who had been demon possessed and had the legion, sitting and clothed and in his right mind. And they were afraid. 41 5:16 And those who saw it told them how it happened to him who had been demon possessed, and also concerning the swine. 41 5:17 Then they began to plead with Him to depart from their region. 41 5:18 And when He got into the boat, he who had been demon possessed begged Him that he might be with Him. 41 5:19 However, Jesus did not permit him, but said to him, "Go home to your friends, and tell them what great things the Lord has done for you, and how He has had compassion on you." 41 5:20 And he departed and began to proclaim in Decapolis all the great things that Jesus had done for him; and everyone marveled. 41 5:21 Now when Jesus had crossed over again by boat to the other side, many people gathered to Him; and He was near the sea. 41 5:22 And behold, one of the rulers of the synagogue came, Jairus by name. And when he saw Him, he fell at His feet 41 5:23 and begged Him earnestly, saying, "My little daughter lies at the point of death. I beg you, come and lay Your hands on her, that she may be healed, and she will live." 41 5:24 So Jesus went with him, and a large crowd followed Him and swarmed Him. 41 5:25 Now a certain woman had a flow of blood for twelve years, 41 5:26 and had suffered many things from many physicians. She had spent all that she had and was no better, but rather grew worse. 41 5:27 When she heard about Jesus, she came behind Him in the crowd and touched His clothes. 41 5:28 Because, she said, "If only I may touch His clothes, I will be made well." 41 5:29 And immediately the fountain of her blood was dried up, and she felt in her body that she was healed of the affliction. 41 5:30 And Jesus, immediately knowing in Himself that virtue had gone out of Him, turned around in the crowd and said, "Who touched My clothes?" 41 5:31 But His disciples said to Him, "You see the crowd swarming You, and You say, 'Who touched Me?'" 41 5:32 And He looked around to see her who had done this thing. 41 5:33 But the woman, fearing and trembling, knowing what had happened to her, came and fell down before Him and told Him the whole truth. 41 5:34 And He said to her, "Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace, and be healed of your affliction." 41 5:35 While He was still speaking, there came some from the ruler of the synagogue's house who said, "Your daughter is dead. Why trouble the Teacher any further?" 41 5:36 As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken, He said to the ruler of the synagogue, "Do not be afraid; only believe." 41 5:37 And He permitted no one to follow Him except Peter, James, and John the brother of James. 41 5:38 Then He came to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and saw the tumult and those who wept and wailed loudly. 41 5:39 And when He came in, He said to them, "Why make this commotion and weep? The girl is not dead, but sleeping." 41 5:40 And they ridiculed Him. But when He had put them all outside, He took the father and the mother of the child, and those who were with Him, and entered where the girl was lying. 41 5:41 Then He took the girl by the hand, and said to her, "Talitha, cumi," which is translated, "Little girl, I say to you, arise." 41 5:42 And immediately the girl arose and walked, because, she was twelve years of age. And they were overcome with great astonishment. 41 5:43 But He commanded them strictly that no one should know it, and commanded that something should be given her to eat. 41 6:1 Then He went out from there and came into His own country, and His disciples followed Him. 41 6:2 And when the Sabbath day had come, He began to teach in the synagogue. And many hearing Him were astonished, saying, "Where did this Man get these things? And what wisdom is this which is given to Him, that even such mighty works are performed by His hands? 41 6:3 Is this not the carpenter, the Son of Mary, and the brother of James, Joses, Judas, and Simon? And are not His sisters here with us?" So they were offended at Him. 41 6:4 But Jesus said to them, "A prophet is not without honor except in his own country, among his own relatives, and in his own house." 41 6:5 Now He could do no mighty work there, except that He laid His hands on a few sick people and healed them. 41 6:6 And He marveled because of their unbelief. Then He went around about the villages teaching. 41 6:7 And He called the twelve to Himself, and began to send them out two by two, and gave them power over unclean spirits. 41 6:8 And commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey except only a staff, no bag, no bread, no money in their money belts; 41 6:9 but to wear sandals, and not put on two coats. 41 6:10 He also said to them, "In whatever place you enter into a house, stay there until you depart from that place." 41 6:11 And whoever will not receive you nor hear you, when you depart from there, shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them. Truly, I say to you, it will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city!" 41 6:12 So they went out, and preached that people should repent. 41 6:13 And they cast out many demons, and anointed with oil many who were sick, and healed them. 41 6:14 Now King Herod heard of Him, because His name had become well known. And he said, "That John the Baptist was risen from the dead, and therefore these mighty works are at work in him." 41 6:15 Others said, "It is Elijah."
