And others said, "It is a prophet, or like one of the prophets." 41 6:16 But when Herod heard of it, he said, "This is John, whom I beheaded; he has risen from the dead." 41 6:17 Because, Herod himself had sent out and laid hold of John, and bound him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip's wife; because he had married her. 41 6:18 Because John had said to Herod, "It is not lawful for you to have your brother's wife." 41 6:19 Therefore Herodias had this disagreement with him, and wanted to kill him, but she could not; 41 6:20 because, Herod feared John, knowing that he was a just and holy man, and protected him. And when he heard him, he did many things, and heard him gladly. 41 6:21 Then when a convenient day came that Herod on his birthday gave a feast for his nobles, high officers, and chief men of Galilee. 41 6:22 And when Herodias' daughter herself came in and danced, and pleased Herod and those who sat with him, the king said to the girl, "Ask me whatever you want, and I will give it to you." 41 6:23 He also swore to her, "Whatever you will ask me, I will give it to you, up to half of my kingdom." 41 6:24 So she went out, and said to her mother, "What should I ask?" And she said, "The head of John the Baptist!" 41 6:25 And swiftly she came in immediately to the king and asked, saying, "I want you to give me the head of John the Baptist on a platter at once." 41 6:26 And the king was exceedingly sorry; yet because of his oath and because of those who sat with him, he did not want to refuse her. 41 6:27 So immediately the king sent an executioner and commanded his head to be brought. And he went and beheaded him in the prison, 41 6:28 brought his head on a platter, and gave it to the girl; and the girl gave it to her mother. 41 6:29 And when his disciples heard of it, they came and took away his corpse and laid it in a tomb. 41 6:30 Then the apostles gathered together to Jesus and told Him everything, both what they had done and what they had taught. 41 6:31 And He said to them, "Come aside by yourselves to a deserted place and rest a while." Because, there were many coming and going, and they did not even have time to eat. 41 6:32 So they departed by boat to a deserted place privately. 41 6:33 But the crowd saw them departing. And many knew Him and ran there on foot from all the cities, overtook them, and came together to Him. 41 6:34 And Jesus, when He came out, saw a large crowd and was moved with compassion for them, because they were like sheep not having a shepherd. So He began to teach them many things. 41 6:35 And when the day was now almost over, His disciples came to Him and said, "This is a deserted place, and the time has now passed away. 41 6:36 Send them away, that they may go into the surrounding country and into the villages and buy themselves bread; because, they have nothing to eat." 41 6:37 He replied and said to them, "You give them something to eat." And they said to Him, "Shall we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread and give them something to eat?" 41 6:38 He said to them, "How many loaves do you have? Go and see." And when they knew they said, "Five, and two fish." 41 6:39 Then He commanded them to make everyone sit down in groups on the green grass. 41 6:40 So they sat down in ranks, in hundreds and in fifties. 41 6:41 And when He had taken the five loaves and the two fish, He looked up to heaven, blessed and broke the loaves, and gave them to His disciples to set before them; and the two fish He divided among them all. 41 6:42 So they all ate and were filled. 41 6:43 And they took up twelve baskets full of fragments and of the fish. 41 6:44 Now those who had eaten the loaves were about five thousand men. 41 6:45 And immediately He made His disciples get into the boat and go ahead of Him to the other side, to Bethsaida, while He sent the people away. 41 6:46 And when He had sent them away, He departed to a mountain to pray. 41 6:47 Now when evening came, the boat was in the midst of the sea; and He was alone on the land. 41 6:48 Then He saw them straining at rowing, because the wind was against them. Now about the fourth watch of the night He came to them, walking on the sea, and would have passed them by. 41 6:49 And when they saw Him walking on the sea, they supposed it was a spirit, and shouted out; 41 6:50 because they all saw Him and were troubled. But immediately He talked with them and said to them, "Be of good cheer! It is Me; do not be afraid." 41 6:51 Then He went up into the boat to them, and the wind ceased. And they were greatly amazed in themselves beyond measure, and marveled. 41 6:52 Because, they did not consider the miracle of the loaves, because their heart was hardened. 41 6:53 And when they had crossed over, they came to the land of Gennesaret and drew to the shore. 41 6:54 And when they came out of the boat, immediately the people recognized Him, 41 6:55 ran through that entire surrounding region, and began to carry about on beds those who were sick to wherever they heard He was. 41 6:56 And wherever He entered, into villages, cities, or country, they laid the sick in the streets, and begged Him that they might just touch the edge of His clothes. And as many as touched Him were made well. 41 7:1 Then the Pharisees and some of the scribes came together to Him, having come from Jerusalem. 41 7:2 Now when they saw some of His disciples eat bread with defiled, that is, with unwashed hands, they found fault. 41 7:3 Because, the Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they wash their hands often, holding the tradition of the elders. 41 7:4 And when they come from the marketplace, they do not eat unless they wash. And there are many other things which they have received to embrace, like the washing of cups, pots, copper vessels, and couches. 41 7:5 Then the Pharisees and scribes asked Him, "Why do Your disciples not walk according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashed hands?" 41 7:6 He answered and said to them, "Rightly has Isaiah prophesied of you hypocrites as it is written: 'This people honor Me with their lips, but their heart is far from Me." 41 7:7 Therefore in vain do they worship Me, teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.'" 41 7:8 Because laying aside the commandment of God, you embrace the tradition of men, like the washing of pots and cups, and many other such things you do." 41 7:9 And He said to them, "All too well you reject the commandment of God, that you may keep your own tradition." 41 7:10 Because, Moses said, 'Honor your father and your mother'; and, 'He who curses father or mother, let him be put to death.'" 41 7:11 But you claim, 'If a man says to his father or mother, "Whatever profit you might have received from me is Corban" ' (that is to say, a gift), then he will be exempt, 41 7:12 then you no longer permit him to do anything for his father or his mother," 41 7:13 making the word of God of no effect through your tradition which you have handed down. And many such things you do." 41 7:14 And when He had called all the people to Himself, He said to them, "Hear Me, everyone of you, and understand:" 41 7:15 There is nothing that enters a man from outside which can defile him; but the things which come out of him, those are the things that defile a man." 41 7:16 If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear!" 41 7:17 And when He had entered a house away from the people, His disciples asked Him concerning the parable. 41 7:18 So He said to them, "Are you likewise without understanding also? Do you not perceive that whatever enters a man from outside cannot defile him," 41 7:19 because, it does not enter his heart but the stomach, and goes out into the drain, thus purging all foods?" 41 7:20 And He said, "That which comes out of a man, that defiles a man." 41 7:21 Because, from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, fornications, murders," 41 7:22 thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, perversion, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness." 41 7:23 All these evil things come from within and defile the man." 41 7:24 And from there He arose and went to the region of Tyre and Sidon. And He entered into a house and wanted no one to know it, but He could not be hidden. 41 7:25 Because, a certain woman whose young daughter had an unclean spirit heard about Him, and came and fell at His feet. 41 7:26 The woman was a Greek, a Syrophoenician by birth, and she begged Him that He would cast the demon out of her daughter. 41 7:27 But Jesus said to her, "Let the children be filled first, because it is not appropriate to take the children's bread and throw it to the dogs." 41 7:28 And she replied and said to Him, "Yes, Lord, yet even the dogs under the table eat from the children's crumbs." 41 7:29 Then He said to her, "Because of this saying go your way; the demon has gone out of your daughter." 41 7:30 And when she had come to her house, she found the demon gone out, and her daughter lying upon the bed. 41 7:31 And again, departing from the region of Tyre and Sidon, He came through the midst of the region of Decapolis to the Sea of Galilee. 41 7:32 Then they brought to Him one who was deaf and had an impediment in his speech, and they begged Him to put His hand on him. 41 7:33 And He took him aside from the crowd, and put His fingers in his ears, and He spat and touched his tongue. 41 7:34 Then, looking up to heaven, He sighed, and said to him, "Ephphatha," that is, "Be opened." 41 7:35 And immediately his ears were opened, and the impediment of his tongue was loosed, and he spoke plainly. 41 7:36 Then He commanded them that they should tell no one; but the more He commanded them, the more widely they proclaimed it. 41 7:37 And they were astonished beyond measure, saying, "He has done all things well. He makes both the deaf to hear and the mute to speak." 41 8:1 In those days, the crowds being very large and having nothing to eat, Jesus called His disciples to Him and said to them, 41 8:2 "I have compassion on the multitude, because they have now continued with Me three days and have nothing to eat." 41 8:3 And if I send them away fasting to their own houses, they will faint on the way; because, some of them have come from afar." 41 8:4 Then His disciples replied to Him, "How can one satisfy these people with bread here in the wilderness?" 41 8:5 He asked them, "How many loaves do you have?" And they said, "Seven." 41 8:6 So He commanded the people to sit down on the ground. And He took the seven loaves and gave thanks, broke them and gave them to His disciples to set before them; and they set them before the people. 41 8:7 And they also had a few small fish; and having blessed them, He commanded to set them also before them. 41 8:8 So they ate and were filled, and they took up seven large baskets of leftover food fragments. 41 8:9 Now those who had eaten were about four thousand, and He sent them away. 41 8:10 Then immediately He got into the boat with His disciples, and came to the region of Dalmanutha. 41 8:11 And the Pharisees came out and began to dispute with Him, seeking from Him a sign from heaven, testing Him. 41 8:12 But He sighed deeply in His spirit, and said, "Why does this generation seek a sign? Truly, I say to you, no sign will be given to this generation." 41 8:13 And He left them, and getting into the boat again, departed to the other side. 41 8:14 Now the disciples had forgotten to take bread, and they did not have more than one loaf with them in the boat. 41 8:15 And He charged them, saying, "Take heed, beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and the leaven of Herod." 41 8:16 And they reasoned among themselves, saying, "It is because we have no bread." 41 8:17 But when Jesus knew about it, He said to them, "Why do you reason because you have no bread? Do you not yet perceive nor understand? Is your heart still hardened?" 41 8:18 Having eyes, do you not see? And having ears, do you not hear? And do you not remember?" 41 8:19 And when I broke the five loaves for the five thousand, how many baskets full of fragments did you take up?" They said to Him, "Twelve." 41 8:20 "Also, when the seven for the four thousand, how many large baskets full of fragments did you take up?" And they said, "Seven." 41 8:21 So He said to them, "How is it that you do not understand?" 41 8:22 Then He came to Bethsaida; and they brought a blind man to Him, and begged Him to touch him. 41 8:23 So He took the blind man by the hand and led him out of the town. And when He had spat on his eyes and put His hands on him, He asked him if he saw anything." 41 8:24 And he looked up and said, "I see men like trees, walking." 41 8:25 Then He put His hands on his eyes again and made him look up. And he was restored and saw everyone clearly. 41 8:26 Then He sent him away to his house, saying, "Neither go into the town, nor tell it to anyone in the town." 41 8:27 Now Jesus and His disciples went out to the towns of Caesarea Philippi; and on the road He asked His disciples, saying to them, "Who do men say that I am?" 41 8:28 So they answered, "John the Baptist; but some say, Elijah; and others, one of the prophets." 41 8:29 He said to them, "But who do you say that I am?" Peter answered and said to Him, "You are the Christ." 41 8:30 Then He strictly warned them that they should tell no one about Him. 41 8:31 And He began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders and by chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again. 41 8:32 And He spoke this saying openly. Then Peter took Him aside and began to rebuke Him. 41 8:33 But when He had turned around and looked at His disciples, He rebuked Peter, saying, "Get behind Me, Satan! Because, you are not mindful of the things that are of God, but the things that are of men." 41 8:34 And when He had called the people to Himself, with His disciples also, He said to them, "Whoever desires to come after Me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow Me." 41 8:35 Because, whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for My sake and the gospel's will save it." 41 8:36 Because, what shall it profit a man if he gains the entire world, and loses his own soul?" 41 8:37 Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?" 41 8:38 Because, whoever shall be ashamed of Me and My words in this adulterous and sinful generation, of him the Son of Man will also be ashamed when He comes in the glory of His Father with the holy angels." 41 9:1 And He said to them, "Truly, I say to you that there are some standing here who will not taste death until they see the kingdom of God coming with power." 41 9:2 Now after six days Jesus took Peter, James, and John, with Him and led them up on a high mountain privately by themselves; and He was transfigured before them. 41 9:3 His clothes became shining, exceedingly white, like snow, such as no launderer on earth can whiten them. 41 9:4 And Elijah appeared to them with Moses, and they were talking with Jesus. 41 9:5 Then Peter responded and said to Jesus, "Teacher, it is good for us to be here; and let us make three tabernacles: one for You, one for Moses, and one for Elijah," 41 9:6 because, he did not know what to say, because, they were greatly afraid. 41 9:7 And a cloud came and overshadowed them; and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, "This is My beloved Son. Hear Him!" 41 9:8 Then suddenly, when they had looked around, they saw no one anymore, but only Jesus with themselves. 41 9:9 Now as they came down from the mountain, He commanded them that they should tell no one the things they had seen, until the Son of Man had risen from the dead. 41 9:10 So they kept this saying to themselves, questioning one another what the rising from the dead meant. 41 9:11 And they asked Him, saying, "Why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?" 41 9:12 Then He answered and told them, "Indeed, Elijah comes first and restores all things; and just like it is written concerning the Son of Man, that He must suffer many things and be treated with contempt." 41 9:13 But I say to you that Elijah indeed came, and they did to him whatever they wished, as it is written of him." 41 9:14 And when He came to His disciples, He saw a large crowd around them, and scribes disputing with them. 41 9:15 And immediately, when they saw Him, all the people were greatly amazed, and running to Him, greeted Him. 41 9:16 And He asked the scribes, "What are you disputing with them?" 41 9:17 Then one of the crowd answered and said, "Teacher, I brought my son to You, who has a mute spirit. 41 9:18 And wherever it seizes him, it throws him down; he foams at the mouth, gnashes his teeth, and withers away. So I spoke to Your disciples, that they should cast it out, but they could not." 41 9:19 He answered him and said, "O faithless generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I bear with you? Bring him to Me." 41 9:20 Then they brought him to Him. And when he saw Him, immediately the spirit convulsed him, and he fell on the ground and rolled around, foaming at the mouth. 41 9:21 So He asked his father, "How long has this been happening to him?" And he said, "From childhood. 41 9:22 And often it has thrown him both into the fire and into the water to destroy him. But if You can do anything, have compassion on us and help us." 41 9:23 Jesus said to him, "If you can believe, all things are possible to him who believes." 41 9:24 Immediately the father of the child cried out and said with tears, "Lord, I believe; help my unbelief!" 41 9:25 When Jesus saw that the people came running together, He rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to it: "You mute and deaf spirit, I command you, come out of him and enter into him no more!" 41 9:26 Then the spirit shouted out, convulsed him greatly, and came out of him. And he became as one dead, so that many said, "He is dead." 41 9:27 But Jesus took him by the hand and lifted him up, and he arose. 41 9:28 And when He had come into the house, His disciples asked Him privately, "Why could we not cast it out?" 41 9:29 So He said to them, "This kind can come out by nothing but through prayer and fasting." 41 9:30 Then they departed from there and passed through Galilee, and He did not want anyone to know it. 41 9:31 Because, He taught His disciples and said to them, "The Son of Man is being delivered into the hands of men, and they will kill Him. And after He is killed, He will rise the third day." 41 9:32 But they did not understand this saying, and were afraid to ask Him. 41 9:33 Then He came to Capernaum. And when He was in the house He asked them, "What was it you disputed among yourselves on the road?" 41 9:34 But they kept silent, because, on the road they had disputed among themselves who would be the greatest. 41 9:35 And He sat down, called the twelve, and said to them, "If anyone desires to be first, he shall be last of all and servant of all." 41 9:36 Then He took a child and set him in the midst of them. And when He had taken him in His arms, He said to them, 41 9:37 "Whoever receives one of these children in My name receives Me; and whoever receives Me, receives not Me but Him who sent Me." 41 9:38 Now John replied to Him, saying, "Teacher, we saw someone who does not follow us casting out demons in Your name, and we forbade him because he does not follow us." 41 9:39 But Jesus said, "Do not forbid him, because, no one who works a miracle in My name can soon afterward speak evil of Me." 41 9:40 Because he who is not against us is on our side." 41 9:41 Because, whoever gives you a cup of water to drink in My name, because you belong to Christ, truly, I say to you, he will not lose his reward." 41 9:42 "But whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in Me to stumble, it would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck, and he were thrown into the sea." 41 9:43 And if your hand causes you to offend, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life maimed, rather than having two hands, to go to hell, into the fire that will never be quenched," 41 9:44 where 'Their worm does not die and the fire is not quenched.'" 41 9:45 And if your foot causes you to offend, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life lame, rather than having two feet, to be cast into hell, into the fire that will never be quenched," 41 9:46 where 'Their worm does not die, and the fire is not quenched.'" 41 9:47 And if your eye causes you to offend, pluck it out. It is better for you to enter the kingdom of God with one eye, rather than having two eyes, to be cast into hell fire," 41 9:48 where 'Their worm does not die and the fire is not quenched.'" 41 9:49 "Because, everyone will be seasoned with fire, and every sacrifice will be seasoned with salt." 41 9:50 Salt is good, but if the salt loses its flavor, how will you season it? Have salt in yourselves, and have peace with one another." 41 10:1 Then He arose from there and came to the region of Judea by the other side of the Jordan. And crowds gathered to Him again, and as He was accustomed, He taught them again. 41 10:2 Then the Pharisees came to Him and asked Him, "Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife?" testing Him. 41 10:3 And He answered and said to them, "What did Moses command you?" 41 10:4 They said, "Moses permitted a man to write a certificate of divorce, and to dismiss her." 41 10:5 And Jesus replied and said to them, "Because of the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept." 41 10:6 But from the beginning of the creation, God 'made them male and female.'" 41 10:7 'For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife," 41 10:8 and the two will become one flesh'; so then they are no longer two, but one flesh." 41 10:9 Therefore what God has joined together, let not man separate." 41 10:10 Then in the house, His disciples asked Him again about the same matter. 41 10:11 So He said to them, "Whoever puts away his wife and marries another commits adultery against her." 41 10:12 And if a woman puts away her husband and marries another, she commits adultery." 41 10:13 Then they brought little children to Him, that He might touch them; but his disciples rebuked those who brought them. 41 10:14 But when Jesus saw it, He was greatly displeased and said to them, "Permit the little children to come to Me, and do not forbid them; because, of such is the kingdom of God." 41 10:15 Truly, I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God as a little child will not enter into it." 41 10:16 And He took them up in His arms, laid His hands on them, and blessed them. 41 10:17 Now as He was going out on the road, one came running, knelt before Him, and asked Him, "Good Teacher, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?" 41 10:18 So Jesus said to him, "Why do you call Me good? No one is good but One, that is, God." 41 10:19 You know the commandments: 'Do not commit adultery,' 'Do not murder,' 'Do not steal,' 'Do not bear false witness,' 'Do not defraud,' 'Honor your father and your mother.'" 41 10:20 And he replied and said to Him, "Teacher, all these things I have observed from my youth." 41 10:21 Then Jesus, looking at him, loved him, and said to him, "One thing you lack: Go your way, sell whatever you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, take up the cross, and follow Me." 41 10:22 But he was sad at that saying, and went away sorrowful, because he had many possessions. 41 10:23 Then Jesus looked around and said to His disciples, "How hard it is for those who have riches to enter the kingdom of God!" 41 10:24 And the disciples were astonished at His words. But Jesus responded again and said to them, "Children, how hard it is for those who trust in riches to enter the kingdom of God!" 41 10:25 It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God." 41 10:26 And they were greatly astonished, saying among themselves, "Who then can be saved?" 41 10:27 But Jesus looking at them said, "With men it is impossible, but not with God; because, with God all things are possible." 41 10:28 Then Peter began to say to Him, "See, we have left all and have followed You." 41 10:29 So Jesus replied and said, "Truly, I say to you, there is no one who has left house or brothers or sisters or father or mother or wife or children or lands, for My sake and the gospel's," 41 10:30 who will not receive a hundredfold now in this time, houses and brothers and sisters and mothers and children and lands, with persecutions, and in the age to come, eternal life." 41 10:31 But many who are first will be last, and the last first." 41 10:32 Now they were on the road, going up to Jerusalem, and Jesus was going before them; and they were amazed. And as they followed they were afraid. Then He took aside the twelve again and began to tell them the things that would happen to Him: 41 10:33 Saying, "Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be delivered to the chief priests and to the scribes; and they will condemn Him to death and deliver Him to the Gentiles;" 41 10:34 and they will mock Him, and will scourge Him, and will spit on Him, and will kill Him. And the third day He will rise again." 41 10:35 Then James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to Him, saying, "Teacher, we want You to do for us whatever we desire." 41 10:36 And He said to them, "What do you want Me to do for you?" 41 10:37 They said to Him, "Grant us that we may sit, one on Your right hand and the other on Your left, in Your glory." 41 10:38 But Jesus said to them, "You do not know what you ask. Are you able to drink the cup that I drink of, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?" 41 10:39 They said to Him, "We are able." So Jesus said to them, "You will indeed drink the cup that I drink, and with the baptism I am baptized with you will be baptized; 41 10:40 but to sit on My right hand and on My left hand is not Mine to give, but it will be given to those for whom it is prepared." 41 10:41 And when the ten heard it, they began to be greatly displeased with James and John. 41 10:42 But Jesus called them to Himself and said to them, "You know that those who are considered rulers over the Gentiles lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them." 41 10:43 Yet it shall not be so among you; but whoever desires to become great among you will be your servant." 41 10:44 And whoever of you desires to be chief shall be servant of all." 41 10:45 Because, even the Son of Man did not come to be ministered to, but to minister, and to give His life a ransom for many." 41 10:46 Now they came to Jericho. As He went out of Jericho with His disciples and a large crowd, blind Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, sat by the roadside begging. 41 10:47 And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to shout out and say, "Jesus, You Son of David, have mercy on me!" 41 10:48 Then many warned him that he should be quiet; but he shouted out all the more, "You Son of David, have mercy on me!" 41 10:49 So Jesus stood still and commanded him to be called. Then they called the blind man, saying to him, "Be of good cheer. Rise, He is calling you." 41 10:50 And throwing aside his coat, he rose and came to Jesus. 41 10:51 So Jesus replied and said to him, "What do you want Me to do for you?" The blind man said to Him, "Lord, that I may receive my sight." 41 10:52 Then Jesus said to him, "Go your way; your faith has made you well." And immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus on the road. 41 11:1 Now when they came near to Jerusalem, to Bethphage and Bethany, at the Mount of Olives, He sent out two of His disciples; 41 11:2 and He said to them, "Go your way into the village opposite you; and as soon as you have entered into it you will find a colt tied, on which no one has sat. Loose him and bring him." 41 11:3 And if anyone says to you, 'Why are you doing this?' say that, 'The Lord has need of him,' and immediately he will send him here." 41 11:4 So they went their way, and found the colt tied by the door outside in a place where two roads meet, and they loosed him. 41 11:5 But some of those who stood there said to them, "What are you doing, loosing the colt?" 41 11:6 And they spoke to them just as Jesus had commanded. So they let them go. 41 11:7 Then they brought the colt to Jesus and threw their clothes on him, and He sat upon him. 41 11:8 And many spread their clothes on the road, and others cut down branches from the trees and spread them on the road. 41 11:9 Then those who went before and those who followed shouted, saying: "Hosanna! 'Blessed is He who comes in the name of the LORD!' 41 11:10 Blessed be the kingdom of our father David that comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!" 41 11:11 And Jesus entered into Jerusalem and into the temple. So when He had looked around at all things, as the hour was already late, He went out to Bethany with the twelve. 41 11:12 Now the next day, when they had come out from Bethany, He was hungry. 41 11:13 And seeing from afar a fig tree having leaves, He went to see if perhaps He would find something on it. And when He came to it, He found nothing but leaves, because it was not yet the season for figs. 41 11:14 And Jesus responded and said to it, "Let no one eat fruit from you ever again." And His disciples heard it. 41 11:15 Then they came to Jerusalem. And Jesus went into the temple and began to drive out those who bought and sold in the temple, and overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of those who sold doves. 41 11:16 And He would not permit anyone to carry any vessel through the temple. 41 11:17 Then He taught, saying to them, "Is it not written, 'My house shall be called a house of prayer for all nations'? But you have made it a 'den of thieves.'" 41 11:18 And the scribes and chief priests heard it and sought how they might destroy Him; because they feared Him, as all the people were astonished at His doctrine. 41 11:19 And when evening had come, He went out of the city. 41 11:20 Now in the morning, as they passed by, they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots. 41 11:21 And Peter, remembering, said to Him, "Teacher, look! The fig tree which You cursed has withered away." 41 11:22 So Jesus replied and said to them, "Have faith in God." 41 11:23 Because, truly, I say to you, whoever shall say to this mountain, 'Be removed and be cast into the sea,' and does not doubt in his heart, but believes that those things he says will come to pass, he will have whatever he says." 41 11:24 Therefore I say to you, whatever things you desire when you pray, believe that you receive them, and you will have them." 41 11:25 "And whenever you stand praying, if you have anything against anyone, forgive, that your Father in heaven may also forgive you your trespasses." 41 11:26 But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father in heaven forgive your trespasses." 41 11:27 Then they came again to Jerusalem. And as He was walking in the temple, the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders came to Him. 41 11:28 And they said to Him, "By what authority are You doing these things? And who gave You this authority to do these things?" 41 11:29 But Jesus answered and said to them, "I also will ask you one question; then answer Me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things:" 41 11:30 The baptism of John, was it from heaven or from men? Answer Me." 41 11:31 And they reasoned among themselves, saying, "If we shall say, 'From heaven,' He will say, 'Why then did you not believe him?' 41 11:32 But if we say, 'From men,'" they feared the people, because, everyone counted John to have been a prophet indeed. 41 11:33 So they answered and said to Jesus, "We cannot tell." And Jesus replied and said to them, "Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things." 41 12:1 Then He began to speak to them in parables: "A certain man planted a vineyard and set a hedge around it, dug a place for the grape juice vat and built a tower. And he leased it to vinedressers and went into a far country." 41 12:2 Now when the season came he sent a servant to the vinedressers, that he might receive some of the fruit of the vineyard from the vinedressers." 41 12:3 And they took him and beat him and sent him away empty handed." 41 12:4 So, again he sent them another servant, and they threw stones at him, wounded him in the head, and sent him away shamefully treated." 41 12:5 And again he sent another, and him they killed; and many others, beating some and killing some." 41 12:6 Therefore still having one son, his dearly beloved, he also sent him to them last, saying, 'They shall reverence my son.'" 41 12:7 But those vinedressers said among themselves, 'This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.'" 41 12:8 So they took him and killed him and cast him out of the vineyard." 41 12:9 "Therefore what shall the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the vinedressers, and give the vineyard to others." 41 12:10 Have you not even read this Scripture: 'The stone which the builders rejected has become the chief cornerstone." 41 12:11 This was the LORD'S doing, and it is marvelous in our eyes'?" 41 12:12 And they sought to lay hands on Him, but feared the people, because, they knew that He had spoken the parable against them. So they left Him and went their way. 41 12:13 Then they sent to Him some of the Pharisees and the Herodians, to catch Him in His words. 41 12:14 When they had come, they said to Him, "Teacher, we know that You are true, and esteem no one; because, You do not regard the person of men, but teach the way of God in truth. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not? 41 12:15 Should we give, or should we not give?" But He, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them, "Why do you test Me? Bring Me a denarius that I may see it." 41 12:16 So they brought it. And He said to them, "Whose image and inscription is this?" They said to Him, "Caesar's." 41 12:17 And Jesus replied and said to them, "Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's." And they marveled at Him. 41 12:18 Then some Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to Him; and they asked Him, saying: 41 12:19 "Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if a man's brother dies, and leaves his wife behind, and leaves no children, that his brother should take his wife and raise up offspring for his brother. 41 12:20 Now there were seven brothers. The first took a wife; and dying, he left no offspring. 41 12:21 And the second took her, and he died; nor did he leave any offspring. And the third likewise. 41 12:22 So the seven had her and left no offspring. Last of all the woman died also. 41 12:23 Therefore, in the resurrection, when they rise, whose wife shall she be? Because all seven had her as wife." 41 12:24 Jesus answered and said to them, "Are you not in error because of this, because, you do not know the Scriptures nor the power of God?" 41 12:25 Because, when they rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like the angels who are in heaven." 41 12:26 But concerning the dead, that they rise, have you not read in the book of Moses, how in the bush God spoke to him, saying, 'I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob'?" 41 12:27 He is not the God of the dead, but the God of the living. You are greatly in error because of this." 41 12:28 Then one of the scribes came, and having heard them reasoning together, perceiving that He had answered them well, asked Him, "Which is the first commandment of all?" 41 12:29 And Jesus answered him, "The first of all the commandments is: 'Hear, O Israel, the LORD our God is one LORD." 41 12:30 And you shall love the LORD your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your mind, and with all your strength.' This is the first commandment." 41 12:31 And the second is similar, being this: 'You shall love your neighbor as yourself.' There is no other commandment greater than these." 41 12:32 So the scribe said to Him, "Well said, Teacher. You have spoken the truth, because there is one God, and there is no other but He. 41 12:33 And to love Him with all the heart, with all the understanding, with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love one's neighbor as oneself, is more than all of the entire burnt offerings and sacrifices." 41 12:34 Now when Jesus saw that he responded wisely, He said to him, "You are not far from the kingdom of God." But after that no one dared ask Him any questions. 41 12:35 Then Jesus responded and said, while He taught in the temple, "How is it that the scribes say that Christ is the Son of David?" 41 12:36 Because David himself said by the Holy Spirit: 'The LORD said to my Lord, "Sit at My right hand, until I make Your enemies Your footstool." ' 41 12:37 Therefore David himself calls Him 'Lord'; how is He then his Son?" And the common people heard Him gladly. 41 12:38 Then He said to them in His doctrine, "Beware of the scribes, who desire to go around in long robes, love greetings in the marketplaces," 41 12:39 the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts," 41 12:40 who devour widows' houses, and for an exhibition make long prayers. These will receive greater damnation." 41 12:41 Now Jesus sat opposite the treasury and saw how the people put money into the treasury. And many who were rich put in much. 41 12:42 Then one poor widow came and threw in two mites, which make a quadrans. 41 12:43 So He called His disciples to Himself and said to them, "Truly, I say to you that this poor widow has put in more than all those who have given into the treasury;" 41 12:44 because, they all put in out of their abundance, but she out of her poverty put in all that she had, even her entire livelihood." 41 13:1 Then as He went out of the temple, one of His disciples said to Him, "Teacher, see what manner of stones and what buildings are here!" 41 13:2 And Jesus replied and said to him, "Do you see these great buildings? Not one stone will be left upon another, that will not be thrown down." 41 13:3 Now as He sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked Him privately, 41 13:4 "Tell us, when shall these things be? And what shall be the sign when all these things shall be fulfilled?" 41 13:5 And Jesus, answering them, began to say: "Take heed that no one deceives you." 41 13:6 Because, many will come in My name, saying, 'I am Christ,' and will deceive many." 41 13:7 But when you hear of wars and rumors of wars, do not be troubled; because, such things must happen, but the end will not be yet." 41 13:8 Because nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. And there will be earthquakes in various places, and there will be famines and troubles. These are the beginnings of sorrows." 41 13:9 "But watch out for yourselves, because, they will deliver you up to councils, and you will be beaten in the synagogues. You will be brought before rulers and kings for My sake, for a testimony to them." 41 13:10 And the gospel must first be preached to all the nations." 41 13:11 But when they arrest you and deliver you up, do not worry beforehand, or premeditate what you will speak. But whatever is given you in that hour, speak that; because it is not you who speaks, but the Holy Spirit." 41 13:12 Now brother will betray brother to death, and a father his son; and children will rise up against their parents and will cause them to be put to death." 41 13:13 And you will be hated by all people for My name's sake. But he who endures to the end, the same will be saved." 41 13:14 "But when you see the 'abomination of desolation,' spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not" (let the reader understand), "then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains. 41 13:15 Let him who is on the housetop not go down into the house, nor enter into it to take anything out of his house." 41 13:16 And let him who is in the field not turn back again to get his clothes." 41 13:17 But woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing babes in those days!" 41 13:18 And pray that your flight may not be in winter." 41 13:19 Because, in those days there will be affliction, such as has not been since the beginning of the creation which God created until this time, nor ever will be." 41 13:20 And unless the Lord had shortened those days, no flesh would be saved; but for the elect's sake, whom He has chosen, He shortened the days." 41 13:21 "Then if anyone says to you, 'Look, here is Christ!' or, 'Look, He is there!' do not believe them." 41 13:22 Because, false christs and false prophets will rise and show signs and wonders to seduce, if it were possible, even the elect." 41 13:23 But take heed; behold, I have told you all things beforehand." 41 13:24 "But in those days, after that tribulation, the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give her light;" 41 13:25 the stars of heaven will fall, and the powers in the heavens will be shaken." 41 13:26 Then they will see the Son of Man coming in the clouds with great power and glory." 41 13:27 And then He will send His angels, and gather together His elect from the four winds, from the farthest part of the earth to the farthest part of heaven." 41 13:28 "Now learn this parable from the fig tree: When its branch has already become tender, and puts forth leaves, you know that summer is near." 41 13:29 So you also, when you see these things come to pass, know that it is near, even at the doors!" 41 13:30 Truly, I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things are done." 41 13:31 Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will not pass away." 41 13:32 "But of that day and that hour no one knows, no, not the angels which are in heaven, nor the Son, but the Father." 41 13:33 Take heed, watch and pray; because, you do not know when the time is." 41 13:34 Because, the Son of Man is like a man going to a far country, who left his house and gave authority to his servants, and to every person his work, and commanded the doorkeeper to watch." 41 13:35 Watch therefore, because, you do not know when the master of the house is coming, in the evening, at midnight, at the crowing of the rooster, or in the morning," 41 13:36 lest, coming suddenly, he find you sleeping." 41 13:37 And what I say to you, I say to all: Watch!" 41 14:1 After two days it was the Feast of the Passover and of Unleavened Bread. And the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take Him by deception and put Him to death. 41 14:2 But they said, "Not on the feast day, lest there be an uproar of the people." 41 14:3 And being in Bethany at the house of Simon the leper, as He sat at the table, a woman came having an alabaster flask of very costly oil of spikenard. Then she broke the flask and poured it on His head. 41 14:4 But there were some who were indignant among themselves, and said, "Why was this fragrant oil wasted? 41 14:5 Because, it might have been sold for more than three hundred denarii and had been given to the poor." And they murmured against her. 41 14:6 But Jesus said, "Leave her alone. Why do you trouble her? She has done a good work for Me." 41 14:7 Because, you have the poor with you always, and whenever you desire you can do them good; but Me you do not have always." 41 14:8 She has done what she could. She has come beforehand to anoint My body for burial." 41 14:9 Truly, I say to you, wherever this gospel is preached in the entire world, what this woman has done will also be told as a memorial to her." 41 14:10 Then Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went to the chief priests to betray Him to them. 41 14:11 And when they heard it, they were glad, and promised to give him money. So he sought how he might conveniently betray Him. 41 14:12 Now on the first day of Unleavened Bread, when they killed the Passover, His disciples said to Him, "Where do You want us to go and prepare, that You may eat the Passover?" 41 14:13 And He sent out two of His disciples and said to them, "Go into the city, and a man will meet you carrying a pitcher of water; follow him." 41 14:14 Wherever he goes in, say to the master of the house, 'The Teacher says, "Where is the guest room in which I may eat the Passover with My disciples?" ' 41 14:15 Then he will show you a large upper room, furnished and prepared; there make preparations for us." 41 14:16 So His disciples went out, and came into the city, and found it just as He had said to them; and they prepared the Passover. 41 14:17 In the evening He came with the twelve. 41 14:18 Now as they sat and ate, Jesus said, "Truly, I say to you, one of you who eats with Me will betray Me." 41 14:19 And they began to be sorrowful, and to say to Him one by one, "Is it I?" And another said, "Is it I?" 41 14:20 He answered and said to them, "It is one of the twelve, who dips with Me in the dish." 41 14:21 The Son of Man indeed goes just as it is written of Him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been good for that man if he had never been born." 41 14:22 And as they were eating, Jesus took bread, blessed and broke it, and gave it to them and said, "Take, eat; this is My body." 41 14:23 Then He took the cup, and when He had given thanks He gave it to them, and they all drank of it. 41 14:24 And He said to them, "This is My blood of the new covenant, which is shed for many." 41 14:25 Truly, I say to you, I will no longer drink of the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God." 41 14:26 And when they had sung a song, they went out to the Mount of Olives. 41 14:27 Then Jesus said to them, "All of you will be made to stumble because of Me this night, because, it is written: 'I will strike the Shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.'" 41 14:28 "But after I have been raised, I will go before you to Galilee." 41 14:29 But Peter said to Him, "Even if all are made to stumble, yet I will not be." 41 14:30 And Jesus said to him, "Truly, I say to you that today, even this night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny Me three times." 41 14:31 But he spoke more vehemently, "If I have to die with You, I will not deny You in any way!" And they all said likewise. 41 14:32 Then they came to a place which was named Gethsemane; and He said to His disciples, "You sit here while I pray." 41 14:33 And He took Peter, James, and John with Him, and began to be troubled and very distressed. 41 14:34 Then He said to them, "My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to death. Stay here and watch." 41 14:35 He went a little farther, and fell on the ground, and prayed that if it were possible, the hour might pass from Him. 41 14:36 And He said, "Abba, Father, all things are possible for You. Take this cup away from Me; nevertheless, not what I will, but what You will." 41 14:37 Then He came and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, "Simon, are you sleeping? Could you not watch one hour?" 41 14:38 Watch and pray all of you, lest you enter into temptation. Truly the spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak." 41 14:39 Again He went away and prayed, and spoke the same words. 41 14:40 And when He returned, He found them asleep again, because their eyes were heavy; and they did not know what to answer Him. 41 14:41 Then He came the third time and said to them, "Sleep now and take your rest, it is enough! The hour has come; behold, the Son of Man is being betrayed into the hands of sinners." 41 14:42 Rise, let us be going. See, he who betrays Me is at hand." 41 14:43 And immediately, while He was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, with a large crowd with swords and clubs, came from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders. 41 14:44 Now His betrayer had given them a signal, saying, "Whomever I kiss, He is the One; seize Him and lead Him away safely." 41 14:45 And as soon as he had come, immediately he went up to Him and said to Him, "Teacher, Teacher!" and kissed Him. 41 14:46 Then they laid their hands on Him and took Him. 41 14:47 And one of those who stood by drew a sword and struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear. 41 14:48 Then Jesus responded and said to them, "Have you come out, as against a thief, with swords and clubs to take Me?" 41 14:49 I was daily with you in the temple teaching, and you did not seize Me. But the Scriptures must be fulfilled." 41 14:50 Then they all forsook Him and fled. 41 14:51 Now a certain young man followed Him, having a linen cloth thrown around his naked body. And the young men laid hold of him, 41 14:52 and he left the linen cloth and fled from them naked. 41 14:53 And they led Jesus away to the high priest; and with him were assembled all the chief priests, the elders, and the scribes. 41 14:54 But Peter followed Him at a distance, right into the courtyard of the high priest. And he sat with the servants and warmed himself at the fire. 41 14:55 Now the chief priests and all the council sought testimony against Jesus to put Him to death, but found none. 41 14:56 Because, many bore false witness against Him, but their testimonies did not agree. 41 14:57 Then some rose up and bore false witness against Him, saying, 41 14:58 "We heard Him say, 'I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and within three days I will build another made without hands.'" 41 14:59 But not even then did their testimony agree together. 41 14:60 And the high priest stood up in the midst and asked Jesus, saying, "Do You answer nothing? What is it that these people testify against You?" 41 14:61 But He kept silent and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked Him, saying to Him, "Are You the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?" 41 14:62 Jesus said, "I am. And you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Power, and coming with the clouds of heaven." 41 14:63 Then the high priest tore his clothes and said, "What further need do we have of witnesses? 41 14:64 You have heard the blasphemy! What do you think?" And they all condemned Him to be deserving of death. 41 14:65 Then some began to spit on Him, and to cover His face, and to beat Him, and to say to Him, "Prophesy!" And the officers struck Him with the palms of their hands. 41 14:66 Now as Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the servant girls of the high priest came. 41 14:67 And when she saw Peter warming himself, she looked at him and said, "You also were with Jesus of Nazareth." 41 14:68 But he denied it, saying, "I neither know nor understand what you are saying." And he went out on the porch, and a rooster crowed. 41 14:69 And the servant girl saw him again, and began to say to those who stood by, "This is one of them." 41 14:70 But he denied it again. And a little later those who stood by said to Peter again, "Surely you are one of them; because, you are a Galilean, and your speech reveals it." 41 14:71 Then he began to curse and swear, saying, "I do not know this Man of whom you speak!" 41 14:72 A second time the rooster crowed. Then Peter called to mind the word that Jesus had said to him, "Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny Me three times." And when he thought about it, he wept. 41 15:1 Then immediately, in the morning, the chief priests held a consultation with the elders and scribes and the entire council; and they bound Jesus, led Him away, and delivered Him to Pilate. 41 15:2 Then Pilate asked Him, "Are You the King of the Jews?" And He answered and said to him, "It is as you say." 41 15:3 And the chief priests accused Him of many things, but He answered nothing. 41 15:4 Then Pilate asked Him again, saying, "Do You answer nothing? See how many things they witness against You!" 41 15:5 But Jesus still answered nothing, so that Pilate marveled. 41 15:6 Now at that feast he would release one prisoner to them, whomever they requested. 41 15:7 And there was one named Barabbas, who lay chained with his fellow rebels; they had committed murder in the rebellion. 41 15:8 Then the crowd, shouting loudly, began to ask him to do just as he had always done for them. 41 15:9 But Pilate answered them, saying, "Do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?" 41 15:10 Because he knew that the chief priests had handed Him over because of envy. 41 15:11 But the chief priests stirred up the people, so that he should rather release Barabbas to them. 41 15:12 Then Pilate answered and said to them again, "What then do you want me to do to Him whom you call the King of the Jews?" 41 15:13 So they shouted out again, "Crucify Him!" 41 15:14 Then Pilate said to them, "Why, what evil has He done?" But they shouted out all the more earnestly, "Crucify Him!" 41 15:15 And so Pilate, wanting to gratify the people, released Barabbas to them; and he delivered Jesus, after he had scourged Him, to be crucified. 41 15:16 Then the soldiers led Him away into the hall called Praetorium, and they called together the entire garrison. 41 15:17 And they clothed Him with purple; and they platted a crown of thorns, put it on His head, 41 15:18 and began to salute Him, "Hail, King of the Jews!" 41 15:19 Then they struck Him on the head with a reed and spat on Him; and bowing their knees, they worshiped Him. 41 15:20 And when they had mocked Him, they took the purple off Him, put His own clothes on Him, and led Him out to crucify Him. 41 15:21 Then they compelled a certain man, Simon a Cyrenian, the father of Alexander and Rufus, as he was coming out of the country and passing by, to carry His cross. 41 15:22 And they brought Him to the place Golgotha, which is translated, The Place of a Skull. 41 15:23 Then they gave Him wine mingled with myrrh to drink, but He did not take it. 41 15:24 And when they crucified Him, they divided His clothes, casting lots for them to determine what every man should take. 41 15:25 Now it was the third hour, and they crucified Him. 41 15:26 And the inscription of His accusation was written above: THE KING OF THE JEWS. 41 15:27 And with Him they also crucified two thieves, one on His right hand and the other on His left. 41 15:28 So the Scripture was fulfilled which says, "And He was numbered with the transgressors." 41 15:29 And those who passed by ridiculed Him, shaking their heads and saying, "Aha! You who destroys the temple and builds it in three days, 41 15:30 save Yourself, and come down from the cross!" 41 15:31 Likewise the chief priests also, mocking among themselves with the scribes, said, "He saved others; He cannot save Himself. 41 15:32 Let Christ, the King of Israel, descend now from the cross, that we may see and believe." Even those who were crucified with Him reviled Him. 41 15:33 Now when the sixth hour had come, there was darkness over the entire land until the ninth hour. 41 15:34 And at the ninth hour Jesus shouted out with a loud voice, saying, "Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?" which is translated, "My God, My God, why have You forsaken Me?" 41 15:35 And when they heard that, some of those who stood by said, "Behold, He is calling for Elijah!" 41 15:36 Then someone ran and filled a sponge full of vinegar, put it on a reed, and offered it to Him to drink, saying, "Let Him alone; let us see if Elijah will come to take Him down." 41 15:37 And Jesus shouted out with a loud voice, and gave up the spirit. 41 15:38 Then the veil of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom. 41 15:39 So when the centurion, who stood opposite Him, saw that He shouted out like this and gave up the spirit, he said, "Truly this Man was the Son of God!" 41 15:40 There were also women looking on from afar, among whom were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James the Less and of Joses, and Salome, 41 15:41 who also followed Him and ministered to Him when He was in Galilee, and many other women who came up with Him to Jerusalem. 41 15:42 Now when evening had come, because it was the Preparation, that is, the day before the Sabbath, 41 15:43 Joseph of Arimathea, an honorable council member, who also waited for the kingdom of God, came, and went in boldly to Pilate and sought the body of Jesus. 41 15:44 Pilate marveled that He was already dead; and summoning the centurion to him, he asked him if He had been dead for some time. 41 15:45 So when he knew it from the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph. 41 15:46 Then he bought fine linen, took Him down, and wrapped Him in the linen. And he laid Him in a tomb which had been cut out of the rock, and rolled a stone against the door of the tomb. 41 15:47 And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses observed where He was laid. 41 16:1 Now when the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought sweet spices, that they might come and anoint Him. 41 16:2 And very early in the morning, on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb at the rising of the sun. 41 16:3 And they said among themselves, "Who shall roll away the stone from the door of the tomb for us?" 41 16:4 But when they looked, they saw that the stone had been rolled away, because, it was very large. 41 16:5 And entering the tomb, they saw a young man clothed in a long white robe sitting on the right side; and they were afraid. 41 16:6 But he said to them, "Do not be afraid. You seek Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified. He is risen! He is not here. Behold the place where they laid Him. 41 16:7 But go your way, tell His disciples, and Peter, that He is going before you into Galilee; there you will see Him, as He said to you." 41 16:8 So they went out quickly and fled from the tomb, because they trembled and were astonished. And they said nothing to anyone, because they were afraid. 41 16:9 Now when Jesus was risen early on the first day of the week, He appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom He had cast seven demons. 41 16:10 And she went and told those who had been with Him, as they mourned and wept. 41 16:11 And when they heard that He was alive and had been seen by her, they did not believe. 41 16:12 After that, He appeared in another form to two of them as they walked and went into the country. 41 16:13 And they went and told it to the rest, but they did not believe them either. 41 16:14 Later He appeared to the eleven as they sat at the table; and He rebuked their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they did not believe those who had seen Him after He had risen. 41 16:15 And He said to them, "Go into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature." 41 16:16 He who believes and is baptized will be saved; but he who does not believe will be damned." 41 16:17 And these signs will follow those who believe: In My name they will cast out demons; they will speak with new tongues;" 41 16:18 they will take up serpents; and if they drink any deadly thing, it will not hurt them; they will lay hands on the sick, and they will recover." 41 16:19 So then, after the Lord had spoken to them, He was received up into heaven, and sat down at the right hand of God. 41 16:20 And they went out and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them and confirming the word through the signs following them. Amen. 42 1:1 In as much as many have taken in hand to arrange in order a declaration of those things which are most surely believed among us, 42 1:2 just as those who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and ministers of the word delivered them to us, 42 1:3 it seemed good to me also, having had perfect understanding of all things from the very first, to write to you in order, most excellent Theophilus, 42 1:4 that you may know the certainty of those things in which you were instructed. 42 1:5 There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the division of Abijah, and his wife was of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth. 42 1:6 And they were both righteous before God, walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless. 42 1:7 But they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they were both now well advanced in years. 42 1:8 And it came to pass, that while he was serving in the priest's office before God in the order of his division, 42 1:9 according to the custom of the priesthood, his lot fell to burn incense when he went into the temple of the Lord. 42 1:10 And the entire crowd of the people were praying outside at the time of incense. 42 1:11 Then an angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing on the right side of the altar of incense. 42 1:12 And when Zacharias saw him, he was troubled, and fear fell upon him. 42 1:13 But the angel said to him, "Do not fear, Zacharias, because your prayer is heard; and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you will call his name John. 42 1:14 And you will have joy and happiness and many will rejoice at his birth. 42 1:15 Because, he will be great in the sight of the Lord and will drink neither grape juice nor strong drink. And he will be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his mother's womb. 42 1:16 And he will turn many of the children of Israel to the Lord their God. 42 1:17 He will also go before Him in the spirit and power of Elijah, 'to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children,' and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just, to make ready a people prepared for the Lord." 42 1:18 And Zacharias said to the angel, "How shall I know this? Because, I am an old man, and my wife well advanced in years." 42 1:19 And the angel answered and said to him, "I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God, and was sent to speak to you and to show you these glad tidings. 42 1:20 But behold, you will be mute and not able to speak until the day that these things will take place, because you did not believe my words which will be fulfilled in their own time." 42 1:21 And the people waited for Zacharias and marveled that he lingered so long in the temple. 42 1:22 But when he came out, he could not speak to them; and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple, because he beckoned to them and remained speechless. 42 1:23 So it was, as soon as the days of his service were completed, he departed to his own house. 42 1:24 Now after those days his wife Elizabeth conceived; and hid herself five months, saying, 42 1:25 "Thus the Lord has dealt with me, in the days when He looked upon me, to take away my dishonor among men." 42 1:26 Now in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a city of Galilee, named Nazareth, 42 1:27 to a virgin betrothed to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David. And the virgin's name was Mary. 42 1:28 And the angel went in to her presence and said, "Rejoice, you who are highly favored, the Lord is with you; blessed are you among women!" 42 1:29 But when she saw him, she was troubled at his saying and considered what manner of greeting this was. 42 1:30 Then the angel said to her, "Do not fear, Mary, because you have found favor with God. 42 1:31 And behold, you will conceive in your womb and bring forth a Son, and will call His name JESUS. 42 1:32 He will be great, and will be called the Son of the Highest; and the Lord God will give to Him the throne of His father David. 42 1:33 And He will reign over the house of Jacob forever, and of His kingdom there will be no end." 42 1:34 Then Mary said to the angel, "How can this be, since I do not know a man?" 42 1:35 And the angel answered and said to her, "The Holy Spirit will come upon you and the power of the Highest will overshadow you; therefore, also, that Holy One who will be born of you will be called the Son of God. 42 1:36 Now behold, Elizabeth your relative has also conceived a son in her old age; and this is the sixth month for her, who was called barren. 42 1:37 Because with God nothing will be impossible." 42 1:38 Then Mary said, "Behold the maidservant of the Lord! Let it be to me according to your word." And the angel departed from her. 42 1:39 Mary arose in those days and hurried into the hill country, into a city of Judah, 42 1:40 and entered into the house of Zacharias and greeted Elizabeth. 42 1:41 And it happened, when Elizabeth heard the greeting of Mary, the babe leaped in her womb; and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit. 42 1:42 And she spoke out with a loud voice and said, "Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb! 42 1:43 But why is this granted to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me? 42 1:44 Because, indeed, as soon as the voice of your greeting sounded in my ears, the babe leaped in my womb for joy. 42 1:45 And blessed is she who believed, because there will be a fulfillment of those things which were told her from the Lord." 42 1:46 Then Mary said: "My soul magnifies the Lord, 42 1:47 and my spirit has rejoiced in God my Savior. 42 1:48 Because, He has regarded the lowly state of His maidservant; because behold, from now on all generations will call me blessed. 42 1:49 Because, He who is mighty has done great things for me, and holy is His name. 42 1:50 And His mercy is on those who reverence Him from generation to generation. 42 1:51 He has shown strength with His arm; He has scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts. 42 1:52 He has put down the mighty from their thrones, and exalted the lowly. 42 1:53 He has filled the hungry with good things, and He has sent the rich away empty. 42 1:54 He has helped His servant Israel, in remembrance of His mercy, 42 1:55 as He spoke to our fathers, to Abraham and to His seed forever." 42 1:56 Then Mary stayed with her about three months, and returned to her own house. 42 1:57 Now Elizabeth's full time came for her to be delivered, and she brought forth a son. 42 1:58 And her neighbors and her relatives heard how the Lord had shown great mercy on her, and they rejoiced with her. 42 1:59 And so it was, on the eighth day, they came to circumcise the child; and they called him Zacharias, after the name of his father. 42 1:60 But his mother replied and said, "Not this; but he will be called John." 42 1:61 But they said to her, "There is no one from your family that is called by this name." 42 1:62 So they made signs to his father, what he would have him called. 42 1:63 And he asked for a writing tablet, and wrote, saying, "His name is John." So they all marveled. 42 1:64 And immediately His mouth was opened and his tongue loosed, and he spoke and praised God. 42 1:65 Then reverence came on all who lived around about them; and all these sayings were discussed throughout all the hill country of Judea. 42 1:66 And all those who heard them kept them in their hearts, saying, "What kind of child shall this be?" And the hand of the Lord was with him. 42 1:67 Now his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Spirit, and prophesied, saying, 42 1:68 "Blessed is the Lord God of Israel, because, He has visited and redeemed His people, 42 1:69 and has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David, 42 1:70 as He spoke by the mouth of His holy prophets, who have been since the world began, 42 1:71 that we should be saved from our enemies and from the hand of all who hate us, 42 1:72 to perform the mercy promised to our fathers and to remember His holy covenant, 42 1:73 the oath which He swore to our father Abraham: 42 1:74 That He would grant to us, that we, being delivered out of the hand of our enemies, might serve Him without fear, 42 1:75 in holiness and righteousness before Him all the days of our life. 42 1:76 "And you, child, will be called the prophet of the Highest; because, you will go before the face of the Lord to prepare His ways, 42 1:77 to give knowledge of salvation to His people by the remission of their sins, 42 1:78 through the tender mercy of our God, with which the Dayspring from on high has visited us; 42 1:79 to give light to those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, to guide our feet into the way of peace." 42 1:80 So the child grew and became strong in spirit, and was in the deserts until the day of his appearance to Israel. 42 2:1 And it came to pass in those days that a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that all the world should be registered for taxation. 42 2:2 And this tax registrar first occurred when Quirinius was governor of Syria. 42 2:3 And everyone went to be registered for taxation, every one into his own city. 42 2:4 And Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judea, to the city of David, which is called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and lineage of David, 42 2:5 to be registered for taxation with Mary, his betrothed wife, who was large due to pregnancy. 42 2:6 And so it was, that while they were there, the days were completed for her to be delivered. 42 2:7 And she brought forth her firstborn Son, and wrapped Him in swaddling clothes and laid Him in a manger, because there was no room for them in the inn. 42 2:8 Now there were in the same country shepherds staying out in the field, keeping watch over their flock by night. 42 2:9 And behold, the angel of the Lord came over them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them and they were very afraid. 42 2:10 Then the angel said to them, "Do not fear, because behold, I bring you good news of great joy, which will be to all people. 42 2:11 Because, there is born to you this day in the city of David a Savior, who is Christ the Lord. 42 2:12 And this will be a sign to you: You will find the Babe wrapped in swaddling clothes, lying in a manger." 42 2:13 And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God and saying: 42 2:14 "Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace, good will toward men!" 42 2:15 So it was, when the angels had gone away from them into heaven, that the shepherds said to each other, "Let us now travel to Bethlehem and see this thing that has come to pass, which the Lord has made known to us." 42 2:16 And they came quickly and found Mary and Joseph, and the Babe lying in a manger. 42 2:17 Now when they had seen Him, they made widely known the saying which was told them concerning this Child. 42 2:18 And all those who heard it marveled at those things which were told them by the shepherds. 42 2:19 But Mary kept all these things and pondered them in her heart. 42 2:20 Then the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, as it was told to them. 42 2:21 And when eight days were completed for the circumcision of the Child, His name was called JESUS, the name given by the angel before He was conceived in the womb. 42 2:22 When the days of her purification according to the law of Moses were completed, they brought Him to Jerusalem to present Him to the Lord 42 2:23 (as it is written in the law of the Lord, "Every male who opens the womb shall be called holy to the LORD"), 42 2:24 and to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord, "A pair of turtledoves or two young pigeons." 42 2:25 And behold, there was a man in Jerusalem, whose name was Simeon, and this man was just and devout, waiting for the Consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him. 42 2:26 And it had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he should not see death before he had seen the Lord's Christ. 42 2:27 So he came by the Spirit into the temple. And when the parents brought in the Child Jesus, to do for Him after the custom of the law, 42 2:28 then he took Him up in his arms and blessed God and said: 42 2:29 "Lord, now let Your servant depart in peace, according to Your word; 42 2:30 Because, my eyes have seen Your salvation 42 2:31 which You have prepared before the face of all people, 42 2:32 A light to bring revelation to the Gentiles, and the glory of Your people Israel." 42 2:33 And Joseph and His mother marveled at those things which were spoken about Him. 42 2:34 Then Simeon blessed them, and said to Mary His mother, "Behold, this Child is destined for the fall and rising of many in Israel, and for a sign which will be spoken against 42 2:35 (yes, a sword will pierce through your own soul also), that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed." 42 2:36 Now there was one, Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was very old and had lived with a husband seven years from her virginity; 42 2:37 and she was a widow of about eighty four years, who did not depart from the temple, but served God with fastings and prayers night and day. 42 2:38 And coming in that instant she also gave thanks likewise to the Lord, and spoke of Him to all those who looked for redemption in Jerusalem. 42 2:39 So when they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee, to their own city Nazareth. 42 2:40 And the Child grew and became strong in spirit, filled with wisdom; and the grace of God was upon Him. 42 2:41 Now His parents went to Jerusalem every year at the Feast of the Passover. 42 2:42 And when He was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem according to the custom of the feast. 42 2:43 When they had fulfilled the days, as they returned, the Child Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem. And Joseph and His mother did not know about it; 42 2:44 but supposing Him to have been in the company, they went a day's journey, and they sought Him among their relatives and acquaintances. 42 2:45 So when they did not find Him, they returned to Jerusalem, seeking Him. 42 2:46 Now it happened that after three days they found Him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the teachers, both listening to them and asking them questions. 42 2:47 All who heard Him were astonished at His understanding and answers. 42 2:48 So when they saw Him, they were amazed; and His mother said to Him, "Son, why have you done this to us? Look, Your father and I have sought You desperately." 42 2:49 He said to them, "Why did you seek Me? Did you not know that I must be about My Father's business?" 42 2:50 But they did not understand the statement which He spoke to them. 42 2:51 Then He went down with them and came to Nazareth, and was subject to them, but His mother kept all these sayings in her heart. 42 2:52 And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and men. 42 3:1 Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judea, Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, his brother Philip tetrarch of Ituraea and of the region of Trachonitis, and Lysanias the tetrarch of Abilene, 42 3:2 Annas and Caiaphas being the high priests, the word of God came to John the son of Zacharias in the wilderness. 42 3:3 And he went into all the region around Jordan, preaching a baptism of repentance for the remission of sins, 42 3:4 as it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet, saying: "The voice of one shouting in the wilderness: 'Prepare the way of the LORD; make His paths straight. 42 3:5 Every valley will be filled and every mountain and hill will be brought low; and the crooked place will be made straight and the rough ways will be made smooth; 42 3:6 And all flesh will see the salvation of God.'" 42 3:7 Then he said to the crowds that came out to be baptized by him, "O generation of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come? 42 3:8 Therefore bear fruits worthy of repentance, and do not begin to say within yourselves, 'We have Abraham as our father.' Because I say to you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones. 42 3:9 And even now the axe is laid to the root of the trees. Therefore every tree which does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire." 42 3:10 So the people asked him, saying, "What shall we do then?" 42 3:11 He answered and said to them, "He who has two coats, let him give to him who has none; and he who has food, let him do likewise." 42 3:12 Then tax collectors also came to be baptized, and said to him, "Teacher, what shall we do?" 42 3:13 And he said to them, "Collect no more than that which is appointed to you." 42 3:14 Likewise the soldiers demanded of him, saying, "And what shall we do?" So he said to them, "Do not be violent to anyone, nor accuse anyone falsely, and be content with your wages." 42 3:15 Now as the people were in expectation, and everyone reasoned in their hearts about John, whether he was the Christ or not, 42 3:16 John responded, saying to them all, "I indeed baptize you with water; but One mightier than I is coming, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to loose. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire. 42 3:17 His winnowing fan is in His hand and He will thoroughly clean out His threshing floor, and gather His wheat into His storehouse; but the chaff He will burn with unquenchable fire." 42 3:18 And with many other things in His exhortation he preached to the people. 42 3:19 But Herod the tetrarch, being rebuked by him concerning Herodias, his brother Philip's wife, and for all the evils which Herod had done, 42 3:20 also added this, above all, that he shut up John in prison. 42 3:21 Now when all the people were baptized, it came to pass that Jesus was baptized also; and while praying, the heaven was opened. 42 3:22 And the Holy Spirit descended in bodily form like a dove upon Him, and a voice came from heaven which said, "You are My beloved Son; in You I am well pleased." 42 3:23 So Jesus Himself began to be about thirty years of age, being (as was supposed) the son of Joseph, who was the son of Heli, 42 3:24 who was the son of Matthat, who was the son of Levi, who was the son of Melchi, who was the son of Janna, who was the son of Joseph, 42 3:25 who was the son of Mattathiah, who was the son of Amos, who was the son of Nahum, who was the son of Esli, who was the son of Naggai, 42 3:26 who was the son of Maath, who was the son of Mattathiah, who was the son of Semei, who was the son of Joseph, who was the son of Judah, 42 3:27 who was the son of Joannas, who was the son of Rhesa, who was the son of Zerubbabel, who was the son of Shealtiel, who was the son of Neri, 42 3:28 who was the son of Melchi, who was the son of Addi, who was the son of Cosam, who was the son of Elmodam, who was the son of Er, 42 3:29 who was the son of Jose, who was the son of Eliezer, who was the son of Jorim, who was the son of Matthat, who was the son of Levi, 42 3:30 who was the son of Simeon, who was the son of Judah, who was the son of Joseph, who was the son of Jonan, who was the son of Eliakim, 42 3:31 who was the son of Melea, who was the son of Menan, who was the son of Mattathah, who was the son of Nathan, who was the son of David, 42 3:32 who was the son of Jesse, who was the son of Obed, who was the son of Boaz, who was the son of Salmon, who was the son of Nahshon, 42 3:33 who was the son of Amminadab, who was the son of Ram, who was the son of Hezron, who was the son of Perez, who was the son of Judah, 42 3:34 who was the son of Jacob, who was the son of Isaac, who was the son of Abraham, who was the son of Terah, who was the son of Nahor, 42 3:35 who was the son of Serug, who was the son of Reu, who was the son of Peleg, who was the son of Eber, who was the son of Shelah, 42 3:36 who was the son of Cainan, who was the son of Arphaxad, who was the son of Shem, who was the son of Noah, who was the son of Lamech, 42 3:37 who was the son of Methuselah, who was the son of Enoch, who was the son of Jared, who was the son of Mahalalel, who was the son of Cainan, 42 3:38 who was the son of Enosh, who was the son of Seth, who was the son of Adam, who was the son of God. 42 4:1 Then Jesus, being filled with the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness, 42 4:2 being tempted forty days by the devil.
