And in those days He ate nothing, and when they had ended, afterward He was hungry. 42 4:3 And the devil said to Him, "If You are the Son of God, command this stone to become bread." 42 4:4 But Jesus replied to him, saying, "It is written that, 'Man will not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.'" 42 4:5 Then the devil, taking Him up on a high mountain, showed Him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time. 42 4:6 And the devil said to Him, "I will give You all this authority, and their glory; because, this has been delivered to me and I give it to whomever I wish. 42 4:7 Therefore, if You will worship me, all will be Yours." 42 4:8 And Jesus answered and said to him, "Get behind Me, Satan! Because, it is written, 'You shall worship the LORD your God, and Him only shall you serve.'" 42 4:9 Then he brought Him to Jerusalem, set Him on a pinnacle of the temple, and said to Him, "If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down from here. 42 4:10 Because, it is written: 'He will give His angels orders concerning you, to protect You,' 42 4:11 and, 'In their hands they will hold You up, lest at any time You dash Your foot against a stone.'" 42 4:12 And Jesus responding said to him, "It has been said, 'You shall not tempt the LORD your God.'" 42 4:13 Now when the devil had ended every temptation, he departed from Him for a season. 42 4:14 Then Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee, and there His fame went out through all the surrounding region. 42 4:15 And He taught in their synagogues, being glorified by all. 42 4:16 So He came to Nazareth, where He had been brought up. And as His custom was, He went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day, and stood up to read. 42 4:17 And He was handed the book of the prophet Isaiah. And when He had opened the book, He found the place where it was written: 42 4:18 "The Spirit of the LORD is upon Me, because He has anointed Me to preach the gospel to the poor; He has sent Me to heal the brokenhearted, to preach deliverance to the captives and recovery of sight to the blind, to set at liberty those who are oppressed;" 42 4:19 to proclaim the acceptable year of the LORD." 42 4:20 Then He closed the book, and He gave it back to the attendant and sat down. And the eyes of everyone who was in the synagogue were fixed upon Him. 42 4:21 And He began to say to them, "Today this Scripture is fulfilled in your ears." 42 4:22 So all bore witness to Him, and marveled at the gracious words which proceeded out of His mouth. And they said, "Is this not Joseph's son?" 42 4:23 Then He said to them, "You will surely say this proverb to Me, 'Physician, heal yourself! Whatever we have heard done in Capernaum, do also here in Your country.'" 42 4:24 And He said, "Truly, I say to you, no prophet is accepted in his own country." 42 4:25 But I tell you truly, many widows were in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the heaven was shut up three years and six months, and there was a huge famine throughout all the land;" 42 4:26 but Elijah was sent to none of them, except to Zarephath, in the region of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow." 42 4:27 And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet, and none of them was cleansed except Naaman the Syrian." 42 4:28 So all those in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were filled with wrath, 42 4:29 and rose up and thrust Him out of the city; and they led Him to the brow of the hill on which their city was built, that they might throw Him down over the cliff. 42 4:30 But passing through the midst of them He went His way, 42 4:31 and went down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and taught them on the Sabbath days. 42 4:32 And they were astonished at His doctrine, because His word was with authority. 42 4:33 Now in the synagogue there was a man who had a spirit of an unclean demon. And he shouted out with a loud voice, 42 4:34 saying, "Leave us alone! What have we to do with You, You Jesus of Nazareth? Did you come to destroy us? I know who You are, the Holy One of God!" 42 4:35 But Jesus rebuked him, saying, "Be quiet and come out of him!" And when the demon had thrown him in the midst, it came out of him and did not hurt him. 42 4:36 Then they were all amazed and spoke among themselves, saying, "What a word this is! Because, with authority and power He commands the unclean spirits and they come out." 42 4:37 And His fame went out into every place in the surrounding region. 42 4:38 Now He arose from the synagogue and entered into Simon's house. But Simon's wife's mother was sick with a high fever and they made request of Him concerning her. 42 4:39 So He stood over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. And immediately she arose and served them. 42 4:40 Now when the sun was setting, all those who had any that were sick with various diseases brought them to Him; and He laid His hands on every one of them and healed them. 42 4:41 And demons also came out of many, shouting out and saying, "You are Christ, the Son of God!" And He, rebuking them, did not permit them to speak, because they knew that He was Christ. 42 4:42 Now when it was day, He departed and went into a deserted place. And the people sought Him and came to Him and tried to keep Him from leaving them; 42 4:43 but He said to them, "I must preach the kingdom of God to other cities also, because for this purpose I have been sent." 42 4:44 And He preached in the synagogues of Galilee. 42 5:1 And it happened, as the people pressed about Him to hear the word of God, that He stood by the Lake of Gennesaret, 42 5:2 and saw two boats standing by the lake; but the fishermen had gone from them and were washing their nets. 42 5:3 Then He got into one of the boats, which was Simon's, and asked him to put out a little from the land. And He sat down and taught the people from the boat. 42 5:4 Now when He had stopped speaking, He said to Simon, "Launch out into the deep and let down your nets for a catch." 42 5:5 But Simon replied and said to Him, "Master, we have toiled all night and have taken nothing; nevertheless at Your word I will let down the net." 42 5:6 And when they had done this, they caught a great number of fish, and their net was breaking. 42 5:7 So they signaled to their partners, who were in the other boat, that they should come and help them. And they came and filled both the boats, so that they began to sink. 42 5:8 When Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus' knees, saying, "Depart from me, because I am a sinful man, O Lord!" 42 5:9 Because, he and all who were with him were astonished at the catch of fish which they had taken; 42 5:10 and so also were James and John, the sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. And Jesus said to Simon, "Do not be afraid. From now on you will catch men." 42 5:11 So when they had brought their boats to land, they forsook everything and followed Him. 42 5:12 And it happened when He was in a certain city, that behold, a man who was full of leprosy seeing Jesus, fell on his face and implored Him, saying, "Lord, if You are willing, You can make me clean." 42 5:13 Then He put out His hand and touched him, saying, "I am willing; be cleansed." And immediately the leprosy left him. 42 5:14 And He commanded him to tell no one, "But go and show yourself to the priest, and make an offering for your cleansing, as a testimony to them, just as Moses commanded." 42 5:15 However, the fame went around concerning Him all the more; and large crowds came together to hear, and to be healed by Him of their infirmities. 42 5:16 And He withdrew Himself into the wilderness and prayed. 42 5:17 Now it happened on a certain day, as He was teaching, that there were Pharisees and teachers of the law sitting by, who had come out of every town of Galilee, Judea, and Jerusalem. And the power of the Lord was present to heal them. 42 5:18 Then behold, men brought on a bed a man who was paralyzed, whom they sought a way to bring in and lay him before Him. 42 5:19 And when they could not find how they might bring him in, because of the crowd, they went up on the housetop and let him down with his bed through the tiling into the midst before Jesus. 42 5:20 And when He saw their faith, He said to him, "Man, your sins are forgiven you." 42 5:21 And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, "Who is this who speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins but God alone?" 42 5:22 But when Jesus perceived their thoughts, He responded and said to them, "Why are you reasoning in your hearts?" 42 5:23 Which is easier, to say, 'Your sins are forgiven you,' or to say, 'Rise up and walk'?" 42 5:24 But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins," He said to the man who was paralyzed, "I say to you, arise, take up your bed, and go to your house." 42 5:25 And immediately he rose up before them, took up what he had been lying on, and departed to his own house, glorifying God. 42 5:26 And they were all amazed, and they glorified God and were filled with reverence, saying, "We have seen strange things today!" 42 5:27 And after these things He went out and saw a tax collector named Levi, sitting at the tax office. And He said to him, "Follow Me." 42 5:28 So he left everything, rose up, and followed Him. 42 5:29 Then Levi made Him a large feast in his own house. And there were a large number of tax collectors and others who sat down with them. 42 5:30 And their scribes and the Pharisees complained against His disciples, saying, "Why do You eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?" 42 5:31 And Jesus answering said to them, "Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick." 42 5:32 I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners, to repentance." 42 5:33 Then they said to Him, "Why do the disciples of John fast often and make prayers, and likewise the disciples of the Pharisees, but Yours eat and drink?" 42 5:34 And He said to them, "Can you make the friends of the bridechamber fast while the bridegroom is with them?" 42 5:35 But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them; then they will fast in those days." 42 5:36 Then He also spoke a parable to them: "No one puts a piece from a new garment on an old one; otherwise the new makes a tear, and also the piece that was taken out of the new does not settle with the old." 42 5:37 And no one puts new grape juice into old wineskins; or else the new grape juice will burst the wineskins and be spilled, and the wineskins will be ruined." 42 5:38 But new grape juice must be put into new wineskins, and both are preserved." 42 5:39 And also, no one having drunk old grape juice, immediately desires new; because he says, 'The old is better.'" 42 6:1 Now it happened on the second Sabbath after the first that He went through the grainfields. And His disciples plucked the heads of grain and ate them, rubbing them in their hands. 42 6:2 And some of the Pharisees said to them, "Why are you doing what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath days?" 42 6:3 But Jesus answering them said, "Have you not yet read this that David did, when he was hungry, he and those who were with him:" 42 6:4 how he went into the house of God, took and ate the showbread, and also gave some to those with him, which is not lawful to eat but is only for the priests?" 42 6:5 And He said to them, "The Son of Man is also Lord of the Sabbath." 42 6:6 Now it happened also on another Sabbath, that He entered into the synagogue and taught. And a man was there whose right hand was withered. 42 6:7 So the scribes and Pharisees watched Him, whether He would heal on the Sabbath day, that they might find an accusation against Him. 42 6:8 But He knew their thoughts, and said to the man who had the withered hand, "Rise up and stand here in the midst." And he arose and stood there. 42 6:9 Then Jesus said to them, "I will ask you one thing: Is it lawful on the Sabbath days to do good or to do evil, to save life or to destroy it?" 42 6:10 And when He had looked around at them all, He said to the man, "Stretch out your hand." And he did so, and his hand was restored as whole as the other. 42 6:11 But they were filled with madness, and discussed with one another what they might do to Jesus. 42 6:12 Now it came to pass in those days that He went out to the mountain to pray, and continued all night in prayer to God. 42 6:13 And when it was day, He called His disciples to Himself; and from them He chose twelve whom He also named apostles: 42 6:14 Simon, whom He also named Peter, and Andrew his brother; James and John; Philip and Bartholomew; 42 6:15 Matthew and Thomas; James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon called the Zealot; 42 6:16 Judas the brother of James, and Judas Iscariot who also became the traitor. 42 6:17 And He came down with them and stood on a level place with the gathering of His disciples and a large crowd of people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and from the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear Him and be healed of their diseases, 42 6:18 as well as those who were tormented with unclean spirits. And they were healed. 42 6:19 And the entire crowd sought to touch Him, because power went out from Him and healed them all. 42 6:20 Then He lifted up His eyes toward His disciples, and said: "Blessed are you poor, because yours is the kingdom of God." 42 6:21 Blessed are you who hunger now, because you will be filled. Blessed are you who weep now, because you will laugh." 42 6:22 Blessed are you when men hate you, and when they will separate you from their company, and revile you, and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of Man's sake." 42 6:23 Rejoice in that day and leap for joy! Because indeed, your reward is great in heaven, because in the same manner their fathers did to the prophets." 42 6:24 "But woe to you who are rich, because you have received your consolation." 42 6:25 Woe to you who are full, because you will hunger. Woe to you who laugh now, because you will mourn and weep." 42 6:26 Woe to you when all men speak well of you, because so did their fathers to the false prophets." 42 6:27 "But I say to you who hear: Love your enemies, do good to those who hate you," 42 6:28 bless those who curse you, and pray for those who spitefully use you." 42 6:29 And to him who strikes you on the one cheek, offer the other also. And from him who takes away your cloak, do not forbid to take your coat as well." 42 6:30 Give to everyone who asks of you. And from him who takes away your goods do not ask them back." 42 6:31 And just as you desire that people should do to you, you also do to them likewise." 42 6:32 "Because, if you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? Because even sinners love those who love them." 42 6:33 And if you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? Because even sinners do the same." 42 6:34 And if you lend to those from whom you hope to receive back, what credit is that to you? Because even sinners lend to sinners to receive as much back." 42 6:35 But love your enemies, do good, and lend, hoping for nothing in return; and your reward will be great, and you will be the children of the Most High. Because He is kind to the unthankful and evil." 42 6:36 Therefore be merciful, just as your Father also is merciful." 42 6:37 "Judge not, and you will not be judged. Condemn not, and you will not be condemned. Forgive, and you will be forgiven." 42 6:38 Give, and it will be given to you: good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over will men give into your bosom. Because, with the same measure that you use, it will be measured back to you." 42 6:39 And He spoke a parable to them: "Can the blind lead the blind? Will they not both fall into the ditch?" 42 6:40 A disciple is not above his teacher, but everyone who is perfect will be like his teacher." 42 6:41 And why do you look at the speck in your brother's eye, but do not perceive the plank in your own eye?" 42 6:42 Or how can you say to your brother, 'Brother, let me remove the speck that is in your eye,' when you yourself do not see the plank that is in your own eye? You hypocrite! First remove the plank from your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck that is in your brother's eye." 42 6:43 "Because, a good tree does not bear bad fruit, nor does a bad tree bear good fruit." 42 6:44 Because, every tree is known by its own fruit. Because, men do not gather figs from thorns, nor do they gather grapes from a bramble bush." 42 6:45 A good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings forth that which is good; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart brings forth that which is evil. Because out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks." 42 6:46 "But why do you call Me 'Lord, Lord,' and not do the things that I say?" 42 6:47 Whoever comes to Me, and hears My sayings and does them, I will show you whom he is like:" 42 6:48 He is like a man who built a house, who dug deep and laid the foundation on the rock. And when the flood arose, the stream beat vehemently against that house, and could not shake it, because it was founded on a rock." 42 6:49 But he who heard and did nothing is like a man who built a house on the earth without a foundation, against which the stream beat vehemently; and immediately it fell. And the ruin of that house was great." 42 7:1 Now when He concluded all His sayings in the hearing of the people, He entered into Capernaum. 42 7:2 And a certain centurion's servant, who was dear to him, was sick and ready to die. 42 7:3 So when he heard about Jesus, he sent elders of the Jews to Him, pleading with Him that He would come and heal his servant. 42 7:4 And when they came to Jesus, they begged Him earnestly, saying that the one whom He should do this to was deserving, 42 7:5 "because, he loves our nation, and has built us a synagogue." 42 7:6 Then Jesus went with them. And when He was already not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to Him, saying to Him, "Lord, do not trouble Yourself, because, I am not worthy that You should enter under my roof. 42 7:7 Therefore I did not even think myself worthy to come to You. But say the word, and my servant will be healed. 42 7:8 Because, I also am a man placed under authority, having soldiers under me. And I say to one, 'Go,' and he goes; and to another, 'Come,' and he comes; and to my servant, 'Do this,' and he does it." 42 7:9 When Jesus heard these things, He marveled at him, and turned around and said to the people that followed Him, "I say to you, I have not found such great faith, not even in Israel!" 42 7:10 And those who were sent, returning to the house, found the servant well who had been sick. 42 7:11 Now it happened, the day after, that He went into a city called Nain; and many of His disciples went with Him, and many people. 42 7:12 And when He came near the gate of the city, behold, a dead man was being carried out, the only son of his mother; and she was a widow. And many people from the city were with her. 42 7:13 And when the Lord saw her, He had compassion on her and said to her, "Do not weep." 42 7:14 Then He came and touched the coffin, and those who carried him stood still. And He said, "Young man, I say to you, arise." 42 7:15 So he who was dead sat up and began to speak. And He presented him to his mother. 42 7:16 Then reverence came upon everyone, and they glorified God, saying that: "A great prophet has risen up among us"; and, "God has visited His people." 42 7:17 And this report about Him went forth throughout all Judea and all the surrounding region. 42 7:18 Then the disciples of John reported to him about all these things. 42 7:19 And John, calling two of his disciples to him, sent them to Jesus, saying, "Are You He who should come, or do we look for another?" 42 7:20 When the men had come to Him, they said, "John the Baptist has sent us to You, saying, 'Are You He who should come, or do we look for another?'" 42 7:21 And that very hour He cured many of their infirmities, diseases, and evil spirits; and to many that were blind He gave sight. 42 7:22 So Jesus answering said to them, "Go your way and tell John the things you have seen and heard: that the blind see, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, the poor have the gospel preached to them." 42 7:23 And blessed is he who is not offended because of Me." 42 7:24 And when the messengers of John had departed, He began to speak to the people concerning John: "What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?" 42 7:25 But what did you go out to see? A man clothed in fine clothing? Indeed those who are wear fine clothes and live in luxury are in kings' courts." 42 7:26 But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I say to you, and much more than a prophet." 42 7:27 This is he of whom it is written: 'Behold, I send My messenger before Your face, who will prepare Your way before You.'" 42 7:28 Because, I say to you, among those born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist; but he who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than him." 42 7:29 And all the people who heard Him, even the tax collectors justified God, having been baptized with the baptism of John. 42 7:30 But the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the counsel of God regarding themselves, not having been baptized by him. 42 7:31 And the Lord said, "To what then shall I compare the men of this generation, and to what are they like?" 42 7:32 They are like children sitting in the marketplace and calling to one another, saying: 'We played the flute for you, and you did not dance; we mourned to you, and you did not weep.'" 42 7:33 Because, John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking grape juice, and you say, 'He has a demon.'" 42 7:34 The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, 'Look, a glutton and a wine drinker, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!'" 42 7:35 But wisdom is justified by all her children." 42 7:36 Then one of the Pharisees asked Him to eat with him. And He went to the Pharisee's house, and sat down to eat. 42 7:37 And behold, a woman in the city who was a sinner, when she knew that Jesus sat at the table in the Pharisee's house, brought an alabaster flask of fragrant oil, 42 7:38 and stood at His feet behind Him weeping; and began to wash His feet with tears, and wiped them with the hair of her head; and kissed His feet and anointed them with the fragrant oil. 42 7:39 Now when the Pharisee who had invited Him saw this, he spoke within himself, saying, "This Man, if He were a prophet, would have known who and what manner of woman this is who is touching Him, because she is a sinner." 42 7:40 And Jesus responded and said to him, "Simon, I have something to say to you." So he said, "Teacher, say it." 42 7:41 "There was a certain creditor who had two debtors. One owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty." 42 7:42 And when they had nothing with which to repay, he freely forgave them both. Tell Me, therefore, which of them shall love him most?" 42 7:43 Simon answered and said, "I suppose the one whom he forgave more." And He said to him, "You have rightly judged." 42 7:44 Then He turned to the woman and said to Simon, "Do you see this woman? I entered into your house; you gave Me no water for My feet, but she has washed My feet with her tears and wiped them with the hairs of her head." 42 7:45 You gave Me no kiss, but this woman has not ceased to kiss My feet since the time I came in." 42 7:46 You did not anoint My head with oil, but this woman has anointed My feet with fragrant oil." 42 7:47 Therefore I say to you, her sins, which are many, are forgiven, because she loved much. But to whom little is forgiven, the same loves little." 42 7:48 Then He said to her, "Your sins are forgiven." 42 7:49 And those who sat at the table with Him began to say to themselves, "Who is this who also forgives sins?" 42 7:50 Then He said to the woman, "Your faith has saved you. Go in peace." 42 8:1 Now it came to pass afterward, that He went through every city and village, preaching and showing the glad tidings of the kingdom of God. And the twelve were with Him, 42 8:2 and certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities; Mary called Magdalene, out of whom had come seven demons, 42 8:3 and Joanna the wife of Chuza, Herod's steward, and Susanna, and many others who provided for Him from their substance. 42 8:4 And when many people had gathered together, and they had come to Him from every city, He spoke by a parable: 42 8:5 "A sower went out to sow his seed. And as he sowed, some fell by the wayside; and it was trampled down, and the birds of the air devoured it." 42 8:6 And some fell on a rock; and as soon as it sprang up, it withered away because it lacked moisture." 42 8:7 And some fell among thorns, and the thorns sprang up with it and choked it." 42 8:8 But others fell on good ground, sprang up, and yielded a crop a hundredfold." And when He had said these things He shouted, "He who has ears to hear, let him hear!" 42 8:9 Then His disciples asked Him, saying, "What does this parable mean?" 42 8:10 And He said, "To you it has been given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God, but to the others in parables, that 'Seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.'" 42 8:11 "Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God." 42 8:12 Those by the wayside are the ones who hear; then the devil comes and takes away the word out of their hearts, lest they should believe and be saved." 42 8:13 The ones on the rock are those who, when they hear, receive the word with joy; but these have no root, who believe for a while and in time of temptation fall away." 42 8:14 Now the ones that fell among thorns are those who, when they have heard, go out and are choked with cares, riches, and pleasures of this life, and bring no fruit to maturity." 42 8:15 But those on the good ground are those who, having heard the word with an honest and good heart, keep it and bear fruit with patience." 42 8:16 "No one, when he has lit a lamp, covers it with a vessel or puts it under a bed, but sets it on a lampstand, that those who enter in may see the light." 42 8:17 Because, nothing is secret that will not be revealed, nor anything hidden that will not be known and come to light." 42 8:18 Therefore take heed how you hear. Because, whoever has, to him more will be given; and whoever does not have, even what he seems to have will be taken from him." 42 8:19 Then His mother and brethren came to Him, and could not approach Him because of the crowd. 42 8:20 And it was told Him by some, who said, "Your mother and Your brethren are standing outside, desiring to see You." 42 8:21 But He replied and said to them, "My mother and My brethren are these who hear the word of God and do it." 42 8:22 Now it happened, on a certain day, that He got into a boat with His disciples. And He said to them, "Let us cross over to the other side of the lake." And they launched out. 42 8:23 But as they sailed He fell asleep. And a windstorm came down on the lake, and they were filling with water, and were in jeopardy. 42 8:24 And they came to Him and awoke Him, saying, "Master, Master, we are perishing!" Then He arose and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water. And they ceased, and there was a calm. 42 8:25 And He said to them, "Where is your faith?" But they being afraid marveled, saying to one another, "What kind of man is this? Because, He commands even the winds and water, and they obey Him!" 42 8:26 Then they arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is opposite Galilee. 42 8:27 And when He went out on the land, there met Him a certain man from the city who had demons for a long time and wore no clothes, nor did he live in a house, but in the tombs. 42 8:28 When he saw Jesus, he yelled out, fell down before Him, and with a loud voice said, "What have I to do with You, Jesus, You Son of the Most High God? I beg You, do not torment me!" 42 8:29 Because, He had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. Because, it had often seized him, and he was kept under guard, bound with chains and shackles; and he broke the bonds and was driven by the demon into the wilderness. 42 8:30 Jesus asked him, saying, "What is your name?" And he said, "Legion," because many demons had entered him. 42 8:31 And they begged Him that He would not command them to go out into the abyss. 42 8:32 Now a herd of many swine was feeding there on the mountain. So they begged Him that He would permit them to enter them. And He permitted them. 42 8:33 Then the demons went out of the man and entered the swine, and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the lake and drowned. 42 8:34 When those who fed them saw what had happened, they fled and told it in the city and in the country. 42 8:35 Then they went out to see what had happened, and came to Jesus, and found the man from whom the demons had departed, sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed and in his right mind. And they were afraid. 42 8:36 They also who had seen it told them by what means he who had been demon possessed was healed. 42 8:37 Then the entire population of the surrounding region of the Gadarenes begged Him to depart from them, because they were seized with great fear. And He got into the boat and returned back again. 42 8:38 Now the man from whom the demons had departed begged Him that he might be with Him. But Jesus sent him away, saying, 42 8:39 "Return to your own house, and show what great things God has done for you." And he went his way and proclaimed throughout the entire city what great things Jesus had done for him. 42 8:40 And it came to pass, when Jesus returned, that the people welcomed Him gladly, because they were all waiting for Him. 42 8:41 And behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue. And he fell down at Jesus' feet and begged Him that He would come to his house, 42 8:42 because, he had an only daughter about twelve years of age, and she was dying. But as He went, the people swarmed Him. 42 8:43 Now a woman, having a flow of blood for twelve years, who had spent all her livelihood on physicians and could not be healed by any, 42 8:44 came behind Him and touched the edge of His clothes. And immediately her flow of blood stopped. 42 8:45 And Jesus said, "Who touched Me?" When all denied it, Peter and those with him said, "Master, the crowds swarm and press You, and You say, 'Who touched Me?'" 42 8:46 But Jesus said, "Somebody touched Me, because I perceive power has gone out from Me." 42 8:47 Now when the woman saw that she was not hidden, she came trembling; and falling down before Him, she declared to Him before all the people the reason she had touched Him and how she was healed immediately. 42 8:48 And He said to her, "Daughter, be of good cheer; your faith has made you well. Go in peace." 42 8:49 While He was still speaking, someone came from the ruler of the synagogue's house, saying to him, "Your daughter is dead. Do not trouble the Teacher." 42 8:50 But when Jesus heard it, He responded to him, saying, "Do not be afraid; only believe, and she will be made well." 42 8:51 And when He came into the house, He permitted no one to go in except Peter, James, and John, and the father and mother of the girl. 42 8:52 Now all wept and mourned for her; but He said, "Do not weep; she is not dead, but sleeping." 42 8:53 And they ridiculed Him, knowing that she was dead. 42 8:54 But He put them all outside, took her by the hand and called, saying, "Little girl, arise." 42 8:55 Then her spirit returned, and she arose immediately. And He commanded that she be given food to eat. 42 8:56 And her parents were astonished, but He commanded them that they should tell no one what had happened. 42 9:1 Then He called His twelve disciples together and gave them power and authority over all demons, and to cure diseases. 42 9:2 And He sent them to preach the kingdom of God and to heal the sick. 42 9:3 And He said to them, "Take nothing for your journey, neither staffs nor bag nor bread nor money; and do not have two coats each." 42 9:4 "Whatever house you enter into, stay there, and from there depart." 42 9:5 And whoever will not receive you, when you go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet as a testimony against them." 42 9:6 So they departed and went through the towns, preaching the gospel and healing everywhere. 42 9:7 Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by Him; and he was perplexed, because it was said by some that John had risen from the dead, 42 9:8 and by some that Elijah had appeared, and by others that one of the old prophets had risen again. 42 9:9 And Herod said, "John I have beheaded, but who is this of whom I hear such things?" So he desired to see Him. 42 9:10 And the apostles, when they had returned, told Him all that they had done. Then He took them and went aside privately into a deserted place belonging to the city called Bethsaida. 42 9:11 But when the people knew it, they followed Him; and He received them and spoke to them about the kingdom of God, and healed those who had need of healing. 42 9:12 And when the day began to wear away, then the twelve came and said to Him, "Send the crowd away, that they may go into the surrounding towns and country, and lodge and get provisions; because we are in a deserted place here." 42 9:13 But He said to them, "You give them something to eat." And they said, "We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless we should go and buy food for all these people." 42 9:14 Because, there were about five thousand men. Then He said to His disciples, "Make them sit down in groups of fifty." 42 9:15 And they did so, and made them all sit down. 42 9:16 Then He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, He blessed and broke them, and gave them to the disciples to set before the crowds. 42 9:17 So they ate and were all filled, and twelve baskets of the leftover fragments were taken up by them. 42 9:18 And it happened, as He was alone praying, that His disciples were with Him, and He asked them, saying, "Who do the people say that I am?" 42 9:19 They answered and said, "John the Baptist, but some say Elijah; and others say that one of the old prophets has risen again." 42 9:20 He said to them, "But who do you say that I am?" Peter answered and said, "The Christ of God." 42 9:21 And He strictly warned and commanded them to tell this thing to no one, 42 9:22 saying, "The Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised the third day." 42 9:23 Then He said to them all, "If anyone desires to come after Me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow Me." 42 9:24 Because, whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for My sake will save it." 42 9:25 Because, what profit is it to a man if he gains the entire world, and is himself thrown away or lost?" 42 9:26 Because, whoever is ashamed of Me and of My words, of him the Son of Man will be ashamed when He comes in His own glory, and in His Father's, and of the holy angels." 42 9:27 But I tell you truly, there are some standing here who will not taste death until they see the kingdom of God." 42 9:28 Now it came to pass, about eight days after these sayings, that He took Peter, John, and James and went up on the mountain to pray. 42 9:29 As He prayed, the appearance of His face was altered, and His robe became white and glistening. 42 9:30 And behold, two men talked with Him, who were Moses and Elijah, 42 9:31 who appeared in glory and spoke of His decease which He was about to accomplish at Jerusalem. 42 9:32 But Peter and those with him were heavy with sleep; and when they were awake, they saw His glory and the two men who stood with Him. 42 9:33 Then it happened, as they were parting from Him, that Peter said to Jesus, "Master, it is good for us to be here; and let us make three tabernacles: one for You, one for Moses, and one for Elijah," not knowing what he said. 42 9:34 While he was saying this, a cloud came and overshadowed them; and they were fearful as they entered the cloud. 42 9:35 And a voice came out of the cloud, saying, "This is My beloved Son. Hear Him!" 42 9:36 When the voice had ceased, Jesus was found alone. But they kept quiet, and told no one in those days any of the things that they had seen. 42 9:37 Now it happened on the next day, when they had come down from the mountain, that a large crowd met Him. 42 9:38 Suddenly a man from the crowd shouted out, saying, "Teacher, I implore You, look on my son, as he is my only child. 42 9:39 And behold, a spirit seizes him, and he suddenly yells out; it convulses him so that he foams at the mouth; and it departs from him with great difficulty, bruising him. 42 9:40 So I implored Your disciples to cast it out, but they could not." 42 9:41 Then Jesus responded and said, "O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you and bear with you? Bring your son here." 42 9:42 And as he was still coming, the demon threw him down and convulsed him. Then Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, healed the child, and gave him back to his father. 42 9:43 And they were all amazed at the mighty power of God. But while everyone marveled at all the things which Jesus did, He said to His disciples, 42 9:44 "Let these words sink down into your ears, because the Son of Man is about to be delivered into the hands of men." 42 9:45 But they did not understand this saying, and it was hidden from them so that they did not perceive it; and they were afraid to ask Him about this saying. 42 9:46 Then a dispute arose among them as to which of them would be greatest. 42 9:47 And Jesus, perceiving the thought of their heart, took a little child and set him by Him, 42 9:48 and said to them, "Whoever receives this little child in My name receives Me; and whoever receives Me receives Him who sent Me. Because he who is least among you all, they will be great." 42 9:49 Now John responded and said, "Master, we saw someone casting out demons in Your name, and we forbade him because he does not follow with us." 42 9:50 But Jesus said to him, "Do not forbid him, because he who is not against us is for us." 42 9:51 Now it came to pass, when the time had come for Him to be received up, that He steadfastly set His face to go to Jerusalem, 42 9:52 and sent messengers before His face. And as they went, they entered into a village of the Samaritans, to prepare for Him. 42 9:53 But they did not receive Him, because His face was set for the journey to Jerusalem. 42 9:54 And when His disciples James and John saw this, they said, "Lord, do You want us to command fire to come down from heaven and consume them, just as Elijah did?" 42 9:55 But He turned and rebuked them, and said, "You do not know what manner of spirit you are of. 42 9:56 Because, the Son of Man did not come to destroy men's lives but to save them." And they went to another village. 42 9:57 Now it happened as they journeyed on the road, that someone said to Him, "Lord, I will follow You wherever You go." 42 9:58 And Jesus said to him, "Foxes have holes and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay His head." 42 9:59 Then He said to another, "Follow Me." But he said, "Lord, let me first go and bury my father." 42 9:60 Jesus said to him, "Let the dead bury their own dead, but you go and preach the kingdom of God." 42 9:61 And another also said, "Lord, I will follow You, but let me first go and say farewell to those who are at my house." 42 9:62 But Jesus said to him, "No one, having put his hand to the plow, and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God." 42 10:1 After these things the Lord appointed seventy others also, and sent them two by two before His face into every city and place where He Himself was about to go. 42 10:2 Then He said to them, "The harvest is truly plentiful, but the laborers are few; therefore pray the Lord of the harvest that He would send out laborers into His harvest." 42 10:3 Go your way; behold, I send you out as lambs among wolves." 42 10:4 Carry neither money bag, knapsack, nor sandals; and greet no one along the road." 42 10:5 But whatever house you enter into, first say, 'Peace be to this house.'" 42 10:6 And if a son of peace is there, your peace will rest upon it; if not, it will return to you again." 42 10:7 And remain in the same house, eating and drinking such things as they give, because the laborer is worthy of his wages. Do not go from house to house." 42 10:8 And whatever city you enter into, and they receive you, eat such things as are set before you." 42 10:9 And heal the sick there, and say to them, 'The kingdom of God has come near to you.'" 42 10:10 But whatever city you enter into, and they do not receive you, go your way out into the streets of it and say," 42 10:11 'The very dust of your city which clings to us we wipe off against you. Nevertheless be sure of this, that the kingdom of God has come near to you.'" 42 10:12 But I say to you that it will be more tolerable in that Day for Sodom than for that city." 42 10:13 "Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! Because, if the mighty works which were done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes." 42 10:14 But it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment than for you." 42 10:15 And you, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, will be thrown down to hell." 42 10:16 He who hears you hears Me, he who rejects you rejects Me, and he who rejects Me rejects Him who sent Me." 42 10:17 Then the seventy returned again with joy, saying, "Lord, even the demons are subject to us in Your name." 42 10:18 And He said to them, "I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven." 42 10:19 Behold, I give you the authority to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy, and nothing will by any means hurt you." 42 10:20 Nevertheless do not rejoice in this, that the spirits are subject to you, but rather rejoice because your names are written in heaven." 42 10:21 In that hour Jesus rejoiced in spirit and said, "I thank You, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that You have hidden these things from the wise and prudent and revealed them to babes. Even so, Father, because so it seemed good in Your sight." 42 10:22 All things have been delivered to Me by My Father, and no one knows who the Son is except the Father, and who the Father is except the Son, and the one to whom the Son wills to reveal Him." 42 10:23 Then He turned to His disciples and said privately, "Blessed are the eyes which see the things that you see;" 42 10:24 because I tell you that many prophets and kings have desired to see these things which you see, and have not seen them, and to hear these things which you hear, and have not heard them." 42 10:25 And behold, a certain lawyer stood up and tested Him, saying, "Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?" 42 10:26 He said to him, "What is written in the law? What is your reading of it?" 42 10:27 So he answered and said, "'You shall love the LORD your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your strength, and with all your mind,' and 'your neighbor as yourself.'" 42 10:28 And He said to him, "You have answered rightly; do this and you will live." 42 10:29 But he, wanting to justify himself, said to Jesus, "And who is my neighbor?" 42 10:30 Then Jesus answering said: "A certain man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among thieves, who stripped him of his clothing, wounded him, and departed, leaving him half dead." 42 10:31 Now by chance a certain priest came down that road. And when he saw him, he passed by on the other side." 42 10:32 And likewise a Levite, when he arrived at the place, came and looked at him, and passed by on the other side." 42 10:33 But a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was. And when he saw him, he had compassion on him." 42 10:34 So he went to him and bandaged his wounds, pouring on oil and wine; and he set him on his own animal, brought him to an inn, and took care of him." 42 10:35 On the next day, when he departed, he took out two denarii, gave them to the innkeeper, and said to him, 'Take care of him; and whatever more you spend, when I come again, I will repay you.'" 42 10:36 So which of these three do you think was neighbor to him who fell among the thieves?" 42 10:37 And he said, "He who showed mercy on him." Then Jesus said to him, "You go and do likewise." 42 10:38 Now it happened as they went that He entered into a certain village; and a certain woman named Martha welcomed Him into her house. 42 10:39 And she had a sister called Mary, who also sat at Jesus' feet and heard His word. 42 10:40 But Martha was distracted with much serving, and she came to Him and said, "Lord, do You not care that my sister has left me to serve alone? Therefore tell her to help me." 42 10:41 And Jesus answered and said to her, "Martha, Martha, you are worried and troubled about many things." 42 10:42 But one thing is needed, and Mary has chosen that good part, which will not be taken away from her." 42 11:1 Now it came to pass, as He was praying in a certain place, when He ceased, that one of His disciples said to Him, "Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples." 42 11:2 So He said to them, "When you pray, say: Our Father who is in heaven, Hallowed be Your name. Your kingdom come. Your will be done as in heaven, so also on earth." 42 11:3 Give us day by day our daily bread." 42 11:4 And forgive us our sins, because we also forgive everyone who is indebted to us. And do not lead us into temptation, but deliver us from evil." 42 11:5 And He said to them, "Which of you will have a friend, and will go to him at midnight and say to him, 'Friend, lend me three loaves;" 42 11:6 because, a friend of mine has come to me on his journey, and I have nothing to set before him';" 42 11:7 and he will reply from within and say, 'Do not trouble me; the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed; I cannot rise and give to you'?" 42 11:8 I say to you, though he will not rise and give to him because he is his friend, yet because of his persistence he will rise and give him as many as he needs." 42 11:9 "So I say to you, ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you." 42 11:10 Because, everyone who asks receives, and he who seeks finds, and to him who knocks it will be opened." 42 11:11 If a son shall ask for bread from anyone of you that is a father, will he give him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, will he give him a serpent instead of a fish?" 42 11:12 Or if he asks for an egg, will he offer him a scorpion?" 42 11:13 If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask Him!" 42 11:14 And He was casting out a demon, and it was mute. So it was, when the demon had gone out, that the mute spoke; and the people marveled. 42 11:15 But some of them said, "He casts out demons by Beelzebub, the ruler of the demons." 42 11:16 Others, testing Him, sought from Him a sign from heaven. 42 11:17 But He, knowing their thoughts, said to them: "Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation, and a house divided against a house falls." 42 11:18 If Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? Because you say I cast out demons by Beelzebub." 42 11:19 And if I cast out demons by Beelzebub, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges." 42 11:20 But if I cast out demons with the finger of God, surely the kingdom of God has come upon you." 42 11:21 When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own palace, his goods are in peace." 42 11:22 But when a stronger than he comes upon him and overcomes him, he takes from him all his armor in which he trusted, and divides his spoils." 42 11:23 He who is not with Me is against Me, and he who does not gather with Me scatters." 42 11:24 "When an unclean spirit goes out of a man, he walks through dry places, seeking rest; and finding none, he says, 'I will return to my house from which I came.'" 42 11:25 And when he comes, he finds it swept and put in order." 42 11:26 Then he goes and takes with him seven other spirits more wicked than himself, and they enter in and dwell there; and the last state of that man is worse than the first." 42 11:27 And it happened, as He spoke these things, that a certain woman from the crowd raised her voice and said to Him, "Blessed is the womb that bore You, and the breasts which You have sucked!" 42 11:28 But He said, "Rather, blessed are those who hear the word of God and keep it!" 42 11:29 And while the people were tightly gathered together, He began to say, "This is an evil generation. It seeks a sign, and no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah the prophet." 42 11:30 Because, as Jonah became a sign to the Ninevites, so also the Son of Man will be to this generation." 42 11:31 The queen of the South will rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation and condemn them, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, a greater than Solomon is here." 42 11:32 The men of Nineveh will rise up in the judgment with this generation and will condemn it, because, they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and indeed a greater than Jonah is here." 42 11:33 "No one, when he has lit a lamp, puts it in a secret place or under a basket, but on a lampstand, that those who come in may see the light." 42 11:34 The lamp of the body is the eye. Therefore, when your eye is single, your entire body also is full of light. But when your eye is corrupted, your body also is full of darkness." 42 11:35 Therefore take heed that the light which is in you is not darkness." 42 11:36 If then your entire body is full of light, having no part dark, the entire body will be full of light, as when the bright shining of a lamp gives you light." 42 11:37 And as He spoke, a certain Pharisee asked Him to dine with him. So He went in and sat down to eat. 42 11:38 And when the Pharisee saw it, he marveled that He had not first washed before dinner. 42 11:39 Then the Lord said to him, "Now you Pharisees make the outside of the cup and dish clean, but your inward part is full of greed and wickedness." 42 11:40 You fools! Did not He who made the outside make the inside also?" 42 11:41 But rather give charitable deeds of such things as you have; then indeed all things are clean to you." 42 11:42 "But woe to you Pharisees! Because you tithe mint and rue and all manner of herbs, and pass over justice and the love of God. These you ought to have done, without leaving the others undone." 42 11:43 Woe to you Pharisees! Because, you love the best seats in the synagogues and greetings in the marketplaces." 42 11:44 Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because, you are like graves which are not seen, and the men who walk over them are not aware of them." 42 11:45 Then one of the lawyers responded and said to Him, "Teacher, by saying these things You reproach us also." 42 11:46 And He said, "Woe to you also, you lawyers! Because, you load men with burdens hard to bear, and you yourselves do not touch the burdens with one of your fingers." 42 11:47 Woe to you! Because, you build the tombs of the prophets, and your fathers killed them." 42 11:48 In fact, you bear witness that you approve the deeds of your fathers; because, they indeed killed them, and you build their tombs." 42 11:49 Therefore the wisdom of God also said, 'I will send them prophets and apostles, and some of them they will kill and persecute,'" 42 11:50 that the blood of all the prophets which was shed from the foundation of the world may be required of this generation," 42 11:51 from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah who perished between the altar and the temple. Truly, I say to you, it will be required of this generation." 42 11:52 "Woe to you lawyers! Because, you have taken away the key of knowledge. You did not enter in yourselves, and those who were entering in you hindered." 42 11:53 And as He said these things to them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to contest Him vehemently, and to provoke Him to speak about many things, 42 11:54 lying in wait for Him, and seeking to catch Him in something out of His mouth, that they might accuse Him. 42 12:1 In the meantime, when an innumerable multitude of people had gathered together, so that they trampled one another, He began to say to His disciples first of all, "Beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy." 42 12:2 Because, there is nothing covered that will not be revealed, nor hidden that will not be known." 42 12:3 Therefore whatever you have spoken in the dark will be heard in the light, and what you have spoken in the ear in inner rooms will be proclaimed upon the housetops." 42 12:4 "And I say to you, My friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do." 42 12:5 But I will forewarn you whom you should reverence: Reverence Him who, after He has killed, has authority to cast into hell; yes, I say to you, reverence Him!" 42 12:6 "Are not five sparrows sold for two copper coins? And not one of them is forgotten before God." 42 12:7 But even the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Do not fear therefore; you are of more value than many sparrows." 42 12:8 "Also I say to you, whoever confesses Me before men, him the Son of Man also will confess before the angels of God." 42 12:9 But he who denies Me before men will be denied before the angels of God." 42 12:10 "And anyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man, it will be forgiven him; but to him who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit, it will not be forgiven." 42 12:11 "Now when they bring you to the synagogues and to magistrates and authorities, do not worry about how or what you should answer, or what you should say." 42 12:12 Because, the Holy Spirit will teach you in that very hour what you ought to say." 42 12:13 Then one from the company said to Him, "Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me." 42 12:14 But He said to him, "Man, who made Me a judge or an arbitrator over you?" 42 12:15 And He said to them, "Take heed and beware of covetousness, because, one's life does not consist in the abundance of the things he possesses." 42 12:16 Then He spoke a parable to them, saying: "The ground of a certain rich man yielded plentifully." 42 12:17 And he thought within himself, saying, 'What shall I do, since I have no room to store my crops?'" 42 12:18 So he said, 'I will do this: I will pull down my barns and build greater, and there I will store all my crops and my goods." 42 12:19 And I will say to my soul, "Soul, you have many goods laid up for many years; take your ease; eat, drink, and be merry." ' 42 12:20 But God said to him, 'You fool! This night your soul will be required of you; then whose shall those things be which you have provided?'" 42 12:21 "So is he who lays up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God." 42 12:22 Then He said to His disciples, "Therefore I say to you, do not worry about your life, what you shall eat; nor about the body, what you shall put on." 42 12:23 Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothing." 42 12:24 Consider the ravens, because, they neither sow nor reap, which have neither storehouse nor barn; and God feeds them. Of how much more value are you than the birds?" 42 12:25 And which of you by worrying can add one cubit to his stature?" 42 12:26 If you then are not able to do the things that are the least, why are you anxious for the rest?" 42 12:27 Consider the lilies, how they grow: they neither toil nor spin; and yet I say to you, even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these." 42 12:28 If then God so clothes the grass, which today is in the field and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, how much more will He clothe you, O you of little faith?" 42 12:29 "And do not seek what you should eat or what you should drink, nor have an anxious mind." 42 12:30 Because, all these things the nations of the world seek after, and your Father knows that you need these things." 42 12:31 But instead, seek the kingdom of God, and all these things will be added to you." 42 12:32 "Do not fear, little flock, because it is your Father's good pleasure to give you the kingdom." 42 12:33 Sell what you have and give charitable gifts; provide yourselves money bags which do not grow old, a treasure in the heavens that does not fail, where no thief approaches nor moth destroys." 42 12:34 Because where your treasure is, there your heart will be also." 42 12:35 "Let your waist be girded and your lamps burning;" 42 12:36 and you yourselves be like men who wait for their master, when he will return from the wedding, that when he comes and knocks they may open to him immediately." 42 12:37 Blessed are those servants whom the master, when he comes, will find watching. Truly, I say to you that he will gird himself and have them sit down to eat, and will come out and serve them." 42 12:38 And if he should come in the second watch, or come in the third watch, and find them so, blessed are those servants." 42 12:39 But know this, that if the master of the house had known what hour the thief would come, he would have watched and not allowed his house to be broken into." 42 12:40 Therefore you also be ready, because the Son of Man is coming at an hour you do not expect." 42 12:41 Then Peter said to Him, "Lord, do You speak this parable only to us, or also to everyone?" 42 12:42 And the Lord said, "Who then is that faithful and wise steward, whom his master will make ruler over his household, to give them their portion of food in due season?" 42 12:43 Blessed is that servant whom his master will find so doing when he comes." 42 12:44 Truly, I say to you that he will make him ruler over all that he has." 42 12:45 But then, if that servant says in his heart, 'My master is delaying his coming,' and begins to beat the male and female servants, and to eat and drink and be drunk," 42 12:46 the master of that servant will come on a day when he is not looking for him, and at an hour when he is not aware, and will cut him in two and will appoint him his portion with the unbelievers." 42 12:47 And that servant who knew his master's will, and did not prepare himself or do according to his will, will be beaten with many stripes." 42 12:48 But he who did not know, yet committed things deserving of stripes, will be beaten with a few stripes. Because, to whoever much is given, from him much will be required; and to whom much has been committed by men, of him they will ask the more." 42 12:49 "I came to send fire on the earth, and what do I desire if it were already lit?" 42 12:50 But I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how distressed I am until it is accomplished!" 42 12:51 Do you suppose that I came to give peace on earth? I tell you, not at all, but rather division." 42 12:52 Because, from now on five in one house will be divided: three against two, and two against three." 42 12:53 Father will be divided against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother in law against her daughter in law and daughter in law against her mother in law." 42 12:54 Then He also said to the people, "Whenever you see a cloud rising out of the west, immediately you say, 'A shower is coming'; and so it is." 42 12:55 And when you see the south wind blow, you say, 'There will be hot weather'; and it happens." 42 12:56 You hypocrites! You can discern the face of the sky and of the earth, but how is it you do not discern this time?" 42 12:57 "Yes, and why, even of yourselves, do you not judge what is right?" 42 12:58 When you go with your adversary to the magistrate, make every effort along the way to be delivered from him, lest he drag you to the judge, the judge deliver you to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison." 42 12:59 I tell you, you will not depart from there until you have paid the very last mite." 42 13:1 There were present at that season some who told Him about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices. 42 13:2 And Jesus replied and said to them, "Do you suppose that these Galileans were worse sinners than all other Galileans, because they suffered such things?" 42 13:3 I tell you, no; but unless you repent you will all likewise perish." 42 13:4 Or those eighteen on whom the tower in Siloam fell and killed them, do you think that they were worse sinners than all other men who dwelt in Jerusalem?" 42 13:5 I tell you, no; but unless you repent you will all likewise perish." 42 13:6 He also spoke this parable: "A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, and he came seeking fruit on it and found none." 42 13:7 Then he said to the keeper of his vineyard, 'Look, for three years I have come seeking fruit on this fig tree and find none. Cut it down; why does it use up the ground?'" 42 13:8 But he answered and said to him, 'Sir, let it alone this year also, until I dig around it and fertilize it." 42 13:9 And if it bears fruit, well. But if not, then after that you can cut it down.'" 42 13:10 Now He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath. 42 13:11 And behold, there was a woman who had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and was bent over and could in no way lift herself up. 42 13:12 But when Jesus saw her, He called her to Him and said to her, "Woman, you are loosed from your infirmity." 42 13:13 And He laid His hands on her, and immediately she was made straight, and glorified God. 42 13:14 But the ruler of the synagogue responded with indignation, because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath day; and he said to the people, "There are six days on which men ought to work; therefore come and be healed on them, and not on the Sabbath day." 42 13:15 The Lord then replied to him and said, "You hypocrite! Does not each one of you on the Sabbath loose his ox or his donkey from the stall, and lead it away to water it?" 42 13:16 So ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan has bound, behold, for eighteen years, be loosed from this bond on the Sabbath day?" 42 13:17 And when He said these things, all His adversaries were put to shame; and all the people rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by Him. 42 13:18 Then He said, "What is the kingdom of God like? And to what shall I compare it?" 42 13:19 It is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took and threw in his garden; and it grew and became a large tree, and the birds of the air nested in its branches." 42 13:20 And again He said, "To what shall I liken the kingdom of God?" 42 13:21 It is like leaven, which a woman took and hid three measures of meal inside until it was all leavened." 42 13:22 And He went through the cities and villages, teaching, and journeying toward Jerusalem. 42 13:23 Then one said to Him, "Lord, are there few who are saved?" And He said to them, 42 13:24 "Strive to enter through the narrow gate, because many, I say to you, will seek to enter in and will not be able." 42 13:25 When once the Master of the house has risen up and shut the door, and you begin to stand outside and knock at the door, saying, 'Lord, Lord, open for us,' and He will reply and say to you, 'I do not know you, where you are from,'" 42 13:26 then you will begin to say, 'We ate and drank in Your presence, and You have taught in our streets.'" 42 13:27 But He will say, 'I tell you I do not know you, where you are from. Depart from Me, all you workers of iniquity.'" 42 13:28 There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when you see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, and you yourselves thrust out." 42 13:29 And they will come from the east and from the west, from the north and from the south, and will sit down in the kingdom of God." 42 13:30 And behold there are last who will be first, and there are first who will be last." 42 13:31 On the same day some Pharisees came, saying to Him, "Get out and depart from here, because Herod will kill You." 42 13:32 And He said to them, "You go and tell that fox, 'Behold, I cast out demons and perform cures today and tomorrow, and the third day I will be perfected.'" 42 13:33 Nevertheless I must walk today, tomorrow, and the day following; because, it cannot be that a prophet should perish outside of Jerusalem." 42 13:34 "O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, the one who kills the prophets and stones those who are sent to you! How often I wanted to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her brood under her wings, but you were not willing!" 42 13:35 Behold! Your house is left to you desolate; and truly, I say to you, you will not see Me until the time comes when you will say, 'Blessed is He who comes in the name of the LORD!'" 42 14:1 Now it happened, as He went into the house of one of the rulers of the Pharisees to eat bread on the Sabbath day, that they watched Him. 42 14:2 And behold, there was a certain man before Him who had dropsy. 42 14:3 And Jesus, responding, spoke to the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, "Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath day?" 42 14:4 But they kept silent. And He took him and healed him, and let him go. 42 14:5 Then He responded to them, saying, "Which of you, having a donkey or an ox that has fallen into a pit, will not immediately pull him out on the Sabbath day?" 42 14:6 And they could not answer Him regarding these things. 42 14:7 So He told a parable to those who were invited, when He noted how they chose the best places, saying to them: 42 14:8 "When you are invited by anyone to a wedding feast, do not sit down in the best place, lest one more honorable than you be invited by him;" 42 14:9 and he who invited you and him come and say to you, 'Give place to this man,' and then you begin with shame to take the lowest place." 42 14:10 But when you are invited, go and sit down in the lowest place, so that when he who invited you comes he may say to you, 'Friend, go up higher.' Then you will have glory in the presence of those who sit at the table with you." 42 14:11 Because, whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted." 42 14:12 Then He also said to him who invited Him, "When you give a dinner or a supper, do not ask your friends, your brethren, your relatives, nor your rich neighbors, lest they also invite you back, and you be repaid." 42 14:13 But when you give a feast, invite the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind." 42 14:14 And you will be blessed, because they cannot repay you; because, you will be repaid at the resurrection of the just." 42 14:15 Now when one of those who sat at the table with Him heard these things, he said to Him, "Blessed is he who will eat bread in the kingdom of God!" 42 14:16 Then He said to him, "A certain man made a large supper and invited many," 42 14:17 and sent his servant at supper time to say to those who were invited, 'Come, because all things are now ready.'" 42 14:18 But they all with one accord began to make excuses. The first said to him, 'I have bought a piece of ground, and I must go and see it. I ask you to have me excused.'" 42 14:19 And another said, 'I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I am going to test them. I ask you to have me excused.'" 42 14:20 Still another said, 'I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.'" 42 14:21 So that servant came and reported these things to his master. Then the master of the house, being angry, said to his servant, 'Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in here the poor and the maimed and the lame and the blind.'" 42 14:22 And the servant said, 'Master, it is done as you have commanded, and still there is room.'" 42 14:23 Then the master said to the servant, 'Go out into the highways and hedges, and compel them to come in, that my house may be filled." 42 14:24 Because, I say to you that none of those men who were invited will taste my supper.'" 42 14:25 Now large crowds went with Him. And He turned and said to them, 42 14:26 "If anyone comes to Me and does not hate his father and mother, wife and children, brothers and sisters, yes, and his own life also, he cannot be My disciple." 42 14:27 And whoever does not bear his cross and come after Me cannot be My disciple." 42 14:28 Because, which of you, intending to build a tower, does not sit down first and count the cost, whether he has enough to finish it?" 42 14:29 Lest, after he has laid the foundation, and is not able to finish it, all who see it begin to mock him," 42 14:30 saying, 'This man began to build and was not able to finish.'" 42 14:31 Or what king, going to make war against another king, does not sit down first and consider whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him who comes against him with twenty thousand?" 42 14:32 Or else, while the other is still a long way off, he sends a delegation and desires conditions of peace." 42 14:33 So likewise, whoever it is of you who does not forsake all that he has cannot be My disciple." 42 14:34 "Salt is good; but if the salt has lost its flavor, how will it be seasoned?" 42 14:35 It is neither fit for the land nor for the dunghill, but men throw it out. He who has ears to hear, let him hear!" 42 15:1 Then all the tax collectors and the sinners drew near to Him to hear Him. 42 15:2 And the Pharisees and scribes murmured, saying, "This Man receives sinners and eats with them." 42 15:3 So He spoke this parable to them, saying: 42 15:4 "What man of you, having a hundred sheep, if he loses one of them, does not leave the ninety nine in the wilderness, and go after the one which is lost until he finds it?" 42 15:5 And when he has found it, he lays it on his shoulders, rejoicing." 42 15:6 And when he comes home, he calls together his friends and neighbors, saying to them, 'Rejoice with me, because I have found my sheep which was lost!'" 42 15:7 I say to you that likewise there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety nine just persons who need no repentance." 42 15:8 "Or what woman, having ten silver coins, if she loses one coin, does not light a lamp, sweep the house, and search diligently until she finds it?" 42 15:9 And when she has found it, she calls her friends and her neighbors together, saying, 'Rejoice with me, because I have found the piece which I lost!'" 42 15:10 Likewise, I say to you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner who repents." 42 15:11 Then He said: "A certain man had two sons." 42 15:12 And the younger of them said to his father, 'Father, give me the portion of goods that falls to me.' So he divided to them his livelihood." 42 15:13 And not many days after, the younger son gathered all together, journeyed to a far country, and there wasted his possessions with reckless living." 42 15:14 But when he had spent everything, there arose a severe famine in that land, and he began to be in need." 42 15:15 Then he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country, and he sent him into his fields to feed swine." 42 15:16 And he would gladly have filled his stomach with the pods that the swine ate, and no one gave anything to him." 42 15:17 "But when he came to himself, he said, 'How many of my father's hired servants have enough bread and to spare, and I perish with hunger!" 42 15:18 I will arise and go to my father, and will say to him, "Father, I have sinned against heaven and before you," 42 15:19 and I am no longer worthy to be called your son. Make me like one of your hired servants." ' 42 15:20 "And he arose and came to his father. But when he was still a long way off, his father saw him and had compassion, and ran and fell on his neck and kissed him." 42 15:21 And the son said to him, 'Father, I have sinned against heaven and in your sight, and am no longer worthy to be called your son.'" 42 15:22 "But the father said to his servants, 'Bring out the best robe and put it on him, and put a ring on his hand and sandals on his feet." 42 15:23 And bring the fatted calf here and kill it, and let us eat and be merry;" 42 15:24 because this my son was dead and is alive again; he was lost and is found.' And they began to be merry." 42 15:25 "Now his older son was in the field. And as he came and drew near to the house, he heard music and dancing." 42 15:26 So he called one of the servants and asked what these things meant." 42 15:27 And he said to him, 'Your brother has come, and because he has received him safe and sound, your father has killed the fatted calf.'" 42 15:28 "But he was angry and would not go in. Therefore his father came out and pleaded with him." 42 15:29 So he replied and said to his father, 'Behold, these many years I have been serving you; I never transgressed your commandment at any time; and yet you never gave me a young goat, that I might be merry with my friends." 42 15:30 But as soon as this son of yours came, who has devoured your livelihood with harlots, you killed the fatted calf for him.'" 42 15:31 "And he said to him, 'Son, you are always with me, and all that I have is yours." 42 15:32 It was right that we should make merry and be glad, because that your brother was dead and is alive again, and was lost and is found.'" 42 16:1 He also said to His disciples: "There was a certain rich man who had a steward, and an accusation was brought to him that this man was wasting his goods." 42 16:2 So he called him and said to him, 'What is this I hear about you? Give an account of your stewardship, because you can no longer be steward.'" 42 16:3 "Then the steward said within himself, 'What shall I do? Because, my master is taking the stewardship away from me. I cannot dig; I am ashamed to beg." 42 16:4 I have resolved what to do, that when I am put out of the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.'" 42 16:5 "So he called every one of his master's debtors to him, and said to the first, 'How much do you owe my master?'" 42 16:6 And he said, 'A hundred measures of oil.' So he said to him, 'Take your bill, and sit down quickly and write fifty.'" 42 16:7 Then he said to another, 'And how much do you owe?' So he said, 'A hundred measures of wheat.' And he said to him, 'Take your bill, and write eighty.'" 42 16:8 So the master commended the unjust steward because he had dealt shrewdly. Because, the sons of this world are more shrewd in their generation than the children of light." 42 16:9 "And I say to you, make friends for yourselves by unrighteous mammon, that when you fail, they may receive you into an everlasting home." 42 16:10 He who is faithful in what is least is faithful also in much; and he who is unjust in what is least is unjust also in much." 42 16:11 Therefore if you have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?" 42 16:12 And if you have not been faithful in what is another man's, who will give you what is your own?" 42 16:13 "No servant can serve two masters; because, either he will hate the one and love the other, or else he will be loyal to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and mammon." 42 16:14 Now the Pharisees, who were covetous, also heard all these things, and they derided Him. 42 16:15 And He said to them, "You are those who justify yourselves before men, but God knows your hearts. Because, what is highly esteemed among men is an abomination in the sight of God." 42 16:16 "The law and the prophets were until John. Since that time the kingdom of God has been preached, and everyone is pressing into it." 42 16:17 And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for one tittle of the law to fail." 42 16:18 "Whoever puts away his wife and marries another commits adultery; and whoever marries her who is put away from her husband commits adultery." 42 16:19 "There was a certain rich man who was clothed in purple and fine linen and lived lavishly every day." 42 16:20 But there was a certain beggar named Lazarus, full of sores, who was laid at his gate," 42 16:21 and desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man's table. Moreover the dogs came and licked his sores." 42 16:22 So it happened that the beggar died, and was carried by the angels to Abraham's bosom. The rich man also died and was buried." 42 16:23 And being in torments in Hell, he lifted up his eyes and saw Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom." 42 16:24 "Then he cried out and said, 'Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus that he may dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue; because I am tormented in this flame.'" 42 16:25 But Abraham said, 'Son, remember that in your lifetime you received your good things, and likewise Lazarus evil things; but now he is comforted and you are tormented." 42 16:26 And besides all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed, so that those who want to pass from here to you cannot, nor can those who want to come from there pass to us.'" 42 16:27 "Then he said, 'I beg you therefore, father, that you would send him to my father's house," 42 16:28 because, I have five brethren, that he may testify to them, lest they also come to this place of torment.'" 42 16:29 Abraham said to him, 'They have Moses and the prophets; let them hear them.'" 42 16:30 And he said, 'No, father Abraham; but if one went to them from the dead, they will repent.'" 42 16:31 But he said to him, 'If they do not hear Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded though one rise from the dead.'" 42 17:1 Then He said to the disciples, "It is impossible that no offenses should come, but woe to him through whom they do come!" 42 17:2 It would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck, and he were thrown into the sea, than that he should offend one of these little ones." 42 17:3 Take heed to yourselves. If your brother sins against you, rebuke him; and if he repents, forgive him." 42 17:4 And if he sins against you seven times in a day, and seven times in a day returns to you, saying, 'I repent,' you shall forgive him." 42 17:5 And the apostles said to the Lord, "Increase our faith." 42 17:6 But the Lord said, "If you have faith as a mustard seed, you can say to this mulberry tree, 'Be pulled up by the roots and be planted in the sea,' and it would obey you." 42 17:7 And which of you, having a servant plowing or feeding cattle, shall say to him at the end when he has come in from the field, 'Come at once and sit down to eat'?" 42 17:8 But will he not rather say to him, 'Prepare something for my supper, and gird yourself and serve me until I have eaten and drunk, and afterward you will eat and drink'?" 42 17:9 Does he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him? I think not." 42 17:10 So likewise you, when you have done all those things which you are commanded, say, 'We are unprofitable servants. We have done what was our duty to do.'" 42 17:11 Now it happened as He went to Jerusalem that He passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee. 42 17:12 Then as He entered into a certain village, there met Him ten men who were lepers, who stood afar off. 42 17:13 And they lifted up their voices and said, "Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!" 42 17:14 So when He saw them, He said to them, "Go, show yourselves to the priests." And so it was that as they went, they were cleansed. 42 17:15 And one of them, when he saw that he was healed, returned, and with a loud voice glorified God, 42 17:16 and fell down on his face at His feet, giving Him thanks.
