And he was a Samaritan. 42 17:17 So Jesus responding said, "Were there not ten cleansed? But where are the nine?" 42 17:18 There are not any found who returned to give glory to God except this foreigner!" 42 17:19 And He said to him, "Arise, go your way. Your faith has made you well." 42 17:20 Now when He was demanded by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God would come, He answered them and said, "The kingdom of God does not come with observation;" 42 17:21 nor will they say, 'Look here!' or 'Look there!' Because indeed, the kingdom of God is within you." 42 17:22 Then He said to the disciples, "The days will come when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it." 42 17:23 And they will say to you, 'See here!' or 'See there!' Do not go after them or follow them." 42 17:24 Because, as the lightning that flashes out of one part under heaven shines to the other part under heaven, so also the Son of Man will be in His day." 42 17:25 But first He must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation." 42 17:26 And as it was in the days of Noah, so it will be also in the days of the Son of Man:" 42 17:27 They ate, they drank, they married wives, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noah entered the ark, and the flood came and destroyed them all." 42 17:28 Likewise also, as it was in the days of Lot: They ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they built;" 42 17:29 but on the day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven and destroyed them all." 42 17:30 Even so will it be in the day when the Son of Man is revealed." 42 17:31 "In that day, he who is on the housetop, and his goods are in the house, let him not come down to take them away. And he who is in the field, let him not turn back." 42 17:32 Remember Lot's wife." 42 17:33 Whoever seeks to save his life will lose it, and whoever loses his life will preserve it." 42 17:34 I tell you, in that night there will be two men in one bed: the one will be taken and the other will be left." 42 17:35 Two women will be grinding together: the one will be taken and the other left." 42 17:36 Two men will be in the field: the one will be taken and the other left." 42 17:37 And they replied and said to Him, "Where, Lord?" So He said to them, "Wherever the body is, there the eagles will be gathered together." 42 18:1 Then He spoke a parable to them, concluding that men always ought to pray and not lose heart, 42 18:2 saying: "There was in a certain city a judge who did not reverence God nor regard man." 42 18:3 Now there was a widow in that city; and she came to him, saying, 'Avenge me from my adversary.'" 42 18:4 And he would not for a while; but afterward he said within himself, 'Though I do not reverence God nor regard man," 42 18:5 yet because this widow troubles me I will avenge her, lest by her continual coming she weary me.'" 42 18:6 Then the Lord said, "Hear what the unjust judge said." 42 18:7 And will God not avenge His own elect who cry out day and night to Him, though He bears long with them?" 42 18:8 I tell you that He will avenge them speedily. Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, shall He find faith on the earth?" 42 18:9 Also He spoke this parable to some who trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and despised others: 42 18:10 "Two men went up to the temple to pray, one a Pharisee and the other a tax collector." 42 18:11 The Pharisee stood and prayed to himself like this, 'God, I thank You that I am not like other men are, extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even as this tax collector." 42 18:12 I fast twice a week; I give tithes of all that I possess.'" 42 18:13 And the tax collector, standing afar off, would not so much as raise his eyes to heaven, but beat his breast, saying, 'God, be merciful to me a sinner!'" 42 18:14 I tell you, this man went down to his house justified rather than the other; because, everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted." 42 18:15 Then they also brought infants to Him that He might touch them; but when His disciples saw it, they rebuked them. 42 18:16 But Jesus called them to Him and said, "Permit little children to come to Me, and do not forbid them; because, of such is the kingdom of God." 42 18:17 Truly, I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God as a little child will by no means enter it." 42 18:18 Now a certain ruler asked Him, saying, "Good Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?" 42 18:19 So Jesus said to him, "Why do you call Me good? No one is good but One, that is, God." 42 18:20 You know the commandments: 'Do not commit adultery,' 'Do not murder,' 'Do not steal,' 'Do not bear false witness,' 'Honor your father and your mother.'" 42 18:21 And he said, "All these things I have kept from my youth up." 42 18:22 So when Jesus heard these things, He said to him, "You still lack one thing. Sell all that you have and distribute to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow Me." 42 18:23 But when he heard this, he became very sorrowful, because he was very rich. 42 18:24 And when Jesus saw that he became very sorrowful, He said, "How hard it is for those who have riches to enter the kingdom of God!" 42 18:25 Because, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God." 42 18:26 And those who heard it said, "Who then can be saved?" 42 18:27 But He said, "The things which are impossible with men are possible with God." 42 18:28 Then Peter said, "See, we have left all and followed You." 42 18:29 So He said to them, "Truly, I say to you, there is no one who has left house or parents or brethren or wife or children, for the sake of the kingdom of God," 42 18:30 who will not receive many times more in this present time, and in the age to come life everlasting." 42 18:31 Then He took the twelve to Himself and said to them, "Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of Man will be accomplished." 42 18:32 Because, He will be delivered to the Gentiles and will be mocked and insulted and spat upon." 42 18:33 Then they will scourge Him and put Him to death. And the third day He will rise again." 42 18:34 But they understood none of these things; this saying was hidden from them, and they did not know the things which were spoken. 42 18:35 Then it happened, as He was coming near Jericho, that a certain blind man sat by the road begging. 42 18:36 And hearing the crowd passing by, he asked what it meant. 42 18:37 So they told him that Jesus of Nazareth was passing by. 42 18:38 And he shouted, saying, "Jesus, You Son of David, have mercy on me!" 42 18:39 Then those who went before warned him that he should be quiet; but he shouted all the more, "You Son of David, have mercy on me!" 42 18:40 So Jesus stood still and commanded him to be brought to Him. And when he had come near, He asked him, 42 18:41 saying, "What do you want Me to do for you?" He said, "Lord, that I may receive my sight." 42 18:42 Then Jesus said to him, "Receive your sight; your faith has saved you." 42 18:43 And immediately he received his sight, and followed Him, glorifying God. And all the people, when they saw it, gave praise to God. 42 19:1 Then Jesus entered and passed through Jericho. 42 19:2 Now behold, there was a man named Zacchaeus who was a chief tax collector, and he was rich. 42 19:3 And he sought to see who Jesus was, but could not because of the crowd, because he was of short stature. 42 19:4 So he ran ahead and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see Him, because He was going to pass that way. 42 19:5 And when Jesus came to the place, He looked up and saw him, and said to him, "Zacchaeus, make haste and come down, because today I must stay at your house." 42 19:6 So he made haste and came down, and received Him joyfully. 42 19:7 But when they saw it, they all murmured, saying, "He has gone to be a guest with a man who is a sinner." 42 19:8 Then Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, "Look, Lord, I give half of my goods to the poor; and if I have taken anything from anyone by false accusation, I restore fourfold to them." 42 19:9 And Jesus said to him, "Today salvation has come to this house, because he also is the son of Abraham;" 42 19:10 because the Son of Man has come to seek and to save that which was lost." 42 19:11 Now as they heard these things, He spoke another parable, because He was near Jerusalem and because they thought the kingdom of God would appear immediately. 42 19:12 Therefore He said: "A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom and to return." 42 19:13 So he called his ten servants, delivered to them ten minas, and said to them, 'Do business until I come.'" 42 19:14 But his citizens hated him, and sent a message after him, saying, 'We will not have this man to reign over us.'" 42 19:15 "And so it was that when he returned, having received the kingdom, he then commanded these servants, to whom he had given the money, to be called to him, that he might know how much every man had gained by trading." 42 19:16 Then came the first, saying, 'Master, your mina has earned ten minas.'" 42 19:17 And he said to him, 'Well done, good servant; because you were faithful in a very little, have authority over ten cities.'" 42 19:18 And the second came, saying, 'Master, your mina has earned five minas.'" 42 19:19 Likewise he said to him, 'You also be over five cities.'" 42 19:20 "Then another came, saying, 'Master, look, here is your mina, which I have kept put away in a handkerchief." 42 19:21 Because, I feared you, since you are a harsh man. You collect what you did not lay down, and reap what you did not sow.'" 42 19:22 And he said to him, 'Out of your own mouth I will judge you, you wicked servant. You knew that I was a harsh man, collecting what I did not lay down and reaping what I did not sow." 42 19:23 Why then did you not put my money in the bank, that at my coming I might have collected my own with interest?'" 42 19:24 "And he said to those who stood by, 'Take the mina from him, and give it to him who has ten minas.'" 42 19:25 (they said to him, 'Master, he has ten minas.')" 42 19:26 'Because, I say to you, that to everyone who has will be given; and from him who does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him." 42 19:27 But bring here those enemies of mine, who did not want me to reign over them, and slay them before me.'" 42 19:28 When He had said this, He went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem. 42 19:29 And it came to pass, when He drew near to Bethphage and Bethany, at the mountain called The Mount of Olives, that He sent two of His disciples, 42 19:30 saying, "Go into the village opposite you, in which as you enter you will find a colt tied, on which no one has ever sat. Loose it and bring it here." 42 19:31 And if anyone asks you, 'Why are you loosing it?' you shall say this to him, 'Because the Lord has need of it.'" 42 19:32 So those who were sent went their way and found it just as He had said to them. 42 19:33 And as they were loosing the colt, the owners of it said to them, "Why are you loosing the colt?" 42 19:34 So they said, "The Lord has need of him." 42 19:35 Then they brought him to Jesus. And they threw their clothes on the colt, and they set Jesus on him. 42 19:36 And as He went, they spread their clothes on the road. 42 19:37 Then, as He was drawing near, that is, already at the descent of the Mount of Olives, the entire multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works that they had seen, 42 19:38 saying: "'Blessed is the King who comes in the name of the LORD!' Peace in heaven and glory in the highest!" 42 19:39 And from the crowd some of the Pharisees said to Him, "Teacher, rebuke Your disciples." 42 19:40 But He replied and said to them, "I tell you that if these should keep silent, the stones would immediately shout out." 42 19:41 Now as He drew near, He saw the city and wept over it, 42 19:42 saying, "If you had known, even you, especially in this your day, the things that are for your peace! But now they are hidden from your eyes." 42 19:43 Because, the days will come upon you when your enemies will build an embankment around you, surround you and close you in on every side," 42 19:44 and level you, and your children within you, to the ground; and they will not leave in you one stone upon another, because you did not know the time of your visitation." 42 19:45 Then He went into the temple and began to drive out those who sold and those who bought in it, 42 19:46 saying to them, "It is written, 'My house is a house of prayer,' but you have made it a 'den of thieves.'" 42 19:47 And He was teaching daily in the temple. But the chief priests, the scribes, and the leaders of the people sought to destroy Him, 42 19:48 and were unable to do anything; because all the people were very attentive to hear Him. 42 20:1 Now it happened on one of those days, as He taught the people in the temple and preached the gospel, that the chief priests and the scribes, together with the elders, confronted Him 42 20:2 and spoke to Him, saying, "Tell us, by what authority are You doing these things? Or who is he who gave You this authority?" 42 20:3 But He answered and said to them, "I also will ask you one thing, then answer Me:" 42 20:4 The baptism of John, was it from heaven or from men?" 42 20:5 And they reasoned among themselves, saying, "If we say, 'From heaven,' He will say, 'Why then did you not believe him?' 42 20:6 But if we say, 'From men,' all the people will stone us, because they are persuaded that John was a prophet." 42 20:7 So they answered that they did not know where it was from. 42 20:8 And Jesus said to them, "Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things." 42 20:9 Then He began to tell the people this parable: "A certain man planted a vineyard, leased it to vinedressers, and went into a far country for a long time." 42 20:10 Now at harvest time he sent a servant to the vinedressers, that they might give him some of the fruit of the vineyard. But the vinedressers beat him and sent him away empty handed." 42 20:11 And again he sent another servant; and they beat him also, treated him shamefully, and sent him away empty handed." 42 20:12 And again he sent a third; and they wounded him also and cast him out." 42 20:13 "Then the owner of the vineyard said, 'What shall I do? I will send my beloved son. It may be they will respect him when they see him.'" 42 20:14 But when the vinedressers saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, 'This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.'" 42 20:15 So they cast him out of the vineyard and killed him. Therefore what shall the owner of the vineyard do to them?" 42 20:16 He will come and destroy those vinedressers and give the vineyard to others." And when they heard it they said, "God forbid!" 42 20:17 Then He looked at them and said, "What then is this that is written: 'The stone which the builders rejected has become the chief cornerstone'?" 42 20:18 Whoever falls on that stone will be broken; but on whomever it falls, it will grind him to powder." 42 20:19 And the chief priests and the scribes that very hour sought to lay hands on Him, but they feared the people, because they perceived He had spoken this parable against them. 42 20:20 So they watched Him, and sent out spies who pretended to be righteous men, that they might seize on His words, in order to deliver Him to the power and the authority of the governor. 42 20:21 Then they asked Him, saying, "Teacher, we know that You say and teach rightly, and You do not show any personal favoritism, but teach the way of God in truth: 42 20:22 Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar or not?" 42 20:23 But He perceived their craftiness, and said to them, "Why do you test Me? 42 20:24 Show Me a denarius. Whose image and inscription does it have?" They answered and said, "Caesar's." 42 20:25 And He said to them, "Render therefore to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's." 42 20:26 But they could not catch Him in His words in the presence of the people. And they marveled at His answer and kept silent. 42 20:27 Then some of the Sadducees, who deny that there is a resurrection, came to Him and asked Him, 42 20:28 saying: "Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if a man's brother dies, having a wife, and he dies without children, that his brother should take his wife and raise up offspring for his brother. 42 20:29 Then there were seven brothers. And the first took a wife, and died without children. 42 20:30 And the second took her as wife, and he died childless. 42 20:31 Then the third took her, and in like manner the seven also; and they left no children, and died. 42 20:32 Last of all the woman died also. 42 20:33 Therefore, in the resurrection, whose wife of them is she? Because all seven had her as wife." 42 20:34 And answering Jesus said to them, "The children of this age marry and are given in marriage." 42 20:35 But those who will be counted worthy to attain that age, and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry nor are given in marriage;" 42 20:36 nor can they die anymore, because, they are equal to the angels and are children of God, being children of the resurrection." 42 20:37 But even Moses revealed at the bush that the dead are raised, when he called the Lord 'the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.'" 42 20:38 Because, He is not the God of the dead but of the living, because all live to Him." 42 20:39 Then some of the scribes replied and said, "Teacher, You have spoken well." 42 20:40 But after that they dared not ask Him any more questions. 42 20:41 And He said to them, "How can they say that the Christ is David's Son?" 42 20:42 Now David himself said in the Book of Psalms: 'The LORD said to my Lord, "Sit at My right hand," 42 20:43 until I make Your enemies Your footstool." ' 42 20:44 Therefore David calls Him 'Lord'; how is He then his Son?" 42 20:45 Then, in the hearing of all the people, He said to His disciples, 42 20:46 "Beware of the scribes, who desire to go around in long robes, love greetings in the marketplaces, the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts," 42 20:47 who devour widows' houses, and for a show make long prayers. These will receive greater damnation." 42 21:1 And He looked up and saw the rich ones putting their gifts into the treasury, 42 21:2 and He also saw a certain poor widow putting two mites in there. 42 21:3 So He said, "Truly I say to you that this poor widow has put in more than they all have;" 42 21:4 because, all these out of their abundance have put in offerings for God, but she out of her poverty has put in all the livelihood that she had." 42 21:5 Then, as some spoke of the temple, how it was adorned with beautiful stones and donations, He said, 42 21:6 "As for these things which you see, the days will come in which not one stone will be left upon another that will not be thrown down." 42 21:7 So they asked Him, saying, "Teacher, but when shall these things be? And what sign shall there be when these things are about to take place?" 42 21:8 And He said: "Take heed that you be not be deceived. Because, many will come in My name, saying, 'I am Christ,' and, 'The time has drawn near.' Therefore do not go after them." 42 21:9 But when you hear of wars and commotions, do not be terrified; because, these things must happen first, but the end is not yet." 42 21:10 Then He said to them, "Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom." 42 21:11 And there will be large earthquakes in various places, and famines and pestilences; and there will be fearful sights and great signs from heaven." 42 21:12 But before all these things, they will lay their hands on you and persecute you, delivering you up to the synagogues and into prisons; being brought before kings and rulers for My name's sake." 42 21:13 But it will turn out for you as a testimony." 42 21:14 Therefore settle it in your hearts not to meditate beforehand on what you will answer;" 42 21:15 because, I will give you a mouth and wisdom which all your adversaries will not be able to contradict or resist." 42 21:16 But you will be betrayed also by parents and brethren, relatives and friends; and some of you they will cause to be put to death." 42 21:17 And you will be hated by all people for My name's sake." 42 21:18 But not a hair of your head will perish." 42 21:19 By your endurance you possess your souls." 42 21:20 "But when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then know that its desolation is near." 42 21:21 Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains, let those who are in the midst of it depart out, and let not those who are in the country enter into it." 42 21:22 Because these are the days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled." 42 21:23 But woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing babes in those days! Because there will be great distress in the land and wrath upon this people." 42 21:24 And they will fall by the edge of the sword, and be led away captive into all nations. And Jerusalem will be trampled by Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled." 42 21:25 "And there will be signs in the sun, in the moon, and in the stars; and on the earth distress of nations, with perplexity, the sea and the waves roaring;" 42 21:26 men's hearts failing them from fear and the expectation of those things which are coming on the earth, because the powers of heaven will be shaken." 42 21:27 And then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory." 42 21:28 Now when these things begin to happen, look up and lift up your heads, because your redemption draws near." 42 21:29 Then He spoke to them a parable: "Look at the fig tree, and all the trees." 42 21:30 When they are already budding, you see and know for yourselves that summer is now near." 42 21:31 So you also, when you see these things happening, know that the kingdom of God is near." 42 21:32 Truly, I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all things take place." 42 21:33 Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will not pass away." 42 21:34 "But take heed to yourselves, lest at any time your hearts be weighed down with over indulgence, drunkenness, and cares of this life, and so that Day come upon you unexpectedly." 42 21:35 Because, it will come as a snare on all those who dwell on the face of the entire earth." 42 21:36 Watch therefore, and pray always that you may be counted worthy to escape all these things that will happen, and to stand before the Son of Man." 42 21:37 And in the daytime He was teaching in the temple, but at night He went out and stayed on the mount that is called The Mount of Olives. 42 21:38 Then early in the morning all the people came to Him in the temple to hear Him. 42 22:1 Now the Feast of Unleavened Bread drew near, which is called The Passover. 42 22:2 And the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might kill Him, because they feared the people. 42 22:3 Then Satan entered into Judas, surnamed Iscariot, who was numbered among the twelve. 42 22:4 So he went his way, and communed with the chief priests and captains how he might betray Him to them. 42 22:5 And they were glad, and covenanted to give him money. 42 22:6 So he promised and sought opportunity to betray Him to them in the absence of the crowd. 42 22:7 Then came the Day of Unleavened Bread, when the Passover must be killed. 42 22:8 And He sent Peter and John, saying, "Go and prepare the Passover for us, that we may eat." 42 22:9 So they said to Him, "Where do You want us to prepare?" 42 22:10 And He said to them, "Behold, when you have entered into the city, a man will meet you carrying a pitcher of water; follow him into the house where he enters." 42 22:11 Then you will say to the master of the house, 'The Teacher says to you, "Where is the guest room where I may eat the Passover with My disciples?" ' 42 22:12 Then he will show you a large, furnished upper room; there make ready." 42 22:13 So they went and found it just as He had said to them, and they prepared the Passover. 42 22:14 When the hour had come, He sat down, and the twelve apostles with Him. 42 22:15 Then He said to them, "With fervent desire I have desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer;" 42 22:16 because, I say to you, I will no longer eat of it until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God." 42 22:17 Then He took the cup, and gave thanks, and said, "Take this and divide it among yourselves;" 42 22:18 because, I say to you, I will not drink of the fruit of the vine until the kingdom of God comes." 42 22:19 And He took bread, gave thanks and broke it, and gave it to them, saying, "This is My body which is given for you; do this in remembrance of Me." 42 22:20 Likewise also the cup after supper, saying, "This cup is the new testament in My blood, which is shed for you." 42 22:21 But behold, the hand of him who betrays Me is with Me on the table." 42 22:22 And truly the Son of Man goes as it has been determined, but woe to that man by whom He is betrayed!" 42 22:23 Then they began to question among themselves, which of them it was who would do this thing. 42 22:24 Now there was also a dispute among them, as to which of them should be considered the greatest. 42 22:25 And He said to them, "The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them, and those who exercise authority over them are called 'benefactors.'" 42 22:26 But you shall not be like this; but rather, he who is greatest among you, let him be as the younger, and he who rules as he who serves." 42 22:27 Because, who is greater, he who sits at the table, or he who serves? Is it not he who sits at the table? Yet I am among you as He who serves." 42 22:28 "You are those who have continued with Me in My trials." 42 22:29 And I appoint to you a kingdom, just as My Father has appointed to Me," 42 22:30 that you may eat and drink at My table in My kingdom, and sit upon thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel." 42 22:31 And the Lord said, "Simon, Simon! Indeed, Satan has desired to have you all, that he may sift you all like wheat." 42 22:32 But I have prayed for you, that your faith should not fail; and when you are converted, strengthen your brethren." 42 22:33 But he said to Him, "Lord, I am ready to go with You, both to prison and to death." 42 22:34 Then He said, "I tell you, Peter, the rooster will not crow this day before you will deny three times that you know Me." 42 22:35 And He said to them, "When I sent you without money bag, knapsack, and sandals, did you lack anything?" And they said, "Nothing." 42 22:36 Then He said to them, "But now, he who has a money bag, let him take it, and likewise his knapsack; and he who has no sword, let him sell his coat and buy one." 42 22:37 Because, I say to you that this which is written must still be accomplished in Me: 'And He was numbered with the transgressors.' Because the things concerning Me have an end." 42 22:38 So they said, "Lord, look, here are two swords." And He said to them, "It is enough." 42 22:39 And He came out, and went to the Mount of Olives, as He was accustomed, and His disciples also followed Him. 42 22:40 When He came to the place, He said to them, "Pray that you do not enter into temptation." 42 22:41 And He was withdrawn from them about a stone's throw, and He knelt down and prayed, 42 22:42 saying, "Father, if You are willing, take this cup away from Me; nevertheless not My will, but Yours, be done." 42 22:43 Then an angel appeared to Him from heaven, strengthening Him. 42 22:44 And being in agony, He prayed more earnestly. Then His sweat became like great drops of blood falling down to the ground. 42 22:45 When He rose up from prayer, and had come to His disciples, He found them sleeping from sorrow. 42 22:46 Then He said to them, "Why do you sleep? Rise and pray, lest you enter into temptation." 42 22:47 And while He was still speaking, behold, a crowd; and he who was called Judas, one of the twelve, went before them and drew near to Jesus to kiss Him. 42 22:48 But Jesus said to him, "Judas, are you betraying the Son of Man with a kiss?" 42 22:49 When those around Him saw what was going to happen, they said to Him, "Lord, shall we strike with the sword?" 42 22:50 And one of them struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his right ear. 42 22:51 But Jesus answered and said, "Proceed thus far, all of you." And He touched his ear and healed him. 42 22:52 Then Jesus said to the chief priests, captains of the temple, and the elders who had come to Him, "Have you come out, as against a robber, with swords and clubs?" 42 22:53 When I was with you daily in the temple, you did not stretch your hand out against Me. But this is your hour, and the power of darkness." 42 22:54 Then they took Him, they led Him and brought Him into the high priest's house. But Peter followed at a distance. 42 22:55 Now when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the courtyard and sat down together, Peter sat among them. 42 22:56 And a certain servant girl, seeing him as he sat by the fire, looked intently at him and said, "This man was also with Him." 42 22:57 But he denied Him, saying, "Woman, I do not know Him." 42 22:58 And after a little while another saw him and said, "You also are of them." But Peter said, "Man, I am not!" 42 22:59 Then after about an hour had passed, after another confidently affirmed, saying, "Surely this man was also with Him, because he is a Galilean." 42 22:60 Then Peter said, "Man, I do not know what you are saying!" And immediately, while he was still speaking, the rooster crowed. 42 22:61 And the Lord turned and looked at Peter. Then Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how He had said to him, "Before the rooster crows, you will deny Me three times." 42 22:62 So Peter went out and wept bitterly. 42 22:63 Now the men who held Jesus mocked Him and beat Him. 42 22:64 And having blindfolded Him, they struck Him on the face and asked Him, saying, "Prophesy! Who is it who struck You?" 42 22:65 And many other things they blasphemously spoke against Him. 42 22:66 As soon as it was day, the elders of the people, both chief priests and scribes, came together and led Him into their council, saying, 42 22:67 "Are You the Christ, tell us." But He said to them, "If I tell you, you will not believe. 42 22:68 And if I also ask you, you will not answer Me or let Me go." 42 22:69 After this the Son of Man will sit on the right hand of the power of God." 42 22:70 Then they all said, "Are You then the Son of God?" So He said to them, "You say that I am." 42 22:71 And they said, "What further witness do we need? Because we have heard it ourselves from His own mouth." 42 23:1 Then the entire multitude of them arose and led Him to Pilate. 42 23:2 And they began to accuse Him, saying, "We found this man perverting the nation, and forbidding to pay taxes to Caesar, saying that He Himself is Christ, a King." 42 23:3 Then Pilate asked Him, saying, "Are You the King of the Jews?" And He answered him and said, "You say it." 42 23:4 So Pilate said to the chief priests and to the people, "I find no fault in this Man." 42 23:5 But they were the more fierce, saying, "He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Jewry, beginning from Galilee to this place." 42 23:6 When Pilate heard of Galilee, he asked if the Man were a Galilean. 42 23:7 And as soon as he knew that He belonged to Herod's jurisdiction, he sent Him to Herod, who was himself also in Jerusalem at that time. 42 23:8 Now when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceedingly glad; because, he had desired for a long time to see Him, because he had heard many things about Him, and he had hoped to have seen some miracle done by Him. 42 23:9 Then he questioned Him with many words, but He answered him nothing. 42 23:10 And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused Him. 42 23:11 Then Herod, with his men of war, treated Him with contempt and mocked Him, arrayed Him in a gorgeous robe, and sent Him back to Pilate. 42 23:12 That very day Pilate and Herod became friends with each other, because previously they had been at enmity between themselves. 42 23:13 Then Pilate, when he had called together the chief priests, the rulers, and the people, 42 23:14 said to them, "You have brought this Man to me, as one who perverts the people. And indeed, having examined Him in your presence, I have found no fault in this Man concerning those things of which you accuse Him; 42 23:15 no, neither did Herod, because, I sent you to him; and indeed nothing deserving of death has been done to Him. 42 23:16 I will therefore chastise Him and release Him" 42 23:17 (because it was necessary for him to release one to them at the feast). 42 23:18 But they all shouted out at once, saying, "Away with this Man, and release to us Barabbas," 42 23:19 who had been thrown into prison for a certain rebellion made in the city, and for murder. 42 23:20 Pilate, therefore, willing to release Jesus, spoke to them again. 42 23:21 But they shouted, saying, "Crucify Him, crucify Him!" 42 23:22 Then he said to them the third time, "Why, what evil has He done? I have found no reason for death in Him. I will therefore chastise Him and let Him go." 42 23:23 But they insisted with loud voices demanding that He be crucified. And their voices and that of the chief priests prevailed. 42 23:24 So Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they demanded. 42 23:25 And he released to them the one they preferred, who for rebellion and murder had been thrown into prison; but he delivered Jesus to their will. 42 23:26 Now as they led Him away, they laid hold of a certain man, Simon a Cyrenian, who was coming from the country, and on him they laid the cross that he might carry it after Jesus. 42 23:27 And a large company of the people followed Him, and women who also mourned and lamented Him. 42 23:28 But Jesus, turning to them, said, "Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for Me, but weep for yourselves and for your children." 42 23:29 Because, indeed the days are coming in which they will say, 'Blessed are the barren, the wombs that never bore, and breasts which never nursed!'" 42 23:30 Then they will begin 'to say to the mountains, "Fall on us!" and to the hills, "Cover us!" ' 42 23:31 Because, if they do these things in the green wood, what will be done in the dry?" 42 23:32 There were also two others, criminals, led with Him to be put to death. 42 23:33 And when they had come to the place that is called Calvary, there they crucified Him, and the criminals, one on the right hand and the other on the left. 42 23:34 Then Jesus said, "Father, forgive them, because they do not know what they do." And they divided His clothes and cast lots. 42 23:35 And the people stood looking on. But the rulers, also with them, ridiculed Him, saying, "He saved others; let Him save Himself if He is the Christ, the chosen of God." 42 23:36 The soldiers also mocked Him, coming to Him and offering Him vinegar, 42 23:37 and saying, "If You are the King of the Jews, save Yourself." 42 23:38 And an inscription also was written over Him in letters of Greek, Latin, and Hebrew: THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS. 42 23:39 Then one of the criminals who were hanged blasphemed Him, saying, "If You are the Christ, save Yourself and us." 42 23:40 But the other, responding, rebuked him, saying, "Do you not reverence God, seeing you are under the same condemnation? 42 23:41 And we indeed justly, because we receive the due reward of our deeds; but this Man has done nothing wrong." 42 23:42 Then he said to Jesus, "Lord, remember me when You come into Your kingdom." 42 23:43 And Jesus said to him, "Truly, I say to you, today you will be with Me in Paradise." 42 23:44 Now it was about the sixth hour, and there was darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour. 42 23:45 Then the sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was torn in the middle. 42 23:46 And when Jesus had shouted with a loud voice, He said, "Father, 'into Your hands I commit My spirit.'" Having said this, He gave up the spirit. 42 23:47 So when the centurion saw what had happened, he glorified God, saying, "Certainly this was a righteous Man!" 42 23:48 And all the people who came together to that sight, seeing what had been done, beat their chests and returned. 42 23:49 But all His acquaintances, and the women who followed Him from Galilee, stood at a distance, watching these things. 42 23:50 Now behold, there was a man named Joseph, a council member, and he was a good and just man. 42 23:51 He had not consented to their decision and deed. He was from Arimathea, a city of the Jews, who himself was also waiting for the kingdom of God. 42 23:52 This man went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. 42 23:53 Then he took it down, wrapped it in linen, and laid it in a tomb that was hewn out of the rock, where no one had ever lain before. 42 23:54 That day was the Preparation, and the Sabbath drew near. 42 23:55 And the women also who had come with Him from Galilee followed after, and they observed the tomb and how His body was laid. 42 23:56 Then they returned and prepared spices and fragrant oils. And they rested on the Sabbath according to the commandment. 42 24:1 Now on the first day of the week, very early in the morning, they, and certain others with them, came to the tomb bringing the spices which they had prepared. 42 24:2 But they found the stone rolled away from the tomb. 42 24:3 Then they went in and did not find the body of the Lord Jesus. 42 24:4 And it happened, as they were greatly perplexed about this, that behold, two men stood by them in shining clothing. 42 24:5 Then, as they were afraid and bowed their faces to the earth, they said to them, "Why do you seek the living among the dead? 42 24:6 He is not here, but is risen! Remember how He spoke to you when He was still in Galilee, 42 24:7 saying, 'The Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.'" 42 24:8 And they remembered His words. 42 24:9 Then they returned from the tomb and told all these things to the eleven and to all the rest. 42 24:10 It was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the other women that were with them, who told these things to the apostles. 42 24:11 And their words seemed to them like idle tales, and they did not believe them. 42 24:12 But Peter arose and ran to the tomb; and stooping down, he saw the linen cloths lying by themselves; and departed, marveling to himself at what had happened. 42 24:13 Now behold, two of them were traveling that same day to a village called Emmaus, which was about sixty stadiums from Jerusalem. 42 24:14 And they talked together of all these things which had happened. 42 24:15 So it was, while they conversed and reasoned together, that Jesus Himself drew near and went with them. 42 24:16 But their eyes were restrained, so that they did not know Him. 42 24:17 And He said to them, "What kind of conversation is this that you have with one another as you walk and are sad?" 42 24:18 Then the one whose name was Cleopas answered and said to Him, "Are You only a stranger in Jerusalem, and have You not known the things that happened there in these days?" 42 24:19 And He said to them, "What things?" So they said to Him, "Concerning Jesus of Nazareth, who was a Prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people, 42 24:20 and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered Him to be condemned to death, and have crucified Him. 42 24:21 But we were hoping that it was He who was going to redeem Israel. And besides all this, today is the third day since these things were done. 42 24:22 Yes, and certain women also of our company, who arrived at the tomb early, astonished us. 42 24:23 And when they did not find His body, they came saying that they had also seen a vision of angels who said He was alive. 42 24:24 And certain of those who were with us went to the tomb and found it just as the women had said; but Him they did not see." 42 24:25 Then He said to them, "O foolish ones, and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken!" 42 24:26 Ought not Christ to have suffered these things and to enter into His glory?" 42 24:27 And beginning at Moses and all the Prophets, He expounded to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning Himself. 42 24:28 Then they drew near to the village where they were going, and He indicated that He would have gone farther. 42 24:29 But they constrained Him, saying, "Stay with us, because it is close to evening, and the day is far spent." And He went in to stay with them. 42 24:30 Now it came to pass, as He sat at the table with them, that He took bread, blessed and broke it, and gave it to them. 42 24:31 Then their eyes were opened and they knew Him; and He vanished from their sight. 42 24:32 And they said to one another, "Did not our heart burn within us while He talked with us on the road, and while He opened the Scriptures to us?" 42 24:33 So they rose up that very hour and returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven and those who were with them gathered together, 42 24:34 saying, "The Lord is risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!" 42 24:35 And they told about the things that had happened on the road, and how He was known to them in the breaking of bread. 42 24:36 Now as they said these things, Jesus Himself stood in the midst of them, and said to them, "Peace to you." 42 24:37 But they were terrified and frightened, and supposed they had seen a spirit. 42 24:38 And He said to them, "Why are you troubled? And why do doubts arise in your hearts?" 42 24:39 Behold My hands and My feet, that it is I Myself. Handle Me and see, because a spirit does not have flesh and bones as you see I have." 42 24:40 When He had said this, He showed them His hands and His feet. 42 24:41 But while they still did not believe for joy, and marveled, He said to them, "Have you any food here?" 42 24:42 So they gave Him a piece of a broiled fish and some honeycomb. 42 24:43 And He took it and ate in their presence. 42 24:44 Then He said to them, "These are the words which I spoke to you while I was still with you, that all things must be fulfilled which were written in the Law of Moses and in the Prophets and in the Psalms concerning Me." 42 24:45 And He opened their understanding, that they might understand the Scriptures. 42 24:46 Then He said to them, "Thus it is written, and thus it was necessary for Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead the third day," 42 24:47 and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in His name to all nations, beginning at Jerusalem." 42 24:48 And you are witnesses of these things." 42 24:49 And behold, I send the Promise of My Father upon you; but wait in the city of Jerusalem until you are endued with power from on high." 42 24:50 And He led them out as far as Bethany, and He lifted up His hands and blessed them. 42 24:51 Now it came to pass, while He blessed them, that He was parted from them and carried up into heaven. 42 24:52 And they worshiped Him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy, 42 24:53 and were continually in the temple praising and blessing God. Amen. 43 1:1 In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. 43 1:2 He was in the beginning with God. 43 1:3 All things were made by Him, and without Him nothing was made that was made. 43 1:4 In Him was life, and the life was the light of men. 43 1:5 And the light shines in darkness, and the darkness did not comprehend it. 43 1:6 There was a man sent from God, whose name was John. 43 1:7 This man came for a witness, to bear witness of the Light, that all men through him might believe. 43 1:8 He was not that Light, butwas sentto bear witness of that Light. 43 1:9 That was the true Light which gives light to every man who comes into the world. 43 1:10 He was in the world, and the world was made by Him, yet the world did not know Him. 43 1:11 He came to His own, and His own did not receive Him. 43 1:12 But as many as received Him, to them He gave authority to become the sons of God, even to those who believe on His name: 43 1:13 who were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God. 43 1:14 And the Word was made flesh and dwelt among us, and we beheld His glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father, full of grace and truth. 43 1:15 John bore witness of Him and shouted, saying, "This was He of whom I said, 'He who comes after me is preferred before me, because He was before me.'" 43 1:16 And of His fullness we all have received, and grace for grace. 43 1:17 Because, the law was given through Moses, but grace and truth came by Jesus Christ. 43 1:18 No one has seen God at any time. The only begotten Son, who is in the bosom of the Father, He has declared Him. 43 1:19 Now this is the record of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, "Who are you?" 43 1:20 And he confessed, and did not deny, but confessed, "I am not the Christ." 43 1:21 And they asked him, "What then? Are you Elijah?" And he said, "I am not." "Are you the Prophet?" And he answered, "No." 43 1:22 Then they said to him, "Who are you, that we may give an answer to those who sent us? What do you say about yourself?" 43 1:23 He said: "I am'the voice of one shouting in the wilderness: "Make straight the way of the LORD,"' as the prophet Isaiah said. 43 1:24 Now those who were sent were of the Pharisees. 43 1:25 And they asked him, and said to him, "Why then do you baptize if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?" 43 1:26 John answered them, saying, "I baptize with water, but there stands One among you whom you do not know. 43 1:27 It is He who, coming after me, is preferred before me, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to unloose." 43 1:28 These things were done in Bethabara beyond Jordan, where John was baptizing. 43 1:29 The next day John saw Jesus coming to him, and said, "Behold the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world! 43 1:30 This is He of whom I said, 'After me comes a Man who is preferred before me, because He was before me.' 43 1:31 And I did not know Him; but that He should be revealed to Israel, therefore I came baptizing with water." 43 1:32 And John bore record, saying, "I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and it remained upon Him. 43 1:33 And I did not know Him, but He who sent me to baptize with water, the same said to me, 'Upon whom you will see the Spirit descending, and remaining on Him, this is He who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.' 43 1:34 And I have seen and bare record that this is the Son of God." 43 1:35 Again, the next day, after John stood with two of his disciples, 43 1:36 looking upon Jesus as He walked, he said, "Behold the Lamb of God!" 43 1:37 And the two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus. 43 1:38 Then Jesus turned, and seeing them following, said to them, "What do you seek?" They said to Him, "Rabbi," (which is to say, when translated, Teacher), "where are You staying?" 43 1:39 He said to them, "Come and see." They came and saw where He was staying, and remained with Him that day (because it was about the tenth hour). 43 1:40 One of the two who heard John speak, and followed Him, was Andrew, Simon Peter's brother. 43 1:41 He first found his own brother Simon, and said to him, "We have found the Messiah" (which is translated, the Christ). 43 1:42 And he brought him to Jesus. And when Jesus looked at him, He said, "You are Simon the son of Jonah. You will be called Cephas," (which is translated, A Stone). 43 1:43 The following day Jesus wanted to go to Galilee, and He found Philip, and said to him, "Follow Me." 43 1:44 Now Philip was of Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter. 43 1:45 Philip found Nathanael and said to him, "We have found Him, of whom Moses in the law, and the prophets, wrote, Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph." 43 1:46 And Nathanael said to him, "Can anything good come out of Nazareth?" Philip said to him, "Come and see." 43 1:47 Jesus saw Nathanael coming to Him, and said of him, "Behold an Israelite indeed, in whom is no deceit!" 43 1:48 Nathanael said to Him, "How do You know me?" Jesus answered and said to him, "Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you." 43 1:49 Nathanael replied and said to Him, "Rabbi, You are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!" 43 1:50 Jesus replied and said to him, "Because I said to you, 'I saw you under the fig tree,' do you believe? You will see greater things than these." 43 1:51 And He said to him, "Truly, truly, I say to you, after this you all will see heaven open, and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of Man." 43 2:1 On the third day there was a wedding in Cana of Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there. 43 2:2 Now both Jesus and His disciples were invited to the wedding. 43 2:3 And when they ran out of grape juice, the mother of Jesus said to Him, "They have no grape juice." 43 2:4 Jesus said to her, "Woman, what does your concern have to do with Me? My hour has not yet come." 43 2:5 His mother said to the servants, "Whatever He says to you, do it." 43 2:6 Now there were set there six waterpots of stone, according to the manner of purification of the Jews, containing two or three measures each. 43 2:7 Jesus said to them, "Fill the waterpots with water." And they filled them up to the brim. 43 2:8 And He said to them, "Draw some out now, and take it to the master of the feast." And they took it. 43 2:9 When the master of the feast had tasted the water that was made grape juice, and did not know where it came from (but the servants who had drawn the water knew), the master of the feast called the bridegroom. 43 2:10 And said to him, "Every man at the beginning sets out the good grape juice, and when the guests fully drink that, then the inferior. But you have kept the good grape juice until now!" 43 2:11 This beginning of miracles Jesus did in Cana of Galilee, and manifested His glory; and His disciples believed on Him. 43 2:12 After this He went down to Capernaum, He, His mother, His brethren, and His disciples; and they did not stay there many days. 43 2:13 Now the Passover of the Jews was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem, 43 2:14 and found in the temple those who sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the money changers sitting. 43 2:15 And when He had made a whip of small cords, He drove them all out of the temple, with the sheep and the oxen, and poured out the changers' money and overturned the tables. 43 2:16 And He said to those who sold doves, "Take these things away! Do not make My Father's house a house of merchandise!" 43 2:17 Then His disciples remembered that it was written, "The zeal for Your house has eaten Me up." 43 2:18 So the Jews responded and said to Him, "What sign do You show to us, since You do these things?" 43 2:19 Jesus answered and said to them, "Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up." 43 2:20 Then the Jews said, "It has taken forty six years to build this temple, and will You raise it up in three days?" 43 2:21 But He was speaking of the temple of His body. 43 2:22 Therefore, when He had risen from the dead, His disciples remembered that He had said this to them; and they believed the Scripture and the word which Jesus had said. 43 2:23 Now when He was in Jerusalem at the Passover, during the feast day, many believed in His name when they saw the miracles which He did. 43 2:24 But Jesus did not commit Himself to them, because He knew all men, 43 2:25 and had no need that anyone should testify of man, because He knew what was in man. 43 3:1 There was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews. 43 3:2 This man came to Jesus by night and said to Him, "Rabbi, we know that You are a teacher come from God; because, no one can do these miracles that You do unless God is with him." 43 3:3 Jesus replied and said to him, "Truly, truly, I say to you, unless a man is born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God." 43 3:4 Nicodemus said to Him, "How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother's womb and be born?" 43 3:5 Jesus answered, "Truly, truly, I say to you, unless a man is born of water and of the Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God." 43 3:6 That which is born of the flesh is flesh, and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit." 43 3:7 Do not marvel that I said to you, 'You all must be born again.'" 43 3:8 The wind blows where it wishes, and you hear the sound of it, but cannot tell where it comes from and where it goes. So is everyone who is born of the Spirit." 43 3:9 Nicodemus replied and said to Him, "How can these things be?" 43 3:10 Jesus answered and said to him, "Are you the teacher of Israel, and do not know these things?" 43 3:11 Truly, truly, I say to you, We speak what We know and testify what We have seen, and you all do not receive Our witness." 43 3:12 If I have told you earthly things and you do not believe, how will you believe if I tell you of heavenly things?" 43 3:13 And no man has ascended up to heaven but He who came down from heaven,that is, the Son of Man who is in heaven." 43 3:14 And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of Man be lifted up," 43 3:15 that whoever believes in Him would not perish but have eternal life." 43 3:16 Because God loved the world so much He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him would not perish but have everlasting life." 43 3:17 Because, God did not send His Son into the world to condemn the world, but that the world through Him might be saved." 43 3:18 "He who believes on Him is not condemned; but he who does not believe is condemned already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God." 43 3:19 And this is the condemnation, that the light came into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil." 43 3:20 Because, everyone who does evil hates the light and does not come to the light, lest his deeds should be exposed." 43 3:21 But he who does the truth comes to the light, that his deeds may be clearly seen, that they have been done in God." 43 3:22 After these things Jesus and His disciples came into the land of Judea, and there He remained with them and baptized. 43 3:23 Now John also was baptizing in Aenon near Salim, because there was a lot of water there. And they came and were baptized. 43 3:24 Because John had not yet been thrown into prison. 43 3:25 Then there arose a dispute between some of John's disciples and the Jews about purification. 43 3:26 And they came to John and said to him, "Rabbi, He who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you have witnessed of, look, He is baptizing, and everyone is coming to Him!" 43 3:27 John answered and said, "A man can receive nothing unless it has been given to him from heaven. 43 3:28 You yourselves bear me witness, that I said, 'I am not the Christ,' but that, 'I have been sent before Him.' 43 3:29 He who has the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom's voice. Therefore this joy of mine is fulfilled. 43 3:30 He must increase, but I must decrease. 43 3:31 He who comes from above is above all; he who is of the earth is earthly and speaks of the earth. He who comes from heaven is above all. 43 3:32 And what He has seen and heard, that He testifies; and no one receives His testimony. 43 3:33 He who has received His testimony has certified that God is true. 43 3:34 Because, He whom God has sent speaks the words of God, because God does not give the Spirit by measureto Him. 43 3:35 The Father loves the Son, and has given all things into His hand. 43 3:36 He who believes on the Son has everlasting life; and he who does not believe the Son will not see life, but the wrath of God abides on him." 43 4:1 Therefore, when the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John 43 4:2 (though Jesus Himself did not baptize, but His disciples), 43 4:3 He left Judea and departed again to Galilee. 43 4:4 But He needed to go through Samaria. 43 4:5 So He came to a city of Samaria which is called Sychar, near the plot of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph. 43 4:6 Now Jacob's well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied from His journey, sat thus on the well. Now it was about the sixth hour. 43 4:7 A woman of Samaria came there to draw water. Jesus said to her, "Give Me a drink." 43 4:8 Because His disciples had gone away into the city to buy food. 43 4:9 Then the woman of Samaria said to Him, "How is it that You, being a Jew, ask a drink from me, that is a Samaritan woman?" Because Jews have no dealings with Samaritans. 43 4:10 Jesus answered and said to her, "If you knew the gift of God, and who it is who says to you, 'Give Me a drink,' you would have asked Him, and He would have given you living water." 43 4:11 The woman said to Him, "Sir, You have nothing to draw with, and the well is deep. Where then do You get that living water? 43 4:12 Are You greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well, and drank from it himself, as well as his children and his livestock?" 43 4:13 Jesus answered and said to her, "Whoever drinks of this water will thirst again," 43 4:14 but whoever drinks of the water that I will give him will never thirst. But the water that I will give him will be in him a fountain of water springing up into everlasting life." 43 4:15 The woman said to Him, "Sir, give me this water, that I may not thirst, nor come here to draw." 43 4:16 Jesus said to her, "Go, call your husband, and come here." 43 4:17 The woman replied and said, "I have no husband." Jesus said to her, "You have said rightly, 'I have no husband,' 43 4:18 Because, you have had five husbands, and the one whom you now have is not your husband; in that you spoke truly." 43 4:19 The woman said to Him, "Sir, I perceive that You are a prophet. 43 4:20 Our fathers worshiped on this mountain, and you all say that in Jerusalem is the place where one ought to worship." 43 4:21 Jesus said to her, "Woman, believe Me, the hour is coming when you will neither on this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, worship the Father." 43 4:22 You worship what you do not know; we know what we worship, because salvation is of the Jews." 43 4:23 But the hour is coming, and now is, when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth; because the Father is seeking such to worship Him." 43 4:24 God is a Spirit, and those who worship Him must worship Him in spirit and in truth." 43 4:25 The woman said to Him, "I know that Messiah is coming, who is called Christ. When He comes, He will tell us all things." 43 4:26 Jesus said to her, "I who speak to you am He." 43 4:27 And at this point His disciples came, and they marveled that He talked with the woman; yet no one said, "What do You seek?" or, "Why are You talking with her?" 43 4:28 The woman then left her waterpot, went her way into the city, and said to the men, 43 4:29 "Come, see a Man who told me everything that I ever did. Is this not the Christ?" 43 4:30 Then they went out of the city and came to Him. 43 4:31 In the meantime His disciples urged Him, saying, "Teacher, eat." 43 4:32 But He said to them, "I have food to eat of which you do not know about." 43 4:33 Therefore the disciples said to one another, "Has anyone brought Him anything to eat?" 43 4:34 Jesus said to them, "My food is to do the will of Him who sent Me, and to finish His work." 43 4:35 Do you not say, 'There are still four months and then comes the harvest'? Behold, I say to you, lift up your eyes and look at the fields, because they are already white for harvest!" 43 4:36 And he who reaps receives wages, and gathers fruit for eternal life, that both he who sows and he who reaps may rejoice together." 43 4:37 Because in this the saying is true: 'One sows and another reaps.'" 43 4:38 I sent you to reap that for which you have not labored; others have labored, and you have entered into their labors." 43 4:39 And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on Him because of the word of the woman who testified, "He told me everything that I ever did." 43 4:40 So when the Samaritans had come to Him, they urged Him to stay with them; and He stayed there two days. 43 4:41 And many more believed because of His own word. 43 4:42 Then they said to the woman, "Now we believe, not because of what you said, butbecause we have heard Him ourselves and we know that this is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world." 43 4:43 Now after the two days He departed from there and went to Galilee. 43 4:44 Because, Jesus Himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country. 43 4:45 Then when He came to Galilee, the Galileans received Him, having seen all the things He did in Jerusalem at the feast; because they also had gone to the feast. 43 4:46 So Jesus came again to Cana of Galilee where He had made the water grape juice. And there was a certain nobleman whose son was sick at Capernaum. 43 4:47 When he heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went to Him and implored Him to come down and heal his son, because he was at the point of death. 43 4:48 Then Jesus said to him, "Unless you see signs and wonders, you all will not believe." 43 4:49 The nobleman said to Him, "Sir, come down before my child dies!" 43 4:50 Jesus said to him, "Go your way; your son lives." So the man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him, and he went his way. 43 4:51 And as he was now going down, his servants met him and told him, saying, "Your son lives!" 43 4:52 Then he inquired of them the hour when he began to get better. And they said to him, "Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him." 43 4:53 So the father knew that it was at the same hour in which Jesus said to him, "Your son lives." And he himself believed, and his entire household. 43 4:54 This again is the second miracle that Jesus did when He had come out of Judea into Galilee. 43 5:1 After this there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem. 43 5:2 Now there is in Jerusalem by the SheepGatea pool, which is called in the Hebrew language,Bethesda, having five porches. 43 5:3 In these lay a large crowd of sick people, blind, lame, paralyzed, waiting for the moving of the water. 43 5:4 Because, an angel went down at a certain time into the pool and stirred up the water; then whoever stepped in first, after the stirring of the water, was made well of whatever disease he had. 43 5:5 Now a certain man was there who had an infirmity thirty eight years. 43 5:6 When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he already had been in that condition a long time, He said to him, "Do you want to be made well?" 43 5:7 The sick man answered Him, "Sir, I have no man to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up; but while I am coming, another steps down before me." 43 5:8 Jesus said to him, "Rise, take up your bed and walk." 43 5:9 And immediately the man was made well, took up his bed, and walked. And on the same day was the Sabbath. 43 5:10 The Jews therefore said to him who was cured, "It is the Sabbath day; it is not lawful for you to carry your bed." 43 5:11 He replied to them, "He who made me well, He said to me, 'Take up your bed and walk.'" 43 5:12 Then they asked him, "Who is the Man who said to you, 'Take up your bed and walk'?" 43 5:13 But the one who was healed did not know who it was, because Jesus had withdrawn, a crowd being in that place. 43 5:14 Afterward Jesus found him in the temple, and said to him, "See, you have been made well. Sin no more, lest a worse thing come upon you." 43 5:15 The man departed and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well. 43 5:16 So therefore the Jews persecuted Jesus, and sought to kill Him, because He had done these things on the Sabbath day. 43 5:17 But Jesus responded to them, "My Father has been working until now, and I work." 43 5:18 Therefore the Jews sought all the more to kill Him, because He not only broke the Sabbath, but also said that God was His Father, making Himself equal with God. 43 5:19 Then Jesus responded and said to them, "Truly, truly, I say to you, the Son can do nothing of Himself, but what He sees the Father do; because whatever He does, the Son also does in like manner." 43 5:20 Because, the Father loves the Son, and shows Him all things that He Himself does; and He will show Him greater works than these, that you may marvel." 43 5:21 Because, as the Father raises the dead and gives life to them, even so the Son gives life to whom He will." 43 5:22 Because, the Father judges no one, but has committed all judgment to the Son," 43 5:23 that everyone should honor the Son just as they honor the Father. He who does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent Him." 43 5:24 "Truly, truly, I say to you, he who hears My word and believes on Him who sent Me has everlasting life, and will not come into condemnation, but has passed from death into life." 43 5:25 Truly, truly, I say to you, the hour is coming, and now is, when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God; and those who hear will live." 43 5:26 Because, as the Father has life in Himself, so He has granted the Son to have life in Himself," 43 5:27 and has given Him authority to execute judgment also, because He is the Son of Man." 43 5:28 Do not marvel at this; because, the hour is coming in which all who are in the graves will hear His voice" 43 5:29 and will come forth; those who have done good, to the resurrection of life, and those who have done evil, to the resurrection of damnation." 43 5:30 I can of Myself do nothing. As I hear, I judge; and My judgment is righteous, because I do not seek My own will but the will of the Father who has sent Me." 43 5:31 "If I bear witness of Myself, My witness is not true." 43 5:32 There is another who bears witness of Me, and I know that the witness which He witnesses of Me is true." 43 5:33 You sent to John, and he has borne witness to the truth." 43 5:34 Yet I do not receive testimony from man, but I say these things that you may be saved." 43 5:35 He was the burning and shining lamp, and you were willing for a time to rejoice in his light." 43 5:36 But I have a greater witness than John's; because, the works which the Father has given Me to finish, the same works that I do, bear witness of Me, that the Father has sent Me." 43 5:37 And the Father Himself, who has sent Me, has testified of Me. You have neither heard His voice at any time, nor seen His form." 43 5:38 And you do not have His word abiding in you, because whom He sent, Him you do not believe." 43 5:39 Search the Scriptures, because in them you think you have eternal life; and these are they which testify of Me." 43 5:40 But you are not willing to come to Me that you may have life." 43 5:41 "I do not receive honor from men." 43 5:42 But I know you, that you do not have the love of God in you." 43 5:43 I have come in My Father's name, and you do not receive Me; if another comes in his own name, him you will receive." 43 5:44 How can you believe, who receive honor from one another, and do not seek the honor that comes from the God alone?" 43 5:45 Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father; there is one who accuses you, that is Moses, in whom you trust." 43 5:46 Because, if you believed Moses, you would believe Me; because he wrote about Me." 43 5:47 But if you do not believe his writings, how shall you believe My words?" 43 6:1 After these things Jesus went over the Sea of Galilee, which is the Sea of Tiberias. 43 6:2 Then a large crowd followed Him, because they saw His miracles which He performed on those who were diseased. 43 6:3 And Jesus went up on the mountain, and there He sat with His disciples. 43 6:4 Now the Passover, a feast of the Jews, was near. 43 6:5 Then Jesus lifted up His eyes, and seeing a large crowd coming toward Him, He said to Philip, "Where shall we buy bread, that these may eat?" 43 6:6 But this He said to test him, because He Himself knew what He would do. 43 6:7 Philip answered Him, "Two hundred denarii worth of bread is not sufficient for them, that every one of them may have a little." 43 6:8 One of His disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, said to Him, 43 6:9 "There is a boy here who has five barley loaves and two small fish, but what are they among so many?" 43 6:10 Then Jesus said, "Make the men sit down." Now there was a lot of grass in the place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand. 43 6:11 And Jesus took the loaves, and when He had given thanks He distributed them to the disciples, and the disciples to those who were sitting down; and likewise of the fish, as much as they wanted. 43 6:12 So when they were filled, He said to His disciples, "Gather up the fragments that remain, so that nothing is lost." 43 6:13 Therefore they gathered them up, and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves which were left over by those who had eaten. 43 6:14 Then those men, when they had seen the miracle that Jesus did, said, "This is truly that Prophet who is to come into the world." 43 6:15 Therefore when Jesus perceived that they were about to come and take Him by force to make Him king, He departed again to the mountain by Himself alone. 43 6:16 Now when evening came, His disciples went down to the sea, 43 6:17 got into a boat, and went over the sea toward Capernaum. And it was already dark, and Jesus had not come to them. 43 6:18 Then the sea arose because a great wind was blowing. 43 6:19 So when they had rowed about twenty or thirty stadiums they saw Jesus walking on the sea and drawing near the boat; and they were afraid. 43 6:20 But He said to them, "It is I; do not be afraid." 43 6:21 Then they willingly received Him into the boat, and immediately the boat was at the land where they were going. 43 6:22 On the following day, when the people who were standing on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other boat there, except that one which His disciples had entered, and that Jesus had not entered the boat with His disciples, but that His disciples had gone away alone; 43 6:23 (however, other boats came from Tiberias, near the place where they ate bread after the Lord had given thanks) 43 6:24 therefore when the people saw that Jesus was not there, nor His disciples, they also got into boats and came to Capernaum, seeking Jesus. 43 6:25 And when they found Him on the other side of the sea, they said to Him, "Rabbi, when did You come here?" 43 6:26 Jesus answered them and said, "Truly, truly, I say to you, you seek Me, not because you saw the miracles, but because you ate of the loaves and were filled." 43 6:27 Do not labor for the food which perishes, but for the food which endures to everlasting life, which the Son of Man will give you, because God the Father has set His seal on Him." 43 6:28 Then they said to Him, "What shall we do, that we may work the works of God?" 43 6:29 Jesus answered and said to them, "This is the work of God, that you believe on Him whom He has sent." 43 6:30 Therefore they said to Him, "What sign shall You perform then, that we may see it and believe You? What work shall You do? 43 6:31 Our fathers ate the manna in the desert; as it is written, 'He gave them bread from heaven to eat.'" 43 6:32 Then Jesus said to them, "Truly, truly, I say to you, Moses did not give you the bread from heaven, but My Father gives you the true bread from heaven." 43 6:33 Because, the bread of God is He who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world." 43 6:34 Then they said to Him, "Lord, give us this bread always." 43 6:35 And Jesus said to them, "I am the bread of life. He who comes to Me will never hunger, and he who believes on Me will never thirst." 43 6:36 But I said to you that you have seen Me and yet do not believe." 43 6:37 All that the Father gives Me will come to Me, and the one who comes to Me I will by no means cast out." 43 6:38 Because, I came down from heaven, not to do My own will, but the will of Him who sent Me." 43 6:39 And this is the will of the Father who sent Me, that of all He has given Me I should lose nothing, but should raise it up again at the last day." 43 6:40 And this is the will of Him who sent Me, that everyone who sees the Son and believes on Him may have everlasting life; and I will raise him up at the last day." 43 6:41 The Jews then complained about Him, because He said, "I am the bread which came down from heaven." 43 6:42 And they said, "Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How is it then that He says, 'I came down from heaven'?" 43 6:43 Jesus therefore responded and said to them, "Do not murmur among yourselves." 43 6:44 No one can come to Me unless the Father who sent Me draws him; and I will raise him up at the last day." 43 6:45 It is written in the prophets, 'And they will all be taught by God.' Therefore everyone who has heard and learned from the Father comes to Me." 43 6:46 Not that anyone has seen the Father, except He who is from God; He has seen the Father." 43 6:47 Truly, truly, I say to you, he who believes on Me has everlasting life." 43 6:48 I am the bread of life." 43 6:49 Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, and are dead." 43 6:50 This is the bread which comes down from heaven, that one may eat of it and not die." 43 6:51 I am the living bread which came down from heaven. If anyone eats of this bread, he will live forever; and the bread that I will give is My flesh, which I will give for the life of the world." 43 6:52 The Jews therefore quarreled among themselves, saying, "How can this Man give us His flesh to eat?" 43 6:53 Then Jesus said to them, "Truly, truly, I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink His blood, you have no life in you." 43 6:54 Whoever eats My flesh and drinks My blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day." 43 6:55 Because My flesh is food indeed, and My blood is drink indeed." 43 6:56 He who eats My flesh and drinks My blood abides in Me, and I in him." 43 6:57 As the living Father has sent Me, and I live because of the Father, so he who eats Me will live because of Me." 43 6:58 This is the bread which came down from heaven; not as your fathers ate the manna, and are dead. He who eats this bread will live forever." 43 6:59 These things He said in the synagogue as He taught in Capernaum. 43 6:60 Therefore many of His disciples, when they heardthis, said, "This is a hard saying; who can understand it?" 43 6:61 When Jesus knew in Himself that His disciples complained about this, He said to them, "Does this offend you?" 43 6:62 Whatthen if you should see the Son of Man ascend up where He was before?" 43 6:63 It is the Spirit who gives life; the flesh profits nothing. The words that I speak to you, they are spirit, and they are life." 43 6:64 But there are some of you who do not believe." Because, Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who did not believe, and who would betray Him. 43 6:65 And He said, "Therefore I have said to you that no one can come to Me unless it has been granted to him by My Father." 43 6:66 From that time many of His disciples went back and walked with Him no longer. 43 6:67 Then Jesus said to the twelve, "Do you also want to go away?" 43 6:68 But Simon Peter answered Him, "Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life. 43 6:69 Also we believe and are convinced that You are the Christ, the Son of the living God." 43 6:70 Jesus replied to them, "Did I not choose you twelve, and one of you is a devil?" 43 6:71 He spoke of Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon, because it was he who would betray Him, being one of the twelve. 43 7:1 After these things Jesus walked in Galilee; because, He did not want to walk in Judea, because the Jews sought to kill Him. 43 7:2 Now the Jews' Feast of Tabernacles was at hand. 43 7:3 His brethren therefore said to Him, "Depart from here and go into Judea, that Your disciples also may see the works that You are doing. 43 7:4 Because, no one does anything in secret while he himself seeks to be known openly. If You do these things, show Yourself to the world." 43 7:5 Because even His brethren did not believe in Him. 43 7:6 Then Jesus said to them, "My time has not yet come, but your time is always ready." 43 7:7 The world cannot hate you, but it hates Me because I testify of it that its works are evil." 43 7:8 You go up to this feast. I am not going up to this feast yet, because My time has not yet fully come." 43 7:9 When He had said these words to them, He remained in Galilee. 43 7:10 But when His brethren had gone up, then He also went up to the feast, not openly, but as it were in secret. 43 7:11 Then the Jews sought Him at the feast, and said, "Where is He?" 43 7:12 And there was much murmuring among the people concerning Him. Because, some said, "He is a good Man"; others said, "No, but He deceives the people." 43 7:13 However, no one spoke openly of Him for fear of the Jews. 43 7:14 Now about the middle of the feast Jesus went up into the temple and taught. 43 7:15 And the Jews marveled, saying, "How does this Man know letters, having never studied?" 43 7:16 Jesus answered them and said, "My doctrine is not Mine, but His who sent Me." 43 7:17 If anyone will do His will, he will know concerning the doctrine, whether it is from God or whether I speak from Myself." 43 7:18 He who speaks from himself seeks his own glory; but He who seeks the glory of the One who sent Him is true, and no unrighteousness is in Him." 43 7:19 Did not Moses give you the law, and yet none of you keeps the law? Why do you seek to kill Me?" 43 7:20 The people answered and said, "You have a demon. Who is seeking to kill You?" 43 7:21 Jesus answered and said to them, "I did one work, and you all marvel." 43 7:22 Moses therefore gave you circumcision (not that it is from Moses, but from the fathers), and you circumcise a man on the Sabbath day." 43 7:23 If a man receives circumcision on the Sabbath day, so that the law of Moses should not be broken, are you angry with Me because I made a man completely well on the Sabbath day?" 43 7:24 Do not judge according to appearance, but judge with righteous judgment." 43 7:25 Now some of them from Jerusalem said, "Is this not He whom they seek to kill? 43 7:26 But look! He speaks boldly, and they say nothing to Him.
