Do the rulers actually know that this is truly the Christ? 43 7:27 However, we know where this Man is from; but when the Christ comes, no one knows where He is from." 43 7:28 Then Jesus shouted, as He taught in the temple, saying, "You both know Me, and you know where I am from; and I have not come of Myself, but He who sent Me is true, whom you do not know." 43 7:29 But I know Him, because I am from Him, and He sent Me." 43 7:30 Therefore they sought to take Him; but no one laid hands on Him, because His hour had not yet come. 43 7:31 And many of the people believed on Him, and said, "When the Christ comes, will He do more miracles than these which this Man has done?" 43 7:32 The Pharisees heard the people murmuring these things concerning Him, and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take Him. 43 7:33 Then Jesus said to them, "I will be with you a little while longer, and then I go to Him who sent Me." 43 7:34 You will seek Me and not find Me, and where I am, there you cannot come." 43 7:35 Then the Jews said among themselves, "Where does He intend to go that we will not find Him? Does He intend to go to the Dispersion among the Gentiles and teach the Gentiles? 43 7:36 What is this thing that He said, 'You shall seek Me and not find Me, and where I am, there you cannot come'?" 43 7:37 During the last day, that great day of the feast, Jesus stood and shouted saying, "If anyone thirsts, let him come to Me and drink." 43 7:38 He who believes on Me, as the Scripture has said, out of his belly will flow rivers of living water." 43 7:39 But this He spoke concerning the Spirit, whom those believing on Him would receive; because, the Holy Spirit was not yetgiven, because Jesus was not yet glorified. 43 7:40 Therefore many from the people, when they heard this saying, said, "Truly this is the Prophet." 43 7:41 Others said, "This is the Christ." But some said, "Shall the Christ come out of Galilee? 43 7:42 Has not the Scripture said that the Christ comes from the seed of David and from the town of Bethlehem, where David was?" 43 7:43 So there was a division among the people because of Him. 43 7:44 Now some of them wanted to take Him, but no one laid hands on Him. 43 7:45 Then the officers came to the chief priests and Pharisees, and they said to them, "Why have you not brought Him?" 43 7:46 The officers answered, "No man ever spoke like this Man!" 43 7:47 Then the Pharisees replied to them, "Are you also deceived? 43 7:48 Have any of the rulers or the Pharisees believed on Him? 43 7:49 But these people that do not know the law are accursed." 43 7:50 Nicodemus (he who came to Jesus by night, being one of them) said to them, 43 7:51 "Does our law judge a man before it hears him and knows what he is doing?" 43 7:52 They answered and said to him, "Are you also from Galilee? Search and look, because no prophet has arisen out of Galilee." 43 7:53 And everyone went to his own house. 43 8:1 Jesus went to the Mount of Olives. 43 8:2 Now early in the morning He came again into the temple, and all the people came to Him; and He sat down and taught them. 43 8:3 Then the scribes and Pharisees brought to Him a woman caught in adultery. And when they had set her in the midst, 43 8:4 they said to Him, "Teacher, this woman was caught in adultery, in the very act. 43 8:5 Now Moses, in the law, commanded us that such should be stoned. But what do You say?" 43 8:6 This they said, testing Him, that they might have something of which to accuse Him. But Jesus stooped down and wrote on the ground with His finger, as though He did not hear them. 43 8:7 So when they continued asking Him, He raised Himself up and said to them, "He who is without sin among you, let him throw a stone at her first." 43 8:8 And again He stooped down and wrote on the ground. 43 8:9 Then those who heard it, being convicted by their own conscience, went out one by one, beginning with the oldest even to the last. And Jesus was left alone, and the woman standing in the midst. 43 8:10 When Jesus had lifted Himself up and saw no one but the woman, He said to her, "Woman, where are those accusers of yours? Has no one condemned you?" 43 8:11 She said, "No one, Lord." And Jesus said to her, "Neither do I condemn you; go and sin no more." 43 8:12 Then Jesus spoke to them again, saying, "I am the light of the world. He who follows Me will not walk in darkness, but will have the light of life." 43 8:13 The Pharisees therefore said to Him, "You bear record of Yourself; Your record is not true." 43 8:14 Jesus replied and said to them, "Though I bear record of Myself, yet My record is true, because, I know where I came from and where I am going; but you do not know where I come from and where I am going." 43 8:15 You judge according to the flesh; I judge no one." 43 8:16 And yet if I judge, My judgment is true; because I am not alone, but I and the Father who sent Me." 43 8:17 It is also written in your law that the testimony of two men is true." 43 8:18 I am One who bears witness of Myself, and the Father who sent Me bears witness of Me." 43 8:19 Then they said to Him, "Where is Your Father?" Jesus answered, "You know neither Me nor My Father. If you had known Me, you would have known My Father also." 43 8:20 These words Jesus spoke in the treasury, as He taught in the temple; and no one laid hands on Him, because His hour had not yet come. 43 8:21 Then Jesus said to them again, "I am going my way, and you will seek Me, and will die in your sins. Where I go you cannot come." 43 8:22 So the Jews said, "Shall He kill Himself, because He says, 'Where I go you cannot come'?" 43 8:23 And He said to them, "You are from beneath; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world." 43 8:24 Therefore I said to you that you will die in your sins; because, if you do not believe that I am He, you will die in your sins." 43 8:25 Then they said to Him, "Who are You?" And Jesus said to them, "Just what I have been saying to you from the beginning. 43 8:26 I have many things to say and to judge concerning you, but He who sent Me is true; and I speak to the world those things which I heard from Him." 43 8:27 They did not understand that He spoke to them of the Father. 43 8:28 Then Jesus said to them, "When you lift up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am He, and that I do nothing of Myself; but as My Father has taught Me, I speak these things." 43 8:29 And He who sent Me is with Me. The Father has not left Me alone, because I always do those things that please Him." 43 8:30 As He spoke these words, many believed on Him. 43 8:31 Then Jesus said to those Jews who believed on Him, "If you continue in My word, then you are My disciples indeed." 43 8:32 And you will know the truth, and the truth will make you free." 43 8:33 They replied to Him, "We are Abraham's descendants, and have never been in bondage to anyone. How can You say, 'You will be made free'?" 43 8:34 Jesus answered them, "Truly, truly, I say to you, whoever commits sin is a servant of sin." 43 8:35 And a servant does not abide in the house forever, but the Son abides forever." 43 8:36 Therefore if the Son makes you free, you will be free indeed." 43 8:37 "I know that you are Abraham's seed, but you seek to kill Me, because My word has no place in you." 43 8:38 I speak what I have seen with My Father, and you do what you have seen with your father." 43 8:39 They replied and said to Him, "Abraham is our father." Jesus said to them, "If you were Abraham's children, you would do the works of Abraham. 43 8:40 But now you seek to kill Me, a Man who has told you the truth which I heard from God. Abraham did not do this." 43 8:41 You do the deeds of your father." Then they said to Him, "We were not born of fornication; we have one Father, even God." 43 8:42 Jesus said to them, "If God were your Father, you would love Me, because, I proceeded forth and came from God; nor have I come of Myself, but He sent Me." 43 8:43 Why do you not understand My speech? That is because you are not able to hear My word." 43 8:44 You are of your father the devil, and the desires of your father you will do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and did not abide in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks a lie, he speaks from his own resources, because he is a liar and the father of it." 43 8:45 And because I tell you the truth, you do not believe Me." 43 8:46 Which of you convicts Me of sin? And if I tell the truth, why do you not believe Me?" 43 8:47 He who is of God hears God's words; therefore you do not hear them, because you are not of God." 43 8:48 Then the Jews replied and said to Him, "Do we not say rightly that You are a Samaritan and have a demon?" 43 8:49 Jesus answered, "I do not have a demon; but I honor My Father, and you dishonor Me." 43 8:50 And I do not seek My own glory; there is One who seeks and judges." 43 8:51 Truly, truly, I say to you, if anyone keeps My word he will never see death." 43 8:52 Then the Jews said to Him, "Now we know that You have a demon! Abraham is dead, and the prophets; and You say, 'If anyone keeps My word he will never taste death.'" 43 8:53 Are You greater than our father Abraham, who is dead? And the prophets are dead. Who do You make Yourself out to be?" 43 8:54 Jesus answered, "If I honor Myself, My honor is nothing. It is My Father who honors Me, of whom you say that He is your God." 43 8:55 Yet you have not known Him, but I know Him. And if I should say, 'I do not know Him,' I would be a liar like you; but I do know Him and keep His word." 43 8:56 Your father Abraham rejoiced to see My day, and he saw it and was glad." 43 8:57 Then the Jews said to Him, "You are not yet fifty years old, and have You seen Abraham?" 43 8:58 Jesus said to them, "Truly, truly, I say to you, before Abraham was, I AM." 43 8:59 Then they took up stones to throw at Him; but Jesus hid Himself and went out of the temple, going through the midst of them, and so passed by. 43 9:1 Now as Jesus passed by, He saw a man who was blind from his birth. 43 9:2 And His disciples asked Him, saying, "Teacher, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?" 43 9:3 Jesus answered, "Neither this man nor his parents sinned, but that the works of God should be revealed in him." 43 9:4 I must work the works of Him who sent Me while it is day; the night is coming when no one can work." 43 9:5 As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world." 43 9:6 When He had said these things, He spat on the ground and made clay with the saliva; and He anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay. 43 9:7 And He said to him, "Go, wash in the pool of Siloam" (which is translated, Sent). So he went and washed, and returned seeing. 43 9:8 Therefore the neighbors and those who previously had seen that he was blind said, "Is not this he who sat and begged?" 43 9:9 Some said, "This is he." Others said, "He is like him." But he said, "I am he." 43 9:10 Therefore they said to him, "How were your eyes opened?" 43 9:11 He answered and said, "A Man who is called Jesus made clay and anointed my eyes and said to me, 'Go to the pool of Siloam and wash.' So I went and washed, and I received sight." 43 9:12 Then they said to him, "Where is He?" He said, "I do not know." 43 9:13 They brought him who formerly was blind to the Pharisees. 43 9:14 Now it was a Sabbath day when Jesus made the clay and opened his eyes. 43 9:15 Then the Pharisees also asked him again how he had received his sight. He said to them, "He put clay on my eyes, and I washed, and I see." 43 9:16 Therefore some of the Pharisees said, "This Man is not from God, because He does not keep the Sabbath day." Others said, "How can a man who is a sinner do such miracles?" And there was a division among them. 43 9:17 They said to the blind man again, "What do you say about Him because He opened your eyes?" He said, "He is a prophet." 43 9:18 But the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind and received his sight, until they called the parents of him who had received his sight. 43 9:19 And they asked them, saying, "Is this your son, who you say was born blind? How then does he now see?" 43 9:20 His parents answered them and said, "We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind; 43 9:21 but by what means he now sees we do not know, or who opened his eyes we do not know. He is of age; ask him. He will speak for himself." 43 9:22 His parents said these things because they feared the Jews, because, the Jews had agreed already that if anyone confessed that He was Christ, he would be put out of the synagogue. 43 9:23 Therefore his parents said, "He is of age; ask him." 43 9:24 So they again called the man who was blind, and said to him, "Give God the praise! We know that this Man is a sinner." 43 9:25 He replied and said, "Whether He is a sinner or not I do not know. One thing I know: that though I was blind, now I see." 43 9:26 Then they said to him again, "What did He do to you? How did He open your eyes?" 43 9:27 He answered them, "I have told you already, and you did not listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you also want to become His disciples?" 43 9:28 Then they reviled him and said, "You are His disciple, but we are Moses' disciples. 43 9:29 We know that God spoke to Moses; as for this fellow, we do not know where He is from." 43 9:30 The man responded and said to them, "Why, this is a marvelous thing, that you do not know where He is from; and yet He has opened my eyes! 43 9:31 Now we know that God does not hear sinners; but if anyone is a worshiper of God and does His will, He hears him. 43 9:32 Since the world began it has been unheard of that anyone opened the eyes of one who was born blind. 43 9:33 If this Man were not from God, He could do nothing." 43 9:34 They replied and said to him, "You were completely born in sins, and are you teaching us?" And they threw him out. 43 9:35 Jesus heard that they had thrown him out; and when He had found him, He said to him, "Do you believe on the Son of God?" 43 9:36 He answered and said, "Who is He, Lord, that I may believe on Him?" 43 9:37 And Jesus said to him, "You have both seen Him and it is He who is talking with you." 43 9:38 Then he said, "Lord, I believe!" And he worshiped Him. 43 9:39 And Jesus said, "For judgment I have come into this world, that those who do not see may see, and that those who see may be made blind." 43 9:40 Then some of the Pharisees who were with Him heard these words, and said to Him, "Are we blind also?" 43 9:41 Jesus said to them, "If you were blind, you would have no sin; but now you say, 'We see.' Therefore your sin remains." 43 10:1 "Truly, truly, I say to you, he who does not enter the sheepfold by the door, but climbs up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber." 43 10:2 But he who enters by the door is the shepherd of the sheep." 43 10:3 To him the doorkeeper opens, and the sheep hear his voice; and he calls his own sheep by name and leads them out." 43 10:4 And when he brings out his own sheep, he goes before them; and the sheep follow him, because they know his voice." 43 10:5 Yet they will not follow a stranger, but will flee from him, because they do not know the voice of strangers." 43 10:6 Jesus spoke this parable to them, but they did not understand those things which He spoke to them. 43 10:7 Then Jesus said to them again, "Truly, truly, I say to you, I am the door of the sheep." 43 10:8 All who ever came before Me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not hear them." 43 10:9 I am the door. If anyone enters by Me, he will be saved, and will go in and out and find pasture." 43 10:10 The thief does not come except to steal, and to kill, and to destroy. I have come that they may have life, and that they may have it more abundantly." 43 10:11 "I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd gives His life for the sheep." 43 10:12 But he who is a hireling, and is not the shepherd, who does not own the sheep, sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep and flees; and the wolf catches them and scatters the sheep." 43 10:13 The hireling flees because he is a hireling and does not care for the sheep." 43 10:14 I am the good shepherd; and know My sheep, and am known by My own." 43 10:15 As the Father knows Me, even so I know the Father; and I lay down My life for the sheep." 43 10:16 And other sheep I have which are not of this fold; them also I must bring, and they will hear My voice; and there will be one flockandone shepherd." 43 10:17 "Therefore My Father loves Me, because I lay down My life that I may take it again." 43 10:18 No one takes it from Me, but I lay it down of Myself. I have authority to lay it down, and I have authority to take it again. This command I have received from My Father." 43 10:19 Therefore there was a division again among the Jews because of these sayings. 43 10:20 And many of them said, "He has a demon and is mad. Why do you listen to Him?" 43 10:21 Others said, "These are not the words of one who has a demon. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?" 43 10:22 Now it was the Feast of Dedication in Jerusalem, and it was winter. 43 10:23 And Jesus walked in the temple, in Solomon's porch. 43 10:24 Then the Jews surrounded Him and said to Him, "How long do You keep us in doubt? If You are the Christ, tell us plainly." 43 10:25 Jesus answered them, "I told you, and you do not believe. The works that I do in My Father's name, they bear witness of Me." 43 10:26 But you do not believe, because you are not of My sheep, as I said to you." 43 10:27 My sheep hear My voice, and I know them, and they follow Me." 43 10:28 And I give them eternal life, and they will never perish; neither will anyone snatch them out of My hand." 43 10:29 My Father, who has given them to Me, is greater than all; and no one is able to snatch them out of My Father's hand." 43 10:30 I and My Father are one." 43 10:31 Then the Jews took up stones again to stone Him. 43 10:32 Jesus responded to them, "Many good works I have shown you from My Father. For which of those works do you stone Me?" 43 10:33 The Jews answered Him, saying, "For a good work we do not stone You, but for blasphemy, and because You, being a Man, make Yourself God." 43 10:34 Jesus replied to them, "Is it not written in your law, 'I said, "You are gods" '? 43 10:35 If He called them gods, to whom the word of God came, and the Scripture cannot be broken," 43 10:36 do you say of Him whom the Father has sanctified and sent into the world, 'You are blaspheming,' because I said, 'I am the Son of God'?" 43 10:37 If I do not do the works of My Father, do not believe Me;" 43 10:38 but if I do, though you do not believe Me, believe the works, that you may know and believe that the Father is in Me, and I in Him." 43 10:39 Therefore they sought again to seize Him, but He escaped out of their hand. 43 10:40 And He went away again beyond the Jordan to the place where John was baptizing at first, and there He stayed. 43 10:41 Then many came to Him and said, "John performed no miracle, but all the things that John spoke about this Man are true." 43 10:42 And many believed on Him there. 43 11:1 Now a certain man was sick, named Lazarus, of Bethany, the town of Mary and her sister Martha. 43 11:2 It was that Mary who anointed the Lord with fragrant oil and wiped His feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick. 43 11:3 Therefore the sisters sent to Him, saying, "Lord, behold, he whom You love is sick." 43 11:4 When Jesus heard that, He said, "This sickness is not to death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God may be glorified through it." 43 11:5 Now Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus. 43 11:6 So, when He heard that he was sick, He stayed two more days in the place where He was. 43 11:7 Then after this He said to His disciples, "Let us go to Judea again." 43 11:8 His disciples said to Him, "Teacher, lately the Jews sought to stone You, and are You going there again?" 43 11:9 Jesus answered, "Are there not twelve hours in the day? If anyone walks in the day, he does not stumble, because he sees the light of this world." 43 11:10 But if one walks in the night, he stumbles, because the light is not in him." 43 11:11 These things He said, and after that He said to them, "Our friend Lazarus sleeps, but I go that I may wake him out of sleep." 43 11:12 Then His disciples said, "Lord, if he sleeps he will recover." 43 11:13 However, Jesus spoke of his death, but they thought that He was speaking about taking rest in sleep. 43 11:14 Then Jesus said to them plainly, "Lazarus is dead." 43 11:15 And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, that you may believe. Nevertheless let us go to him." 43 11:16 Then Thomas, who is called Didymus, said to his fellow disciples, "Let us also go, that we may die with Him." 43 11:17 So when Jesus came, He found that he had already been laid in the tomb four days. 43 11:18 Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, about fifteen stadiums away. 43 11:19 And many of the Jews came to Martha and Mary, to comfort them concerning their brother. 43 11:20 Now Martha, as soon as she heard that Jesus was coming, went and met Him, but Mary was still sitting in the house. 43 11:21 Then Martha said to Jesus, "Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died. 43 11:22 But even now I know that whatever You ask of God, God will give You." 43 11:23 Jesus said to her, "Your brother will rise again." 43 11:24 Martha said to Him, "I know that he will rise again in the resurrection at the last day." 43 11:25 Jesus said to her, "I am the resurrection and the life. He who believes in Me, though he may die, yet he will live." 43 11:26 And whoever lives and believes in Me will never die. Do you believe this?" 43 11:27 She said to Him, "Yes, Lord, I believe that You are the Christ, the Son of God, who would come into the world." 43 11:28 And when she had said these things, she went her way and secretly called Mary her sister, saying, "The Teacher has come and is calling for you." 43 11:29 As soon as she heard that, she arose quickly and came to Him. 43 11:30 Now Jesus had not yet come into the town, but was in the place where Martha met Him. 43 11:31 Then the Jews who were with her in the house, and comforting her, when they saw that Mary rose up quickly and went out, followed her, saying, "She is going to the tomb to weep there." 43 11:32 Then, when Mary came where Jesus was, and saw Him, she fell down at His feet, saying to Him, "Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died." 43 11:33 Therefore, when Jesus saw her weeping, and the Jews who came with her weeping, He groaned in the spirit and was troubled, 43 11:34 and said, "Where have you laid him?" They said to Him, "Lord, come and see." 43 11:35 Jesus wept. 43 11:36 Then the Jews said, "See how He loved him!" 43 11:37 And some of them said, "Could not this Man, who opened the eyes of the blind, also have kept this man from dying?" 43 11:38 Then Jesus, again groaning in Himself, came to the tomb. It was a cave, and a stone lay on it. 43 11:39 Jesus said, "Take away the stone." Martha, the sister of him who was dead, said to Him, "Lord, by this time he smells, because he has been dead four days." 43 11:40 Jesus said to her, "Did I not say to you that if you would believe you would see the glory of God?" 43 11:41 Then they took away the stone from the place where the dead man was lying. And Jesus lifted up His eyes and said, "Father, I thank You that You have heard Me." 43 11:42 And I know that You always hear Me, but because of the people who are standing by I said this, that they may believe that You sent Me." 43 11:43 Now when He had spoken these things, He shouted with a loud voice, "Lazarus, come forth!" 43 11:44 And he who had died came out bound hand and foot with graveclothes, and his face was wrapped with a cloth. Jesus said to them, "Loose him, and let him go." 43 11:45 Then many of the Jews who had come to Mary, and had seen the things Jesus did, believed on Him. 43 11:46 But some of them went away to the Pharisees and told them the things Jesus had done. 43 11:47 Then the chief priests and the Pharisees gathered a council and said, "What shall we do? Because this Man does many miracles. 43 11:48 If we let Him alone like this, everyone will believe on Him, and the Romans will come and take away both our place and nation." 43 11:49 And one of them, named Caiaphas, being the high priest that year, said to them, "You know nothing at all, 43 11:50 nor do you consider that it is expedient for us that one man should die for the people, and not that the entire nation should perish." 43 11:51 Now this he did not say from himself; but being high priest that year he prophesied that Jesus would die for the nation, 43 11:52 and not for that nation only, but also that He would gather together in one the children of God who were scattered abroad. 43 11:53 Then, from that day on, they plotted to put Him to death. 43 11:54 Therefore Jesus no longer walked openly among the Jews, but went from there into the country near the wilderness, to a city called Ephraim, and there remained with His disciples. 43 11:55 And the Passover of the Jews was soon at hand, and many went from the country up to Jerusalem before the Passover, to purify themselves. 43 11:56 Then they sought Jesus, and spoke among themselves as they stood in the temple, "What do you think, that He will not come to the feast?" 43 11:57 Now both the chief priests and the Pharisees had given a command, that if anyone knew where He was, he should report it, that they might seize Him. 43 12:1 Then, six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany, where Lazarus was who had been dead, whom He had raised from the dead. 43 12:2 There they made Him a supper; and Martha served, but Lazarus was one of those who sat at the table with Him. 43 12:3 Then Mary took a pound of very costly oil of spikenard, anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped His feet with her hair. And the house was filled with the fragrance of the oil. 43 12:4 But one of His disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, who would betray Him, said, 43 12:5 "Why was this fragrant oil not sold for three hundred denarii and given to the poor?" 43 12:6 This he said, not that he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief, and had the money bag; and carried what was put in it. 43 12:7 But Jesus said, "Leave her alone; she has kept this for the day of My burial." 43 12:8 Because, the poor you have with you always, but Me you do not have always." 43 12:9 Now a great many of the Jews knew that He was there; and they came, not for Jesus' sake only, but that they might also see Lazarus, whom He had raised from the dead. 43 12:10 But the chief priests plotted to put Lazarus to death also, 43 12:11 because on account of him many of the Jews went away and believed on Jesus. 43 12:12 On the next day many people who had come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem, 43 12:13 took branches of palm trees and went out to meet Him, and shouted: "Hosanna! Blessed is the King of Israel who comes in the name of the LORD!" 43 12:14 Then Jesus, when He had found a young donkey, sat on it; as it is written: 43 12:15 "Fear not, daughter of Zion; behold, your King is coming, sitting on a donkey's colt." 43 12:16 His disciples did not understand these things at first; but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written about Him and that they had done these things to Him. 43 12:17 Therefore the people, who were with Him when He called Lazarus out of his tomb and raised him from the dead, bore record. 43 12:18 For this reason the people also met Him, because they heard that He had done this miracle. 43 12:19 The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, "You see that you are accomplishing nothing. Look, the world has gone after Him!" 43 12:20 Now there were certain Greeks among those who came up to worship at the feast. 43 12:21 So they came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida of Galilee, and asked him, saying, "Sir, we desire to see Jesus." 43 12:22 Philip came and told Andrew, and in turn Andrew and Philip told Jesus. 43 12:23 But Jesus replied to them, saying, "The hour has come that the Son of Man should be glorified." 43 12:24 Truly, truly, I say to you, unless a grain of wheat falls into the ground and dies, it remains alone; but if it dies, it produces much grain." 43 12:25 He who loves his life will lose it, and he who hates his life in this world will keep it for eternal life." 43 12:26 If anyone serves Me, let him follow Me; and where I am, there My servant will be also. If anyone serves Me, him My Father will honor." 43 12:27 "Now My soul is troubled, and what shall I say? 'Father, save Me from this hour'? But for this purpose I came to this hour." 43 12:28 Father, glorify Your name." Then a voice came from heaven,saying, "I have both glorified it and will glorify it again." 43 12:29 Therefore the people who stood by and heard it said that it had thundered. Others said, "An angel has spoken to Him." 43 12:30 Jesus responded and said, "This voice did not come because of Me, but for your sake." 43 12:31 Now is the judgment of this world; now the ruler of this world will be cast out." 43 12:32 And I, if I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all men to Me." 43 12:33 This He said, signifying by what death He would die. 43 12:34 The people responded to Him, "We have heard from the law that the Christ remains forever; and how can You say, 'The Son of Man must be lifted up'? Who is this Son of Man?" 43 12:35 Then Jesus said to them, "A little while longer the light is with you. Walk while you have the light, lest darkness overtake you; because he who walks in darkness does not know where he is going." 43 12:36 While you have the light, believe in the light, that you may be children of light." These things Jesus spoke, and departed, and hid Himself from them. 43 12:37 But although He had done so many miracles before them, they did not believe in Him, 43 12:38 that the word of Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spoke: "Lord, who has believed our report? And to whom has the arm of the LORD been revealed?" 43 12:39 Therefore they could not believe, because Isaiah said again: 43 12:40 "He has blinded their eyes and hardened their hearts, lest they should see with their eyes, lest they should understand with their hearts and be converted, so that I should heal them." 43 12:41 These things Isaiah said when he saw His glory and spoke of Him. 43 12:42 Nevertheless even among the rulers many believed on Him, but because of the Pharisees they did not confess Him, lest they should be put out of the synagogue; 43 12:43 because they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God. 43 12:44 Jesus shouted and said, "He who believes on Me, believes not on Me but on Him who sent Me." 43 12:45 And he who sees Me sees Him who sent Me." 43 12:46 I have come as a light into the world, that whoever believes on Me should not abide in darkness." 43 12:47 And if anyone hears My words and does not believe, I do not judge him; because I did not come to judge the world but to save the world." 43 12:48 He who rejects Me, and does not receive My words, has that which judges him, the word that I have spoken, that will judge him in the last day." 43 12:49 Because, I have not spoken from Myself; but the Father who sent Me gave Me a commandment, what I should say and what I should speak." 43 12:50 And I know that His command is everlasting life. Therefore, whatever I speak, just as the Father said to Me, so I speak." 43 13:1 Now before the Feast of the Passover, when Jesus knew that His hour had come that He should depart from this world to the Father, having loved His own who were in the world, He loved them to the end. 43 13:2 And supper being ended, the devil having already put it into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, to betray Him, 43 13:3 Jesus, knowing that the Father had given all things into His hands, and that He had come from God and was going to God, 43 13:4 He rose from supper and laid aside His clothes, took a towel and tied it around his waist. 43 13:5 After that, He poured water into a basin and began to wash the disciples' feet, and to wipe them with the towel with which He wrapped around Himself. 43 13:6 Then He came to Simon Peter. And Peter said to Him, "Lord, are You washing my feet?" 43 13:7 Jesus answered and said to him, "What I am doing you do not understand now, but you will know after this." 43 13:8 Peter said to Him, "You shall never wash my feet!" Jesus replied to him, "If I do not wash you, you have no part with Me." 43 13:9 Simon Peter said to Him, "Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head!" 43 13:10 Jesus said to him, "He who is washed needs only to wash his feet, but is completely clean; and you are clean, but not all of you." 43 13:11 Because, He knew who would betray Him; therefore He said, "You are not all clean." 43 13:12 So when He had washed their feet, taken His clothes, and sat down again, He said to them, "Do you know what I have done to you?" 43 13:13 You call Me Teacher and Lord, and you say well, because so I am." 43 13:14 If I then, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also ought to wash one another's feet." 43 13:15 Because, I have given you an example, that you should do as I have done to you." 43 13:16 Truly, truly, I say to you, a servant is not greater than his master; nor is he who is sent greater than he who sent him." 43 13:17 If you know these things, blessed are you if you do them." 43 13:18 "I do not speak concerning all of you. I know whom I have chosen; but that the Scripture may be fulfilled, 'He who eats bread with Me has lifted up his heel against Me.'" 43 13:19 Now I tell you before it comes, that when it does come to pass, you may believe that I am He." 43 13:20 Truly, truly, I say to you, he who receives whomever I send receives Me; and he who receives Me receives Him who sent Me." 43 13:21 When Jesus had said these things, He was troubled in spirit, and testified and said, "Truly, truly, I say to you, one of you will betray Me." 43 13:22 Then the disciples looked at one another, dubious about whom He spoke. 43 13:23 Now there was leaning on Jesus' bosom one of His disciples, whom Jesus loved. 43 13:24 Simon Peter therefore motioned to him to ask who it was of whom He spoke. 43 13:25 Then, leaning back on Jesus' breast, he said to Him, "Lord, who is it?" 43 13:26 Jesus answered, "It is he to whom I will give a piece of bread when I have dipped it." And having dipped the bread, He gave it to Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon. 43 13:27 Now after the piece of bread, Satan entered him. Then Jesus said to him, "What you do, do quickly." 43 13:28 But no one at the table knew for what reason He said this to him. 43 13:29 Because, some of them thought, because Judas had the money bag, that Jesus had said to him, "Buy those things we need for the feast," or that he should give something to the poor. 43 13:30 Having received the piece of bread, he then went out immediately. And it was night. 43 13:31 So, when he had gone out, Jesus said, "Now the Son of Man is glorified, and God is glorified in Him." 43 13:32 If God is glorified in Him, God will also glorify Him in Himself, and will glorify Him immediately." 43 13:33 Little children, I will be with you a little while longer. You will seek Me; and as I said to the Jews, 'Where I am going, you cannot come,' so now I say to you." 43 13:34 A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another; as I have loved you, that you also love one another." 43 13:35 By this everyone will know that you are My disciples, if you have love for one another." 43 13:36 Simon Peter said to Him, "Lord, where are You going?" Jesus answered him, "Where I am going you cannot follow Me now, but you will follow Me afterward." 43 13:37 Peter said to Him, "Lord, why can I not follow You now? I will lay down my life for Your sake." 43 13:38 Jesus answered him, "Will you lay down your life for My sake? Truly, truly, I say to you, the rooster will not crow until you have denied Me three times." 43 14:1 "Let not your heart be troubled; you believe in God, believe also in Me." 43 14:2 In My Father's house are many mansions; if it were not so, I would have told you. I go to prepare a place for you." 43 14:3 And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again and receive you to Myself; that where I am, there you may be also." 43 14:4 And where I go you know, and the way you know." 43 14:5 Thomas said to Him, "Lord, we do not know where You are going, and how can we know the way?" 43 14:6 Jesus said to him, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through Me." 43 14:7 "If you had known Me, you would have known My Father also; and from now on you know Him and have seen Him." 43 14:8 Philip said to Him, "Lord, show us the Father, and it is enough for us." 43 14:9 Jesus said to him, "Have I been with you for such a long a time, and yet you have not known Me, Philip? He who has seen Me has seen the Father; so how can you say, 'Show us the Father'?" 43 14:10 Do you not believe that I am in the Father, and the Father in Me? The words that I speak to you I do not speak from Myself; but the Father who dwells in Me, He does the works." 43 14:11 Believe Me that I am in the Father and the Father in Me, or else believe Me for the sake of the works themselves." 43 14:12 "Truly, truly, I say to you, he who believes on Me, the works that I do he will do also; and greater works than these he will do, because I go to My Father." 43 14:13 And whatever you ask in My name, that I will do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son." 43 14:14 If you shall ask anything in My name, I will do it." 43 14:15 "If you love Me, keep My commandments." 43 14:16 And I will pray the Father, and He will give you another Comforter, that He may abide with you forever;" 43 14:17 that is the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot receive, because it neither sees Him nor knows Him; but you know Him, because He dwells with you and will be in you." 43 14:18 I will not leave you comfortless; I will come to you." 43 14:19 "Yet a little while longer and the world will see Me no more, but you see Me. Because I live, you will live also." 43 14:20 At that day you will know that I am in My Father, and you in Me, and I in you." 43 14:21 He who has My commandments and keeps them, it is he who loves Me. And he who loves Me will be loved by My Father, and I will love him and will manifest Myself to him." 43 14:22 Judas (not Iscariot) said to Him, "Lord, how is it that You will manifest Yourself to us, and not to the world?" 43 14:23 Jesus answered and said to him, "If anyone loves Me, he will keep My words; and My Father will love him, and We will come to him and make Our home with him." 43 14:24 He who does not love Me does not keep My words; and the word which you hear is not Mine but the Father's who sent Me." 43 14:25 "These things I have spoken to you while being present with you. " 43 14:26 But the Comforter,who isthe Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in My name, He will teach you all things, and bring all things to your remembrance, whatever I have said to you." 43 14:27 Peace I leave with you, My peace I give to you; not as the world gives do I give to you. Do not let your heart to be troubled, neither let it be afraid." 43 14:28 You have heard Me say to you, 'I am going away and coming back to you.' If you loved Me, you would rejoice because I said, 'I am going to the Father,' because My Father is greater than I." 43 14:29 "And now I have told you before it comes to pass, that when it does come to pass, you may believe." 43 14:30 I will no longer talk much with you, because the ruler of this world is coming, and he has nothing in Me." 43 14:31 But that the world may know that I love the Father, and just as the Father gave Me commandment, so I do. Arise, let us go from here." 43 15:1 "I am the true vine, and My Father is the vinedresser." 43 15:2 Every branch in Me that does not bear fruit He takes away; and every branch that bears fruit He prunes, that it may bear more fruit." 43 15:3 Now you are clean because of the word which I have spoken to you." 43 15:4 Abide in Me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, unless it abides in the vine, neither can you, unless you abide in Me." 43 15:5 "I am the vine, you are the branches. He who abides in Me, and I in him, the same bears much fruit; because without Me you can do nothing." 43 15:6 If anyone does not abide in Me, he is cast out as a branch and is withered; and people gather them and throw them into the fire, and they are burned." 43 15:7 If you abide in Me, and My words abide in you, you will ask what you desire, and it will be done to you." 43 15:8 By this My Father is glorified, that you bear much fruit; so you will be My disciples." 43 15:9 "As the Father has loved Me, I also have loved you; continue in My love." 43 15:10 If you keep My commandments, you will abide in My love, just as I have kept My Father's commandments and abide in His love." 43 15:11 "These things I have spoken to you, that My joy may remain in you, and that your joy may be full." 43 15:12 This is My commandment, that you love one another as I have loved you." 43 15:13 No one has greater love than this, that he lay down his life for his friends." 43 15:14 You are My friends if you do whatever I command you." 43 15:15 No longer do I call you servants, because a servant does not know what his master is doing; but I have called you friends, because all things that I have heard from My Father I have made known to you." 43 15:16 You did not choose Me, but I chose you and appointed you that you should go and bear fruit, and that your fruit should remain, that whatever you ask the Father in My name He may give you." 43 15:17 These things I command you, that you love one another." 43 15:18 "If the world hates you, you know that it hated Me before it hated you." 43 15:19 If you were of the world, the world would love its own. But because you are not of the world, but I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hates you." 43 15:20 Remember the word that I said to you, 'A servant is not greater than his master.' If they persecuted Me, they will also persecute you. If they kept My word, they will keep yours also." 43 15:21 But all these things they will do to you for My name's sake, because they do not know Him who sent Me." 43 15:22 If I had not come and spoken to them, they would have no sin, but now they have no excuse for their sin." 43 15:23 He who hates Me hates My Father also." 43 15:24 If I had not done among them the works which no one else did, they would have no sin; but now they have both seen and hated both Me and My Father." 43 15:25 Butthis happenedthat the word might be fulfilled which is written in their law, 'They hated Me without a reason.'" 43 15:26 "But when the Comforter comes, whom I will send to you from the Father, that is the Spirit of truth who proceeds from the Father, He will testify of Me." 43 15:27 And you also will bear witness, because you have been with Me from the beginning." 43 16:1 "These things I have spoken to you, that you should not be made to stumble." 43 16:2 They will put you out of the synagogues; yes, the time is coming that whoever kills you will think that he offers God service." 43 16:3 And these things they will do to you because they have not known the Father nor Me." 43 16:4 But these things I have told you, that when the time comes, you may remember that I told you of them. And these things I did not say to you at the beginning, because I was with you." 43 16:5 "But now I go away to Him who sent Me, and none of you asks Me, 'Where are You going?'" 43 16:6 But because I have said these things to you, sorrow has filled your heart." 43 16:7 Nevertheless I tell you the truth. It is to your advantage that I go away; because, if I do not go away, the Comforter will not come to you; but if I depart, I will send Him to you." 43 16:8 And when He has come, He will convict the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:" 43 16:9 of sin, because they do not believe on Me;" 43 16:10 of righteousness, because I go to My Father and you see Me no more;" 43 16:11 of judgment, because the ruler of this world is judged." 43 16:12 "I still have many things to say to you, but you cannot bear them now." 43 16:13 However, when He, the Spirit of truth, has come, He will guide you into all truth; because, He will not speak on from Himself, but whatever He hears He will speak; and He will show you things to come." 43 16:14 He will glorify Me, because He will take of what is Mine and declare it to you." 43 16:15 All things that the Father has are Mine. Therefore I said that He will take of Mine and declare it to you." 43 16:16 "A little while, and you will not see Me; and again a little while, and you will see Me, because I go to the Father." 43 16:17 Then some of His disciples said among themselves, "What is this that He says to us, 'A little while, and you will not see Me; and again a little while, and you will see Me'; and, 'because I go to the Father'?" 43 16:18 They said therefore, "What is this that He says, 'A little while'? We do not know what He is saying." 43 16:19 Now Jesus knew that they desired to ask Him, and He said to them, "Are you inquiring among yourselves about what I said, 'A little while, and you will not see Me; and again a little while, and you will see Me'?" 43 16:20 Truly, truly, I say to you that you will weep and lament, but the world will rejoice; and you will be sorrowful, but your sorrow will be turned into joy." 43 16:21 A woman, when she is in labor, has sorrow because her hour has come; but as soon as she has given birth to the child, she no longer remembers the anguish, for joy that a human being has been born into the world." 43 16:22 Therefore you now have sorrow; but I will see you again and your heart will rejoice, and your joy no one will take from you." 43 16:23 "And in that day you will ask Me nothing. Truly, truly, I say to you, whatever you ask the Father in My name He will give you." 43 16:24 Until now you have asked nothing in My name. Ask, and you will receive, that your joy may be full." 43 16:25 "These things I have spoken to you in proverbs; but the time is coming when I will no longer speak to you in proverbs, but I will tell you plainly about the Father." 43 16:26 In that day you will ask in My name, and I do not say to you that I will pray the Father for you;" 43 16:27 because the Father Himself loves you, because you have loved Me, and have believed that I came forth from God." 43 16:28 I came forth from the Father and have come into the world. Again, I leave the world and go to the Father." 43 16:29 His disciples said to Him, "See, now You are speaking plainly, and using no proverb! 43 16:30 Now we are sure that You know all things, and have no need that anyone should question You. By this we believe that You came forth from God." 43 16:31 Jesus replied to them, "Do you now believe?" 43 16:32 Behold, the hour is coming, yes, has now come, that you will be scattered, each to his own, and will leave Me alone. And yet I am not alone, because the Father is with Me." 43 16:33 These things I have spoken to you, that in Me you may have peace. In the world you will have tribulation; but be of good cheer, I have overcome the world." 43 17:1 Jesus spoke these words, and lifted up His eyes to heaven, saying: "Father, the hour has come. Glorify Your Son, that Your Son also may glorify You," 43 17:2 as You have given Him authority over all flesh, that He should give eternal life to as many as You have given Him." 43 17:3 And this is eternal life, that they may know You, the only true God, and Jesus Christ whom You have sent." 43 17:4 I have glorified You on the earth. I have finished the work which You have given Me to do." 43 17:5 And now, O Father, glorify Me together with Yourself, with the glory which I had with You before the world was." 43 17:6 "I have manifested Your name to the men whom You have given Me out of the world. They were Yours, You gave them to Me, and they have kept Your word." 43 17:7 Now they have known that all things which You have given Me are from You." 43 17:8 Because, I have given to them the words which You have given Me; and they have received them, and have known surely that I came forth from You; and they have believed that You sent Me." 43 17:9 "I pray for them. I do not pray for the world but for those whom You have given Me, because they are Yours." 43 17:10 And all Mine are Yours, and Yours are Mine, and I am glorified in them." 43 17:11 and now I am no longer in the world, but these are in the world, and I come to You. Holy Father, keep through Your own name those whom You have given Me, that they may be one as We are." 43 17:12 While I was with them in the world, I kept them in Your name. Those whom You gave Me I have kept; and none of them is lost except the son of perdition, that the Scripture might be fulfilled." 43 17:13 But now I come to You, and these things I speak in the world, that they may have My joy fulfilled in themselves." 43 17:14 I have given them Your word; and the world has hated them because they are not of the world, just as I am not of the world." 43 17:15 I do not pray that You should take them out of the world, but that You should keep them from the evil." 43 17:16 They are not of the world, just as I am not of the world." 43 17:17 Sanctify them through Your truth. Your word is truth." 43 17:18 Just as You have sent Me into the world, I also have sent them into the world." 43 17:19 And for their sakes I sanctify Myself, that they also may be sanctified through the truth." 43 17:20 "I do not pray for these only, but also for those who will believe on Me through their word;" 43 17:21 that they all may be one, as You, Father, are in Me, and I in You; that they also may be one in Us, that the world may believe that You have sent Me." 43 17:22 And the glory which You gave Me I have given them, that they may be one just as We are one:" 43 17:23 I in them, and You in Me; that they may be made perfect in one, and that the world may know that You have sent Me, and have loved them as You have loved Me." 43 17:24 "Father, I desire that they also whom You have given Me may be with Me where I am, that they may behold My glory which You have given Me; because You loved Me before the foundation of the world." 43 17:25 O righteous Father! The world has not known You, but I have known You; and these have known that You sent Me." 43 17:26 And I have declared to them Your name, and will declare it, that the love with which You loved Me may be in them, and I in them." 43 18:1 When Jesus had spoken these words, He went out with His disciples over the Brook Kidron, where there was a garden, which He and His disciples entered into. 43 18:2 And Judas, who betrayed Him, also knew the place; because Jesus often met there with His disciples. 43 18:3 Then Judas, having received a detachment of men, and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees, came there with lanterns, torches, and weapons. 43 18:4 Jesus therefore, knowing all things that would come upon Him, went forward and said to them, "Whom are you seeking?" 43 18:5 They answered Him, "Jesus of Nazareth." Jesus said to them, "I am He." And Judas, who betrayed Him, also stood with them. 43 18:6 Now when He said to them, "I am He," they drew back and fell to the ground. 43 18:7 Then He asked them again, "Whom are you seeking?" And they said, "Jesus of Nazareth." 43 18:8 Jesus answered, "I have told you that I am He. Therefore, if you seek Me, let these go their way," 43 18:9 that the saying might be fulfilled which He spoke, "Of those whom You gave Me I have lost none." 43 18:10 Then Simon Peter, having a sword, drew it and struck the high priest's servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant's name was Malchus. 43 18:11 So Jesus said to Peter, "Put your sword into the sheath. The cup which My Father has given Me, should I not drink it?" 43 18:12 Then the detachment of troops and the captain and the officers of the Jews arrested Jesus and bound Him. 43 18:13 And they led Him away to Annas first, because he was the father in law of Caiaphas who was high priest that year. 43 18:14 Now it was Caiaphas who advised the Jews that it was expedient that one man should die for the people. 43 18:15 And Simon Peter followed Jesus, and so did another disciple. Now that disciple was known to the high priest, and went with Jesus into the courtyard of the high priest. 43 18:16 But Peter stood at the door outside. Then the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to her who kept the door, and brought Peter in. 43 18:17 Then the servant girl who kept the door said to Peter, "You are not also one of this Man's disciples, are you?" He said, "I am not." 43 18:18 Now the servants and officers who had made a fire of coals stood there, because it was cold, and they warmed themselves. And Peter stood with them and warmed himself. 43 18:19 The high priest then asked Jesus about His disciples and of His doctrine. 43 18:20 Jesus answered him, "I spoke openly to the world. I always taught in synagogue and in the temple, where the Jews always meet, and in secret I have said nothing." 43 18:21 Why do you ask Me? Ask those who have heard Me what I said to them. Indeed they know what I said." 43 18:22 And when He had said these things, one of the officers who stood by struck Jesus with the palm of his hand, saying, "Do You answer the high priest like that?" 43 18:23 Jesus answered him, "If I have spoken evil, bear witness of the evil; but if well, why do you strike Me?" 43 18:24 Now Annas had sent Him bound to Caiaphas the high priest. 43 18:25 Now Simon Peter stood and warmed himself. Therefore they said to him, "Are you not also one of His disciples?" He denied it and said, "I am not!" 43 18:26 One of the servants of the high priest, being a relative of him whose ear Peter cut off, said, "Did I not see you in the garden with Him?" 43 18:27 Peter then denied again; and immediately the rooster crowed. 43 18:28 Then they led Jesus from Caiaphas to the judgment hall, and it was early. But they themselves did not go into the judgment hall, lest they should be defiled, but that they might eat the Passover. 43 18:29 Pilate then went out to them and said, "What accusation do you bring against this Man?" 43 18:30 They answered and said to him, "If He were not an evildoer, we would not have delivered Him up to you." 43 18:31 Then Pilate said to them, "You take Him and judge Him according to your law." Therefore the Jews said to him, "It is not lawful for us to put anyone to death," 43 18:32 that the saying of Jesus might be fulfilled which He spoke, signifying by what death He would die. 43 18:33 Then Pilate entered the judgment hall again, called Jesus, and said to Him, "Are You the King of the Jews?" 43 18:34 Jesus answered him, "Are you speaking for yourself about this, or did others tell you this concerning Me?" 43 18:35 Pilate answered, "Am I a Jew? Your own nation and the chief priests have delivered You to me. What have You done?" 43 18:36 Jesus answered, "My kingdom is not of this world. If My kingdom were of this world, My servants would fight, so that I would not be delivered to the Jews; but now My kingdom is not from here." 43 18:37 Pilate therefore said to Him, "Are You a king then?" Jesus answered, "You say rightly that I am a king. For this reason I was born, and for this reason I have come into the world, that I should bear witness to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth hears My voice." 43 18:38 Pilate said to Him, "What is truth?" And when he had said this, he went out again to the Jews, and said to them, "I find no fault in Him at all. 43 18:39 "But you have a custom that I should release someone to you at the Passover. Do you therefore want me to release to you the King of the Jews?" 43 18:40 Then they all shouted again, saying, "Not this Man, but Barabbas!" Now Barabbas was a robber. 43 19:1 So then Pilate took Jesus and scourged Him. 43 19:2 And the soldiers twisted a crown of thorns and put it on His head, and they put a purple robe on Him. 43 19:3 Then they said, "Hail, King of the Jews!" And they struck Him with their hands. 43 19:4 Then Pilate then went out again, and said to them, "Behold, I am bringing Him out to you, that you may know that I find no fault in Him." 43 19:5 Then Jesus came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. AndPilatesaid to them, "Behold the Man!" 43 19:6 Therefore, when the chief priests and officers saw Him, they shouted out, saying, "Crucify Him, crucify Him!" Pilate said to them, "You take Him and crucify Him, because I find no fault in Him." 43 19:7 The Jews replied to him, "We have a law, and according to our law He ought to die, because He made Himself the Son of God." 43 19:8 Therefore, when Pilate heard that saying, he was the more afraid, 43 19:9 and went again into the judgment hall, and said to Jesus, "Where are You from?" But Jesus gave him no answer. 43 19:10 Then Pilate said to Him, "Are You not speaking to me? Do You not know that I have authority to crucify You, and have authority to release You?" 43 19:11 Jesus answered, "You could have no authority at all against Me unless it had been given you from above. Therefore the one who delivered Me to you has the greater sin." 43 19:12 From then on Pilate sought to release Him, but the Jews shouted out, saying, "If you let this Man go, you are not Caesar's friend. Whoever makes himself a king speaks against Caesar." 43 19:13 When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he brought Jesus out and sat down in the judgment seat in a place that is called The Pavement, but in the Hebrew, Gabbatha. 43 19:14 Now it was the Preparation Day of the Passover, and about the sixth hour. And he said to the Jews, "Behold your King!" 43 19:15 But they shouted out, "Away with Him, away with Him! Crucify Him!" Pilate said to them, "Shall I crucify your King?" The chief priests answered, "We have no king but Caesar!" 43 19:16 Then he delivered Him to them to be crucified. So they took Jesus and led Him away. 43 19:17 And He, bearing His cross, went out to a place called the Place of a Skull, which is called in the Hebrew, Golgotha, 43 19:18 where they crucified Him, and two others with Him, one on either side, and Jesus in the middle. 43 19:19 Now Pilate wrote a title and put it on the cross. And the writing was: JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS. 43 19:20 Then many of the Jews read this title, because, the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city; and it was written in Hebrew, Greek, and Latin. 43 19:21 So the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, "Do not write, 'The King of the Jews,' but, 'He said, "I am the King of the Jews."'" 43 19:22 Pilate replied, "What I have written, I have written." 43 19:23 Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took His clothes and made four parts, to each soldier a part, and also His coat. Now the coat was without seam, woven from the top in one piece. 43 19:24 Therefore they said among themselves, "Let us not tear it, but cast lots for it, whose it shall be," that the Scripture might be fulfilled which says: "They divided My clothes among them, and for My coat they cast lots." Therefore the soldiers did these things. 43 19:25 Now there stood by the cross of Jesus His mother, and His mother's sister, Marythe wife ofClopas, and Mary Magdalene. 43 19:26 Therefore, when Jesus saw His mother, and the disciple whom He loved standing by, He said to His mother, "Woman, behold your son!" 43 19:27 Then He said to the disciple, "Behold your mother!" And from that hour that disciple took her to his own home. 43 19:28 After this, Jesus, knowing that all things were now accomplished, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, said, "I thirst!" 43 19:29 Now a vessel full of vinegar was sitting there; and they filled a sponge with vinegar, put it on hyssop, and put it to His mouth. 43 19:30 So when Jesus had received the vinegar, He said, "It is finished!" He bowed His head, and gave up His spirit. 43 19:31 Then since it was the Preparation Day, that the bodies should not remain on the cross on the Sabbath day (because that Sabbath was a high day), the Jews asked Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away. 43 19:32 Then the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first and of the other who was crucified with Him. 43 19:33 But when they came to Jesus and saw that He was already dead, they did not break His legs. 43 19:34 But one of the soldiers pierced His side with a spear, and blood and water came out straight away. 43 19:35 And he who saw it bare record, and his record is true; and he knows that he is speaking the truth, so that you may believe. 43 19:36 Because these things were done that the Scripture should be fulfilled, "Not one of His bones will be broken." 43 19:37 And again another Scripture says, "They will look on Him whom they pierced." 43 19:38 After this, Joseph of Arimathea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly, for fear of the Jews, asked Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus; and Pilate gave him permission. So he came and took the body of Jesus. 43 19:39 And Nicodemus, who at first came to Jesus by night, also came, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes,weighingabout a hundred pounds. 43 19:40 Then they took the body of Jesus, and bound it in strips of linen with the spices, as the custom of the Jews is to bury. 43 19:41 Now in the place where He was crucified there was a garden, and in the garden a new tomb in which no one had yet been laid. 43 19:42 So there they laid Jesus, because of the Jews' Preparation Day, because the tomb was nearby. 43 20:1 The first day of the week Mary Magdalene came to the tomb early, while it was still dark, and saw that the stone had been taken away from the tomb. 43 20:2 Then she ran and came to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and said to them, "They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we do not know where they have laid Him." 43 20:3 Peter therefore went out, and the other disciple, and came to the tomb. 43 20:4 So they both ran together, and the other disciple outran Peter and came to the tomb first. 43 20:5 And he, stooping down and looking in, saw the linen cloths lying there; yet he did not go in. 43 20:6 Then Simon Peter came, following him, and went into the tomb; and he saw the linen cloths lying there, 43 20:7 and the handkerchief that had been around His head, not lying with the linen cloths, but folded together in a place by itself. 43 20:8 Then the other disciple, who came to the tomb first, went in also; and he saw and believed. 43 20:9 Because, as yet they did not know the Scripture, that He must rise again from the dead. 43 20:10 Then the disciples went away again to their own homes. 43 20:11 But Mary stood outside by the tomb weeping, and as she wept she stooped down and looked into the tomb. 43 20:12 And she saw two angels in white sitting, one at the head and the other at the feet, where the body of Jesus had laid. 43 20:13 Then they said to her, "Woman, why are you weeping?" She said to them, "Because they have taken away my Lord, and I do not know where they have laid Him." 43 20:14 Now when she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, and did not know that it was Jesus. 43 20:15 Jesus said to her, "Woman, why are you weeping? Whom are you seeking?" She, supposing Him to be the gardener, said to Him, "Sir, if You have carried Him away, tell me where You have laid Him, and I will take Him away." 43 20:16 Jesus said to her, "Mary!" She turned and said to Him, "Rabboni!" (which is to say, Teacher). 43 20:17 Jesus said to her, "Do not cling to Me, because, I have not yet ascended to My Father; but go to My brethren and say to them, 'I am ascending to My Father and your Father, and to My God and your God.'" 43 20:18 Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and that He had spoken these things to her. 43 20:19 Then, the same day at evening, being the first day of the week, when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and said to them, "Peace be with you." 43 20:20 And when He had said this, He showed them His hands and His side. Then the disciples rejoiced when they saw the Lord. 43 20:21 So Jesus said to them again, "Peace be to you! As My Father has sent Me, so I also send you." 43 20:22 And when He had said this, He breathed on them, and said to them, "Receive the Holy Spirit." 43 20:23 If you forgive the sins of any, they are forgiven them; and if you retain the sins of any, they are retained." 43 20:24 Now Thomas, called Didymus, one of the twelve, was not with them when Jesus came. 43 20:25 The other disciples therefore said to him, "We have seen the Lord." But he said to them, "Unless I see in His hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and put my hand into His side, I will not believe." 43 20:26 And after eight days His disciples were again inside, and Thomas with them.ThenJesus came, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst, and said, "Peace be to you!" 43 20:27 Then He said to Thomas, "Reach your finger here, and look at My hands; and reach your hand here, and put it into My side. Do not be faithless, but believing." 43 20:28 And Thomas replied and said to Him, "My Lord and my God!" 43 20:29 Jesus said to him, "Thomas, because you have seen Me, you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen and yet have believed." 43 20:30 And truly Jesus did many other signs in the presence of His disciples, which are not written in this book; 43 20:31 but these are written that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing you may have life through His name. 43 21:1 After these things Jesus showed Himself again to the disciples at the Sea of Tiberias, and in this way He showed Himself: 43 21:2 Simon Peter, Thomas called Didymus, Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two others of His disciples were together. 43 21:3 Simon Peter said to them, "I am going fishing." They said to him, "We are going with you also." They went out and immediately got into the boat, and that night they caught nothing. 43 21:4 But when the morning had now come, Jesus stood on the shore; but the disciples did not know that it was Jesus. 43 21:5 Then Jesus said to them, "Children, have you any food?" They answered Him, "No." 43 21:6 And He said to them, "Cast the net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some." So they cast, and now they were not able to draw it in because of the multitude of fish. 43 21:7 Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, "It is the Lord!" Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he put on his fisherman's coat (because he had removed it), and plunged himself into the sea. 43 21:8 But the other disciples came in the little boat (because they were not far from land, but about two hundred cubits), dragging the net with fish. 43 21:9 Then, as soon as they had come to land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid on it, and bread. 43 21:10 Jesus said to them, "Bring some of the fish which you have just caught." 43 21:11 Simon Peter went up and dragged the net to land, full of large fish, one hundred and fifty three; and although there were so many, the net was not broken. 43 21:12 Jesus said to them, "Come and eat." Yet none of the disciples dared ask Him, "Who are You?" Knowing that it was the Lord. 43 21:13 Jesus then came and took the bread and gave it to them, and likewise the fish. 43 21:14 This is now the third time Jesus showed Himself to His disciples after He was risen from the dead. 43 21:15 So when they had eaten, Jesus said to Simon Peter, "Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me more than these?" He said to Him, "Yes, Lord; You know that I love You." He said to him, "Feed My lambs." 43 21:16 He said to him again a second time, "Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me?" He said to Him, "Yes, Lord; You know that I love You." He said to him, "Feed My sheep." 43 21:17 He said to him the third time, "Simon, son of Jonah, do you love Me?" Peter was grieved because He said to him the third time, "Do you love Me?" And he said to Him, "Lord, You know all things; You know that I love You." Jesus said to him, "Feed My sheep. 43 21:18 Truly, truly, I say to you, when you were younger, you girded yourself and walked where you desired; but when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will gird you and carry you where you do not desire." 43 21:19 This He spoke, signifying by what death he would glorify God. And when He had spoken this, He said to him, "Follow Me." 43 21:20 Then Peter, turning around, saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following, who also had leaned on His breast at the supper, and said, "Lord, who is the one who betrays You?" 43 21:21 Peter, seeing him, said to Jesus, "Lord, what shall this mando?" 43 21:22 Jesus said to him, "If I will that he remains until I come, what is that to you? You follow Me." 43 21:23 Then this saying went out among the brethren that this disciple would not die. Yet Jesus did not say to him that he would not die, but, "If I will that he remain until I come, what is that to you?" 43 21:24 This is the disciple who testifies of these things, and wrote these things; and we know that his testimony is true. 43 21:25 And there are also many other things that Jesus did, which if every one was written, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that would be written. Amen. 44 1:1 The former account I made, O Theophilus, of all that Jesus began both to do and teach, 44 1:2 until the day in which He was taken up, after He through the Holy Spirit had given commandments to the apostles whom He had chosen, 44 1:3 to whom He also presented Himself alive after His passion by many infallible proofs, being seen by them for forty days and speaking of the things pertaining to the kingdom of God. 44 1:4 And being assembled together with them, commanded them that they should not depart from Jerusalem, but to wait for the Promise of the Father, "which," He said, "you have heard from Me; 44 1:5 because, John truly baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit not many days from now." 44 1:6 Therefore, when they had come together, they asked Him, saying, "Lord, will You at this time restore again the kingdom to Israel?" 44 1:7 And He said to them, "It is not for you to know the times or the seasons which the Father has put in His own authority." 44 1:8 But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you; and you will be witnesses to Me in Jerusalem, and also in all Judea and Samaria, and to the end of the earth." 44 1:9 Now when He had spoken these things, while they watched, He was taken up, and a cloud received Him out of their sight. 44 1:10 And while they looked steadfastly toward heaven as He went up, behold, two men stood by them in white clothing, 44 1:11 who also said, "You men of Galilee, why do you stand gazing up into heaven? This same Jesus, who is taken up from you into heaven, will so come in like manner as you saw Him go into heaven." 44 1:12 Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet, which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day's journey. 44 1:13 And when they had entered, they went up into an upper room where, Peter, James, John, and Andrew; Philip and Thomas; Bartholomew and Matthew; Jamesthe sonof Alphaeus and Simon Zelotes, and Judasthe brotherof James, were staying. 44 1:14 These all continued with one accord in prayer and supplication, with the women and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with His brethren. 44 1:15 And in those days Peter stood up in the midst of the disciples (altogether the number of names was about a hundred and twenty), and said, 44 1:16 "Men and brethren, this Scripture had to be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit spoke beforehand through the mouth of David concerning Judas, who became a guide to those who arrested Jesus; 44 1:17 because he was numbered with us and obtained a part in this ministry. 44 1:18 Now this man purchased a field with the wages of iniquity; and falling headlong, he burst open in the middle and all his entrails gushed out. 44 1:19 And it became known to all those dwelling in Jerusalem; so that field is called in their own language, Akel Dama, that is to say, The Field of Blood. 44 1:20 Because, it is written in the Book of Psalms: 'Let his dwelling place be desolate, and let no one live in it'; and, 'Let another take his position.' 44 1:21 Therefore, of these men who have accompanied us the entire time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us, 44 1:22 beginning from the baptism of John to that day when He was taken up from us, one of these must be ordained to be a witness with us of His resurrection." 44 1:23 And they proposed two: Joseph called Barsabas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias. 44 1:24 And they prayed and said, "You, O Lord, who know the hearts of all men, show which of these two You have chosen, 44 1:25 that he may take part in this ministry and apostleship from which Judas by transgression fell, that he might go to his own place." 44 1:26 And they put forward their lots, and the lot fell on Matthias. And he was numbered with the eleven apostles. 44 2:1 Now when the Day of Pentecost had fully come, they were all with one accord in one place. 44 2:2 And suddenly there came a sound from heaven, as of a rushing mighty wind, and it filled the entire house where they were sitting. 44 2:3 Then there appeared to them divided tongues like as of fire, and it sat upon each of them. 44 2:4 And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak with other tongues, as the Spirit gave them utterance. 44 2:5 And there were dwelling in Jerusalem Jews, devout men, from every nation under heaven. 44 2:6 And when this sound occurred, the crowd came together, and were confused, because everyone heard them speak in his own language. 44 2:7 Then they were all amazed and marveled, saying to one another, "Look, are not all these who speak Galileans? 44 2:8 And how is it that we hear, each man in our own language in which we were born? 44 2:9 Parthians and Medes and Elamites, those dwelling in Mesopotamia, in Judea and Cappadocia, in Pontus and Asia, 44 2:10 Phrygia and Pamphylia, in Egypt and in the parts of Libya adjoining Cyrene, visitors from Rome, Jews and proselytes, 44 2:11 Cretans and Arabs, we hear them speaking in our own languages the wonderful works of God." 44 2:12 So they were all amazed and in doubt, saying to one another, "Whatever could this mean?" 44 2:13 Others mocking said, "They are full of new wine." 44 2:14 But Peter, standing up with the eleven, raised his voice and said to them, "You men of Judea and all of you who dwell in Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and heed my words. 44 2:15 Because, these are not drunk, as you suppose, since it is only the third hour of the day. 44 2:16 But this is what was spoken through the prophet Joel: 44 2:17 'And it will come to pass in the last days, says God, I will pour out of My Spirit on all flesh, and your sons and your daughters will prophesy, your young men will see visions, and your old men will dream dreams. 44 2:18 And on My menservants and on My maidservants I will pour out of My Spirit in those days; and they will prophesy. 44 2:19 I will show wonders in heaven above and signs in the earth beneath: Blood and fire and vapor of smoke. 44 2:20 The sun will be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the coming of the great and awesome day of the LORD comes. 44 2:21 And it will come to pass that whoever calls on the name of the LORD will be saved.' 44 2:22 "You men of Israel, hear these words: Jesus of Nazareth, a Man approved by God among you by miracles, wonders, and signs which God did by Him in your midst, as you yourselves also know: 44 2:23 Him, being delivered by the determined purpose and foreknowledge of God, you have taken, and by wicked hands, have crucified, and put to death; 44 2:24 whom God raised up, having loosed the pains of death, because it was not possible that He should be held by it. 44 2:25 Because, David says concerning Him: 'I foresaw the LORD always before my face, because, He is at my right hand, that I may not be shaken. 44 2:26 Therefore my heart rejoiced, and my tongue was glad; moreover my flesh also will rest in hope. 44 2:27 Because, You will not leave my soul in the abode of the dead, nor will You allow Your Holy One to see corruption. 44 2:28 You have made known to me the ways of life; You will make me full of joy in Your presence.' 44 2:29 "Men and brethren, let me speak freely to you of the patriarch David, that he is both dead and buried, and his tomb is with us to this day. 44 2:30 Therefore, being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him that of the fruit of his body, according to the flesh, He would raise up the Christ to sit on his throne, 44 2:31 he, foreseeing this, spoke concerning the resurrection of the Christ, that His soul was not left in the abode of the dead, nor did His flesh see corruption. 44 2:32 This Jesus God has raised up, of which we are all witnesses. 44 2:33 Therefore being exalted to the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, He poured out this which you now see and hear. 44 2:34 "Because, David did not ascend into the heavens, but he says himself: 'The Lord said to my Lord, "Sit at My right hand, 44 2:35 until I make Your enemies Your footstool."' 44 2:36 "Therefore let all the house of Israel know with certainty that God has made this same Jesus, whom you have crucified, both Lord and Christ." 44 2:37 Now when they heard this, they were cut to the heart, and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles, "Men and brethren, what shall we do?" 44 2:38 Then Peter said to them, "Repent, and let every one of you be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins; and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit. 44 2:39 Because, the promise is to you and to your children, and to all who are afar off, that is to as many as the Lord our God will call." 44 2:40 And with many other words he testified and exhorted them, saying, "Save yourselves from this perverse generation." 44 2:41 Then those who gladly received his word were baptized; and that day about three thousand souls were addedto them. 44 2:42 And they continued steadfastly in the apostles' doctrine and fellowship, in the breaking of bread, and in prayers. 44 2:43 Then reverence came upon every soul, and many wonders and signs were done by the apostles. 44 2:44 Now all who believed were together, and had all things in common, 44 2:45 and sold their possessions and goods, and divided them among all the people, as anyone had need. 44 2:46 So continuing daily with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread from house to house, they ate their food with gladness and simplicity of heart, 44 2:47 praising God and having favor with all the people.
