Shall the thing formed say to him who formed it, "Why have you made me like this?" 45 9:21 Does not the potter have power over the clay, from the same lump to make one vessel for honor and another for dishonor? 45 9:22 What if God, wanting to show His wrath and to make His power known, endured with much longsuffering the vessels of wrath prepared for destruction, 45 9:23 and that He might make known the riches of His glory on the vessels of mercy, which He had prepared beforehand for glory, 45 9:24 even us whom He has called, not of the Jews only, but also of the Gentiles? 45 9:25 As He says also in Hosea: "I will call them My people, who were not My people, and her beloved, who was not beloved." 45 9:26 "And it will come to pass that in the place where it was said to them, 'You are not My people,' There they will be called children of the living God." 45 9:27 Isaiah also proclaims concerning Israel: "Though the number of the children of Israel be as the sand of the sea, a remnant will be saved. 45 9:28 Because, He will finish the work and cut it short in righteousness, because the Lord will make a short work upon the earth." 45 9:29 And as Isaiah said before: "Unless the Lord of Sabaoth had left us a seed, we would have become like Sodom, and we would have been made like Gomorrah." 45 9:30 What shall we say then? That Gentiles, who did not pursue righteousness, have attained to righteousness, even the righteousness which is of faith; 45 9:31 but Israel, pursuing the law of righteousness, has not attained to the law of righteousness. 45 9:32 Why? Because,theydid notseek itby faith, but as it were, by the works of the law. Because they stumbled at that stumbling stone. 45 9:33 As it is written: "Behold, I lay in Zion a stumbling stone and rock of offense, and whoever believes on Him will not be put to shame." 45 10:1 Brethren, my heart's desire and prayer to God for Israel is that they might be saved. 45 10:2 Because, I bear them record that they have a zeal for God, but not according to knowledge. 45 10:3 Because, they being ignorant of God's righteousness, and seeking to establish their own righteousness, have not submitted themselves to the righteousness of God. 45 10:4 Because Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes. 45 10:5 Because, Moses writes about the righteousness which is of the law, "That the man who does those things shall live by them." 45 10:6 But the righteousness that is of faith speaks in this way, "Do not say in your heart, 'Who shall ascend into heaven?'" (that is, to bring Christ down from above) 45 10:7 or, "'Who shall descend into the abyss?'" (that is, to bring Christ up from the dead). 45 10:8 But what does it say? "The word is near you, even in your mouth and in your heart" (that is, the word of faith which we preach): 45 10:9 that if you confess with your mouth the Lord Jesus and will believe in your heart that God has raised Him from the dead, you will be saved. 45 10:10 Because, with the heart one believes to righteousness, and with the mouth confession is made to salvation. 45 10:11 Because, the Scripture says, "Whoever believes on Him will not be put to shame." 45 10:12 Because, there is no distinction between the Jew and the Greek, because the same Lord over all is rich to all who call upon Him. 45 10:13 Because "whoever calls on the name of the Lord will be saved." 45 10:14 How then shall they call on Him in whom they have not believed? And how shall they believe in Him of whom they have not heard? And how shall they hear without a preacher? 45 10:15 And how shall they preach unless they are sent? As it is written: "How beautiful are the feet of those who preach the gospel of peace, and bring glad tidings of good things!" 45 10:16 But they have not all obeyed the gospel. Because, Isaiah says, "LORD, who has believed our report?" 45 10:17 So then faith comes by hearing, and hearing by the word of God. 45 10:18 But I say, have they not heard? Yes indeed: "Their sound has gone out to all the earth, and their words to the ends of the world." 45 10:19 But I say, did Israel not know? First Moses says: "I will provoke you to jealousy by those who are not a people, and I will move you to anger by a foolish nation." 45 10:20 But Isaiah is very bold and says: "I was found by those who did not seek Me; I was made manifest to those who did not ask for Me." 45 10:21 But to Israel he says: "All day long I have stretched out My hands to a disobedient and contrary people." 45 11:1 I say then, has God cast away His people? God forbid! Because, I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin. 45 11:2 God has not cast away His people whom He foreknew. Or do you not know what the Scripture says of Elijah, how he makes intercession to God against Israel, saying, 45 11:3 "LORD, they have killed Your prophets and torn down Your altars, and I alone am left, and they seek my life"? 45 11:4 But what does God reply to him? "I have reserved for Myself seven thousand men who have not bowed the knee tothe image ofBaal." 45 11:5 Even so then, at this present time there is a remnant according to the election of grace. 45 11:6 And if by grace, then it is no longer of works; otherwise grace is no longer grace. But if it is of works, it is no longer grace; otherwise work is no longer work. 45 11:7 What then? Israel has not obtained what it seeks after; but the elect have obtained it, and the rest were blinded. 45 11:8 Just as it is written: "God has given them a spirit of slumber, eyes that they should not see and ears that they should not hear, to this very day." 45 11:9 And David says: "Let their table become a snare and a trap, a stumbling block and a retribution to them. 45 11:10 Let their eyes be darkened, so that they cannot see, and bow down their back always." 45 11:11 I say then, have they stumbled that they should fall? God forbid! Butratherthrough their fall, salvationhas cometo the Gentiles, to provoke them to jealousy, 45 11:12 Now if their fall became riches of the world, and their failure the riches of the Gentiles, how much more their fullness! 45 11:13 Because, I speak to you Gentiles; inasmuch as I am an apostle to the Gentiles, I magnify my ministry, 45 11:14 if by any means I may provoke to jealousy those who are my flesh and might save some of them. 45 11:15 Because, if their rejection is the reconciling of the world, what shalltheiracceptance be but life from the dead? 45 11:16 Because, if the firstfruit is holy, the lump is alsoholy; and if the root is holy, soarethe branches. 45 11:17 And if some of the branches were broken off, and you, being a wild olive tree, were grafted in among them, and with them became a partaker of the root and nourishment of the olive tree, 45 11:18 do not boast against the branches. But if you do boast, remember that you do not support the root, but the root supports you. 45 11:19 You will say then, "Branches were broken off that I might be grafted in." 45 11:20 Wellsaid. Because of unbelief they were broken off, and you stand by faith. Do not be highminded, but have reverence. 45 11:21 Because, if God did not spare the natural branches, He may not spare you either. 45 11:22 Therefore consider the goodness and severity of God: on those who fell, severity; but toward you, goodness, if you continue in His goodness. Otherwise you also will be cut off. 45 11:23 And they also, if they do not continue in unbelief, will be grafted in, because God is able to graft them in again. 45 11:24 Because, if you were cut out of the olive tree which is wild by nature, and were grafted contrary to nature into a good olive tree, how much more will these, who are natural branches, be grafted into their own olive tree? 45 11:25 Because, I do not desire, brethren, that you should be ignorant of this mystery, lest you should be wise in your own opinion, that blindness in part has happened to Israel until the fullness of the Gentiles has come in. 45 11:26 And so all Israel will be saved, as it is written: "The Deliverer will come out of Zion, and He will turn away ungodliness from Jacob; 45 11:27 Because, this is My covenant with them, when I will take away their sins." 45 11:28 Concerning the gospel they are enemies for your sake, but concerning the election they are belovedbecause ofthe fathers. 45 11:29 Because the gifts and the calling of God are irrevocable. 45 11:30 Because, as you previously did not believe God, yet have now obtained mercy through their unbelief, 45 11:31 even so these also have now not believed, that through the mercy shown you they also may obtain mercy. 45 11:32 Because, God has concluded them all in unbelief, that He might have mercy on all. 45 11:33 Oh, the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! How unsearchable are His judgments and His ways past finding out! 45 11:34 "Because, who has known the mind of the LORD? Or who has become His counselor?" 45 11:35 "Or who has first given to Him and it will be repaid back to him?" 45 11:36 Because, of Him and through Him and to Him are all things, to whom be glory forever. Amen. 45 12:1 I urge you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that you present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God,which isyour reasonable service. 45 12:2 And do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove what is that good and acceptable and perfect will of God. 45 12:3 Because I say, through the grace given to me, to everyone who is among you, not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think, but to think soberly, just as God has dealt to each one a measure of faith. 45 12:4 Because, as we have many members in one body, but all the members do not have the same function, 45 12:5 so we, being many, are one body in Christ, and individually members of one another. 45 12:6 Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us: if prophecy, let us prophesy according to the proportion of faith; 45 12:7 or ministry,let us use itin our ministering; he who teaches, in teaching; 45 12:8 he who exhorts, in exhortation; he who gives,let him do itwith liberality; he who leads, with diligence; he who shows mercy, with cheerfulness. 45 12:9 Let love be without hypocrisy. Abhor what is evil. Cling to what is good. 45 12:10 Be kindly affectionate to one another with brotherly love, in honor giving preference to one another; 45 12:11 not lagging in diligence, fervent in spirit, serving the Lord; 45 12:12 rejoicing in hope, patient in tribulation, continuing steadfastly in prayer; 45 12:13 distributing to the needs of the saints, given to hospitality. 45 12:14 Bless those who persecute you; bless and do not curse. 45 12:15 Rejoice with those who rejoice, and weep with those who weep. 45 12:16 Be of the same mind toward one another. Do not set your mind on high things, but associate with the humble. Do not be wise in your own opinion. 45 12:17 Repay no one evil for evil. Provide things that are honest in the sight of everyone. 45 12:18 If it is possible, as much as depends on you, live peaceably with everyone. 45 12:19 Beloved, do not avenge yourselves, but rather give place to wrath; because it is written, "Vengeance is Mine, I will repay," says the Lord. 45 12:20 Therefore "If your enemy hungers, feed him; if he thirsts, give him a drink; because in so doing you will heap coals of fire on his head." 45 12:21 Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good. 45 13:1 Let every soul be subject to the governing authorities. Because, there is no authority except from God; the authorities that exist are appointed by God. 45 13:2 Therefore whoever resists the authority resists the ordinance of God, and those who resist will bring damnation on themselves. 45 13:3 Because, rulers are not a terror to good conduct, but to evil. Do you want to be unafraid of the authority? Do what is good, and you will have praise from the same. 45 13:4 Because, he is God's minister to you for good. But if you do that which is evil, be afraid; because he does not bear the sword in vain; because he is God's minister, an avengerto executewrath on him who does evil. 45 13:5 Therefore you must be subject, not only because of wrath but also for conscience' sake. 45 13:6 Because, for this reason you also pay taxes, because they are God's ministers attending continually to this very thing. 45 13:7 Render therefore to all their due: taxes to whom taxes are due, customs to whom customs, reverence to whom reverence, honor to whom honor. 45 13:8 Owe no one anything except to love one another, because he who loves another has fulfilled the law. 45 13:9 Becausethese, "You shall not commit adultery," "You shall not murder," "You shall not steal," "You shall not bear false witness," "You shall not covet," and if there is any other commandment, are all summed up in this saying, namely, "You shall love your neighbor as yourself." 45 13:10 Love does no harm to a neighbor; therefore love is the fulfillment of the law. 45 13:11 And this, knowing the time, that now it is high time to awake out of sleep; because now our salvation is nearer than when we first believed. 45 13:12 The night is well advanced, the day is at hand. Therefore let us cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armor of light. 45 13:13 Let us walk honestly, as in the day, not in revelry and drunkenness, not in lewdness and lust, not in strife and envy. 45 13:14 But you, put on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make no provision for the flesh, tofulfill itslusts. 45 14:1 Receive one who is weak in the faith, but not to disputes over doubtful things. 45 14:2 Because, one believes he may eat all things, but he who is weak eats only vegetables. 45 14:3 Let not him who eats despise him who does not eat, and let not him who does not eat judge him who eats; because God has received him. 45 14:4 Who are you to judge another's servant? To his own master he stands or falls. Indeed, he will be able to stand, because God is able to make him stand. 45 14:5 One person esteems one day above another; another esteems every dayalike. Let each be fully convinced in his own mind. 45 14:6 He who observes the day, observes it to the Lord; and he who does not observe the day, to the Lord he does not observe it. He who eats, eats to the Lord, because he gives God thanks; and he who does not eat, to the Lord he does not eat, and gives God thanks. 45 14:7 Because none of us lives to himself, and no one dies to himself. 45 14:8 Because, if we live, we live to the Lord; and if we die, we die to the Lord. So whether we live or die, we are the Lord's. 45 14:9 Because, for this purpose Christ both died, and rose, and revived, that He might be Lord of both the dead and the living. 45 14:10 But why do you judge your brother? Or why do you show contempt for your brother? Because we will all stand before the judgment seat of Christ. 45 14:11 Because, it is written: "As I live, says the LORD, every knee will bow to Me, and every tongue will confess to God." 45 14:12 So then each of us will give account of himself to God. 45 14:13 Therefore let us not judge one another anymore, but rather resolve this, not to put a stumbling block or a reason to fall in his brother's way. 45 14:14 I know and am convinced by the Lord Jesus that there is nothing unclean of itself; but to him who considers anything to be unclean, to him it is unclean. 45 14:15 But if your brother is grieved because ofyourfood, you are no longer walking in love. Do not destroy with your food the one who Christ died for. 45 14:16 Therefore do not let your good be spoken of as evil; 45 14:17 because, the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking, but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit. 45 14:18 Because, he who serves Christ in these things is acceptable to God and approved by men. 45 14:19 Therefore let us pursue the things which make for peace and the things by which one may edify another. 45 14:20 Do not destroy the work of God for the sake of food. All things indeed are pure, but it is evil for the man who eats with offense. 45 14:21 It is good neither to eat meat nor drink grape juice nor doanythingby which your brother stumbles or is offended or is made weak. 45 14:22 Do you have faith? Have it to yourself before God. Happy is he who does not condemn himself in thosethings whichhe approves. 45 14:23 But he who doubts is damned if he eats, because he does noteatfrom faith; because whatever is not from faith is sin. 45 15:1 We then who are strong ought to bear with the failures of the weak, and not to please ourselves. 45 15:2 Let each of us please his neighbor forhisgood, leading to edification. 45 15:3 Because, even Christ did not please Himself; but as it is written, "The reproaches of those who reproached You fell on Me." 45 15:4 Because, whatever things were written beforehand were written for our learning, that we through the patience and comfort of the Scriptures might have hope. 45 15:5 Now may the God of patience and comfort grant you to be like minded toward one another, according to Christ Jesus, 45 15:6 that you may with one mind and one mouth glorify God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ. 45 15:7 You therefore, receive one another, just as Christ also received us, to the glory of God. 45 15:8 Now I say that Jesus Christ has become a servant to the circumcision for the truth of God, to confirm the promisesmadeto the fathers, 45 15:9 and that the Gentiles might glorify God for His mercy, as it is written: "For this reason I will confess to You among the Gentiles, and sing to Your name." 45 15:10 And again he says: "Rejoice, O Gentiles, with His people!" 45 15:11 And again: "Praise the LORD, all you Gentiles! Laud Him, all you people!" 45 15:12 And again, Isaiah says: "There will be a root of Jesse; and He who will rise to reign over the Gentiles, in Him the Gentiles will trust." 45 15:13 Now may the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that you may abound in hope through the power of the Holy Spirit. 45 15:14 Now I myself am persuaded concerning you, my brethren, that you also are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another. 45 15:15 Nevertheless, brethren, I have written more boldly to you on some points, as reminding you, because of the grace given to me by God, 45 15:16 that I might be a minister of Jesus Christ to the Gentiles, ministering the gospel of God, that the offering up of the Gentiles might be acceptable, being sanctified by the Holy Spirit. 45 15:17 Therefore I have reason to glory through Jesus Christ in those things which pertain to God. 45 15:18 Because, I will not dare to speak of any of those things which Christ has not accomplished through me, in word and deed, to make the Gentiles obedient, 45 15:19 in mighty signs and wonders, by the power of the Spirit of God, so that from Jerusalem and round about to Illyricum I have fully preached the gospel of Christ. 45 15:20 Yes, so I have striven to preach the gospel, not where Christ was named, lest I should build on another man's foundation, 45 15:21 but as it is written: "To whom He was not announced, they will see; and those who have not heard will understand." 45 15:22 For this reason I also have been often hindered from coming to you. 45 15:23 But now no longer having a place in these parts, and having a great desire these many years to come to you, 45 15:24 whenever I take my journey to Spain, I will come to you. Because, I hope to see you on my journey, and to be helped on my way there by you, once I have enjoyed your company for a while. 45 15:25 But now I am going to Jerusalem to minister to the saints. 45 15:26 Because, it pleased those from Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor among the saints who are in Jerusalem. 45 15:27 It has pleased them indeed, and they are their debtors. Because, if the Gentiles have been partakers of their spiritual things, their duty is also to minister to them in material things. 45 15:28 Therefore, when I have performed this and have sealed to them this fruit, I will come via you into Spain. 45 15:29 But I know that when I come to you, I will come in the fullness of the blessing of the gospel of Christ. 45 15:30 Now I urge you, brethren, for the sake of the Lord Jesus Christ, and for the love of the Spirit, that you strive together with me in prayers to God for me, 45 15:31 that I may be delivered from those in Judea who do not believe, and that my service which I have for Jerusalem may be accepted by the saints, 45 15:32 that I may come to you with joy by the will of God, and may be refreshed together with you. 45 15:33 Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen. 45 16:1 I commend to you Phoebe our sister, who is a servant of the church in Cenchrea, 45 16:2 that you may receive her in the Lord in a manner worthy of the saints, and that you assist her in whatever business she has need of you; because she has been a helper of many and of myself also. 45 16:3 Greet Priscilla and Aquila, my helpers in Christ Jesus, 45 16:4 who risked their own necks for my life, to whom not only I give thanks, but also all the churches of the Gentiles. 45 16:5 Likewisegreetthe church that is in their house. Greet my beloved Epaenetus, who is the firstfruits of Achaia to Christ. 45 16:6 Greet Mary, who labored much for us. 45 16:7 Greet Andronicus and Junia, my countrymen and my fellow prisoners, who are of note among the apostles, who also were in Christ before me. 45 16:8 Greet Amplias, my beloved in the Lord. 45 16:9 Greet Urbanus, our helper in Christ, and Stachys, my beloved. 45 16:10 Greet Apelles, approved in Christ. Greet those who are of the household of Aristobulus. 45 16:11 Greet Herodion, my countryman. Greet those who are of the household of Narcissus who are in the Lord. 45 16:12 Greet Tryphena and Tryphosa, who labor in the Lord. Greet the beloved Persis, who labored much in the Lord. 45 16:13 Greet Rufus, chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine. 45 16:14 Greet Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Hermes, and the brethren who are with them. 45 16:15 Greet Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints who are with them. 45 16:16 Greet one another with a holy kiss. The churches of Christ greet you. 45 16:17 Now I urge you, brethren, note those who cause divisions and offenses, contrary to the doctrine which you learned, and avoid them. 45 16:18 Because, those who are such do not serve our Lord Jesus Christ, but their own belly, and by smooth words and flattering speech deceive the hearts of the simple. 45 16:19 Because, your obedience has become known to everyone. Therefore I am glad on your behalf; but I want you to be wise in what is good, and simple concerning evil. 45 16:20 And the God of peace will crush Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen. 45 16:21 Timothy, my fellow worker, and Lucius, Jason, and Sosipater, my countrymen, greet you. 45 16:22 I, Tertius, who wrote this letter, greet you in the Lord. 45 16:23 Gaius, my host and the host of the entire church, greets you. Erastus, the treasurer of the city, greets you, and Quartus, a brother. 45 16:24 The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen. 45 16:25 Now to Him who is mighty to establish you according to my gospel and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery kept secret since the ages began 45 16:26 but is now made manifest, and by the scriptures of the prophets, made known to all nations, according to the commandment of the everlasting God, for obedience to the faith, 45 16:27 to God, alone wise, be glory through Jesus Christ forever. Amen. 46 1:1 Paul, calledto bean apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, and Sosthenesourbrother, 46 1:2 To the church of God which is at Corinth, to those who are sanctified in Christ Jesus, calledto besaints, with all who in every place call on the name of Jesus Christ our Lord, both theirs and ours: 46 1:3 Grace be to you and peace from God our Father andfromthe Lord Jesus Christ. 46 1:4 I thank my God always concerning you for the grace of God which was given to you by Jesus Christ, 46 1:5 that you are enriched in everything by Him in all utterance and in all knowledge, 46 1:6 even as the testimony of Christ was confirmed in you, 46 1:7 so that you come short in no gift, waiting for the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, 46 1:8 who will also confirm you to the end, that you may be blameless in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ. 46 1:9 God is faithful, by whom you were called into the fellowship of His Son, Jesus Christ our Lord. 46 1:10 Now I plead with you, brethren, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you all speak the same thing, and that there be no divisions among you, but that you be perfectly joined together in the same mind and in the same judgment. 46 1:11 Because, it has been declared to me concerning you, my brethren, by those of Chloe's household, that there are contentions among you. 46 1:12 Now I say this, that each of you says, "I am of Paul," or "I am of Apollos," or "I am of Cephas," or "I am of Christ." 46 1:13 Is Christ divided? Was Paul crucified for you? Or were you baptized in the name of Paul? 46 1:14 I thank God that I baptized none of you except Crispus and Gaius, 46 1:15 lest anyone should say that I had baptized in my own name. 46 1:16 And, I also baptized the household of Stephanas. Besides, I do not know whether I baptized any other. 46 1:17 Because, Christ did not send me to baptize, but to preach the gospel, not with wisdom of words, lest the cross of Christ should be made of no effect. 46 1:18 Because, the preaching of the cross is foolishness to those who perish, but to us who are saved it is the power of God. 46 1:19 Because it is written: "I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent." 46 1:20 Where is the wise? Where is the scribe? Where is the disputer of this age? Has not God made foolish the wisdom of this world? 46 1:21 Because since, in the wisdom of God, the world by wisdom did not know God, it pleased God through the foolishness of preaching to save those who believe. 46 1:22 Because, Jews request a sign, and Greeks seek after wisdom; 46 1:23 but we preach Christ crucified, to the Jews a stumbling block and to the Greeks foolishness, 46 1:24 but to those who are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God and the wisdom of God. 46 1:25 Because, the foolishness of God is wiser than men, and the weakness of God is stronger than men. 46 1:26 Because, you see your calling, brethren, that not many wise according to the flesh, not many mighty, not many noble,are called. 46 1:27 But God has chosen the foolish things of the world to put to shame the wise, and God has chosen the weak things of the world to put to shame the things which are mighty; 46 1:28 and the base things of the world and the things which are despised God has chosen,yesand the things which are not, to bring to nothing the things that are, 46 1:29 that no flesh should glory in His presence. 46 1:30 But of Him you are in Christ Jesus, who, from God, became for us wisdom and righteousness and sanctification and redemption, 46 1:31 that, according to as it is written, "He who glories, let him glory in the Lord." 46 2:1 And I, brethren, when I came to you, did not come with excellence of speech or of wisdom declaring to you the testimony of God. 46 2:2 Because, I determined not to know anything among you except Jesus Christ and Him crucified. 46 2:3 And I was with you in weakness, in fear, and in much trembling. 46 2:4 And my speech and my preaching was not with persuasive words of human wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power, 46 2:5 that your faith should not stand in the wisdom of men but in the power of God. 46 2:6 However, we speak wisdom among those who are perfect, yet not the wisdom of this age, nor of the rulers of this age, who come to nothing. 46 2:7 But we speak the wisdom of God in a mystery,eventhe hiddenwisdomwhich God ordained before the ages for our glory, 46 2:8 which none of the rulers of this age knew; because, had they known it, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory. 46 2:9 But as it is written: "Eye has not seen, nor ear heard, nor have entered into the heart of man the things which God has prepared for those who love Him." 46 2:10 But God has revealedthemto us by His Spirit. Because, the Spirit searches all things, yes, the deep things of God. 46 2:11 Because, what man knows the things of a man except the spirit of the man which is in him? Even so no one knows the things of God except the Spirit of God. 46 2:12 Now we have received, not the spirit of the world, but the Spirit who is from God, that we might know the things that have been freely given to us from God. 46 2:13 These things we also speak, not in words which man's wisdom teaches but which the Holy Spirit teaches, comparing spiritual things with spiritual. 46 2:14 But the natural man does not receive the things of the Spirit of God, because they are foolishness to him; nor can he knowthem, because they are spiritually discerned. 46 2:15 But he who is spiritual judges all things, yet he himself is judged by no one. 46 2:16 Because, "who has known the mind of the Lord that he may instruct Him?" But we have the mind of Christ. 46 3:1 And I, brethren, could not speak to you as to spiritual people but as to carnal, even as to babes in Christ. 46 3:2 I have fed you with milk and not with solid food; because until now you were not ableto receive it, and even now you are still not able; 46 3:3 because you are still carnal. Because where there is envy, strife, and divisions among you, are you not carnal and walk like men? 46 3:4 Because when one says, "I am of Paul," and another, "I am of Apollos," are you not carnal? 46 3:5 Who then is Paul, and who is Apollos, but ministers by whom you believed, as the Lord gave to each person? 46 3:6 I have planted, Apollos watered, but God gave the increase. 46 3:7 So then neither he who plants is anything, nor he who waters, but God who gives the increase. 46 3:8 Now he who plants and he who waters are one, and each one will receive his own reward according to his own labor. 46 3:9 Because, we are God's coworkers; you are God's field, you are God's building. 46 3:10 According to the grace of God which was given to me, as a wise master builder I have laid the foundation, and another builds on it. But let each one take heed how he builds on it. 46 3:11 Because no other foundation can anyone lay than that which is laid, which is Jesus Christ. 46 3:12 Now if anyone builds on this foundation with gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, straw, 46 3:13 each one's work will be revealed; because the Day will declare it, because it will be revealed by fire; and the fire will test each one's work, of what sort it is. 46 3:14 If anyone's work which he has built on it endures, he will receive a reward. 46 3:15 If anyone's work is burned, he will suffer loss; but he himself will be saved, yet so as through fire. 46 3:16 Do you not know that you are the temple of God and that the Spirit of God dwells in you? 46 3:17 If anyone defiles the temple of God, God will destroy him. Because the temple of God is holy, whichtempleyou are. 46 3:18 Let no one deceive himself. If anyone among you seems to be wise in this age, let him become a fool that he may be wise. 46 3:19 Because the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. Because it is written, "He traps the wise in their own craftiness"; 46 3:20 and again, "The LORD knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are vain." 46 3:21 Therefore let no one boast in men. Because all things are yours: 46 3:22 whether Paul or Apollos or Cephas, or the world or life or death, or things present or things to come; all are yours. 46 3:23 And you are Christ's, and ChristisGod's. 46 4:1 Let a man so consider us, as servants of Christ and stewards of the mysteries of God. 46 4:2 Moreover it is required in stewards that one be found faithful. 46 4:3 But with me it is a very small thing that I should be judged by you or by a man's judgment. In fact, I do not even judge myself. 46 4:4 Because, I know of nothing against myself, yet I am not justified by this; but He who judges me is the Lord. 46 4:5 Therefore judge nothing before the time, until the Lord comes, who will both bring to light the hidden things of darkness and reveal the counsels of the hearts. And then each one's praise will come from God. 46 4:6 Now these things, brethren, I have figuratively transferred to myself and Apollos for your sakes, that you may learn in us not to thinkabout people beyond what is written, that none of you may be puffed up on behalf of one against the other. 46 4:7 Because who makes you differfrom another? And what do you have that you did not receive? Now if you did indeed receive it, why do you boast as if you had not received it? 46 4:8 You are already full! You are already rich! You have reigned as kings without us; and indeed I could wish you did reign, that we also might reign with you! 46 4:9 Because, I think that God has displayed us, the apostles, last, as men condemned to death; because we have been made a spectacle to the world, to angels and to men. 46 4:10 Wearefools for Christ's sake, but youarewise in Christ! Weareweak, but youarestrong! You are honorable, but we are despised! 46 4:11 Even to the present hour we both hunger and thirst, and we are unclothed, and beaten, and have no permanent home. 46 4:12 And we labor, working with our own hands. Being reviled, we bless; being persecuted, we endure it; 46 4:13 being defamed, we entreat. We have been made as the scum of the earth, andarethe offscouring of all things to this day. 46 4:14 I do not write these things to shame you, but as my beloved sons I warn you. 46 4:15 Because, though you might have ten thousand instructors in Christ, yetyoudo nothavemany fathers; because in Christ Jesus I have begotten you through the gospel. 46 4:16 Therefore I urge you all, be followers of me. 46 4:17 For this reason I have sent Timothy to you, who is my beloved and faithful son in the Lord, who will remind you of my ways which are in Christ, as I teach everywhere in every church. 46 4:18 Now some are puffed up, as though I were not coming to you. 46 4:19 But I will come to you shortly, if the Lord wills, and I will know, not the speech of those who are puffed up, but the power. 46 4:20 Because the kingdom of God is not in word but in power. 46 4:21 What do you want? Shall I come to you with a rod, or in love and in the spirit of meekness? 46 5:1 It is commonly reportedthat there issexual immorality among you, and such sexual immorality as is not even named among the Gentiles, that a man has his father's wife! 46 5:2 And you are puffed up, and have not rather mourned, that he who has done this deed might be taken away from among you. 46 5:3 Because, I indeed, as absent in body but present in spirit, have already judged (as though I were present) concerning him who has so done this deed, 46 5:4 in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, when you are gathered together, along with my spirit, with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ, 46 5:5 to deliver sucha oneto Satan for the destruction of the flesh, that his spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus. 46 5:6 Your glorying is not good. Do you not know that a little leaven leavens the entire lump? 46 5:7 Therefore purge out the old leaven, that you may be a new lump, since you truly are unleavened. Because,evenChrist, our Passover, was sacrificed for us. 46 5:8 Therefore let us keep the feast, not with old leaven, nor with the leaven of malice and wickedness, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth. 46 5:9 I wrote to you in a letter not to keep company with sexually immoral people. 46 5:10 Yet I certainly did not mean with the sexually immoral people of this world, or with the covetous, or extortioners, or idolaters, since then you would need to go out of the world. 46 5:11 But now I have written to you not to keep company with anyone that is named a brother, who is sexually immoral, or covetous, or an idolater, or a reviler, or a drunkard, or an extortioner; not even to eat with such a person. 46 5:12 Because, what have I to do with judging those also who are outside? Do you not judge those who are inside? 46 5:13 But those who are outside God judges. Therefore "put away from yourselves that evil person." 46 6:1 Dare any of you, having a matter against another, go to law before the unrighteous, and not before the saints? 46 6:2 Do you not know that the saints will judge the world? And if the world will be judged by you, are you unworthy to judge the smallest matters? 46 6:3 Do you not know that we will judge angels? How much more, things that pertain to this life? 46 6:4 If then you have judgments concerning things pertaining to this life, appoint those who are least esteemed in the church to judge! 46 6:5 I say this to your shame. Is it so, that there is not a wise man among you, not even one, who will be able to judge between his brethren? 46 6:6 But brother goes to law against brother, and that before the unbelievers! 46 6:7 Now therefore, it is already an utter failure for you, because you go to law against one another. Why do you not rather accept wrong? Why do you not rather allow yourselves be defrauded? 46 6:8 No, you do wrong and defraud, and that to your brethren! 46 6:9 Do you not know that the unrighteous will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived. Neither fornicators, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor effeminate, nor abusers of themselves with mankind, 46 6:10 nor thieves, nor covetous, nor drunkards, nor revilers, nor extortioners will inherit the kingdom of God. 46 6:11 And such were some of you. But you are washed, but you are sanctified, but you are justified in the name of the Lord Jesus and by the Spirit of our God. 46 6:12 All things are lawful for me, but all things are not helpful. All things are lawful for me, but I will not be brought under the authority of any. 46 6:13 Foods for the stomach and the stomach for foods, but God will destroy both it and them. Now the bodyisnot for sexual immorality but for the Lord, and the Lord for the body. 46 6:14 And God has both raised up the Lord and will also raise us up by His own power. 46 6:15 Do you not know that your bodies are members of Christ? Shall I then take the members of Christ and make them the members of a harlot? God forbid! 46 6:16 Or do you not know that he who is joined to a harlot is one body with her? Because "the two," He says, "will be one flesh." 46 6:17 But he who is joined to the Lord is one spirit with Him. 46 6:18 Flee sexual immorality. Every sin that a man does is outside the body, but he who commits sexual immorality sins against his own body. 46 6:19 Or do you not know that your body is the temple of the Holy Spiritwho isin you, whom you have from God, and you are not your own? 46 6:20 Because, you were bought at a price; therefore glorify God in your body and in your spirit, which are God's. 46 7:1 Now concerning the things of which you wrote to me: It is good for a man not to touch a woman. 46 7:2 Nevertheless,to avoidsexual immorality, let each man have his own wife, and let each woman have her own husband. 46 7:3 Let the husband render to his wife the affection due her, and likewise also the wife to her husband. 46 7:4 The wife does not have authority over her own body, but the husband does. And likewise the husband does not have authority over his own body, but the wife does. 46 7:5 Do not deprive one another except it be with consent for a time, that you may give yourselves to fasting and prayer; and come together again so that Satan does not tempt you because of your lack of self control. 46 7:6 But I say this by permission, and not as a commandment. 46 7:7 Because I wish that all men were even as I myself. But each one has his own gift from God, one in this manner and another in that. 46 7:8 Therefore, I say to the unmarried and to the widows: It is good for them if they remain even as I am; 46 7:9 but if they cannot exercise self control, let them marry. Because it is better to marry than to burn with passion. 46 7:10 Now to the married I command,yetnot I but the Lord: A wife is not to depart from her husband. 46 7:11 But even if she does depart, let her remain unmarried or be reconciled to her husband. And do not let a husband divorce his wife. 46 7:12 But to the rest I, not the Lord, say: If any brother has a wife who does not believe, and she is willing to live with him, let him not divorce her. 46 7:13 And a woman who has a husband who does not believe, if he is willing to live with her, let her not divorce him. 46 7:14 Because, the unbelieving husband is sanctified by the wife, and the unbelieving wife is sanctified by the husband; otherwise your children would be unclean, but now they are holy. 46 7:15 But if the unbeliever departs, let him depart; a brother or a sister is not under bondage in suchcases. But God has called us to peace. 46 7:16 Because, how do you know, O wife, whether you will save your husband? Or how do you know, O husband, whether you will save your wife? 46 7:17 But as God has distributed to each one, as the Lord has called each one, so let him walk. And so I ordain in all the churches. 46 7:18 Was anyone called while circumcised? Let him not become uncircumcised. Was anyone called while uncircumcised? Let him not be circumcised. 46 7:19 Circumcision is nothing and uncircumcision is nothing, but keeping the commandments of God. 46 7:20 Let each one remain in the same calling in which he was called. 46 7:21 Were you calledwhilea servant? Do not be concerned about it; but if you can be made free, rather use it. 46 7:22 Because he who is called in the Lordwhilea servant is the Lord's freedman. Likewise he who is calledwhilefree is Christ's servant. 46 7:23 You were bought with a price; do not become servants of men. 46 7:24 Brethren, let each one remain with God in that state in which he was called. 46 7:25 Now concerning virgins: I have no commandment from the Lord; yet I give my judgment as one who has received mercy from the Lord to be faithful. 46 7:26 I suppose therefore that this is good because of the present distress,I saythat it is good for a man to remain as he is: 46 7:27 Are you bound to a wife? Do not seek to be loosed. Are you loosed from a wife? Do not seek a wife. 46 7:28 But even if you do marry, you have not sinned; and if a virgin marries, she has not sinned. Nevertheless such will have trouble in the flesh, but I would spare you that. 46 7:29 But this I say, brethren, the time is short, so that from now on even those who have wives should be as though they had none, 46 7:30 those who weep as though they did not weep, those who rejoice as though they did not rejoice, those who buy as though they did not possess, 46 7:31 and those who use this world as not misusing it. Because the form of this world is passing away. 46 7:32 But I want you to be without worry. He who is unmarried cares for the things that pertain to the Lord, how he may please the Lord. 46 7:33 But he who is married cares about the things that are of the world, how he may please his wife. 46 7:34 There is also a difference between a wife and a virgin. The unmarried woman cares about the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and in spirit. But she who is married cares about the things of the world, how she may please her husband. 46 7:35 And this I say for your own profit, not that I may put a snare on you, but for what is proper, and that you may serve the Lord without distraction. 46 7:36 But if any man thinks he is behaving improperly toward his virgin, if she is past the flower of her age, and thus it must be, let him do what he wishes. He does not sin; let them marry. 46 7:37 Nevertheless he who stands steadfast in his heart, having no necessity, but has power over his own will, and has so determined in his heart that he will keep his virgin, does well. 46 7:38 So then he who gives her in marriage does well, but he who does not give her in marriage does better. 46 7:39 A wife is bound by law as long as her husband lives; but if her husband dies, she is at liberty to be married to whom she wills, only in the Lord. 46 7:40 But she is happier if she remains as she is, according to my judgment; and I think also that I have the Spirit of God. 46 8:1 Now concerning things offered to idols: We know that we all have knowledge. Knowledge puffs up, but love edifies. 46 8:2 And if anyone thinks that he knows anything, he knows nothing yet as he ought to know. 46 8:3 But if anyone loves God, this one is known of Him. 46 8:4 Therefore concerning the eating of things that are offered in sacrifice to idols, we know that an idol is nothing in the world, and that there is no other God but one. 46 8:5 Because, even if there are so called gods, whether in heaven or on earth (as there are many gods and many lords), 46 8:6 yet for us there is only one God, the Father, of whom are all things, and we in Him; and one Lord Jesus Christ, by whom are all things, even ourselves by Him. 46 8:7 However, not everyone possesses that knowledge; but some, with consciousness of the idol, until now eat it as a thing offered to an idol; and their conscience, being weak, is defiled. 46 8:8 But food does not commend us to God; because neither if we eat are we better off, nor if we do not eat are we worse off. 46 8:9 But beware lest somehow this liberty of yours becomes a stumbling block to those who are weak. 46 8:10 Because, if anyone sees you who have knowledge eating in an idol's temple, shall not the conscience of him who is weak be emboldened to eat those things offered to idols? 46 8:11 And because of your knowledge shall the weak brother perish, for whom Christ died? 46 8:12 But when you all sin like this against the brethren, and wound their weak conscience, you all sin against Christ. 46 8:13 Therefore, if food makes my brother stumble, I will never eat meat while the world stands, lest I make my brother stumble. 46 9:1 Am I not an apostle? Am I not free? Have I not seen Jesus Christ our Lord? Are you not my work in the Lord? 46 9:2 If I am not an apostle to others, yet doubtless I am to you. Because, you are the seal of my apostleship in the Lord. 46 9:3 My defense to those who examine me is this: 46 9:4 Do we have no right to eat and drink? 46 9:5 Do we have no right to take along a sister, a wife, as do also the other apostles, the brethren of the Lord, and Cephas? 46 9:6 Or is it only Barnabas and I who have no right to refrain from working? 46 9:7 Who ever goes to war at his own expense? Who plants a vineyard and does not eat of its fruit? Or who tends a flock and does not drink of the milk of the flock? 46 9:8 Do I say these things as a mere man? Or does not the law say the same also? 46 9:9 Because, it is written in the law of Moses, "You shall not muzzle an ox while it treads out the grain." Is it oxen God is concerned about? 46 9:10 Or does He say it entirely for our sakes? No doubt,thisis written for our sakes, that he who plows should plow in hope, and he who threshes in hope should be partaker of his hope. 46 9:11 If we have sown spiritual things for you, is it a great thing if we reap your material things? 46 9:12 If others are partakers of this authority over you, are we not even more? Nevertheless we have not used this authority, but endure all things lest we hinder the gospel of Christ. 46 9:13 Do you not know that those who minister the holy things eat of the things of the temple, and those who serve at the altar partake of the altar? 46 9:14 Even so the Lord has ordained that those who preach the gospel should live from the gospel. 46 9:15 But I have used none of these things, nor have I written these things that it should be done so to me; because it would be better for me to die than that anyone should make my boasting empty. 46 9:16 Because, though I preach the gospel, I have nothing to boast about, because necessity is laid upon me; yes, woe is me if I do not preach the gospel! 46 9:17 Because, if I do this thing willingly, I have a reward; but if against my will, I have been entrusted with a stewardshipof the gospel. 46 9:18 What is my reward then? Truly, that when I preach the gospel, I may present the gospel of Christ free of charge, that I may not abuse my authority in the gospel. 46 9:19 Because, though I am free from all men, I have made myself a servant to all, that I might win the more; 46 9:20 and to the Jews I became as a Jew, that I might win Jews; to those who are under the law, as under the law, that I might win those who are under the law; 46 9:21 to those who are without law, as without law (not being without law toward God, but under the law toward Christ), that I might win those who are without law; 46 9:22 to the weak I became as weak, that I might win the weak. I have become all things to all men, that I might by all means save some. 46 9:23 Now this I do for the gospel's sake, that I may be partaker of it withyou. 46 9:24 Do you not know that those who run in a race all run, but one receives the prize? Run in such a way that you may obtain it. 46 9:25 And everyone who strives for dominance has self control in all things. Now theydo itto obtain a perishable crown, but we for the imperishable. 46 9:26 Therefore I do not run with uncertainty. So I do not fight as one who beats the air. 46 9:27 But I discipline my body and bring it into subjection, lest in any way when I have preached to others, I myself should become an outcast. 46 10:1 Moreover, brethren, I do not want you to be ignorant that all our fathers were under the cloud, all passed through the sea, 46 10:2 all were baptized under Moses in the cloud and in the sea, 46 10:3 all ate the same spiritual food, 46 10:4 and all drank the same spiritual drink. Because, they drank of that spiritual Rock that followed them, and that Rock was Christ. 46 10:5 But with most of them God was not well pleased, because they were scattered in the wilderness. 46 10:6 Now these things became our examples, to the intent that we should not lust after evil things as they also lusted. 46 10:7 And do not become idolaters asweresome of them. As it is written, "The people sat down to eat and drink, and rose up to play." 46 10:8 Nor let us commit sexual immorality, as some of them committed, and in one day twenty three thousand fell; 46 10:9 nor let us tempt Christ, as some of them also tempted, and were destroyed by serpents; 46 10:10 nor complain, as some of them also complained, and were destroyed by the destroyer. 46 10:11 Now all these things happened to them as examples, and they were written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the ages have come. 46 10:12 Therefore let him who thinks he stands take heed lest he fall. 46 10:13 There is no temptation that has come upon you except such as is common to everyone; but God is faithful, who will not allow you to be tempted beyond what you are able, but with the temptation will also make the way of escape, that you may be able to endure it. 46 10:14 Therefore, my beloved, flee from idolatry. 46 10:15 I speak as to wise men; judge for yourselves what I say. 46 10:16 The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not the communion of the blood of Christ? The bread which we break, is it not the communion of the body of Christ? 46 10:17 Because we, though many, are one bread and one body; because we all partake of that one bread. 46 10:18 Observe Israel according to the flesh: Are not those who eat of the sacrifices partakers of the altar? 46 10:19 What am I saying then? That an idol is anything, or what is offered in sacrifice to idols is anything? 46 10:20 Rather,I am sayingthat the things which the Gentiles sacrifice they sacrifice to demons and not to God, and I do not want that you would have fellowship with demons. 46 10:21 You cannot drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons; you cannot partake of the Lord's table and of the table of demons. 46 10:22 Or do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? Are we stronger than He? 46 10:23 All things are lawful for me, but not all things are helpful; all things are lawful for me, but not all things edify. 46 10:24 Let no one seek his own, but each one the other's well being. 46 10:25 Eat whatever is sold in the meat market, asking no questions for conscience' sake; 46 10:26 because "the earth is the LORD'S, and all its fullness." 46 10:27 If any of those who do not believe invites youto a meal, and you desire to go, eat whatever is set before you, asking no question for conscience' sake. 46 10:28 But if anyone says to you, "This was offered to idols," do not eat it for the sake of the one who told you, and for conscience' sake; because "the earth is the LORD'S, and all its fullness." 46 10:29 I do not say your own conscience, but that of the others. Because why is my liberty judged by another man's conscience? 46 10:30 But if I partake with thanks, why am I evil spoken of for that over which I give thanks? 46 10:31 Therefore, whether you eat or drink, or whatever you do, do all to the glory of God. 46 10:32 Give no offense, either to the Jews or to the Gentiles or to the church of God, 46 10:33 just as I also please all men in all things, not seeking my own profit, but the profit of many, that they may be saved. 46 11:1 Be followers of me, just as I also am of Christ. 46 11:2 Now I praise you, brethren, that you remember me in all things and keep the traditions just as I delivered them to you. 46 11:3 But I want you to know that the head of every man is Christ, the head of the woman is man, and the head of Christ is God. 46 11:4 Every man praying or prophesying, having his head covered, dishonors his head. 46 11:5 But every woman who prays or prophesies with her head uncovered dishonors her head, because, that is one and the same as if her head were shaved. 46 11:6 Because, if a woman is not covered, let her also be shorn. But if it is shameful for a woman to be shorn or shaved, let her be covered. 46 11:7 Because, a man indeed ought not to cover his head, since he is the image and glory of God; but woman is the glory of man. 46 11:8 Because, the man is not from the woman, but the woman from the man. 46 11:9 Nor was man created for the woman, but woman for the man. 46 11:10 For this reason the woman ought to have a symbol of authority on her head, because of the angels. 46 11:11 Nevertheless, neither is man independent of woman, nor woman independent of man, in the Lord. 46 11:12 Because, as woman came from man, even so man also comes through woman; but all things are from God. 46 11:13 Judge among yourselves. Is it proper for a woman to pray to God uncovered? 46 11:14 Does not even nature itself teach you that if a man has long hair, it is a dishonor to him? 46 11:15 But if a woman has long hair, it is a glory to her; because her hair is given to her for a covering. 46 11:16 But if anyone seems to be contentious, we have no such custom, nor do the churches of God. 46 11:17 Now in giving these instructions to you I do not praise you, since you come together not for the better but for the worse. 46 11:18 Because, first of all, when you come together in the church, I hear that there are divisions among you, and in part I believe it. 46 11:19 Because, there must also be heresies among you, that those who are approved may be identified among you. 46 11:20 Therefore when you come together into one place, this is not to eat the Lord's Supper. 46 11:21 Because, in eating, each one takes his own supper ahead of others; and one is hungry and another drinks to the full. 46 11:22 What! Do you not have houses to eat and drink in? Or do you despise the church of God and shame those who have nothing? What shall I say to you? Shall I praise you in this? I do not praise you. 46 11:23 Because, I received from the Lord that which I also delivered to you: that the Lord Jesus on the same night in which He was betrayed took bread; 46 11:24 and when He had given thanks, He broke it and said, "Take, eat; this is My body which is broken for you; do this in remembrance of Me." 46 11:25 In the same manner He also took the cup after supper, saying, "This cup is the new testament in My blood. This do, each time you drink it, in remembrance of Me." 46 11:26 Because, every time you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the Lord's death until He comes. 46 11:27 Therefore whoever eats this bread or drinks this cup of the Lord in an unworthy manner will be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord. 46 11:28 But let a man examine himself, and so let him eat of the bread and drink of the cup. 46 11:29 Because, he who eats and drinks in an unworthy manner eats and drinks damnation to himself, not discerning the Lord's body. 46 11:30 For this reason many are weak and sick among you, and many sleep. 46 11:31 Because if we would judge ourselves, we would not be judged. 46 11:32 But when we are judged, we are chastened by the Lord, that we may not be condemned with the world. 46 11:33 Therefore, my brethren, when you come together to eat, wait for one another. 46 11:34 But if anyone is hungry, let him eat at home, lest you come together for condemnation. And the rest I will set in order when I come. 46 12:1 Now concerning spiritualgifts, brethren, I do not want you to be ignorant: 46 12:2 You know that you were Gentiles, carried away to these mute idols, however you were led. 46 12:3 Therefore I make known to you that no one speaking by the Spirit of God calls Jesus accursed, and that no one can say that Jesus is the Lord except by the Holy Spirit. 46 12:4 Now there are diversities of gifts, but the same Spirit. 46 12:5 And there are differences of ministries, but the same Lord. 46 12:6 And there are diversities of activities, but it is the same God who empowers them all in everyone. 46 12:7 But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to each one for everyone's benefit. 46 12:8 Because, to one is given the word of wisdom by the Spirit, to another the word of knowledge by the same Spirit, 46 12:9 to another faith by the same Spirit, to another gifts of healing by the same Spirit, 46 12:10 to another the working of miracles, to another prophecy, to another discerning of spirits, to anotherdifferentkinds of tongues, to another the interpretation of tongues. 46 12:11 But these are empowered by one and the same Spirit, distributing to each one individually as He wills. 46 12:12 Because, as the body is one and has many members, but all the members of that one body, being many, are one body, so alsoisChrist. 46 12:13 Because, by one Spirit we were all baptized into one body, whetherwe areJews or Greeks, whether we areslaves or free, and have all been made to drink into one Spirit. 46 12:14 Because the body is not one member but many. 46 12:15 If the foot should say, "Because I am not a hand, I am not of the body," is it therefore not of the body? 46 12:16 And if the ear should say, "Because I am not an eye, I am not of the body," is it therefore not of the body? 46 12:17 If the whole body were an eye, where would be the hearing? If the whole were hearing, where would be the smelling? 46 12:18 But now God has arranged the members, each one of them, in the body just as He pleased. 46 12:19 And if they were all one member, where would the body be? 46 12:20 But now indeed there are many members, yet one body. 46 12:21 And the eye cannot say to the hand, "I have no need of you"; nor again the head to the feet, "I have no need of you." 46 12:22 No, on the contrary, those members of the body which seem to be weaker are necessary. 46 12:23 And thosemembersof the body which we think to be less honorable, on these we bestow more abundant honor; and our unpresentable parts have more abundant modesty, 46 12:24 but our presentablepartshave no lack. But God assembled together the body, having given more abundant honor to that part which lacked, 46 12:25 that there should be no division in the body, but that the members should have the same care for one another. 46 12:26 And if one member suffers, all the members suffer with it; or if one member is honored, all the members rejoice with it. 46 12:27 Now you are the body of Christ, and members individually. 46 12:28 And God has arranged these in the church: first apostles, second prophets, third teachers, after that miracles, then gifts of healings, helps, administrations, varieties of tongues. 46 12:29 Are all apostles? Are all prophets? Are all teachers? Are all workers of miracles? 46 12:30 Do all have gifts of healing? Do all speak with tongues? Do all interpret? 46 12:31 But earnestly desire the best gifts. And yet I show you a more excellent way. 46 13:1 Though I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, but do not have love, I have become as sounding brass or a clanging cymbal. 46 13:2 And though I have the gift of prophecy, and understand all mysteries and all knowledge, and though I have all faith, so that I could remove mountains, but do not have love, I am nothing. 46 13:3 And though I give all my goods to feed the poor, and though I give my body to be burned, but have not love, it profits me nothing. 46 13:4 Love suffers long and is kind; love does not envy; love does not parade itself, is not puffed up; 46 13:5 does not behave rudely, does not seek its own, is not easily provoked, thinks no evil; 46 13:6 does not rejoice in iniquity, but rejoices in the truth; 46 13:7 bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things. 46 13:8 Love never fails. But if there are prophecies,theywill fail; if there are tongues,theywill cease; ifthereis knowledge,itwill vanish away. 46 13:9 Because, we know in part and we prophesy in part. 46 13:10 But when that which is perfect has come, then that which is in part will be done away. 46 13:11 When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child; but when I became a man, I put away childish things. 46 13:12 Because, now we see in a mirror, dimly, but then face to face. Now I know in part, but then I will know just as I also am known. 46 13:13 So now faith, hope, and love, abide, these three; but the greatest of these is love. 46 14:1 Pursue love, and desire spiritual gifts, but especially that you may prophesy. 46 14:2 Because, he who speaks inan unknowntongue does not speak to men but to God, because no one understands him; however, in the spirit he speaks mysteries. 46 14:3 But he who prophesies speaks edification and exhortation and comfort to men. 46 14:4 He who speaks inan unknowntongue edifies himself, but he who prophesies edifies the church. 46 14:5 I wish you all spoke with tongues, but even more that you prophesied; because, he who prophesies is greater than he who speaks with tongues, unless he interprets, that the church may receive edification. 46 14:6 Now, brethren, if I come to you speaking with tongues, what shall I profit you unless I speak to you either by revelation, by knowledge, by prophesying, or by doctrine? 46 14:7 Even things without life, whether flute or harp, when they make a sound, unless they make a distinction in the notes, how will it be known what is piped or played? 46 14:8 Because, if the trumpet makes an uncertain sound, who will prepare themself for battle? 46 14:9 So likewise you, unless you utter by the tongue words easy to understand, how will it be known what is spoken? Because you will be speaking into the air. 46 14:10 There are, it may be, so many kinds of languages in the world, and noneof themis without significance. 46 14:11 Therefore, if I do not know the meaning of the language, I will be a foreigner to him who speaks, and he who speaks will be a foreigner to me. 46 14:12 Even so you, since you are zealous for spiritualgifts, seek that you may excel for the edification of the church. 46 14:13 Therefore let him who speaks inan unknowntongue pray that he may interpret. 46 14:14 Because, if I pray inan unknowntongue, my spirit prays, but my understanding is unfruitful. 46 14:15 What is the conclusion then? I will pray with the spirit, and I will also pray with the understanding. I will sing with the spirit, and I will also sing with the understanding. 46 14:16 Otherwise, if you bless with the spirit, how will he who occupies the place of the uninformed say "Amen" at your giving of thanks, since he does not understand what you say? 46 14:17 Because, you indeed give thanks well, but the other is not edified. 46 14:18 I thank my God I speak with tongues more than you all; 46 14:19 yet in the church I would rather speak five words with my understanding, thatby my voiceI may teach others also, than ten thousand words inan unknowntongue. 46 14:20 Brethren, do not be children in understanding; however, in malice be children, but in understanding be mature. 46 14:21 In the law it is written: "Withpeopleof other tongues and other lips I will speak to this people; and yet, for all that, they will not hear Me," says the Lord. 46 14:22 Therefore tongues are for a sign, not to those who believe but to unbelievers; but prophesying is not for unbelievers but serves for those who believe. 46 14:23 Therefore if the entire church comes together in one place, and all speak with tongues, and there come in those who are uninformed or unbelievers, will they not say that you are crazy? 46 14:24 But if all prophesy, and an unbeliever or an uninformed person comes in, he is convinced by all, he is convicted by all. 46 14:25 And so the secrets of his heart are revealed; and so, falling down on his face, he will worship God and report that God is truly among you. 46 14:26 How is it then, brethren? Whenever you come together, each of you has a psalm, has a doctrine, has a tongue, has a revelation, has an interpretation. Let all things be done for edification. 46 14:27 If anyone speaks inan unknowntongue, let there be two or at the most three, each in turn, and let one interpret. 46 14:28 But if there is no interpreter, let him keep silent in church, and let him speak to himself and to God. 46 14:29 Let two or three prophets speak, and let the others judge. 46 14:30 But if anything is revealed to another who sits by, let the first keep silent. 46 14:31 Because, you can all prophesy one by one, that all may learn and all may be encouraged. 46 14:32 And the spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets. 46 14:33 Because, God is notthe authorof confusion but of peace, as in all the churches of the saints. 46 14:34 Let your women keep silent in the churches, because they are not permitted to speak; butthey are commandedto be submissive, as the law also says. 46 14:35 And if they want to learn something, let them ask their husbands at home; because it is shameful for women to speak in the church. 46 14:36 What? Did the word of God originate from you? Or was it to you only that it has come? 46 14:37 If anyone thinks himself to be a prophet or spiritual, let him acknowledge that the things which I write to you are the commandments of the Lord. 46 14:38 But if anyone is ignorant, let him be ignorant. 46 14:39 Therefore, brethren, earnestly desire to prophesy, and do not forbid to speak with tongues. 46 14:40 Let all things be done decently and in order. 46 15:1 Moreover, brethren, I declare to you the gospel which I preached to you, which also you received and in which you stand, 46 15:2 by which also you are saved, if you keep in memory that which I preached to you, unless you have believed in vain. 46 15:3 Because, I delivered to you first of all that which I also received: how Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures, 46 15:4 and that He was buried, and that He rose again the third day according to the Scriptures, 46 15:5 and that He was seen by Cephas, then by the twelve. 46 15:6 After that He was seen by over five hundred brethren at once, of whom the greater part remain to the present, but some have fallen asleep. 46 15:7 After that He was seen by James, then by all the apostles. 46 15:8 Then last of all He was seen by me also, as by one born out of due time. 46 15:9 Because, I am the least of the apostles, who am not worthy to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God. 46 15:10 But by the grace of God I am what I am, and His grace which was imparted to me was not in vain; but I labored more abundantly than they all, yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me. 46 15:11 Therefore, whether it was I or they, so we preach and so you believed. 46 15:12 Now if Christ is preached that He rose from the dead, how do some among you say that there is no resurrection of the dead? 46 15:13 But if there is no resurrection of the dead, then Christ is not risen. 46 15:14 And if Christ is not risen, then our preaching is in vain and your faith is also in vain. 46 15:15 Yes, and we are found to be false witnesses of God, because we have testified of God that He raised up Christ, whom He did not raise up, if in fact the dead do not rise. 46 15:16 Because, if the dead do not rise, then Christ is not risen. 46 15:17 And if Christ is not risen, your faith is vain; you are still in your sins! 46 15:18 Then also those who have fallen asleep in Christ have perished. 46 15:19 If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are of all men the most miserable. 46 15:20 But now Christ is risen from the dead, and has become the firstfruits of those who sleep. 46 15:21 Because, since by man came death, by Man also came the resurrection of the dead. 46 15:22 Because as in Adam all die, even so in Christ all will be made alive. 46 15:23 But each one in his own order: Christ the firstfruits, afterward those who are Christ's at His coming. 46 15:24 Then comes the end, when He will have delivered the kingdom to God, even the Father, when He puts down all rule and all authority and power. 46 15:25 Because, He must reign until He has put all enemies under His feet. 46 15:26 The last enemy that will be destroyed is death. 46 15:27 Because "He has put all things under His feet." But when He says "all things are put under Him," it is evident that He who put all things under Him is the exception. 46 15:28 Now when all things are made subject to Him, then the Son Himself will also be subject to Him who put all things under Him, that God may be all in all. 46 15:29 Otherwise, what shall they do who are baptized for the dead, if the dead do not rise at all? Why then are they baptized for the dead? 46 15:30 And why do we stand in danger every hour? 46 15:31 I affirm, by the boasting which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily. 46 15:32 If, in the manner of men, I have fought with beasts at Ephesus, what advantage is it to me? If the dead do not rise, "Let us eat and drink, because tomorrow we die!" 46 15:33 Do not be deceived: "Evil company corrupts good morals." 46 15:34 Awake to righteousness, and do not sin; because some do not have the knowledge of God. I speak this to your shame. 46 15:35 But someone will say, "How are the dead raised up? And with what body do they come?" 46 15:36 Foolish one, what you sow is not made alive unless it dies. 46 15:37 And what you sow, you do not sow that body that will be, but mere grain, perhaps wheat or some other grain. 46 15:38 But God gives it a body as it has pleased Him, and to each seed its own body. 46 15:39 All flesh is not the same flesh, but there is one kind of flesh of men, another flesh of animals, another of fish, and another of birds. 46 15:40 There are also celestial bodies and terrestrial bodies; but the glory of the celestial is one, and the glory of the terrestrial is another. 46 15:41 There is one glory of the sun, another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars; because one star differs from another star in glory. 46 15:42 So also is the resurrection of the dead. The body is sown in corruption, it is raised in incorruption. 46 15:43 It is sown in dishonor, it is raised in glory. It is sown in weakness, it is raised in power. 46 15:44 It is sown a natural body, it is raised a spiritual body. There is a natural body, and there is a spiritual body. 46 15:45 And so it is written, "The first man Adam became a living soul." The last Adam became a life giving spirit. 46 15:46 However, the spiritual is not first, but the natural, and afterward that which is spiritual. 46 15:47 The first man was of the earth, made of dust; the second Man is the Lord from heaven. 46 15:48 As was the man of dust, so also are those who are made of dust; and as is the heavenly Man, so also are those who are heavenly. 46 15:49 And as we have borne the image of the man of dust, we will also bear the image of the Heavenly. 46 15:50 Now this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God; nor does corruption inherit incorruption. 46 15:51 Behold, I show you a mystery: We will not all sleep, but we will all be changed, 46 15:52 in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. Because, the trumpet will sound, and the dead will be raised incorruptible, and we will be changed. 46 15:53 Because, this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortal must put on immortality. 46 15:54 So when this corruptible has put on incorruption, and this mortal has put on immortality, then will be brought to pass the saying that is written: "Death is swallowed up in victory." 46 15:55 "O Death, where is your sting? O grave, where is your victory?" 46 15:56 The sting of death is sin, and the strength of sin is the law. 46 15:57 But thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ. 46 15:58 Therefore, my beloved brethren, be steadfast, immovable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, knowing that your labor is not in vain in the Lord. 46 16:1 Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I have directed the churches of Galatia, so you must do also: 46 16:2 On the firstdayof the week let each one of you lay something aside, storing up asGodhas prospered him, that there be no collections when I come. 46 16:3 And when I come, whomever you approve byyourletters I will send to bear your gift to Jerusalem. 46 16:4 But if it is fitting that I go also, they will go with me. 46 16:5 Now I will come to you when I pass through Macedonia (because I am passing through Macedonia). 46 16:6 And it may be that I will remain, or even spend the winter with you, that you may send me on my journey, wherever I go. 46 16:7 Because, I do not wish to see you now along the way; but I hope to stay a while with you, if the Lord permits. 46 16:8 But I will stay in Ephesus until Pentecost. 46 16:9 Because, a great and effective door has opened to me, and there are many adversaries. 46 16:10 Now if Timothy comes, see that he may be with you without fear; because, he does the work of the Lord, as I also do. 46 16:11 Therefore let no one despise him. But send him on his journey in peace, that he may come to me; because I am expecting him with the brethren. 46 16:12 Now concerningourbrother Apollos, I strongly urged him to come to you with the brethren, but he was quite unwilling to come at this time; however, he will come when he has a convenient time. 46 16:13 Watch, stand fast in the faith, act like men, be strong. 46 16:14 Let all that you do be done with love. 46 16:15 I urge you, brethren, you know the household of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia, and that they have devoted themselves to the ministry of the saints, 46 16:16 that you also submit to such, and to everyone who works and labors with us. 46 16:17 I am glad about the coming of Stephanas, Fortunatus, and Achaicus, because what was lacking on your part they supplied. 46 16:18 Because they refreshed my spirit and yours. Therefore acknowledge such people. 46 16:19 The churches of Asia greet you. Aquila and Priscilla greet you heartily in the Lord, with the church that is in their house. 46 16:20 All the brethren greet you. Greet one another with a holy kiss. 46 16:21 The salutation from me Paul with my own hand. 46 16:22 If anyone does not love the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maranatha! 46 16:23 The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. 46 16:24 My love be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen. 47 1:1 Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, to the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints who are in all Achaia: 47 1:2 Grace be to you and peace from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ. 47 1:3 Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort, 47 1:4 who comforts us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort those who are in any trouble, with the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God. 47 1:5 Because, as the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also abounds by Christ. 47 1:6 Now if we are afflicted, it is for your consolation and salvation, which is effective for enduring the same sufferings which we also suffer. Or if we are comforted, it is for your consolation and salvation. 47 1:7 And our hope for you is unshaken, because, we know that as you are partakers of the sufferings, so also you will also be of the consolation. 47 1:8 Because, we do not want you to be ignorant, brethren, of our trouble which came to us in Asia: that we were burdened beyond measure, above strength, so that we despaired even of life. 47 1:9 But we had the sentence of death in ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves but in God who raises the dead, 47 1:10 who delivered us from so great a death, and does deliver us; in whom we trust that He will still deliver, 47 1:11 you also helping together in prayer for us, that thanks may be given by the means of many people on our behalf for the gift granted to us through many. 47 1:12 Because our rejoicing is this: the testimony of our conscience that we conducted ourselves in the world in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom but by the grace of God, and more abundantly toward you. 47 1:13 Because, we are not writing any other things to you than what you read or acknowledge, and I trust you will acknowledge, even to the end; 47 1:14 as also you have acknowledged us partially, that we are your rejoicing, just as you also are ours, in the day of the Lord Jesus. 47 1:15 And in this confidence I intended to come to you before, that you might have a second benefit; 47 1:16 to visit you on the way to Macedonia, to return again from Macedonia to you, and be brought on my way toward Judea. 47 1:17 Therefore, when I was planning this, did I do it lightly?
