Or the things I plan, do I plan according to the flesh, that with me there should be Yes, Yes, and No, No? 47 1:18 But as God is true, our word to you was not Yes and No. 47 1:19 Because, the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, even by me, Silvanus, and Timothy, was not Yes and No, but in Him was Yes. 47 1:20 Because, all the promises of God in Him are Yes, and in Him Amen, to the glory of God by us. 47 1:21 Now He who establishes us with you in Christ and has anointed us is God, 47 1:22 who also has sealed us and given us the Spirit in our hearts as a guarantee. 47 1:23 Moreover I call God to record against my soul, that to spare you I have not yet come to Corinth. 47 1:24 Not that we have dominion over your faith, but are helpers for your joy; because by faith you stand. 47 2:1 But I determined this within myself, that I would not come again to you in sorrow. 47 2:2 Because, if I make you sorrowful, then who is he who makes me glad but the one who is made sorrowful by me? 47 2:3 And I wrote this very thing to you, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow from those of whom I ought to rejoice, having confidence in you all that my joy is the joy of you all. 47 2:4 Because, out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you, with many tears, not that you should be grieved, but that you might know the love which I have so abundantly for you. 47 2:5 But if anyone has caused grief, he has not grieved me, except partially; so that I may not be harsh to you all. 47 2:6 This punishment which was inflicted by many is sufficient for such a man, 47 2:7 so that, on the contrary, you ought rather to forgive him, and comfort him, lest perhaps such a one should be swallowed up with too much sorrow. 47 2:8 Therefore I urge you to reaffirm your love to him. 47 2:9 Because, this is why I also wrote, that I might put you to the test, whether you are obedient in all things. 47 2:10 To whom you forgive anything, I also forgive. Because, if I have forgiven anything, to whom I forgive it, I have forgiven it for your sakes in the person of Christ, 47 2:11 lest Satan should get a favorable position over us; because we are not ignorant of his devices. 47 2:12 Furthermore, when I came to Troas to preach Christ's gospel, and a door was opened to me by the Lord, 47 2:13 I had no rest in my spirit, because I did not find Titus my brother; but taking my leave of them, I departed from there into Macedonia. 47 2:14 Now thanks be to God who always causes us to triumph in Christ, and makes manifest the fragrance of His knowledge in every place through us. 47 2:15 Because, we are to God the sweet fragrance of Christ among those who are saved and among those who are perishing. 47 2:16 To the one we are the aroma of death leading to death, and to the other the aroma of life leading to life. And who is sufficient for these things? 47 2:17 Because, we are not, like so many, who corrupt the word of God; but as of sincerity, but as from God, in the sight of God we speak in Christ. 47 3:1 Do we begin again to commend ourselves? Or do we need, as some others, letters of commendation to you or letters of commendation from you? 47 3:2 You are our letter written in our hearts, known and read by everyone; 47 3:3 in as much as you are clearly declared to be a letter of Christ, delivered by us, written not with ink but by the Spirit of the living God, not on tablets of stone but on tablets of flesh, that is, of the heart. 47 3:4 And we have such confidence through Christ toward God. 47 3:5 Not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think of anything as originating from ourselves, but our sufficiency is from God, 47 3:6 who also has made us competent ministers of the new testament, not of the letter but of the Spirit; because the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life. 47 3:7 But if the ministry of death, written and engraved on stones, was glorious, so that the children of Israel could not look steadfastly at Moses' face because of the glory of his countenance, which glory was passing away, 47 3:8 how will the ministry of the Spirit not be more glorious? 47 3:9 Because, if the ministry of condemnation is glory, the ministry of righteousness exceeds much more in glory. 47 3:10 Because, even what was made glorious had no glory in this respect, because of the glory that excels. 47 3:11 Because, if what is passing away was glorious, what remains is much more glorious. 47 3:12 Therefore, seeing we have such hope, we use much freedom of speech; 47 3:13 unlike Moses, who put a veil over his face so that the children of Israel could not look steadfastly at the outcome of what was passing away. 47 3:14 But their minds were blinded. Because, until this day the same veil remains unlifted in the reading of the Old Testament. This veil is taken away in Christ. 47 3:15 But even to this day, when Moses is read, a veil is upon their heart. 47 3:16 Nevertheless when it shall turn to the Lord, the veil will be taken away. 47 3:17 Now the Lord is the Spirit; and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty. 47 3:18 But we all, with unveiled face, beholding as in a mirror the glory of the Lord, are changed into the same image from glory to glory, just as by the Spirit of the Lord. 47 4:1 Therefore, seeing we have this ministry, as we have received mercy, we do not lose heart. 47 4:2 But we have renounced the hidden things of dishonesty, not walking in craftiness nor handling the word of God deceitfully, but by the manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God. 47 4:3 But even if our gospel is veiled, it is veiled to those who are perishing, 47 4:4 whose minds the god of this age has blinded, who do not believe, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine on them. 47 4:5 Because, we do not preach ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord, and ourselves your servants for Jesus' sake. 47 4:6 Because God, who commanded light to shine out of darkness, has shone in our hearts to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ. 47 4:7 But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellence of the power may be of God and not of us. 47 4:8 We are troubled on every side, yet not distressed; we are perplexed, but not in despair; 47 4:9 persecuted, but not forsaken; struck down, but not destroyed; 47 4:10 always carrying about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus, that the life of Jesus also may be manifested in our body. 47 4:11 Because, we who live are always delivered to death for Jesus' sake, that the life of Jesus also may be manifested in our mortal flesh. 47 4:12 So then death is working in us, but life in you. 47 4:13 We having the same spirit of faith, according to what is written, "I believed and therefore I spoke," we also believe and therefore speak, 47 4:14 knowing that He who raised up the Lord Jesus will also raise us up by Jesus, and will present us with you. 47 4:15 Because, all things are for your sakes, that the abundant grace may through the thanksgiving of many, abound to the glory of God. 47 4:16 Therefore we do not lose heart. Even though our outward man is perishing, yet the inward man is being renewed day by day. 47 4:17 Because, our light affliction, which is only for a moment, is working for us a far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory, 47 4:18 while we do not look at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen. Because, the things which are seen are temporary, but the things which are not seen are eternal. 47 5:1 Because, we know that if our earthly house, this tent, is destroyed, we have a building from God, a house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens. 47 5:2 Because, in this we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed with our habitation which is from heaven, 47 5:3 if indeed, having been clothed, we will not be found naked. 47 5:4 Because, we who are in this tent groan, being burdened, not because we want to be unclothed, but further clothed, that mortality may be swallowed up by life. 47 5:5 Now He who has prepared us for this very thing is God, who also has given to us the Spirit as a guarantee. 47 5:6 Therefore we are always confident, knowing that while we are at home in the body we are absent from the Lord. 47 5:7 Because we walk by faith, not by sight. 47 5:8 We are confident, I proclaim, and willing rather to be absent from the body and to be present with the Lord. 47 5:9 Therefore we labor, so that whether present or absent, we may be accepted of Him. 47 5:10 Because, we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ, that each one may receive the things done in the body, according to what he has done, whether it is good or bad. 47 5:11 Knowing, therefore, the terror of the Lord, we persuade men; but we are made manifest to God, and I also trust are made manifest in your consciences. 47 5:12 Because, we do not commend ourselves again to you, but give you opportunity to boast on our behalf, that you may have something to answer them who boast in appearance and not in heart. 47 5:13 Because, if we are beside ourselves, it is for God; or if we are sober, it is for you. 47 5:14 Because, the love of Christ compels us, because we have judged thus: that if One died for all, then all died; 47 5:15 and that He died for all, that those who live should live no longer for themselves, but for Him who died for them and rose again. 47 5:16 Therefore, from now on, we regard no one according to the flesh. Even though we have known Christ according to the flesh, yet from now on we know Him like this no longer. 47 5:17 Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creature; old things have passed away; behold, all things have become new. 47 5:18 Now all these things are from God, who has reconciled us to Himself by Jesus Christ, and has given to us the ministry of reconciliation, 47 5:19 that is, that God was in Christ reconciling the world to Himself, not imputing their trespasses to them, and has committed to us the word of reconciliation. 47 5:20 Now then, we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God were pleading to you through us: we urge you on Christ's behalf, be reconciled to God. 47 5:21 Because, He made Him who knew no sin to be sin for us, that we might be made the righteousness of God in Him. 47 6:1 We then, as workers together with Him also urge you not to receive the grace of God in vain. 47 6:2 Because, He says: "In an acceptable time I have heard you, and in the day of salvation I have helped you." Behold, now is the accepted time; behold, now is the day of salvation. 47 6:3 Giving no offense in anything, that the ministry may not be faulted. 47 6:4 But in all things we commend ourselves as the ministers of God: in much patience, in afflictions, in needs, in distresses, 47 6:5 in stripes, in imprisonments, in riots, in labors, in sleeplessness, in fastings; 47 6:6 by purity, by knowledge, by longsuffering, by kindness, by the Holy Spirit, by genuine love, 47 6:7 by the word of truth, by the power of God, by the armor of righteousness on the right hand and on the left, 47 6:8 by honor and dishonor, by evil report and good report; as deceivers, and yet true; 47 6:9 as unknown, and yet well known; as dying, and behold we live; as chastened, and yet not killed; 47 6:10 as sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, and yet possessing all things. 47 6:11 O you Corinthians! Our mouth is open to you, our heart is wide open. 47 6:12 You are not restricted by us, but you are restricted by your own affections. 47 6:13 Now in return for the same (I speak as to my children), you also be open. 47 6:14 Do not be unequally yoked together with unbelievers. Because, what fellowship has righteousness with unrighteousness? And what communion has light with darkness? 47 6:15 And what accord has Christ with Belial? Or what part has he who believes with an infidel? 47 6:16 And what agreement has the temple of God with idols? Because, you are the temple of the living God. As God has said: "I will dwell in them and walk in them. And I will be their God, and they will be My people." 47 6:17 Therefore "Come out from among them and be separate, says the Lord. Do not touch what is unclean, and I will receive you." 47 6:18 "I will be a Father to you, and you will be My sons and daughters, says the LORD Almighty." 47 7:1 Therefore, having these promises, greatly beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the reverence of God. 47 7:2 Receive us. We have wronged no one, we have corrupted no one, we have cheated no one. 47 7:3 I do not say this to condemn you; because I have said before that you are in our hearts, to die together and to live together with you. 47 7:4 Great is my boldness of speech toward you, great is my boasting on your behalf. I am filled with comfort. I am exceedingly joyful in all our tribulation. 47 7:5 Because, when we came to Macedonia, our bodies had no rest, but we were troubled on every side. Outside were conflicts, inside were fears. 47 7:6 Nevertheless God, who comforts the downcast, comforted us by the coming of Titus, 47 7:7 and not only by his coming, but also by the consolation with which he was comforted in you, when he told us of your earnest desire, your mourning, your fervent mind towards me, so that I rejoiced even more. 47 7:8 Because, even though I made you sorry with my letter, I do not regret it; though I did regret it. Because, I perceive that the same letter made you sorry, though only for a season. 47 7:9 Now I rejoice, not that you were made sorry, but that your sorrow led to repentance. Because you were made sorry in a godly manner, that you might suffer loss from us in nothing. 47 7:10 Because, godly sorrow produces repentance leading to salvation, not to be regretted; but the sorrow of the world produces death. 47 7:11 Because, observe this very thing, that you sorrowed in a godly manner: yes what diligence it produced in you, yes what clearing of yourselves, yes what indignation, yes what fear, what vehement desire, what zeal, what vindication! In all things you have proven yourselves to be clear in this matter. 47 7:12 Therefore, although I wrote to you, I did not do it because of him who had done the wrong, nor because of him who suffered wrong, but that our care for you in the sight of God might appear to you. 47 7:13 Therefore we have been comforted in your comfort. And we rejoiced exceedingly more for the joy of Titus, because his spirit was refreshed by you all. 47 7:14 Because, if in anything I have boasted to him about you, I am not ashamed. But as we spoke all things to you in truth, even so our boasting which I made before Titus was found true. 47 7:15 And his inner affections are greater for you as he remembers the obedience of you all, how with reverence and trembling you received him. 47 7:16 Therefore I rejoice that I have confidence in you in all things. 47 8:1 Moreover, brethren, we make known to you the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia: 47 8:2 how that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their extreme poverty abounded in the riches of their liberality. 47 8:3 Because, I bear record that according to their ability, yes, and beyond their ability, they were freely willing, 47 8:4 urging us with many requests that we would receive the gift and take on us the fellowship of the ministering to the saints. 47 8:5 And this they did, not just as we hoped, but they first gave themselves to the Lord, and then to us by the will of God. 47 8:6 So that we urged Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also complete this grace in you also. 47 8:7 Therefore, as you abound in everything, in faith, in speech, in knowledge, and in all diligence, and in your love for us, see that you abound in this grace also. 47 8:8 I speak not by commandment, but I am testing the sincerity of your love by the diligence of others. 47 8:9 Because, you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that though He was rich, yet for your sakes He became poor, that you through His poverty might be rich. 47 8:10 And in this I give my advice: It is to your advantage not only to be doing what you began and were desiring to do a year ago; 47 8:11 but now you also must complete the doing of it; that as there was a readiness to desire it, so there also may be a completion out of what you have. 47 8:12 Because, if there is first a willing mind, it is accepted according to what one has, and not according to what he does not have. 47 8:13 Because, I do not mean that others should be eased and you burdened; 47 8:14 but by an equality, that now at this time your abundance may be a supply for their lack, that their abundance also may be a supply for your lack, that there may be equality. 47 8:15 As it is written, "He who gathered much had nothing left over, and he who gathered little had no lack." 47 8:16 But thanks be to God who put the same earnest care for you into the heart of Titus. 47 8:17 Because, he not only accepted the exhortation, but being more diligent, he went to you of his own accord. 47 8:18 And we have sent with him the brother whose praise is in the gospel throughout all the churches, 47 8:19 and not only that, but who was also chosen by the churches to travel with us with this grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the Lord Himself and to show your ready mind, 47 8:20 avoiding this: that anyone should blame us in this abundance which is administered by us, 47 8:21 providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men. 47 8:22 And we have sent with them our brother whom we have often proved diligent in many things, but now much more diligent, because of the great confidence which I have in you. 47 8:23 If anyone inquires about Titus, he is my partner and fellow worker concerning you. Or if our brethren are inquired about, they are messengers of the churches, and the glory of Christ. 47 8:24 Therefore show to them, and before the churches, the proof of your love and of our boasting on your behalf. 47 9:1 Now concerning the ministering to the saints, it is superfluous for me to write to you; 47 9:2 Because, I know your willingness, about which I boast of you to the Macedonians, that Achaia was ready a year ago; and your zeal has stirred up the majority. 47 9:3 Yet I have sent the brethren, lest our boasting of you should be in vain in this respect, that, you may be ready, as I said; 47 9:4 lest if some Macedonians come with me and find you unprepared, we (that we do not mention you) should be ashamed of this confident boasting. 47 9:5 Therefore I thought it necessary to exhort the brethren to go to you ahead of time, and prepare your generous gift beforehand, of which you had previous notification, that it may be ready as a matter of generosity and not as a grudging obligation. 47 9:6 But this I say: He who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and he who sows bountifully will also reap bountifully. 47 9:7 So let each one give, according as he purposes in his heart, not grudgingly or of necessity; because, God loves a cheerful giver. 47 9:8 And God is able to make all grace abound toward you, that you, always having all sufficiency in all things, may have an abundance for every good work. 47 9:9 As it is written: "He has dispersed abroad, he has given to the poor; his righteousness endures forever." 47 9:10 Now He who supplies seed to the sower, also supply bread for your food, multiply your seed sown, and increase the fruits of your righteousness, 47 9:11 being enriched in everything for all abundance, which causes thanksgiving through us to God. 47 9:12 Because, the administration of this service not only supplies the needs of the saints, but also is abounding through many thanksgivings to God, 47 9:13 while, through the proof of this ministry, they glorify God for the obedience of your confession to the gospel of Christ, and for your liberal distribution to them and all people, 47 9:14 and by their prayer for you, who long for you because of the exceeding grace of God in you. 47 9:15 Thanks be to God for His indescribable gift! 47 10:1 Now I, Paul, myself urge with you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ, who in presence am lowly among you, but being absent am bold toward you. 47 10:2 But I urge you that when I am present I may not be bold with that confidence by which I intend to be bold against some, who think of us as if we walked according to the flesh. 47 10:3 Because, though we walk in the flesh, we do not war according to the flesh. 47 10:4 Because, the weapons of our warfare are not carnal but mighty through God for the pulling down of strongholds, 47 10:5 casting down imaginations and every high thing that exalts itself against the knowledge of God, bringing every thought into captivity to the obedience of Christ, 47 10:6 and being ready to punish all disobedience when your obedience is fulfilled. 47 10:7 Do you look at things according to the outward appearance? If anyone is convinced in himself that he is Christ's, let him again consider this in himself, that just as he is Christ's, even so we are Christ's. 47 10:8 Because, even if I should boast somewhat more about our authority, which the Lord gave us for edification and not for your destruction, I will not be ashamed, 47 10:9 lest I seem as if I would to terrify you by letters. 47 10:10 "Because, his letters," they say, "are weighty and powerful, but his bodily presence is weak, and his speech contemptible." 47 10:11 Let such a person consider this, that what we are in word by letters when we are absent, such we will also be in deed when we are present. 47 10:12 Because, we dare not classify ourselves or compare ourselves with those who commend themselves. But they, measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves among themselves, are not wise. 47 10:13 We, however, will not boast of things beyond our measure, but according to the measure of the influence which God has distributed to us, a measure to reach to you also. 47 10:14 Because, we do not stretch ourselves beyond our measure, as though we did not extend to you, because, we have come as far as to you also with the preaching of the gospel of Christ; 47 10:15 not boasting of things beyond our measure, that is, in other men's labors, but having hope, that as your faith is increased, that we will be enlarged abundantly by you according to our influence, 47 10:16 to preach the gospel in the regions beyond you, and not to boast in another man's sphere of accomplishment. 47 10:17 But "he who glories, let him glory in the LORD." 47 10:18 Because, not he who commends himself is approved, but whom the Lord commends. 47 11:1 Oh, that you would bear with me in a little in my folly, and indeed you do bear with me. 47 11:2 Because, I am jealous for you with godly jealousy. Because, I have betrothed you to one husband, that I may present you as a pure virgin to Christ. 47 11:3 But I fear, lest somehow, as the serpent deceived Eve by his craftiness, so your minds may be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ. 47 11:4 Because, if he who comes preaches another Jesus whom we have not preached, or if you receive a different spirit which you have not received, or a different gospel which you have not accepted, you may well put up with him! 47 11:5 Because, I consider that I am not at all inferior to the most eminent apostles. 47 11:6 Even though I am untrained in speech, yet I am not in knowledge. But we have been thoroughly manifested among you in all things. 47 11:7 Did I commit sin in humbling myself that you might be exalted, because I have preached the gospel of God to you free of charge? 47 11:8 I took from other churches, taking wages from them to minister to you. 47 11:9 And when I was present with you, and in need, I was a burden to no one, because, what I lacked the brethren who came from Macedonia supplied. And in all things I kept myself from being burdensome to you, and so I will keep myself. 47 11:10 As the truth of Christ is in me, no one will stop me from this boasting in the regions of Achaia. 47 11:11 Why? Because I do not love you? God knows! 47 11:12 But what I do, I will also continue to do, that I may cut off the opportunity from those who desire an opportunity to be regarded just as we are in the things of which they boast. 47 11:13 Because, such are false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into apostles of Christ. 47 11:14 And no wonder! Because, Satan himself is transformed into an angel of light. 47 11:15 Therefore it is no great thing if his ministers also are transformed into ministers of righteousness, whose end will be according to their works. 47 11:16 I say again, let no one think me a fool. If otherwise, at least receive me as a fool, that I also may boast a little. 47 11:17 What I speak, I speak not according to the Lord, but as it were, foolishly, in this confidence of boasting. 47 11:18 Seeing that many boast according to the flesh, I also will boast. 47 11:19 Because, you put up with fools gladly, since you yourselves are wise! 47 11:20 because, you put up with it if one brings you into bondage, if one devours you, if one takes from you, if one exalts himself, if one strikes you on the face. 47 11:21 To our shame I say that we were too weak for that! But in whatever anyone is bold, I speak foolishly, I am bold also. 47 11:22 Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they the seed of Abraham? So am I. 47 11:23 Are they ministers of Christ? I speak as a fool, I am more: in labors more abundant, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequently, in deaths often. 47 11:24 From the Jews five times I received forty stripes minus one. 47 11:25 Three times I was beaten with rods; once I was stoned; three times I was shipwrecked; a night and a day I have been in the deep; 47 11:26 in frequent journeys, in danger from waters, in danger from robbers, in danger from my own countrymen, in danger from the Gentiles, in danger in the city, in danger in the wilderness, in danger in the sea, in danger among false brethren; 47 11:27 in weariness and toil, in sleeplessness often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness, 47 11:28 besides those things that are external, what comes upon me daily: the concern for all the churches. 47 11:29 Who is weak, and I am not weak? Who is offended, and I do not burn with indignation? 47 11:30 If I must boast, I will boast in the things which concern my weakness. 47 11:31 The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who is blessed forever, knows that I am not lying. 47 11:32 In Damascus the governor, under Aretas the king, was guarding the city of the Damascenes with a garrison, desiring to arrest me; 47 11:33 but I was let down in a basket through a window by the wall, and escaped from his hands. 47 12:1 It is obviously not profitable for me to boast. I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord: 47 12:2 I knew a man in Christ who over fourteen years ago (whether in the body I do not know, or whether out of the body I do not know, God knows) such a one was caught up to the third heaven. 47 12:3 And I knew such a man (whether in the body or out of the body I do not know, God knows) 47 12:4 how he was caught up into Paradise and heard inexpressible words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter. 47 12:5 Of such a one I will boast; yet of myself I will not boast, except in my weaknesses. 47 12:6 Because though I might desire to boast, I will not be a fool; because I will speak the truth. But now I refrain, lest anyone should think of me above what he sees me to be or that he hears from me. 47 12:7 And lest I should be exalted above measure by the abundance of the revelations, a thorn in the flesh was given to me, a messenger of Satan to wound me, lest I be exalted above measure. 47 12:8 Concerning this thing I sought the Lord three times that it might depart from me. 47 12:9 And He said to me, "My grace is sufficient for you, because My strength is made perfect in weakness." Therefore most gladly I will rather boast in my weaknesses, that the power of Christ may rest upon me. 47 12:10 Therefore I take pleasure in weaknesses, in reproaches, in needs, in persecutions, in distresses, for Christ's sake. Because when I am weak, then I am strong. 47 12:11 I have become a fool in boasting; you have compelled me. Because, I ought to have been commended by you; because, in nothing was I behind the most eminent apostles, though I am nothing. 47 12:12 Truly the signs of an apostle were accomplished among you with all perseverance, in signs and wonders and mighty deeds. 47 12:13 Because, what is it in which you were inferior to other churches, except it is that I myself was not burdensome to you? Forgive me this wrong! 47 12:14 Behold, the third time I am ready to come to you. And I will not be burdensome to you; because, I do not seek yours, but you. Because, the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children. 47 12:15 And I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I am loved. 47 12:16 But be that as it may, I did not burden you. Nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you with craftiness! 47 12:17 Did I take advantage of you by any of those whom I sent to you? 47 12:18 I urged Titus, and sent our brother with him. Did Titus take advantage of you? Did we not walk in the same spirit? Did we not walk in the same steps? 47 12:19 Again, do you think that we excuse ourselves to you? We speak before God in Christ. But we do all things, beloved, for your edification. 47 12:20 Because, I fear lest, when I come, I will not find you such as I wish, and that I will be found by you such as you do not wish; lest there be debates, jealousies, outbursts of wrath, selfish ambitions, backbitings, whisperings, puffed up pride, commotion; 47 12:21 and lest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and that I will mourn for many who have sinned already and have not repented of the uncleanness, fornication, and lewdness which they have committed. 47 13:1 This is the third time I am coming to you. "By the mouth of two or three witnesses shall every word be established." 47 13:2 I have told you before, and foretell you, as if I were present the second time, and now being absent I write to those who have sinned already, and to all the rest, that if I come again I will not spare 47 13:3 since you seek a proof of Christ speaking in me, who is not weak toward you, but mighty in you. 47 13:4 Because, though He was crucified in weakness, yet He lives by the power of God. Because, we also are weak in Him, but we will live with Him by the power of God toward you. 47 13:5 Examine yourselves as to whether you are in the faith. Test yourselves. Do you not know yourselves, that Jesus Christ is in you? Unless indeed you are reprobates. 47 13:6 But I trust that you shall know that we are not reprobates. 47 13:7 Now I pray to God that you do no evil, not that we should appear approved, but that you should do what is honest, even though we are as reprobates. 47 13:8 Because, we can do nothing against the truth, but for the truth. 47 13:9 Because, we are glad when we are weak and you are strong. And this also we desire, even your perfection. 47 13:10 Therefore I write these things being absent, lest being present I should use sharpness, according to the authority which the Lord has given me for edification and not for destruction. 47 13:11 Finally, brethren, farewell. Be perfect. Be of good comfort, be of one mind, live in peace; and the God of love and peace will be with you. 47 13:12 Greet one another with a holy kiss. 47 13:13 All the saints greet you. 47 13:14 The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Spirit be with you all. Amen. 48 1:1 Paul, an apostle (not from men nor by man, but by Jesus Christ and God the Father who raised Him from the dead), 48 1:2 and all the brethren who are with me, to the churches of Galatia: 48 1:3 Grace be to you and peace from God the Father and from our Lord Jesus Christ, 48 1:4 who gave Himself for our sins, that He might deliver us from this present evil age, according to the will of our God and Father, 48 1:5 to whombeglory forever and ever. Amen. 48 1:6 I marvel that you are turning away so soon from Him who called you into the grace of Christ, to another gospel, 48 1:7 which is not another; but there are some who trouble you and want to pervert the gospel of Christ. 48 1:8 But even if we, or an angel from heaven, preachany other gospelto you than what we have preached to you, let him be accursed. 48 1:9 As we have said before, so now I say again, if anyone preaches any other gospel to you than what you have received, let him be accursed. 48 1:10 So am I now persuading men, or God? Or do I seek to please men? Because if I still pleased men, I would not be the servant of Christ. 48 1:11 But I make known to you, brethren, that the gospel which was preached by me is not according to man. 48 1:12 Because, I neither received it from man, nor was I taughtit, but it came by the revelation of Jesus Christ. 48 1:13 Because, you have heard of my former conduct in Judaism,howI persecuted the church of God beyond measure and destroyed it. 48 1:14 And I advanced in Judaism beyond many of my contemporaries in my own nation, being more exceedingly zealous for the traditions of my fathers. 48 1:15 But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother's womb and calledmeby His grace, 48 1:16 to reveal His Son in me, that I might preach Him among the Gentiles, I did not immediately confer with flesh and blood, 48 1:17 nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those whowereapostles before me; but I went to Arabia, and returned again to Damascus. 48 1:18 Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter, and remained with him fifteen days. 48 1:19 But I saw none of the other apostles except James, the Lord's brother. 48 1:20 (Now concerning the things which I write to you, indeed, before God, I do not lie.) 48 1:21 Afterward I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia. 48 1:22 And I was unknown by face to the churches of Judea which were in Christ. 48 1:23 But they had heard only, "He who formerly persecuted us now preaches the faith which he once destroyed." 48 1:24 And they glorified God in me. 48 2:1 Then after fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, and took Titus with me also. 48 2:2 And I went up by revelation, and communicated to them that gospel which I preach among the Gentiles, but privately to those who were of reputation, lest by any means I might run, or had run, in vain. 48 2:3 Yet not even Titus who was with me, being a Greek, was compelled to be circumcised. 48 2:4 And this arose because of false brethren secretly brought in (who came in secretly to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage), 48 2:5 to whom we did not yield submission even for an hour, that the truth of the gospel might continue with you. 48 2:6 But from those who seemed to be something (whatever they were, it makes no difference to me; God shows personal favoritism to no man) because, those who seemedto be somethingadded nothing to me. 48 2:7 But on the contrary, when they saw that the gospel for the uncircumcised had been committed to me, as the gospel for the circumcised was to Peter 48 2:8 (because, He who worked effectively in Peter for the apostleship to the circumcised also worked effectively in me toward the Gentiles), 48 2:9 and when James, Cephas, and John, who seemed to be pillars, perceived the grace that had been given to me, they gave me and Barnabas the right hand of fellowship, that weshould goto the Gentiles and they to the circumcised. 48 2:10 Desiringonly that we should remember the poor, the very thing which I also was eager to do. 48 2:11 But when Peter had come to Antioch, I withstood him to his face, because he was to be blamed; 48 2:12 because, before certain men came from James, he would eat with the Gentiles; but when they came, he withdrew and separated himself, fearing thosewho wereof the circumcision. 48 2:13 And the rest of the Jews also played the hypocrite with him, so that even Barnabas was carried away with their hypocrisy. 48 2:14 But when I saw that they were not straightforward about the truth of the gospel, I said to Peter before them all, "If you, being a Jew, live in the manner of Gentiles and not as the Jews, why do you compel Gentiles to live as Jews? 48 2:15 Wewho areJews by nature, and not sinners of the Gentiles, 48 2:16 knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law but by the faith of Jesus Christ, even we have believed in Jesus Christ, that we might be justified by the faith of Christ and not by the works of the law; because by the works of the law no flesh will be justified. 48 2:17 "But if, while we seek to be justified by Christ, we ourselves also are found sinners, is Christ therefore a minister of sin? God forbid! 48 2:18 Because, if I build again those things which I destroyed, I make myself a transgressor. 48 2:19 Because, I through the law died to the law that I might live to God. 48 2:20 I am crucified with Christ; nevertheless I live, yet not I but Christ lives in me; and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me and gave Himself for me. 48 2:21 I do not reject the grace of God; because, if righteousnesscomesthrough the law, then Christ died in vain." 48 3:1 O foolish Galatians! Who has bewitched you that you should not obey the truth, before whose eyes Jesus Christ was clearly portrayed among you as crucified? 48 3:2 This only I want to learn from you: Did you receive the Spirit by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith? 48 3:3 Are you so foolish? Having begun in the Spirit, are you now being made perfect by the flesh? 48 3:4 Have you suffered so many things in vain, if indeed it was in vain? 48 3:5 Therefore He who supplies the Spirit to you and works miracles among you, does He do it by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith? 48 3:6 Just as Abraham "believed God, and it was accounted to him for righteousness." 48 3:7 Therefore know that those who are of faith, the same are children of Abraham. 48 3:8 And the Scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the Gentiles through faith, preached the gospel to Abraham beforehand,saying, "In you all the nations will be blessed." 48 3:9 So then those who are of faith are blessed with faithful Abraham. 48 3:10 Because, as many as are of the works of the law are under the curse; because it is written, "Cursed is everyone who does not continue in all things which are written in the book of the law, to do them." 48 3:11 But that no one is justified by the law in the sight of God is evident, because "the just will live by faith." 48 3:12 Yet the law is not of faith, but "the man who does them will live in them." 48 3:13 Christ has redeemed us from the curse of the law, having become a curse for us (because it is written, "Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree"), 48 3:14 that the blessing of Abraham might come upon the Gentiles through Christ Jesus, that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith. 48 3:15 Brethren, I speak in the manner of men: Though it is only a man's covenant, yet if it is confirmed, no one annuls or adds to it. 48 3:16 Now to Abraham and his Seed were the promises made. He does not say, "And to seeds," as of many, but as of one, "And to your Seed," who is Christ. 48 3:17 And this I say, that the law, which was four hundred and thirty years later, cannot annul the covenant that was confirmed before by God in Christ, that it should make the promise of no effect. 48 3:18 Because, if the inheritance is of the law, it is no longer of promise; but God gave it to Abraham by promise. 48 3:19 What purpose then does the lawserve? It was added because of transgressions, until the Seed should come to whom the promise was made;and it wasordained through angels by the hand of a mediator. 48 3:20 Now a mediator does notmediatefor one only, but God is one. 48 3:21 Is the law then against the promises of God? God forbid! Because, if there had been a law given which could have given life, truly righteousness would have been by the law. 48 3:22 But the Scripture has concluded all under sin, that the promise by faith, of Jesus Christ, might be given to those who believe. 48 3:23 But before faith came, we were preserved by the law, preserved for the faith which would afterward be revealed. 48 3:24 Therefore the law was an instructorto bring usto Christ, that we might be justified by faith. 48 3:25 But after faith has come, we are no longer under an instructor. 48 3:26 Because, you are all sons of God by faith in Christ Jesus. 48 3:27 Because, as many of you as have been baptized into Christ have put on Christ. 48 3:28 There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither slave nor free, there is neither male nor female; because you are all one in Christ Jesus. 48 3:29 And if you are Christ's, thenyou areAbraham's seed, and heirs according to the promise. 48 4:1 Now I say that the heir, as long as he is a child, does not differ at all from a servant, though he is master of all, 48 4:2 but is under instructors and stewards until the time appointed by the father. 48 4:3 Even so we, when we were children, were in bondage under the elements of the world. 48 4:4 But when the fullness of the time had come, God sent forth His Son, born of a woman, born under the law, 48 4:5 to redeem those who were under the law, that we might receive the adoption as sons. 48 4:6 And because you are sons, God has sent forth the Spirit of His Son into your hearts, crying, "Abba, Father!" 48 4:7 Therefore you are no longer a servant but a son, and if a son, then an heir of God through Christ. 48 4:8 But then, indeed, when you did not know God, you served those which by nature are not gods. 48 4:9 But now after you have known God, or rather are known by God, how is it that you turn again to the weak and beggarly elements, to which you desire again to be in bondage? 48 4:10 You observe days and months and seasons and years. 48 4:11 I am afraid for you, lest I have labored for you in vain. 48 4:12 Brethren, I urge you to be as Iam, because Iamas you are. You have not injured me at all. 48 4:13 You know that because of physical weakness I preached the gospel to you at the first. 48 4:14 And my trial which was in my flesh you did not despise or reject, but you received me as an angel of God,evenas Christ Jesus. 48 4:15 What then was the blessing you spoke of? Because, I bear you witness that, if possible, you would have plucked out your own eyes and given them to me. 48 4:16 Have I therefore become your enemy because I tell you the truth? 48 4:17 They are zealous for you, but for no good; yes, they want to exclude you, that you may be zealous for them. 48 4:18 But it is good to be zealous in a good thing always, and not only when I am present with you. 48 4:19 My little children, for whom I labor in birth again until Christ is formed in you, 48 4:20 I desire to be present with you now and to change my tone; because I stand in doubt concerning you. 48 4:21 Tell me, you who desire to be under the law, do you not hear the law? 48 4:22 Because, it is written that Abraham had two sons: the one by a bondwoman, the other by a freewoman. 48 4:23 But he who was of the bondwoman was born according to the flesh, and he of the freewomanwasby promise, 48 4:24 which things are an allegory. Because, these are the two covenants: the one from Mount Sinai which gives birth to bondage, which is Hagar. 48 4:25 Because, this Hagar is Mount Sinai in Arabia, and corresponds to Jerusalem which now is, and is in bondage with her children. 48 4:26 But the Jerusalem above is free, which is the mother of us all. 48 4:27 Because, it is written: "Rejoice, you barren, you who do not bear! Break forth and cry, you who are not in labor! Because, the desolate has many more children than she who has a husband." 48 4:28 Now we, brethren, as Isaac was, are children of promise. 48 4:29 But, as he who was born according to the flesh then persecuted him who wasbornaccording to the Spirit, even so it is now. 48 4:30 Nevertheless what does the Scripture say? "Cast out the bondwoman and her son, because, the son of the bondwoman will not be heir with the son of the freewoman." 48 4:31 So then, brethren, we are not children of the bondwoman but of the free. 48 5:1 Stand fast therefore in the liberty by which Christ has made us free, and do not be entangled again with a yoke of bondage. 48 5:2 Behold I, Paul, say to you that if you become circumcised, Christ will profit you nothing. 48 5:3 And I testify again to every man who becomes circumcised that he is a debtor to keep the entire law. 48 5:4 Christ has become of no effect to you, those of you who are justified by law; you have fallen from grace. 48 5:5 Because, we through the Spirit wait for the hope of righteousness by faith. 48 5:6 Because, in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails anything, but faith working through love. 48 5:7 You ran well. Who hindered you from obeying the truth? 48 5:8 This persuasion does not come from Him who calls you. 48 5:9 A little leaven leavens the entire lump. 48 5:10 I have confidence in you, through the Lord, that you will have no other mind; but he who troubles you will bearhisjudgment, whoever he is. 48 5:11 And I, brethren, if I still preach circumcision, why do I still suffer persecution? Then the offense of the cross has ceased. 48 5:12 I desire that those who trouble you were cut off. 48 5:13 Because you, brethren, have been called to liberty; only do notuseliberty as an opportunity for the flesh, but through love serve one another. 48 5:14 Because all the law is fulfilled in one word,evenin this: "You shall love your neighbor as yourself." 48 5:15 But if you bite and devour one another, beware that you are not consumed by one another! 48 5:16 This I say then: Walk in the Spirit, and you will not fulfill the lust of the flesh. 48 5:17 Because, the flesh lusts against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh; and these are contrary to one another, so that you do not do the things that you want. 48 5:18 But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under the law. 48 5:19 Now the works of the flesh are evident, which are these: adultery, fornication, uncleanness, lustfulness, 48 5:20 idolatry, witchcraft, hatred, fights, jealousies, rage, selfish ambitions, rebellion, heresies, 48 5:21 envy, murders, drunkenness, partying, and the like; of which I tell you beforehand, just as I also told you in time past, that those who do such things will not inherit the kingdom of God. 48 5:22 But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faith, 48 5:23 meekness, self control. Against such there is no law. 48 5:24 And those who are Christ's have crucified the flesh with its passions and desires. 48 5:25 If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit. 48 5:26 Let us not desire vain glory, provoking one another, envying one another. 48 6:1 Brethren, if anyone is overtaken in any trespass, you who are spiritual restore such a one in a spirit of meekness, considering yourself lest you also be tempted. 48 6:2 Bear one another's burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ. 48 6:3 Because, if anyone thinks himself to be something, when he is nothing, he deceives himself. 48 6:4 But let each one examine his own work, and then he will have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another. 48 6:5 Because each one shall bear his own load. 48 6:6 Let him who is taught the word communicate in every good thing with him who teaches. 48 6:7 Do not be deceived, God is not mocked; because whatever a man sows, that he will also reap. 48 6:8 Because, he who sows to his flesh will of the flesh reap corruption, but he who sows to the Spirit will of the Spirit reap everlasting life. 48 6:9 And let us not grow weary while doing good, because in due season we will reap if we do not lose heart. 48 6:10 Therefore, as we have opportunity, let us do good to everyone, especially to those who are of the household of faith. 48 6:11 You see what a large letter I have written to you with my own hand! 48 6:12 As many as desire to make a good showing in the flesh, these compel you to be circumcised, only lest they should suffer persecution for the cross of Christ. 48 6:13 Because, not even those who are circumcised keep the law, but they desire to have you circumcised that they may boast in your flesh. 48 6:14 But God forbid that I should boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world. 48 6:15 Because, in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails anything, but a new creature. 48 6:16 And as many as walk according to this rule, peace and mercy be upon them, and upon the Israel of God. 48 6:17 From now on let no one trouble me, because I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus. 48 6:18 Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christbewith your spirit. Amen. 49 1:1 Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, to the saints who are in Ephesus, and faithful in Christ Jesus: 49 1:2 Grace be to you and peace from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ. 49 1:3 Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places in Christ, 49 1:4 just as He has chosen us in Him before the foundation of the world, that we should be holy and without blame before Him in love, 49 1:5 having predestined us to adoption as children by Jesus Christ to Himself, according to the good pleasure of His will, 49 1:6 to the praise of the glory of His grace, by which He has made us accepted in the Beloved. 49 1:7 In Him we have redemption through His blood, the forgiveness of sins, according to the riches of His grace 49 1:8 which He made to abound toward us in all wisdom and prudence, 49 1:9 having made known to us the mystery of His will, according to His good pleasure which He has purposed in Himself, 49 1:10 that in the dispensation of the fullness of the times He might gather together in one all things in Christ, both which are in heaven and which are on earth, even in Him. 49 1:11 In Him also we have obtained an inheritance, being predestined according to the purpose of Him who works all things according to the counsel of His own will, 49 1:12 that we who first trusted in Christ should be to the praise of His glory. 49 1:13 In Him you also trusted, after you heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation; in whom also, after you believed, you were sealed with the Holy Spirit of promise, 49 1:14 who is the guarantee of our inheritance until the redemption of the purchased possession, to the praise of His glory. 49 1:15 Therefore I also, after I heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for all the saints, 49 1:16 do not cease to give thanks for you, making mention of you in my prayers: 49 1:17 that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give to you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him, 49 1:18 the eyes of your understanding being enlightened; that you may know what is the hope of His calling, what are the riches of the glory of His inheritance in the saints, 49 1:19 and what is the exceeding greatness of His power toward us who believe, according to the working of His mighty power 49 1:20 which He worked in Christ when He raised Him from the dead and seated Him at His own right hand in the heavenly places, 49 1:21 far above all principality and power and might and dominion, and every name that is named, not only in this age but also in that which is to come. 49 1:22 And has put all things under His feet, and gave Him to be the head over all things to the church, 49 1:23 which is His body, the fullness of Him who fills all in all. 49 2:1 And you He has made alive, who were dead in trespasses and sins, 49 2:2 in which you once walked according to the course of this world, according to the prince of the power of the air, the spirit who now works in the children of disobedience, 49 2:3 among whom also we all once conducted ourselves in the lusts of our flesh, fulfilling the desires of the flesh and of the mind, and were by nature children of wrath, just as the others. 49 2:4 But God, who is rich in mercy, because of His great love with which He loved us, 49 2:5 even when we were dead in sins, made us alive together with Christ (by grace you are saved), 49 2:6 and has raised us up together, and made us sit together in the heavenly places in Christ Jesus, 49 2:7 that in the ages to come He might show the exceeding riches of His grace in His kindness toward us through Christ Jesus. 49 2:8 Because, it is by grace you are saved through faith, and that not of yourselves; it is the gift of God, 49 2:9 not of works, lest anyone should boast. 49 2:10 Because, we are His workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand that we should walk in them. 49 2:11 Therefore remember that you, once Gentiles in the flesh, who are called Uncircumcision by what is called the Circumcision made in the flesh by hands, 49 2:12 that at that time you were without Christ, being aliens from the commonwealth of Israel and strangers from the covenants of promise, having no hope and without God in the world. 49 2:13 But now in Christ Jesus you who once were far off have been brought near by the blood of Christ. 49 2:14 Because, He is our peace, who has made both one, and has broken down the middle wall of separation between us, 49 2:15 having abolished in His flesh the enmity, that is, the law of commandments contained in ordinances, so as to make in Himself one new man from the two, thus making peace, 49 2:16 and that He might reconcile them both to God in one body by the cross, thereby putting to death the enmity. 49 2:17 And came and preached peace to you who were afar off and to those who were near. 49 2:18 Because, through Him we both have access by one Spirit to the Father. 49 2:19 Now, therefore, you are no longer strangers and foreigners, but fellow citizens with the saints and members of the household of God, 49 2:20 and are built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Jesus Christ Himself being the chief cornerstone, 49 2:21 in whom the entire building, being fitted together, grows into a holy temple in the Lord, 49 2:22 in whom you also are being built together for a dwelling place of God through the Spirit. 49 3:1 For this reason I, Paul, the prisoner of Jesus Christ for you Gentiles, 49 3:2 if indeed you have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God which was given to me for you, 49 3:3 how that by revelation He made known to me the mystery (as I have briefly written already, 49 3:4 by which, when you read, you may understand my knowledge in the mystery of Christ), 49 3:5 which in other ages was not made known to the sons of men, as it has now been revealed by the Spirit to His holy apostles and prophets: 49 3:6 that the Gentiles should be fellow heirs, of the same body, and partakers of His promise in Christ through the gospel, 49 3:7 of which I became a minister according to the gift of the grace of God given to me by the effective working of His power. 49 3:8 To me, who am less than the least of all the saints, this grace was given, that I should preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ, 49 3:9 and to make all people see what is the fellowship of the mystery, which from the beginning of the ages has been hidden in God who created all things by Jesus Christ; 49 3:10 to the intent that now the manifold wisdom of God might be made known by the church to the principalities and powers in the heavenly places, 49 3:11 according to the eternal purpose which He accomplished in Christ Jesus our Lord, 49 3:12 in whom we have boldness and access with confidence by the faith of Him. 49 3:13 Therefore I ask that you do not lose heart at my tribulations for you, which is your glory. 49 3:14 For this reason I bow my knees to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, 49 3:15 from whom the whole family in heaven and earth is named, 49 3:16 that He would grant you, according to the riches of His glory, to be strengthened with might by His Spirit in the inner man, 49 3:17 that Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith; that you, being rooted and grounded in love, 49 3:18 may be able to comprehend with all the saints what is the width and length and depth and height, 49 3:19 to know the love of Christ which passes knowledge; that you may be filled with all the fullness of God. 49 3:20 Now to Him who is able to do exceedingly abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that works in us, 49 3:21 to Him be glory in the church by Christ Jesus throughout all ages, forever and ever. Amen. 49 4:1 I, therefore, the prisoner of the Lord, urge you to walk worthy of the calling with which you were called, 49 4:2 with all lowliness and meekness, with longsuffering, bearing with one another in love, 49 4:3 endeavoring to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace. 49 4:4 There is one body and one Spirit, just as you are called in one hope of your calling; 49 4:5 one Lord, one faith, one baptism; 49 4:6 one God and Father of all, who is above all, and through all, and in you all. 49 4:7 But to each one of us grace is given according to the measure of the gift of Christ. 49 4:8 Therefore He says: "When He ascended on high, He led captivity captive, and gave gifts to men." 49 4:9 (Now this, "He ascended," what does it mean but that He also first descended into the lower parts of the earth? 49 4:10 He who descended is also the same who ascended up far above all the heavens, that He might fill all things.) 49 4:11 And He gave some to be apostles, some prophets, some evangelists, and some pastors and teachers, 49 4:12 for the perfecting of the saints, for the work of the ministry, for the edifying of the body of Christ, 49 4:13 until we all come to the unity of the faith and of the knowledge of the Son of God, to a perfect man, to the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ; 49 4:14 that we should no longer be children, tossed to and fro and carried about with every wind of doctrine, by the trickery of men, and cunning craftiness, in which they make plans to deceive, 49 4:15 but, speaking the truth in love, may grow up in all things into Him who is the head, who is Christ, 49 4:16 from whom the entire body, joined and knit together by what every joint supplies, according to the effective working by which every part does its share, causes growth of the body for the edifying of itself in love. 49 4:17 This I say, therefore, and testify in the Lord, that you should no longer walk as the rest of the Gentiles walk, in the vanity of their mind, 49 4:18 having their understanding darkened, being alienated from the life of God, through the ignorance that is in them, because of the blindness of their heart; 49 4:19 who, being past feeling, have given themselves over to filthiness, to work all uncleanness with greediness. 49 4:20 But you have not so learned Christ, 49 4:21 if indeed you have heard Him and have been taught by Him, as the truth is in Jesus: 49 4:22 that you put off, concerning your former conduct, the old man which is corrupted according to the deceitful lusts, 49 4:23 and be renewed in the spirit of your mind, 49 4:24 and that you put on the new man which was created according to God, in righteousness and true holiness. 49 4:25 Therefore, putting away lying, "every one speak truth with his neighbor," because we are members of one another. 49 4:26 "Be angry, and do not sin": do not let the sun go down on your wrath, 49 4:27 nor give place to the devil. 49 4:28 Let him who stole steal no longer, but rather let him labor, working with his hands that which is good, that he may have something to give him who has need. 49 4:29 Let no corrupt word proceed out of your mouth, but what is good for necessary edification, that it may minister grace to the hearers. 49 4:30 And do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God, by whom you were sealed for the day of redemption. 49 4:31 Let all bitterness, wrath, anger, clamor, and evil speaking be put away from you, with all malice. 49 4:32 And be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, just as God forgave you because of Christ. 49 5:1 You therefore be followers of God as dear children. 49 5:2 And walk in love, as Christ also has loved us and given Himself for us, an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweet smelling aroma. 49 5:3 But fornication and all uncleanness or covetousness, let it not even be named among you, as is fitting for saints; 49 5:4 neither filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor coarse jesting, which are not fitting, but rather giving of thanks. 49 5:5 Because, you know this; that no fornicator, unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, has any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God. 49 5:6 Let no one deceive you with vain words, for because of these things the wrath of God comes upon the children of disobedience. 49 5:7 Therefore do not be partakers with them. 49 5:8 Because, you were once darkness, but now you are light in the Lord. Walk as children of light 49 5:9 (because, the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness, righteousness, and truth), 49 5:10 finding out what is acceptable to the Lord. 49 5:11 And have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove them. 49 5:12 Because, it is shameful even to speak of those things which are done by them in secret. 49 5:13 But all things that are exposed are made manifest by the light, because whatever makes manifest is light. 49 5:14 Therefore He says: "Awake, you who sleep, arise from the dead, and Christ will give you light." 49 5:15 See then that you walk circumspectly, not as fools but as wise, 49 5:16 redeeming the time, because the days are evil. 49 5:17 Therefore do not be unwise, but understand what the will of the Lord is. 49 5:18 And do not be drunk with wine, in which is dissipation; but be filled with the Spirit, 49 5:19 speaking to yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in your heart to the Lord, 49 5:20 giving thanks always for all things to God, even the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, 49 5:21 submitting yourselves to one another in the reverence of God. 49 5:22 Wives, submit yourselves to your own husbands, as to the Lord. 49 5:23 Because, the husband is the head of the wife, just as Christ is head of the church; and He is the Savior of the body. 49 5:24 Therefore, just as the church is subject to Christ, so let the wives be to their own husbands in everything. 49 5:25 Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ also loved the church and gave Himself for her, 49 5:26 that He might sanctify and cleanse her with the washing of water by the word, 49 5:27 that He might present her to Himself a glorious church, not having spot or wrinkle or any such thing, but that she should be holy and without blemish. 49 5:28 So husbands ought to love their wives as their own bodies; he who loves his wife loves himself. 49 5:29 Because, no one ever hated his own flesh, but nourishes and cherishes it, just as the Lord does the church. 49 5:30 Because, we are members of His body, of His flesh and of His bones. 49 5:31 "For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother and will be joined to his wife, and the two will become one flesh." 49 5:32 This is a great mystery, but I speak concerning Christ and the church. 49 5:33 Nevertheless let each one of you in particular so love his own wife just as himself, and let the wife see that she reverence her husband. 49 6:1 Children, obey your parents in the Lord, because this is right. 49 6:2 "Honor your father and mother," which is the first commandment with promise: 49 6:3 "that it may be well with you and you may live long on the earth." 49 6:4 And you, fathers, do not provoke your children to wrath, but bring them up in the training and admonition of the Lord. 49 6:5 Servants, be obedient to those who are your masters according to the flesh, with reverence and trembling, in sincerity of heart, as to Christ; 49 6:6 not with eye service, as men pleasers, but as servants of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart, 49 6:7 with goodwill doing service, as to the Lord, and not to men, 49 6:8 knowing that whatever good anyone does, he will receive the same from the Lord, whether he is a servant or free. 49 6:9 And you, masters, do the same things to them, giving up threatening, knowing that your own Master also is in heaven, and there is no personal favoritism with Him. 49 6:10 Finally, my brethren, be strong in the Lord and in the power of His might. 49 6:11 Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the schemes of the devil. 49 6:12 Because, we do not wrestle against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this age, against spiritual wickedness in the heavenly places. 49 6:13 Therefore take up the whole armor of God, that you may be able to withstand in the evil day, and having done everything, to stand. 49 6:14 Stand therefore, having wrapped your waist with truth, having put on the breastplate of righteousness, 49 6:15 and shod your feet with the preparation of the gospel of peace; 49 6:16 above all, taking the shield of faith with which you will be able to quench all the fiery darts of the wicked. 49 6:17 And take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God; 49 6:18 praying always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit, being watchful to this end with all perseverance and supplication for all the saints; 49 6:19 and for me, that utterance may be given to me, that I may open my mouth boldly to make known the mystery of the gospel, 49 6:20 for which I am an ambassador in chains; that in it I may speak boldly, as I ought to speak. 49 6:21 But that you also may know my affairs and how I am doing, Tychicus, a beloved brother and faithful minister in the Lord, will make all things known to you; 49 6:22 whom I have sent to you for this very purpose, that you may know our affairs, and that he may comfort your hearts. 49 6:23 Peace be to the brethren, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. 49 6:24 Grace be with all those who love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity. Amen. 50 1:1 Paul and Timothy, the servants of Jesus Christ, to all the saints in Christ Jesus who are in Philippi, with the bishops and deacons: 50 1:2 Grace be to you and peace from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ. 50 1:3 I thank my God upon every remembrance of you, 50 1:4 always in every prayer of mine making request for you all with joy, 50 1:5 for your fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now, 50 1:6 being confident of this very thing, that He who has begun a good work in you will complete it until the day of Jesus Christ; 50 1:7 just as it is right for me to think this of you all, because I have you in my heart, inasmuch as both in my chains and in the defense and confirmation of the gospel, you all are partakers of my grace. 50 1:8 Because, God is my witness, how greatly I long for you all with the affection of Jesus Christ. 50 1:9 And this I pray, that your love may abound still more and more in knowledge and in all discernment, 50 1:10 that you may approve the things that are excellent, that you may be sincere and without offense until the day of Christ, 50 1:11 being filled with the fruits of righteousness which are by Jesus Christ, to the glory and praise of God. 50 1:12 But I want you to understand, brethren, that the things which happened to me have actually turned out for the furtherance of the gospel, 50 1:13 so that it has become evident to the entire palace, and to every other place, that my chains are in Christ; 50 1:14 and most of the brethren in the Lord, having become confident by my chains, are much more bold to speak the word without fear. 50 1:15 Some indeed preach Christ even from envy and strife, and some also from goodwill: 50 1:16 The former preach Christ from contention, not sincerely, supposing to add affliction to my chains; 50 1:17 but the other out of love, knowing that I am appointed for the defense of the gospel. 50 1:18 What then? Only that in every way, whether in pretense or in truth, Christ is preached; and in this I rejoice, yes, and will rejoice. 50 1:19 Because, I know that this will turn out for my deliverance through your prayer and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ, 50 1:20 according to my earnest expectation and my hope that in nothing I shall be ashamed, but that with all boldness, as always, so now also Christ will be magnified in my body, whether it be by life or by death. 50 1:21 Because to me, to live is Christ, and to die is gain. 50 1:22 But if I live on in the flesh, this will mean fruit from my labor; yet what I shall choose I do not know. 50 1:23 Because, I am hard pressed between the two, having a desire to depart and be with Christ, which is far better. 50 1:24 Nevertheless to abide in the flesh is more needful for you. 50 1:25 And being confident of this, I know that I will abide and continue with you all for your progress and joy of faith, 50 1:26 that your rejoicing for me may be more abundant in Jesus Christ by my coming to you again. 50 1:27 Only let your conduct be worthy of the gospel of Christ, so that whether I come and see you or am absent, I may hear of your affairs, that you stand fast in one spirit, with one mind striving together for the faith of the gospel, 50 1:28 and not in any way terrified by your adversaries, which is to them a proof of perdition, but to you of salvation, and that from God. 50 1:29 Because, to you it has been granted on behalf of Christ, not only to believe on Him, but also to suffer for His sake, 50 1:30 having the same conflict which you saw in me and now hear is in me. 50 2:1 Therefore if there is any consolation in Christ, if any comfort of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any affection and mercy, 50 2:2 fulfill my joy by being likeminded, having the same love, being of one accord, of one mind. 50 2:3 Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory, but in lowliness of mind let each esteem others better than themselves. 50 2:4 Let each of you look out not only for his own interests, but also for the interests of others. 50 2:5 Let this mind be in you which was also in Christ Jesus, 50 2:6 who, being in the form of God, did not consider it robbery to be equal with God, 50 2:7 but made Himself of no reputation, and took on Himself the form of a servant, and was made in the likeness of men. 50 2:8 And being found in appearance as a man, He humbled Himself and became obedient to death, even the death of the cross. 50 2:9 Therefore God also has highly exalted Him and given Him a name which is above every name, 50 2:10 that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of those in heaven, and of those on earth, and of those under the earth, 50 2:11 and that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father. 50 2:12 Therefore, my beloved, as you have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with reverence and trembling; 50 2:13 because, it is God who works in you both to will and to do for His good pleasure. 50 2:14 Do all things without complaining and disputing, 50 2:15 that you may be blameless and harmless, the sons of God without fault in the midst of a crooked and perverse generation, among whom you shine as lights in the world, 50 2:16 holding forth the word of life, so that I may rejoice in the day of Christ that I have not run in vain or labored in vain. 50 2:17 Yes, and if I am being offered on the sacrifice and service of your faith, I am glad and rejoice with you all. 50 2:18 For the same reason you also be glad and rejoice with me. 50 2:19 But I trust in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you shortly, that I also may be encouraged when I know your state. 50 2:20 Because I have no one likeminded, who will naturally care for your state. 50 2:21 Because all seek their own, not the things which are Jesus Christ's. 50 2:22 But you know his proven character, that like a son with his father, he served with me in the gospel. 50 2:23 Therefore I hope to send him at once, as soon as I see how it will go with me. 50 2:24 But I trust in the Lord that I myself shall also come shortly. 50 2:25 Yet I considered it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother, fellow worker, and fellow soldier, but your messenger and he who ministered to my need; 50 2:26 since he was longing for you all, and was full of heaviness, because you had heard that he had been sick. 50 2:27 Because, indeed he was sick almost to death; but God had mercy on him, and not only on him but on me also, lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow. 50 2:28 Therefore I sent him the more eagerly, that when you see him again you may rejoice, and I may be less sorrowful. 50 2:29 Receive him therefore in the Lord with all gladness, and hold such men in esteem; 50 2:30 because for the work of Christ he came close to death, not regarding his life, to supply what was lacking in your service toward me. 50 3:1 Finally, my brethren, rejoice in the Lord. For me to write the same things to you is not tedious, but for you it is safe. 50 3:2 Beware of dogs, beware of evil workers, beware of the mutilation! 50 3:3 Because, we are the circumcision, who worship God in the Spirit, rejoice in Christ Jesus, and have no confidence in the flesh, 50 3:4 though I also might have confidence in the flesh. If anyone else thinks he may have confidence in the flesh, I more so: 50 3:5 circumcised the eighth day, of the stock of Israel, of the tribe of Benjamin, a Hebrew of the Hebrews; concerning the law, a Pharisee; 50 3:6 concerning zeal, persecuting the church; concerning the righteousness which is in the law, blameless. 50 3:7 But what things were gain to me, these I have counted loss for Christ. 50 3:8 Yet indeed I also count all things as loss for the excellence of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord, for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and count them as manure, that I may gain Christ 50 3:9 and be found in Him, not having my own righteousness, which is from the law, but that which is through the faith of Christ, the righteousness which is from God by faith; 50 3:10 that I may know Him and the power of His resurrection, and the fellowship of His sufferings, being conformed to His death, 50 3:11 if, by any means, I may attain to the resurrection from the dead. 50 3:12 Not that I have already attained, or am already perfected; but I press on, that I may apprehend that for which Christ Jesus has also laid hold of me. 50 3:13 Brethren, I do not count myself to have attained; but this one thing I do, forgetting those things which are behind and reaching forward to those things which are ahead, 50 3:14 I press toward the goal for the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus. 50 3:15 Therefore let us, as many as are perfect, have this mind; and if in anything you think otherwise, God will reveal even this to you. 50 3:16 Nevertheless, to the degree that we have already attained, let us walk by the same rule, let us be of the same mind. 50 3:17 Brethren, join in following my example, and note those who so walk, as you have us for an example. 50 3:18 Because many walk, of whom I have told you often, and now tell you even weeping, that they are the enemies of the cross of Christ: 50 3:19 whose end is destruction, whose god is their belly, and whose glory is in their shame, who mind earthly things. 50 3:20 Because, our citizenship is in heaven, from which we also eagerly wait for the Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ, 50 3:21 who will transform our vile body that it may be conformed to His glorious body, according to the working by which He is able even to subdue all things to Himself. 50 4:1 Therefore, my greatly beloved and longed for brethren, my joy and crown, so stand fast in the Lord, my greatly beloved. 50 4:2 I implore Euodia and I implore Syntyche to be of the same mind in the Lord. 50 4:3 And I urge you also, true companion, help those women who labored with me in the gospel, with Clement also, and the rest of my fellow workers, whose names are in the Book of Life. 50 4:4 Rejoice in the Lord always. And again I will say, rejoice! 50 4:5 Let your moderation be known to all men. The Lord is at hand. 50 4:6 Be anxious for nothing, but in everything by prayer and supplication, with thanksgiving, let your requests be made known to God; 50 4:7 and the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus. 50 4:8 Finally, brethren, whatever things are true, whatever things are honest, whatever things are just, whatever things are pure, whatever things are lovely, whatever things are of good report, if there is any virtue and if there is anything praiseworthy, meditate on these things. 50 4:9 Those things which you learned and received and heard and saw in me, these do also, and the God of peace will be with you. 50 4:10 But I rejoiced in the Lord greatly that now at last your care for me has flourished again; though you surely did care, but you lacked opportunity. 50 4:11 Not that I speak in regard to need, because I have learned in whatever state I am, to be content with it: 50 4:12 I know both how to be abased, and I know how to abound. Everywhere and in all things I have learned both to be full and to be hungry, both to abound and to suffer need. 50 4:13 I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me. 50 4:14 Nevertheless you have done well that you shared in my affliction. 50 4:15 Now you Philippians know also that in the beginning of the gospel, when I departed from Macedonia, no church shared with me concerning giving and receiving but you alone. 50 4:16 Because even in Thessalonica you sent aid once and again for my necessities. 50 4:17 Not because I desire the gift, but I desire the fruit that abounds to your account. 50 4:18 But I have all and abound. I am full, having received from Epaphroditus the things that were sent from you, a sweet smelling aroma, an acceptable sacrifice, well pleasing to God. 50 4:19 And my God will supply all your need according to His riches in glory by Christ Jesus. 50 4:20 Now to our God and Father be glory forever and ever. Amen. 50 4:21 Greet every saint in Christ Jesus. The brethren who are with me greet you. 50 4:22 All the saints greet you, but especially those who are of Caesar's household. 50 4:23 The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all.
