Amen. 51 1:1 Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, 51 1:2 To the saints and faithful brethren in Christ who are at Colosse: Grace be to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. 51 1:3 We give thanks to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, always praying for you, 51 1:4 since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus, and of your love for all the saints; 51 1:5 because of the hope which is laid up for you in heaven, of which you heard before in the word of the truth of the gospel, 51 1:6 which has come to you, as it has also in all the world, and is bearing fruit, as it is also among you since the day you heard about it, and knew the grace of God in truth; 51 1:7 as you also learned from Epaphras, our dear fellow servant, who is a faithful minister of Christ on your behalf, 51 1:8 who also declared to us your love in the Spirit. 51 1:9 For this reason we also, since the day we heard it, do not cease to pray for you, and to desire that you may be filled with the knowledge of His will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding; 51 1:10 that you may walk worthy of the Lord, fully pleasing Him, being fruitful in every good work and increasing in the knowledge of God; 51 1:11 strengthened with all might, according to His glorious power, for all patience and longsuffering with joy; 51 1:12 giving thanks to the Father who has qualified us to be partakers in the inheritance of the saints in the light, 51 1:13 who has delivered us from the power of darkness and translated us into the kingdom of His beloved Son, 51 1:14 in whom we have redemption through His blood even the forgiveness of sins. 51 1:15 He is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn over all creation. 51 1:16 Because, all things were created by Him that are in heaven and that are on earth, visible and invisible, whether they are thrones or dominions or principalities or powers. All things were created by Him and for Him. 51 1:17 And He is before all things, and by Him all things consist. 51 1:18 And He is the head of the body, the church, who is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead, that in all things He may have the preeminence. 51 1:19 Because, it pleased the Father that in Him all the fullness should dwell, 51 1:20 and by Him, having made peace through the blood of His cross, to reconcile all things to Himself, by Him, whether things on earth or things in heaven. 51 1:21 And you, who once were alienated and enemies in your mind by wicked works, yet now He has reconciled 51 1:22 in the body of His flesh through death, to present you holy, and blameless, and above reproach in His sight, 51 1:23 if you continue in the faith, grounded and steadfast, and are not moved away from the hope of the gospel which you heard, and which was preached to every creature under heaven, of which I, Paul, became a minister. 51 1:24 I now rejoice in my sufferings for you, and fill up in my flesh what is lacking in the afflictions of Christ, for the sake of His body, which is the church, 51 1:25 of which I became a minister according to the stewardship from God which was given to me for you, to fulfill the word of God, 51 1:26 even the mystery which has been hidden from ages and from generations, but now has been revealed to His saints. 51 1:27 To them God desired to make known what are the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles: which is Christ in you, the hope of glory. 51 1:28 Him we preach, warning every man and teaching every man in all wisdom, that we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus. 51 1:29 To this end I also labor, striving according to His working which works in me mightily. 51 2:1 Because, I want you to know what a great conflict I have for you and for those in Laodicea, and for as many as have not seen my face in the flesh, 51 2:2 that their hearts may be encouraged, being knit together in love, and attaining to all the riches of the full assurance of understanding, to the knowledge of the mystery of God, both of the Father and of Christ, 51 2:3 in whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge. 51 2:4 Now this I say lest anyone should deceive you with persuasive words. 51 2:5 Because, though I am absent in the flesh, yet I am with you in the spirit, rejoicing to see your order and the firmness of your faith in Christ. 51 2:6 Therefore, as you have received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk in Him, 51 2:7 rooted and built up in Him and established in the faith, just as you have been taught, abounding in it with thanksgiving. 51 2:8 Beware lest anyone rob you through philosophy and vain deceit, according to the tradition of men, according to the basic principles of the world, and not according to Christ. 51 2:9 Because, in Him dwells all the fullness of the Godhead bodily; 51 2:10 and you are complete in Him, who is the head of all principality and power. 51 2:11 In Him you were also circumcised with the circumcision made without hands, by putting off the body of the sins of the flesh, by the circumcision of Christ, 51 2:12 buried with Him in baptism, in which you also were raised with Him through the faith of the working of God, who has raised Him from the dead. 51 2:13 And you, being dead in your sins and the uncircumcision of your flesh, He has made alive together with Him, having forgiven you all trespasses, 51 2:14 having erased the written record of commands that were against us, which was contrary to us, and took it out of the way, nailing it to the cross. 51 2:15 Having disarmed principalities and powers, He made a spectacle of them, triumphing over them in it. 51 2:16 Therefore let no man judge you in food or in drink, or regarding a holyday, or of the new moon, or of the sabbath days, 51 2:17 which are a shadow of things to come, but the body is of Christ. 51 2:18 Let no one rob you of your reward, delighting in false humility and worship of angels, meddling into those things which he has not seen, vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind, 51 2:19 And not clinging to the Head, from whom all the body, nourished and knit together by joints and ligaments, increases with the increase from God. 51 2:20 Therefore, if you are dead with Christ from the basic principles of the world, why, as though living in the world, are you subject to regulations, 51 2:21 ("Do not touch, do not taste, do not handle," 51 2:22 which all concern things which perish with the using) according to the commandments and doctrines of men? 51 2:23 These things certainly have an appearance of wisdom in self imposed worship and humility, and neglecting of the body, but have no value against the indulgence of the flesh. 51 3:1 If then you are risen with Christ, seek those things which are above, where Christ is sitting at the right hand of God. 51 3:2 Set your affections on things above, not on things on the earth. 51 3:3 Because, you are dead, and your life is hidden with Christ in God. 51 3:4 When Christ who is our life appears, then you also will appear with Him in glory. 51 3:5 Therefore put to death your members which are on the earth; fornication, uncleanness, inordinate passion, evil desire, and covetousness, which is idolatry. 51 3:6 Because of these things the wrath of God is coming upon the children of disobedience, 51 3:7 in which you also once walked when you lived in them. 51 3:8 But now you also put off all these: anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy language out of your mouth. 51 3:9 Do not lie to one another, seeing you have put off the old man with his deeds, 51 3:10 and have put on the new man, who is renewed in knowledge according to the image of Him who created him, 51 3:11 where there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcised nor uncircumcised, Barbarian, Scythian, slave nor free: but Christ is all and in all. 51 3:12 Therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, put on tender mercies, kindness, humility of mind, meekness, longsuffering; 51 3:13 bearing with one another, and forgiving one another, if anyone has a complaint against another; just as Christ forgave you, so you do likewise. 51 3:14 And above all these things put on love, which is the bond of perfection. 51 3:15 And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to which you also were called in one body; and be thankful. 51 3:16 Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom, teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord. 51 3:17 And whatever you do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by Him. 51 3:18 Wives, submit to your own husbands, as is acceptable in the Lord. 51 3:19 Husbands, love your wives, and do not be bitter against them. 51 3:20 Children, obey your parents in all things, because this is well pleasing to the Lord. 51 3:21 Fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, lest they become discouraged. 51 3:22 Servants, obey your masters according to the flesh in all things, not with eye service, as men pleasers, but in singleness of heart, reverencing God. 51 3:23 And whatever you do, do it with all your heart, as to the Lord and not to men, 51 3:24 knowing that from the Lord you will receive the reward of the inheritance; because you serve the Lord Christ. 51 3:25 But he who does wrong will be repaid for the wrong that he has done, and there is no personal favoritism. 51 4:1 Masters, give to your servants that which is just and balanced, knowing that you also have a Master in heaven. 51 4:2 Continue in prayer, and watch in it with thanksgiving; 51 4:3 meanwhile praying also for us, that God would open to us a door for the word, to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I am also in chains, 51 4:4 that I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak. 51 4:5 Walk in wisdom toward those who are outside, redeeming the time. 51 4:6 Let your speech always be with grace, seasoned with salt, that you may know how you ought to answer each person. 51 4:7 Tychicus, who is a beloved brother, a faithful minister and fellow servant in the Lord, will tell you about my state of affairs 51 4:8 whom I have sent to you for the same purpose, that he might know your circumstances, and comfort your hearts, 51 4:9 with Onesimus, a faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They will make known to you all things that are happening here. 51 4:10 Aristarchus my fellow prisoner greets you, with Mark, the sister's son of Barnabas, (about whom you received instructions: if he comes to you, receive him), 51 4:11 and Jesus, who is called Justus, who are of the circumcision. These are my only fellow workers for the kingdom of God who have proven to be a comfort to me. 51 4:12 Epaphras, who is one of you, a servant of Christ, greets you, always laboring fervently for you in prayers, that you may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God. 51 4:13 Because, I bear him record, that he has a great zeal for you, and those who are in Laodicea, and those in Hierapolis. 51 4:14 Luke, the beloved physician and Demas greet you. 51 4:15 Greet the brethren who are in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the church that is in his house. 51 4:16 Now when this letter is read among you, see that it is read in the church of the Laodiceans also, and that you likewise read the letter from Laodicea. 51 4:17 And say to Archippus, "Take heed to the ministry that you have received in the Lord, that you fulfill it." 51 4:18 The salutation of Paul, by my own hand. Remember my chains. Grace be with you. Amen. 52 1:1 Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy, to the church of the Thessalonians which is in God the Father and in the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace be to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. 52 1:2 We always give thanks to God for you all, making mention of you in our prayers, 52 1:3 remembering without ceasing your work of faith, labor of love, and patience of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ in the sight of God even our Father, 52 1:4 knowing, beloved brethren, your election by God. 52 1:5 Because, our gospel did not come to you in word only, but also in power, and in the Holy Spirit and in much assurance, as you know what sort of men we were among you for your sake. 52 1:6 And you became followers of us and of the Lord, having received the word in much affliction, with joy of the Holy Spirit, 52 1:7 so that you were examples to all who believe in Macedonia and Achaia. 52 1:8 Because, from you the word of the Lord sounded forth, not only in Macedonia and Achaia, but also in every place your faith towards God is proclaimed, so that we do not need to say anything. 52 1:9 Because, they themselves declare concerning us what sort of entry we had to you, and how you turned to God from idols to serve the living and true God, 52 1:10 and to wait for His Son from heaven, whom He raised from the dead, even Jesus, who delivered us from the wrath to come. 52 2:1 Because, you yourselves know brethren, that our coming to you was not in vain. 52 2:2 But even after we had suffered beforehand and were disgraced at Philippi, as you know, we were bold in our God to speak to you the gospel of God in much conflict. 52 2:3 Because, our exhortation did not come from deception, nor of uncleanness, nor in trickery. 52 2:4 But as we have been approved by God to be entrusted with the gospel, even so we speak, not as pleasing men, but God, who tests our hearts. 52 2:5 Because, neither at any time did we use flattering words, as you know, nor a cloak of covetousness, God is witness. 52 2:6 Nor did we seek glory from men, either from you or from others, when we might have been burdensome, as the apostles of Christ. 52 2:7 But we were gentle among you, even as a nursing mother cherishes her children. 52 2:8 So affectionately longing for you, we were willing to impart to you, not just the gospel of God, but also our own souls, because you were dear to us. 52 2:9 Because you remember, brethren, our labor and toil; because, laboring night and day, since we did not want to be a burden to any of you, we preached to you the gospel of God. 52 2:10 You are witnesses, and God also, how holy and justly and blamelessly we behaved ourselves among you who believe; 52 2:11 as you know how we exhorted and comforted and commanded every one of you, as a father does to his children, 52 2:12 that you would walk worthy of God, who has called you into His kingdom and glory. 52 2:13 For this reason also we thank God without ceasing, because when you received the word of God which you heard from us, you did not receive it as the word of men, but as it is in truth, the word of God, which also effectually works in you who believe. 52 2:14 Because you, brethren, became followers of the churches of God which in Judea are in Christ Jesus. Because, you also have suffered similar things from your own countrymen, just as they have from the Jews, 52 2:15 who killed both the Lord Jesus and their own prophets, and have persecuted us; and they do not please God, and are contrary to all men, 52 2:16 forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles that they may be saved, to always fill up their sins; because of which the wrath is coming upon them to the uttermost. 52 2:17 But we, brethren, being taken away from you for a short time in presence, not in heart, endeavored more eagerly to see your face with great longing. 52 2:18 Therefore we wanted to come to you, even I, Paul, time and again, but Satan hindered us. 52 2:19 Because what is our hope, or joy, or crown of rejoicing? Is it not even you in the presence of our Lord Jesus Christ at His coming? 52 2:20 Because you are our glory and joy. 52 3:1 Therefore when we could no longer endure it, we thought it good to be left in Athens alone, 52 3:2 and sent Timothy, our brother and minister of God, and our fellow laborer in the gospel of Christ, to establish you and to encourage you concerning your faith, 52 3:3 that no one should be shaken by these afflictions; because you yourselves know that we are appointed to this. 52 3:4 Because indeed, we told you before when we were with you that we would suffer tribulation, just as it came to pass, and you know. 52 3:5 Because of this reason, when I could no longer endure it, I sent to know your faith, lest by some means the tempter had tempted you, and our labor might be in vain. 52 3:6 But now when Timothy came to us from you, and brought us good news of your faith and love, and that you always have good remembrance of us, earnestly desiring to see us, as we also to see you, 52 3:7 therefore, brethren, in all our affliction and distress we were comforted concerning you by your faith. 52 3:8 Because now we live, if you stand firmly in the Lord. 52 3:9 Because, what thanks can we offer back to God for you, for all the joy with which we rejoice for your sake before our God, 52 3:10 night and day praying exceedingly that we may see your face and would perfect that which is lacking in your faith? 52 3:11 Now may God Himself even our Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ, direct our way to you. 52 3:12 And the Lord make you to increase and abound in love towards one another, and towards all men, just as we do towards you, 52 3:13 so that He may establish your hearts blameless in holiness before God, even our Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ with all His saints. 52 4:1 Furthermore then brethren, we urge you and exhort you by the Lord Jesus, that just as you have received from us how you ought to walk and to please God, that you should abound more and more. 52 4:2 Because, you know what commandments we gave you by the Lord Jesus. 52 4:3 Because, this is the will of God, your sanctification: that you should abstain from sexual immorality; 52 4:4 that every one of you should know how to possess his vessel in sanctification and honor, 52 4:5 not in the passion of lust, just as the Gentiles who do not know God; 52 4:6 that no one should take advantage of and defraud his brother in any matter, because the Lord is the avenger of all such, as we have also forewarned you and testified. 52 4:7 Because, God has not called us to uncleanness, but to holiness. 52 4:8 Therefore he who despises, does not despise man, but God, who has also given to us His Holy Spirit. 52 4:9 But concerning brotherly love you do not need that I should write to you, because you yourselves are taught by God to love one another; 52 4:10 and indeed you do so toward all the brethren who are in all Macedonia. But we urge you, brethren, that you increase more and more; 52 4:11 that you also study to be quiet, and to do your own business, and to work with your own hands, as we commanded you, 52 4:12 that you may walk honestly toward those who are outside, and that you may lack nothing. 52 4:13 But I do not want you to be ignorant, brethren, concerning those who are asleep, that you do not mourn just like others who have no hope. 52 4:14 Because, if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, in the same way, God will bring with Him those who sleep in Jesus. 52 4:15 Because, we say this to you by the word of the Lord, that we who are alive and remain until the coming of the Lord will not go before those who are asleep. 52 4:16 Because, the Lord Himself will descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of an archangel, and with the trumpet of God. Then the dead in Christ will rise first. 52 4:17 Then we who are alive and remain will be caught up together with them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air. And then we will always be with the Lord. 52 4:18 Therefore comfort one another with these words. 52 5:1 But concerning the times and the seasons, brethren, you do not have any need that I write to you. 52 5:2 Because, you yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord comes as a thief in the night. 52 5:3 Because, when they say, "Peace and safety!" then sudden destruction comes upon them, like labor pains upon a pregnant woman. And they will not escape. 52 5:4 But you, brethren, are not in darkness, that this Day should overtake you like a thief. 52 5:5 You are all the children of light, and the children of the day, we are not of the night, nor of darkness. 52 5:6 Therefore let us not sleep, as others do, but let us watch and be sober. 52 5:7 Because, those who sleep, sleep at night, and those who are drunk are drunk at night. 52 5:8 But let us who are of the day be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love, and as a helmet, the hope of salvation. 52 5:9 Because, God has not appointed us to wrath, but to obtain salvation by our Lord Jesus Christ, 52 5:10 who died for us, that whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with Him. 52 5:11 Therefore comfort each other and edify one another, just as you also are doing. 52 5:12 And we urge you, brethren, to recognize those who labor among you, and are over you in the Lord and advise you, 52 5:13 and to esteem them very highly in love for their work's sake. And be at peace among yourselves. 52 5:14 Now we exhort you, brethren, warn those who are disorderly, comfort the feebleminded, support the weak, be patient towards everyone. 52 5:15 See that no one renders evil for evil to anyone, but always pursue that which is good both for yourselves, and for everyone. 52 5:16 Rejoice always, 52 5:17 pray without ceasing, 52 5:18 in everything give thanks; because this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you. 52 5:19 Do not quench the Spirit. 52 5:20 Do not despise prophecies. 52 5:21 Test all things; hold firmly to that which is good. 52 5:22 Abstain from every appearance of evil. 52 5:23 And may the God of peace sanctify you completely; and I ask God that your entire spirit, soul, and body be preserved blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ. 52 5:24 He who calls you is faithful, who also will do it. 52 5:25 Brethren, pray for us. 52 5:26 Greet all the brethren with a holy kiss. 52 5:27 I command you by the Lord that this letter be read to all the holy brethren. 52 5:28 The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen. 53 1:1 Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy, to the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ: 53 1:2 Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. 53 1:3 We are bound to thank God always for you, brethren, as it is fitting, because your faith grows exceptionally, and the love of every one of you all abounds toward each other, 53 1:4 so that we ourselves boast about you in the churches of God for your patience and faith in all your persecutions and afflictions that you endure, 53 1:5 which is clear evidence of the righteous judgment of God, that you may be counted worthy of the kingdom of God, for which you also suffer; 53 1:6 seeing it is a righteous thing with God to repay with affliction those who trouble you, 53 1:7 and you who are troubled rest with us, when the Lord Jesus will be revealed from heaven with His mighty angels, 53 1:8 in flaming fire taking vengeance on those who do not know God, and who do not obey the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ. 53 1:9 These will be punished with everlasting destruction from the presence of the Lord, and from the glory of His power, 53 1:10 when He comes in that day to be glorified in His saints, and to be admired among all those who believe, because our testimony among you was believed. 53 1:11 Therefore we also pray always for you, that our God would count you worthy of this calling, and fulfill all the good pleasure of His goodness, and the work of faith with power, 53 1:12 that the name of our Lord Jesus Christ may be glorified in you, and you in Him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ. 53 2:1 Now brethren, concerning the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, and concerning our gathering together to Him, we urge you, 53 2:2 not to be suddenly shaken in mind or to be troubled, either by a spirit or by a word, or by a letter as if from us, as though the Day of Christ is at hand. 53 2:3 Let no one deceive you by any means; because, that Day will not come unless a falling away comes first, and the man of sin is revealed, the son of perdition, 53 2:4 who opposes and exalts himself above all that is called God or that is worshiped, so that he sits as God in the temple of God, declaring that he himself is God. 53 2:5 Do you not remember that when I was still with you, I told you these things? 53 2:6 And now you know what is restraining that he might be revealed in his time. 53 2:7 Because, the mystery of iniquity is at work already; only He who now restrains will restrain, until He is taken out of the way. 53 2:8 And then that wicked one will be revealed, whom the Lord will consume with the Spirit of His mouth and will destroy with the brightness of His coming. 53 2:9 Even him, whose coming is according to the working of Satan with all power, signs, and lying wonders, 53 2:10 and with all unrighteous deception amongst those who perish, because they did not receive the love of the truth, that they might be saved. 53 2:11 And for this reason God will send them strong delusion, that they should believe a lie, 53 2:12 that they all might be damned who did not believe the truth but had pleasure in unrighteousness. 53 2:13 But we are bound to give thanks to God always for you, brethren beloved by the Lord, because God has chosen you from the beginning for salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth, 53 2:14 to which He called you by our gospel, for the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ. 53 2:15 Therefore, brethren, stand firm, and hold the traditions which you were taught, whether by word or our letter. 53 2:16 Now may our Lord Jesus Christ Himself, and God, even our Father, who has loved us and has given us everlasting help and good hope through grace, 53 2:17 encourage your hearts and establish you in every good word and work. 53 3:1 Finally, brethren, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may have a free course, and be glorified, just as it is with you, 53 3:2 and that we may be delivered from unreasonable and wicked men; because not everyone has faith. 53 3:3 But the Lord is faithful, who will establish you and keep you from evil. 53 3:4 And we have confidence in the Lord concerning you, both that you do and will do the things that we command you. 53 3:5 Now may the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God and into the perseverance for Christ. 53 3:6 Now we command you, brethren, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you withdraw yourselves from every brother who walks disorderly and not according to the tradition which he received from us. 53 3:7 Because you yourselves know how you ought to follow us, because we were not disorderly among you; 53 3:8 Neither did we eat anyone's bread free of charge, but worked with labor and toil night and day, that we might not be a burden to any of you, 53 3:9 not because we do not have authority, but to make of ourselves an example of how you should follow us. 53 3:10 Because, even when we were with you, we commanded you this: That if anyone will not work, neither should he eat. 53 3:11 Because, we hear that there are some who walk among you in a disorderly manner, not working at all, but are busybodies. 53 3:12 Now those who are such we command and exhort by our Lord Jesus Christ that they work in quietness and eat their own bread. 53 3:13 But as for you, brethren, do not become weary in doing good. 53 3:14 And if anyone does not obey our word in this letter, note that person, and do not keep company with him, that he may be ashamed. 53 3:15 Yet count him not as an enemy, but instruct him as a brother. 53 3:16 Now may the Lord of peace Himself give you peace always in every way. The Lord be with you all. 53 3:17 The salutation of Paul with my own hand, which is confirmation in every letter; so I write. 53 3:18 The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen. 54 1:1 Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ, by the commandment of God our Savior and the Lord Jesus Christ, who is our hope, 54 1:2 To Timothy, my own son in the faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God our Father and Jesus Christ our Lord. 54 1:3 As I urged you when I went into Macedonia, remain in Ephesus that you may command some that they teach no other doctrine, 54 1:4 nor give heed to fables and endless genealogies, which minister questions rather than godly edification which is in faith, so do. 54 1:5 Now the purpose of the commandment is love from a pure heart, from a good conscience, and from sincere faith, 54 1:6 from which some, having strayed, have turned aside to idle talking, 54 1:7 desiring to be teachers of the law, understanding neither what they say nor the things which they affirm. 54 1:8 But we know that the law is good if one uses it lawfully, 54 1:9 knowing this: that the law is not made for a righteous person, but for the lawless and disobedient, for the ungodly and for sinners, for the unholy and profane, for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers, for manslayers, 54 1:10 for fornicators, for those who defile themselves with mankind, for kidnappers, for liars, for perjurers, and if there is any other thing that is contrary to sound doctrine, 54 1:11 according to the glorious gospel of the blessed God which was committed to my trust. 54 1:12 And I thank Christ Jesus our Lord who has enabled me, because He counted me faithful, putting me into the ministry, 54 1:13 who was formerly a blasphemer, a persecutor, and an abusive man; but I obtained mercy because I did it ignorantly in unbelief. 54 1:14 And the grace of our Lord was exceedingly abundant, with faith and love which are in Christ Jesus. 54 1:15 This is a faithful saying and worthy of all acceptance, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners, of whom I am chief. 54 1:16 However, for this reason I obtained mercy, that in me first Jesus Christ might show forth all longsuffering, as a pattern to those who are going to believe on Him for everlasting life. 54 1:17 Now to the King eternal, immortal, invisible, to God who alone is wise, be honor and glory forever and ever. Amen. 54 1:18 This command I commit to you, son Timothy, according to the prophecies previously made concerning you, that by them you may wage the good warfare, 54 1:19 holding to faith and a good conscience, which some having rejected, concerning the faith have suffered shipwreck, 54 1:20 of whom are Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I delivered to Satan that they may learn not to blaspheme. 54 2:1 Therefore I exhort first of all that supplications, prayers, intercessions, and giving of thanks be made for all men, 54 2:2 for kings and for all who are in authority, that we may lead a quiet and peaceable life in all godliness and honesty. 54 2:3 Because, this is good and acceptable in the sight of God our Savior, 54 2:4 who desires all men to be saved and to come to the knowledge of the truth. 54 2:5 Because there is one God and one Mediator between God and men, the Man Christ Jesus, 54 2:6 who gave Himself a ransom for all, to be testified in due time, 54 2:7 because of which I was appointed a preacher and an apostle, I am speaking the truth in Christ and not lying, a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and truth. 54 2:8 I desire therefore that the men pray everywhere, lifting up holy hands, without wrath and doubting; 54 2:9 in like manner also, that the women adorn themselves in modest apparel, with propriety and moderation, not with braided hair or gold or pearls or costly clothing, 54 2:10 but, which is proper for women professing godliness, with good works. 54 2:11 Let the woman learn in silence with all submission. 54 2:12 And I do not permit the woman to teach or to have authority over the man, but to be in silence. 54 2:13 Because Adam was formed first, then Eve. 54 2:14 And Adam was not deceived, but the woman being deceived, fell into transgression. 54 2:15 Nevertheless she will be saved in childbearing if they continue in faith, love, and holiness, with self control. 54 3:1 This is a faithful saying: If a man desires the position of a bishop, he desires a good work. 54 3:2 A bishop then must be blameless, the husband of one wife, temperate, sober, of good behavior, given to hospitality, able to teach; 54 3:3 not given to wine, not violent, not greedy for money, but gentle, not quarrelsome, not covetous; 54 3:4 one who rules his own house well, having his children in submission with all reverence 54 3:5 (because, if a man does not know how to rule his own house, how will he take care of the church of God?); 54 3:6 not a novice, lest being puffed up with pride he fall into the same condemnation as the devil. 54 3:7 Moreover he must have a good testimony among those who are outside, lest he fall into reproach and the snare of the devil. 54 3:8 Likewise deacons must be reverent, not double tongued, not slaves to wine bingeing, not greedy for money, 54 3:9 holding the mystery of the faith with a pure conscience. 54 3:10 But let these also first be tested; then let them serve as deacons, being found blameless. 54 3:11 Likewise, their wives must be reverent, not slanderers, sober, faithful in all things. 54 3:12 Let deacons be the husbands of one wife, ruling their children and their own houses well. 54 3:13 Because, those who have served well as deacons obtain for themselves a good standing and great boldness in the faith which is in Christ Jesus. 54 3:14 These things I write to you, though I hope to come to you shortly; 54 3:15 but if I am delayed, so that you may know how you ought to conduct yourself in the house of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and ground of the truth. 54 3:16 And without controversy great is the mystery of godliness: God was manifested in the flesh, justified in the Spirit, seen by angels, preached among the Gentiles, believed on in the world, received up into glory. 54 4:1 Now the Spirit expressly says that in latter times some will depart from the faith, giving heed to seducing spirits and doctrines of demons, 54 4:2 speaking lies in hypocrisy, having their own conscience seared with a hot iron, 54 4:3 forbidding to marry, and commanding to abstain from foods which God has created to be received with thanksgiving by those who believe and know the truth. 54 4:4 Because, every creature of God is good, and nothing is to be refused if it is received with thanksgiving; 54 4:5 because it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer. 54 4:6 If you put the brethren in remembrance of these things, you will be a good minister of Jesus Christ, nourished in the words of faith and of the good doctrine which you have carefully pursued. 54 4:7 But reject profane and old wives' fables, and instead exercise yourself toward godliness. 54 4:8 Because, bodily exercise profits a little, but godliness is profitable for all things, having promise of the life that now is and of that which is to come. 54 4:9 This is a faithful saying and worthy of all acceptance. 54 4:10 Because, to this end we both labor and suffer reproach, because we trust in the living God, who is the Savior of all men, especially of those who believe. 54 4:11 These things command and teach. 54 4:12 Let no one despise your youth, but be an example to the believers in word, in conduct, in love, in spirit, in faith, in purity. 54 4:13 Until I come, give attention to reading, to exhortation, to doctrine. 54 4:14 Do not neglect the gift that is in you, which was given to you by prophecy with the laying on of the hands of the eldership. 54 4:15 Meditate on these things; give yourself entirely to them, that your progress may be evident to all. 54 4:16 Take heed to yourself and to the doctrine. Continue in them, because in doing this you will save both yourself and those who hear you. 54 5:1 Do not rebuke an older man, but exhort him as a father, younger men as brethren, 54 5:2 older women as mothers, and younger women as sisters, with all purity. 54 5:3 Honor widows who are truly widows. 54 5:4 But if any widow has children or grandchildren, let them first learn to show piety at home and to repay their parents; because, this is good and acceptable before God. 54 5:5 Now she who is truly a widow, and desolate, trusts in God and continues in supplications and prayers night and day. 54 5:6 But she who lives in pleasure is dead while she lives. 54 5:7 And these things give in commands, that they may be blameless. 54 5:8 But if anyone does not provide for his own, and especially for those of his household, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever. 54 5:9 Do not let a widow under sixty years old be taken into the number, and not unless she has been the wife of one man, 54 5:10 well reported for good works: if she has brought up children, if she has lodged strangers, if she has washed the saints' feet, if she has relieved the afflicted, if she has diligently followed every good work. 54 5:11 But refuse the younger widows; because, when they have, begun to grow immoral against Christ, they desire to marry, 54 5:12 having damnation because they have cast off their first faith. 54 5:13 And besides they learn to be idle, wandering about from house to house, and not only idle but also gossips and busybodies, speaking things which they ought not. 54 5:14 Therefore I desire that the younger women marry, bear children, manage the house, give no opportunity to the adversary to speak reproachfully. 54 5:15 Because, some have already turned aside after Satan. 54 5:16 If any believing man or woman has widows, let them relieve them, and do not let the church be burdened, that it may relieve those who are truly widows. 54 5:17 Let the older men who rule well be counted worthy of double honor, especially those who labor in the word and doctrine. 54 5:18 Because, the Scripture says, "You shall not muzzle an ox while it treads out the grain," and, "The laborer is worthy of his wages." 54 5:19 Do not receive an accusation against an older man except from two or three witnesses. 54 5:20 Those who are sinning rebuke in the presence of all, that others also may have reverence. 54 5:21 I command you before God and the Lord Jesus Christ and the elect angels that you observe these things without prejudice, doing nothing with personal favoritism. 54 5:22 Do not lay hands on anyone hastily, nor be a partaker in other people's sins; keep yourself pure. 54 5:23 No longer drink only water, but use a little grape juice for your stomach's sake and your frequent weaknesses. 54 5:24 Some men's sins are clearly evident, preceding them to judgment, but those of some men follow afterwards. 54 5:25 Likewise also, the good works of some are clearly manifest beforehand, and those that are otherwise cannot be hidden. 54 6:1 Let as many servants as are under the yoke count their own masters worthy of all honor, so that the name of God and His doctrine may not be blasphemed. 54 6:2 And those who have believing masters, let them not despise them because they are brethren, but rather serve them because those who are benefited are faithful and beloved. Teach and exhort these things. 54 6:3 If anyone teaches otherwise and does not consent to wholesome words, even the words of our Lord Jesus Christ, and to the doctrine which is according to godliness, 54 6:4 he is proud, knowing nothing, but is obsessed with disputes and arguments over words, from which come envy, strife, reviling, evil suspicions, 54 6:5 useless disputations of men of corrupt minds and destitute of the truth, who suppose that gain is godliness. From such withdraw yourself. 54 6:6 Now godliness with contentment is great gain. 54 6:7 Because, we brought nothing into this world, and it is certain we can carry nothing out. 54 6:8 And having food and clothing, with these we should be content. 54 6:9 But those who desire to be rich fall into temptation and a snare, and into many foolish and harmful lusts which drown men in destruction and perdition. 54 6:10 Because, the love of money is the root of all evil, for which some have strayed from the faith in their covetousness, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows. 54 6:11 But you, O man of God, flee these things and pursue righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patience, meekness. 54 6:12 Fight the good fight of faith, lay hold on eternal life, to which you were also called and have confessed a good confession before of many witnesses. 54 6:13 I command you in the sight of God who gives life to all things, and before Christ Jesus who witnessed a good confession before Pontius Pilate, 54 6:14 that you keep this commandment without spot, blameless until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ, 54 6:15 which He will reveal in His own timeframe, who is the blessed and only Potentate, the King of kings and Lord of lords, 54 6:16 who alone has immortality, dwelling in unapproachable light, whom no man has seen or can see, to whom be honor and everlasting power. Amen. 54 6:17 Command those who are rich in this present age not to be arrogant, nor to trust in uncertain riches but in the living God, who gives us richly all things to enjoy. 54 6:18 That they do good, that they be rich in good works, ready to distribute, willing to share, 54 6:19 storing up for themselves a good foundation for the time to come, that they may lay hold on eternal life. 54 6:20 O Timothy! Guard that which was committed to your trust, avoiding profane and idle babblings and contradictions of what is falsely called science, 54 6:21 by professing it some have strayed concerning the faith. Grace be with you. Amen. 55 1:1 Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus, 55 1:2 To Timothy, my dearly beloved son. Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord. 55 1:3 I thank God, whom I serve with a pure conscience, as my forefathers did, that without ceasing I remember you in my prayers night and day, 55 1:4 greatly desiring to see you, being mindful of your tears, that I may be filled with joy, 55 1:5 when I call to remembrance the genuine faith that is in you, which dwelt first in your grandmother Lois and your mother Eunice, and I am persuaded is in you also. 55 1:6 Therefore I remind you to stir up the gift of God which is in you through the laying on of my hands. 55 1:7 Because, God has not given us the spirit of fear, but of power and of love and of a sound mind. 55 1:8 Therefore do not be ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me His prisoner, but share with me in the afflictions for the gospel according to the power of God, 55 1:9 who has saved us and called us with a holy calling, not according to our works, but according to His own purpose and grace which was given to us in Christ Jesus before the ages began, 55 1:10 but has now been revealed by the appearing of our Savior Jesus Christ, who has abolished death and brought life and immortality to light through the gospel, 55 1:11 to which I was appointed a preacher, an apostle, and a teacher of the Gentiles. 55 1:12 For this reason I also suffer these things; nevertheless I am not ashamed, because I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day. 55 1:13 Hold fast the pattern of sound words which you have heard from me, in faith and love which are in Christ Jesus. 55 1:14 That good thing which was committed to you, keep by the Holy Spirit who dwells in us. 55 1:15 This you know, that all those in Asia have turned away from me, among whom are Phygellus and Hermogenes. 55 1:16 The Lord grant mercy to the household of Onesiphorus, because he often refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain; 55 1:17 but when he was in Rome, he sought me out very diligently and found me. 55 1:18 The Lord grant to him that he may find mercy from the Lord in that Day, and you know very well how many ways he ministered to me at Ephesus. 55 2:1 You therefore, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus. 55 2:2 And the things that you have heard from me among many witnesses, commit the same to faithful men who will be able to teach others also. 55 2:3 You therefore endure hardship as a good soldier of Jesus Christ. 55 2:4 No one engaged in warfare entangles himself with the affairs of this life, that he may please him who enlisted him as a soldier. 55 2:5 And likewise if anyone competes in athletics, he is not crowned unless he competes according to the rules. 55 2:6 The hardworking farmer must be first to partake of the crops. 55 2:7 Consider what I say, and may the Lord give you understanding in all things. 55 2:8 Remember that Jesus Christ, of the seed of David, was raised from the dead according to my gospel, 55 2:9 for which I suffer trouble as an evildoer, even to the point of chains; but the word of God is not bound. 55 2:10 Therefore I endure all things for the sake of the elect, that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory. 55 2:11 This is a faithful saying: because if we died with Him, we will also live with Him. 55 2:12 If we suffer, we will also reign with Him. If we deny Him, He also will deny us. 55 2:13 If we are faithless, He remains faithful; He cannot deny Himself. 55 2:14 Remind them of these things, commanding them before the Lord not to strive about words to no profit, to the ruin of the hearers. 55 2:15 Study to present yourself approved to God, a worker who does not need to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth. 55 2:16 But shun profane and vain babblings, because they will increase to more ungodliness. 55 2:17 And their word will eat like gangrene. Hymenaeus and Philetus are of this sort, 55 2:18 who have strayed concerning the truth, saying that the resurrection is already past; and they overthrow the faith of some. 55 2:19 Nevertheless the foundation of God stands firm, having this seal: "The Lord knows those who are His," and, "Let everyone who names the name of Christ depart from iniquity." 55 2:20 But in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and silver, but also of wood and clay, some for honor and some for dishonor. 55 2:21 Therefore if anyone cleanses himself from the latter, he will be a vessel for honor, sanctified and useful for the Master, and prepared for every good work. 55 2:22 Flee youthful lusts also; but pursue righteousness, faith, love, peace with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart. 55 2:23 But avoid foolish and ignorant disputes, knowing that they generate strife. 55 2:24 And a servant of the Lord must not quarrel but be gentle to all people, able to teach, patient, 55 2:25 in humility correcting those who are in opposition, if God perhaps will grant them repentance, so that they may know the truth, 55 2:26 and that they may come to their senses and escape the snare of the devil, having been taken captive by him to do his will. 55 3:1 Also know this, that in the last days perilous times will come: 55 3:2 Because, men will be lovers of themselves, covetous, boasters, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy, 55 3:3 without natural affection, covenant breakers, slanderers, without self control, brutal, despisers of those who are good, 55 3:4 traitors, headstrong, haughty, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God, 55 3:5 having a form of godliness but denying its power. And from such people turn away! 55 3:6 Because, of this sort are those who creep into households and make captives of gullible women loaded down with sins, led away by various lusts, 55 3:7 always learning and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth. 55 3:8 Now as Jannes and Jambres resisted Moses, so do these also resist the truth: men of corrupt minds, disapproved concerning the faith; 55 3:9 but they will progress no further, because their folly will be manifest to all people, as theirs also was. 55 3:10 But you have fully followed my doctrine, manner of life, purpose, faith, longsuffering, love, perseverance, 55 3:11 persecutions, afflictions, which happened to me at Antioch, at Iconium, at Lystra, what persecutions I endured, but the Lord delivered me out of them all. 55 3:12 Yes, and all who desire to live godly in Christ Jesus will suffer persecution. 55 3:13 But evil men and seducers will grow worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived. 55 3:14 But you must continue in the things which you have learned and been assured of, knowing from whom you have learned them, 55 3:15 and that from childhood you have known the Holy Scriptures, which are able to make you wise for salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus. 55 3:16 All Scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness, 55 3:17 that the man of God may be perfect, thoroughly equipped for every good work. 55 4:1 I command you therefore before God and the Lord Jesus Christ, who will judge the living and the dead at His appearing and His kingdom: 55 4:2 Preach the word! Be ready in season and out of season. Convince, rebuke, exhort, with all longsuffering and doctrine. 55 4:3 Because, the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine, but according to their own desires, they will heap up for themselves teachers, having itching ears, 55 4:4 and they will turn their ears away from the truth, and will be turned aside to fables. 55 4:5 But you be watchful in all things, endure afflictions, do the work of an evangelist, make your ministry complete. 55 4:6 Because, I am now ready to be offered, and the time of my departure is at hand. 55 4:7 I have fought the good fight, I have finished my race, I have kept the faith. 55 4:8 After this, there is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give me at that Day, and not to me only but also to all who love His appearing. 55 4:9 Be diligent to come to me quickly; 55 4:10 because Demas has forsaken me, having loved this present world, and has departed for Thessalonica, Crescens for Galatia, Titus for Dalmatia. 55 4:11 Only Luke is with me. Get Mark and bring him with you, because he is profitable to me for the ministry. 55 4:12 And Tychicus I have sent to Ephesus. 55 4:13 When you come, bring the cloak with you that I left with Carpus at Troas, and the books, but especially the parchments. 55 4:14 Alexander the coppersmith did me much evil. May the Lord repay him according to his works. 55 4:15 You also must beware of him, because he has greatly resisted our words. 55 4:16 At my first defense no one stood with me, but everyone forsook me. I ask God that it may not be charged against them. 55 4:17 But the Lord stood with me and strengthened me, so that through me the preaching might be fully known, and that all the Gentiles might hear. Also I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion. 55 4:18 And the Lord will deliver me from every evil work and will preserve me for His heavenly kingdom. To Him be glory forever and ever. Amen! 55 4:19 Greet Prisca and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus. 55 4:20 Erastus stayed in Corinth, but Trophimus I have left in Miletus sick. 55 4:21 Do your utmost to come before winter. Eubulus greets you, as well as Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brethren. 55 4:22 The Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Grace be with you. Amen. 56 1:1 Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God's elect and the acknowledgment of the truth which is according to godliness, 56 1:2 in hope of eternal life which God, who cannot lie, promised before the ages began, 56 1:3 but has in due time manifested His word through preaching, which is committed to me according to the commandment of God our Savior; 56 1:4 To Titus, my own son according to the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Savior. 56 1:5 I left you in Crete for this purpose, that you should set in order the things that are lacking, and ordain elders in every city as I appointed you. 56 1:6 If a man is blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of dissipation or insubordination. 56 1:7 Because, a bishop must be blameless, as a steward of God, not self willed, not quick tempered, not given to wine, not violent, not greedy for money, 56 1:8 but a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, self controlled, 56 1:9 holding fast the faithful word as he has been taught, that he may be able, by sound doctrine, both to exhort and convict those who contradict. 56 1:10 Because, there are many insubordinate, both idle talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision, 56 1:11 whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert entire households, teaching things which they ought not to, for the sake of dishonest gain. 56 1:12 One of them, even a prophet of their own, said, "The Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, lazy gluttons." 56 1:13 This testimony is true. Therefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith, 56 1:14 not giving heed to Jewish fables and commandments of men who turn from the truth. 56 1:15 To the pure all things are pure, but to those who are defiled and unbelieving nothing is pure; but even their mind and conscience are defiled. 56 1:16 They profess that they know God, but in works they deny Him, being abominable, disobedient, and disqualified for every good work. 56 2:1 But as for you, speak the things which are proper for sound doctrine: 56 2:2 that the older men be sober, reverent, temperate, sound in faith, in love, in patience; 56 2:3 the older women likewise, that they demonstrate holiness in behavior, not slanderers, not slaves to wine bingeing, teachers of good things; 56 2:4 that they may teach the young women to be sober, to love their husbands, to love their children, 56 2:5 to be discreet, chaste, homemakers, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God may not be blasphemed. 56 2:6 Likewise, exhort the young men to be sober minded, 56 2:7 in all things showing yourself to be a pattern of good works; in doctrine showing incorruptibility reverence, integrity, 56 2:8 sound speech that cannot be condemned, that one who is an opponent may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you. 56 2:9 Exhort servants to be obedient to their own masters, and to be well pleasing in all things, not answering back, 56 2:10 not stealing, but showing all good fidelity, that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Savior in all things. 56 2:11 Because, the grace of God that brings salvation has appeared to all men, 56 2:12 teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly in the present age, 56 2:13 looking for that blessed hope and the glorious appearing of the great God even our Savior Jesus Christ, 56 2:14 who gave Himself for us, that He might redeem us from all iniquity and purify for Himself His own special people, zealous for good works. 56 2:15 Speak these things, exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no one despise you. 56 3:1 Remind them to be subject to rulers and authorities, to obey magistrates, to be ready for every good work, 56 3:2 to speak evil of no one, not quarrelsome but gentle, showing all meekness to all men. 56 3:3 Because, we ourselves were also once foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful and hating one another. 56 3:4 But when the kindness and the love of God our Savior toward man appeared, 56 3:5 not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to His mercy He saved us, through the washing of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Spirit, 56 3:6 whom He poured out on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Savior, 56 3:7 that having been justified by His grace we should become heirs according to the hope of eternal life. 56 3:8 This is a faithful saying, and these things I want you to affirm constantly, that those who have believed in God should be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable to men. 56 3:9 But avoid foolish disputes, genealogies, contentions, and strivings about the law; because they are unprofitable and vain. 56 3:10 A person who is a heretic reject after the first and second admonition, 56 3:11 knowing that such a person is warped and sinning, being self condemned. 56 3:12 When I send Artemas to you, or Tychicus, be diligent to come to me at Nicopolis, for I have decided to spend the winter there. 56 3:13 Send Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey with care, that they may lack nothing. 56 3:14 And let our people also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they may not be unfruitful. 56 3:15 All who are with me greet you. Greet those who love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen. 57 1:1 Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon our beloved friend, and fellow laborer, 57 1:2 to our beloved Apphia, Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church in your house: 57 1:3 Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. 57 1:4 I thank my God, making mention of you always in my prayers, 57 1:5 hearing of your love and faith which you have toward the Lord Jesus and toward all the saints, 57 1:6 that the sharing of your faith may become effectual by acknowledging every good thing that is in you in Christ Jesus. 57 1:7 Because, we have great joy and consolation in your love, because, the hearts of the saints have been refreshed by you, brother. 57 1:8 Therefore, although I could be very bold in Christ to command you that which is appropriate, 57 1:9 yet for love's sake I rather make request of you, being such a one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ: 57 1:10 I make request of you for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten while in my chains, 57 1:11 who was formerly unprofitable to you, but is now profitable to you and to me. 57 1:12 Whom I have sent again. Therefore you receive him, that is, my own heart, 57 1:13 whom I would have kept with me, that in your position, he might have ministered to me in the chains of the gospel. 57 1:14 But I did not want to do anything without your consent, that your goodness might not be of obligation, but voluntary. 57 1:15 Because, perhaps he departed for a season for this reason, that you might receive him forever, 57 1:16 not now as a servant, but more than a servant, a beloved brother, especially to me but how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord? 57 1:17 If then you count me as a partner, receive him as you would me. 57 1:18 If he has wronged you, or owes you anything, put that on my account. 57 1:19 I Paul have written this with my own hand, I will repay it, not to mention to you how you also owe to me even your own lives. 57 1:20 Yes, brother, let me have joy from you in the Lord; refresh my heart in the Lord. 57 1:21 Having confidence in your obedience, I wrote to you, knowing that you will also do even more than I say. 57 1:22 But, meanwhile, prepare for me a guest room also, because I trust that through the prayers of you all I shall be given to you all. 57 1:23 Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you, 57 1:24 also Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, Luke, my fellow laborers. 57 1:25 The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen. 58 1:1 God, who at various times and in diverse ways spoke in time past to the fathers through the prophets, 58 1:2 has in these last days spoken to us by His Son, whom He has appointed heir of all things, by whom also He made the ages; 58 1:3 who being the brightness of His glory and the express image of His person, and upholding all things by the word of His power, when He had by Himself purged our sins, sat down at the right hand of the Majesty on high, 58 1:4 having become so much better than the angels, as He has by inheritance obtained a more excellent name than they. 58 1:5 Because, to which of the angels did He ever say: "You are My Son, today I have begotten You"? And again: "I will be to Him a Father, and He will be to Me a Son"? 58 1:6 But when He again brings the firstborn into the world, He says: "Let all the angels of God worship Him." 58 1:7 And of the angels He says: "Who makes His angels spirits and His ministers a flame of fire." 58 1:8 But to the Son He says: "Your throne, O God, is forever and ever; a scepter of righteousness is the scepter of Your kingdom. 58 1:9 You have loved righteousness and hated iniquity; Therefore God, even Your God, has anointed You with the oil of gladness above Your companions." 58 1:10 And: "You, LORD, in the beginning laid the foundation of the earth, and the heavens are the work of Your hands. 58 1:11 They will perish, but You remain; and they will all grow old like clothing; 58 1:12 And like a cloak You will fold them up, and they will be changed. But You are the same, and Your years will not fail." 58 1:13 But to which of the angels has He ever said: "Sit at My right hand, until I make Your enemies Your footstool"? 58 1:14 Are they not all ministering spirits sent forth to minister for those who will inherit salvation? 58 2:1 Therefore we ought to earnestly pay attention to the things we have heard, lest at any time we should let them slip away. 58 2:2 Because, if the word spoken through angels proved steadfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just reward, 58 2:3 how shall we escape if we neglect so great a salvation, which at the first began to be spoken by the Lord, and was confirmed to us by those who heard Him, 58 2:4 God also bearing them witness both with signs and wonders, with various miracles, and gifts of the Holy Spirit, according to His own will? 58 2:5 Because, He has not put the world to come, of which we speak, in subjection to angels. 58 2:6 But one testified in a certain place, saying: "What is man that You are mindful of him, or the son of man that You visit him? 58 2:7 You have made him a little lower than the angels; You have crowned him with glory and honor, and set him over the works of Your hands. 58 2:8 You have put all things in subjection under his feet." Because, in that He put all in subjection under him, He left nothing that is not put under him. But now we do not yet see all things put under him. 58 2:9 But we see Jesus, who was made a little lower than the angels, for the suffering of death crowned with glory and honor, that He, by the grace of God, might taste death for everyone. 58 2:10 Because, it was fitting for Him, for whom are all things and by whom are all things, in bringing many sons to glory, to make the captain of their salvation perfect through sufferings. 58 2:11 Because, both He who sanctifies and those who are being sanctified are all of one, for which reason He is not ashamed to call them brethren, 58 2:12 saying: "I will declare Your name to My brethren; in the midst of the church I will sing praise to You." 58 2:13 And again: "I will put My trust in Him." And again: "Here am I and the children whom God has given Me." 58 2:14 Inasmuch then as the children are partakers of flesh and blood, He Himself likewise shared in the same, that through death He might destroy him who had the power of death, that is, the devil, 58 2:15 and deliver those who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage. 58 2:16 Because indeed He did not take upon Him the nature of angels, but He took on him the seed of Abraham. 58 2:17 Therefore, in all things He had to be made like His brethren, that He might be a merciful and faithful High Priest in things pertaining to God, to make reconciliation for the sins of the people. 58 2:18 Because, in that He Himself has suffered, being tempted, He is able to help those who are tempted. 58 3:1 Therefore, holy brethren, partakers of the heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our confession, Christ Jesus, 58 3:2 who was faithful to Him who appointed Him, as Moses also was faithful in all His house. 58 3:3 Because, this Man was counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as He who built the house has more honor than the house. 58 3:4 Because every house is built by someone, but He who built all things is God. 58 3:5 And truly Moses was faithful in all His house as a servant, for a testimony of those things which would be spoken afterward, 58 3:6 but Christ as a Son over His own house, whose house we are if we hold firmly to the confidence and the rejoicing of the hope firmly to the end. 58 3:7 Therefore, as the Holy Spirit says: "Today, if you will hear His voice, 58 3:8 do not harden your hearts as in the provocation, in the day of trial in the wilderness, 58 3:9 where your fathers tested Me, tried Me, and saw My works forty years. 58 3:10 Therefore I was angry with that generation, and said, 'They always deceive in their heart, and they have not known My ways.' 58 3:11 So I swore in My wrath, 'They will not enter into My rest.'" 58 3:12 Beware, brethren, lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief in departing from the living God; 58 3:13 but exhort one another daily, while it is called "Today," lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin. 58 3:14 Because, we have become partakers of Christ if we hold the beginning of our confidence firmly to the end, 58 3:15 while it is said: "Today, if you will hear His voice, do not harden your hearts as in the provocation." 58 3:16 Because some, having heard, did provoke. However not all who came out of Egypt by Moses. 58 3:17 Now with whom was He angry forty years? Was it not with those who sinned, whose corpses fell in the wilderness? 58 3:18 And to whom did He swear that they would not enter His rest, but to those who did not believe? 58 3:19 So we see that they could not enter in because of unbelief. 58 4:1 Therefore, since a promise remains of entering His rest, let us have reverence lest any of you seem to have come short of it. 58 4:2 Because, the gospel was preached to us as well as to them; but the word preached did not profit them, not being mixed with faith in those who heard it. 58 4:3 Because, we who have believed do enter into rest, as He has said: "So I swore in My wrath, 'If they will enter into My rest,'" although the works were finished from the foundation of the world. 58 4:4 Because, He spoke in a certain place of the seventh day in this way: "And God rested on the seventh day from all His works"; 58 4:5 and again in this place: "If they will enter into My rest." 58 4:6 Since therefore it remains that some must enter it, and those to whom it was first preached did not enter because of unbelief, 58 4:7 again He declares a certain day, saying in David, "Today," after such a long time, as it has been said: "Today, if you will hear His voice, do not harden your hearts." 58 4:8 Because, if Joshua had given them rest, then He would not have afterward spoken about another day. 58 4:9 There remains therefore a rest for the people of God. 58 4:10 Because, he who has entered His rest has himself also ceased from his own works as God did from His. 58 4:11 Therefore let us labor to enter into that rest, lest anyone fall according to the same example of unbelief. 58 4:12 Because, the word of God is living and powerful, and sharper than any two edged sword, piercing even to the division of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow, and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart. 58 4:13 Neither is there any creature that is not manifest in His sight, but all things are naked and open to the eyes of Him to whom we must give account. 58 4:14 Seeing then that we have a great High Priest who has passed into the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast our confession. 58 4:15 Because, we do not have a High Priest who cannot sympathize with our weaknesses, but was in all points tempted as we are, yet without sin. 58 4:16 Let us therefore come boldly to the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy and find grace to help in time of need. 58 5:1 Because, every high priest taken from among men is ordained for men in things pertaining to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins. 58 5:2 He can have compassion on those who are ignorant and on those who are going astray, since he himself is also subject to weakness. 58 5:3 And because of this he ought, just as for the people so also for himself, to offer for sins. 58 5:4 And no man takes this honor to himself, but he who is called by God, just as Aaron was. 58 5:5 So also Christ did not glorify Himself to become a High Priest, butit was He who said to Him: "You are My Son, today I have begotten You." 58 5:6 As He also says in another place: "You are a priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek"; 58 5:7 who, in the days of His flesh, when He had offered up prayers and supplications, with strong cries and tears to Him who was able to save Him from death, and was heard because He had respect, 58 5:8 though He was a Son, yet He learned obedience by the things which He suffered. 58 5:9 And having been perfected, He became the author of eternal salvation to all who obey Him, 58 5:10 called by God as High Priest "according to the order of Melchizedek," 58 5:11 of whom we have much to say, and hard to explain, since you have become dull of hearing. 58 5:12 Because, though by this time you ought to be teachers, you require that someone teaches you again what are the first principles of the oracles of God; and you have become such as have need of milk and not solid food. 58 5:13 Because, everyone who partakes only of milk is unskilled in the word of righteousness, because he is a babe. 58 5:14 But solid food belongs to those who are of full age, that is, those who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern both good and evil. 58 6:1 Therefore, leaving the elementary principles of the doctrine of Christ, let us go on to perfection, not laying again the foundation of repentance from dead works and of faith toward God, 58 6:2 of the doctrine of baptisms, of laying on of hands, of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment. 58 6:3 And this we will do if God permits. 58 6:4 Because, it is impossible for those who were once enlightened, and have tasted the heavenly gift, and have become partakers of the Holy Spirit, 58 6:5 and have tasted the good word of God and the powers of the age to come, 58 6:6 if they shall fall away, to renew them again to repentance, since they crucify again for themselves the Son of God, and put Him to an open shame. 58 6:7 Because, the earth which drinks in the rain that often comes upon it, and bears herbs useful for those by whom it is cultivated, receives blessing from God; 58 6:8 but that which bears thorns and briers is rejected and is near to being cursed, whose end is to be burned. 58 6:9 But, beloved, we are persuaded of better things concerning you, yes, things that accompany salvation, though we speak in this manner. 58 6:10 Because, God is not unrighteous to forget your work and labor of love which you have shown toward His name, in that you have ministered to the saints, and do minister. 58 6:11 And we desire that each one of you show the same diligence to the full assurance of hope until the end, 58 6:12 that you do not become slothful, but followers of those who through faith and patience inherit the promises. 58 6:13 Because, when God made a promise to Abraham, because He could swear by no one greater, He swore by Himself, 58 6:14 saying, "Surely blessing I will bless you, and multiplying I will multiply you." 58 6:15 And so, after he had patiently endured, he obtained the promise. 58 6:16 Because, men indeed swear by the greater, and an oath for confirmation is for them an end of all dispute. 58 6:17 In this way, God, determining to show more abundantly to the heirs of promise the immutability of His counsel, confirmed it by an oath, 58 6:18 that by two immutable things, in which it is impossible for God to lie, we might have strong consolation, who have fled for refuge to lay hold of the hope set before us. 58 6:19 This hope we have as an anchor of the soul, both sure and steadfast, and which enters into that which is behind the veil, 58 6:20 where the forerunner has entered for us, even Jesus, having become High Priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek. 58 7:1 Because, this Melchizedek, king of Salem, priest of the Most High God, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings and blessed him, 58 7:2 to whom also Abraham gave a tenth part of all, first being translated as "king of righteousness," and then also king of Salem, that is "king of peace," 58 7:3 without father, without mother, without genealogy, having neither beginning of days nor end of life, but made like the Son of God, remains a priest continually. 58 7:4 Now consider how great this man was, to whom even the patriarch Abraham gave a tenth of the spoils. 58 7:5 And indeed those who are of the sons of Levi, who receive the office of the priesthood, have a commandment to receive tithes from the people according to the law, that is, from their brethren, though they have come from the loins of Abraham; 58 7:6 but he whose genealogy is not derived from them received tithes from Abraham and blessed him who had the promises. 58 7:7 Now beyond all contradiction the lesser is blessed by the better. 58 7:8 And here mortal men receive tithes, but there hereceives them, of whom it is witnessed that he lives. 58 7:9 And Levi also, who receives tithes, paid tithes through Abraham, so to speak, 58 7:10 because he was still in the loins of his father when Melchizedek met him. 58 7:11 Therefore, if perfection were through the Levitical priesthood (because under it the people received the law), what further need was there that another priest should rise according to the order of Melchizedek, and not be called according to the order of Aaron? 58 7:12 Because, the priesthood being changed, of necessity there is also a change of the law. 58 7:13 Because, He of whom these things are spoken belongs to another tribe, from which no man has served at the altar. 58 7:14 Because, it is evident that our Lord arose out of Judah, of which tribe Moses spoke nothing concerning priesthood. 58 7:15 And it is yet far more evident if, in the likeness of Melchizedek, there arises another priest 58 7:16 who is made, not according to the law of a fleshly commandment, but according to the power of an endless life. 58 7:17 Because He testifies: "You are a priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek." 58 7:18 Because, on the one hand there is truly an annulling of the former commandment because of its weakness and unprofitableness, 58 7:19 because, the law made nothing perfect; but the bringing in of a better hope did, by which we draw near to God. 58 7:20 And inasmuch asHe wasnotmadepriest without an oath 58 7:21 (because, they have becomepriestswithout an oath, but He with an oath by Him who said to Him: "The LORD has sworn and will not relent, 'You are a priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek'"), 58 7:22 by so much more Jesus has become a surety of a better testament. 58 7:23 Also truly there were many priests, because they were prevented by death from continuing. 58 7:24 But this Man, because He continues forever, has an unchangeable priesthood. 58 7:25 Therefore He is also able to save to the uttermost those who come to God by Him, since He always lives to make intercession for them. 58 7:26 Because, such a High Priest was fitting for us,who isholy, harmless, undefiled, separate from sinners, and has become higher than the heavens; 58 7:27 who does not need daily, as those high priests, to offer up sacrifices, first for His own sins and then for the people's, because this He did once when He offered up Himself. 58 7:28 Because, the law appoints men as high priests who have weakness, but the word of the oath, which came after the law,appointsthe Son who is consecrated forever. 58 8:1 Nowthis isthe summary of the things we are saying: We have such a High Priest, who is seated at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens, 58 8:2 a Minister of the sanctuary and of the true tabernacle which the Lord set up, and not man. 58 8:3 Because, every high priest is appointed to offer both gifts and sacrifices. Therefore it is necessary that this Man also have something to offer. 58 8:4 Because, if He were on earth, He would not be a priest, since there are priests who offer the gifts according to the law; 58 8:5 who serve the copy and shadow of the heavenly things, as Moses was admonished by God, when he was about to make the tabernacle. Because, He said, "See that you make all things according to the pattern shown you on the mountain." 58 8:6 But now He has obtained a more excellent ministry, inasmuch as He is also Mediator of a better covenant, which was established on better promises. 58 8:7 Because, if that firstcovenanthad been faultless, then no place would have been sought for a second. 58 8:8 Because, finding fault with them, He says: "Behold, the days are coming, says the LORD, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah, 58 8:9 not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt; because they did not continue in My covenant, and I disregarded them, says the LORD." 58 8:10 Because, this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, says the LORD: I will put My laws in their mind and write them on their hearts; and I will be to them a God, and they will be to Me a people. 58 8:11 None of them will teach his neighbor, and none his brother, saying, 'Know the LORD,' because all will know Me, from the least of them to the greatest. 58 8:12 Because, I will be merciful to their unrighteousness, and their sins and their iniquities I will remember no more." 58 8:13 In that He says, "A newcovenant," He has made the first obsolete. Now that which has become obsolete and has become old is ready to vanish away. 58 9:1 Then indeed, even the firstcovenanthad ordinances of divine service and the earthly sanctuary. 58 9:2 Because, a tabernacle was prepared: the first part, in which was the lampstand, the table, and the showbread, which is called the sanctuary; 58 9:3 and behind the second veil, the part of the tabernacle which is called the Holiest of All, 58 9:4 which had the golden censer and the ark of the covenant overlaid on all sides with gold, in which were the golden pot that had the manna, Aaron's rod that budded, and the tablets of the covenant; 58 9:5 and above it were the cherubim of glory overshadowing the mercy seat.
