Of these things we cannot now speak in detail. 58 9:6 Now when these things had been prepared like this, the priests always went into the first part of the tabernacle, performing the services of God. 58 9:7 But into the second part the high priestwentalone once a year, not without blood, which he offered for himself and for the errors of the people; 58 9:8 the Holy Spirit indicating this, that the way into the Holiest of All was not yet made manifest while the first tabernacle was still standing. 58 9:9 Whichwassymbolic for the present time in which both gifts and sacrifices are offered which could not make him who performed the service perfect in regard to the conscience; 58 9:10 concernedonly with foods and drinks, various washings, and fleshly ordinances imposed on them until the time of reformation. 58 9:11 But Christ came as High Priest of the good things to come, with the greater and more perfect tabernacle not made with hands, that is, not of this creation. 58 9:12 Not with the blood of goats and calves, but with His own blood He entered into the Most Holy Place once, having obtained eternal redemptionfor us. 58 9:13 Because, if the blood of bulls and goats and the ashes of a heifer, sprinkling the unclean, sanctifies for the purifying of the flesh, 58 9:14 how much more will the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered Himself without spot to God, cleanse your conscience from dead works to serve the living God? 58 9:15 And for this reason He is the Mediator of the new testament, that by means of death, for the redemption of the transgressionsthat wereunder the first testament, that those who are called may receive the promise of the eternal inheritance. 58 9:16 Because, where there is a testament, there must also of necessity be the death of the testator. 58 9:17 Because, a testament is in force after men are dead, since it has no force at all while the testator lives. 58 9:18 Therefore not even the first testament was dedicated without blood. 58 9:19 Because, when Moses had spoken every precept to all the people according to the law, he took the blood of calves and goats, with water, scarlet wool, and hyssop, and sprinkled both the book itself and all the people, 58 9:20 saying, "This is the blood of the testament which God has commanded you." 58 9:21 Then likewise he sprinkled with blood both the tabernacle and all the vessels of the ministry. 58 9:22 And according to the law almost all things are purified with blood, and without shedding of blood there is no remission. 58 9:23 Therefore it was necessary that the pattern of the things in the heavens should be purified with these, but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these. 58 9:24 Because, Christ has not entered the holy places made with hands, which are figures of the true, but into heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God for us; 58 9:25 not that He should offer Himself often, as the high priest enters the Most Holy Place every year with blood of another; 58 9:26 He then would have had to suffer often since the foundation of the world; but now, once at the end of the ages, He has appeared to put away sin by the sacrifice of Himself. 58 9:27 And as it is appointed for men to die once, but after this the judgment, 58 9:28 so Christ was offered once to bear the sins of many. To those who eagerly wait for Him, He will appear a second time, apart from sin, for salvation. 58 10:1 Because the law, having a shadow of the good things to come, and not the very image of the things, can never with those same sacrifices, which they offered continually year by year, make those who approach perfect. 58 10:2 Because then would they not have ceased to be offered? Because, the worshipers, once purified, would have had no more consciousness of sins. 58 10:3 But in those sacrifices there is again a reminder made for sins every year. 58 10:4 Because it is not possible that the blood of bulls and goats could take away sins. 58 10:5 Therefore, when He came into the world, He said: "Sacrifice and offering You did not desire, but a body You have prepared for Me. 58 10:6 In burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin You had no pleasure. 58 10:7 Then I said, 'Behold, I have come (in the volume of the book it is written of Me) to do Your will, O God.'" 58 10:8 Previously saying, "Sacrifice and offering, burnt offerings, and offerings for sin You did not desire, nor had pleasure in them" (which are offered according to the law), 58 10:9 then He said, "Behold, I have come to do Your will, O God." He takes away the first that He may establish the second. 58 10:10 By that will, we are sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all. 58 10:11 And every priest stands ministering daily and offering repeatedly the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins. 58 10:12 But this Man, after He had offered one sacrifice for sins forever, sat down at the right hand of God, 58 10:13 from that time waiting until His enemies are made His footstool. 58 10:14 Because by one offering He has perfected forever those who are sanctified. 58 10:15 But the Holy Spirit also witnesses to us; because after that He had said beforehand, 58 10:16 "This is the covenant that I will make with them after those days, says the LORD: I will put My laws into their hearts, and in their minds I will write them," 58 10:17 "Their sins and their iniquities I will remember no more." 58 10:18 Now where there is remission of these, there is no longer an offering for sin. 58 10:19 Therefore, brethren, having boldness to enter the Holiest by the blood of Jesus, 58 10:20 by a new and living way which He consecrated for us, through the veil, that is to say, His flesh, 58 10:21 and having a High Priest over the house of God, 58 10:22 let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience and our bodies washed with pure water. 58 10:23 Let us hold fast the confession of our faith without wavering, because He who promised is faithful. 58 10:24 And let us consider one another in order to provoke love and good works, 58 10:25 not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as is the manner of some, but exhorting one another, and so much the more as you see the Day approaching. 58 10:26 Because, if we sin willfully after we have received the knowledge of the truth, there no longer remains a sacrifice for sins, 58 10:27 but a certain fearful expectation of judgment, and fiery indignation which will devour the adversaries. 58 10:28 Anyone who has rejected Moses' law died without mercy on the testimony of two or three witnesses. 58 10:29 Of how much worse punishment, do you suppose, will he be thought worthy who has trampled the Son of God underfoot, counted the blood of the covenant by which he was sanctified an unholy thing, and insulted the Spirit of grace? 58 10:30 Because, we know Him who said, "Vengeance is Mine, I will repay," says the Lord. And again, "The LORD will judge His people." 58 10:31 It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God. 58 10:32 But recall the former days in which, after you were illuminated, you endured a great fight of afflictions: 58 10:33 partly while you were made a spectacle both by reproaches and afflictions, and partly while you became companions of those who were so treated; 58 10:34 because you had compassion on me in my chains, and joyfully accepted the plundering of your goods, knowing that you have a better and an enduring possession for yourselves in heaven. 58 10:35 Therefore do not cast away your confidence, which has great reward. 58 10:36 Because, you have need of endurance, so that after you have done the will of God, you may receive the promise: 58 10:37 Because, "Yet a little while, and He who is coming will come and will not delay. 58 10:38 Now the just will live by faith; but if anyone draws back, My soul will have no pleasure in him." 58 10:39 But we are not of those who draw back to perdition, but of those who believe to the saving of the soul. 58 11:1 Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen. 58 11:2 Because by it the elders obtained a good testimony. 58 11:3 Through faith we understand that the ages were framed by the word of God, so that the things which are seen were not made of things which are visible. 58 11:4 By faith Abel offered to God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, by which he obtained witness that he was righteous, God testifying of his gifts; and by it he being dead still speaks. 58 11:5 By faith Enoch was taken away so that he did not see death, "and was not found, because God had taken him"; because before he was taken he had this testimony, that he pleased God. 58 11:6 But without faith it is impossible to please Him, because, he who comes to God must believe that He is, and that He is a rewarder of those who diligently seek Him. 58 11:7 By faith Noah, being warned by God of things not yet seen, moved with reverence, prepared an ark for the saving of his household, by which he condemned the world and became heir of the righteousness which is by faith. 58 11:8 By faith Abraham obeyed when he was called to go out to the place which he would receive as an inheritance. And he went out, not knowing where he was going. 58 11:9 By faith he dwelt in the land of promise as in a foreign country, dwelling in tents with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise; 58 11:10 because, he waited for the city which has foundations, whose builder and maker is God. 58 11:11 By faith Sarah herself also received strength to conceive seed, and she bore a child when she was past the age, because she judged Him faithful who had promised. 58 11:12 Therefore from one man, and him as good as dead, were born as many as the stars of the sky in multitude, innumerable as the sand which is by the seashore. 58 11:13 These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them afar off were persuaded of them, embraced them and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth. 58 11:14 Because those who say such things declare plainly that they seek a homeland. 58 11:15 And truly if they had called to mind that country from which they had come out, they would have had opportunity to return. 58 11:16 But now they desire a better, that is, a heavenly country. Therefore God is not ashamed to be called their God, because He has prepared a city for them. 58 11:17 By faith Abraham, when he was tested, offered up Isaac, and he who had received the promises offered up his only begotten son, 58 11:18 of whom it was said, "In Isaac your seed will be called," 58 11:19 concluding that God was able to raise him up, even from the dead, from which he also received him in a figurative sense. 58 11:20 By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come. 58 11:21 By faith Jacob, when he was dying, blessed both of the sons of Joseph, and worshiped, leaning on the top of his staff. 58 11:22 By faith Joseph, when he was dying, made mention of the departure of the children of Israel, and gave instructions concerning his bones. 58 11:23 By faith Moses, when he was born, was hidden three months by his parents, because they saw he was a beautiful child; and they were not afraid of the king's command. 58 11:24 By faith Moses, when he became of age, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh's daughter, 58 11:25 choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God than to enjoy the passing pleasures of sin, 58 11:26 esteeming the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures in Egypt; because he looked to the reward. 58 11:27 By faith he forsook Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king; because he endured as seeing Him who is invisible. 58 11:28 Through faith he kept the Passover and the sprinkling of blood, lest he who destroyed the firstborn should touch them. 58 11:29 By faith they passed through the Red Sea as by dry land, whereas the Egyptians, attempting to do so, were drowned. 58 11:30 By faith the walls of Jericho fell down after they were encircled for seven days. 58 11:31 By faith the harlot Rahab did not perish with those who did not believe, when she had received the spies with peace. 58 11:32 And what more shall I say? Because, the time would fail me to tell of Gideon and Barak and Samson and Jephthah, also of David and Samuel and the prophets: 58 11:33 who through faith subdued kingdoms, worked righteousness, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions, 58 11:34 quenched the violence of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, out of weakness were made strong, became valiant in battle, turned to flight the armies of the foreigners. 58 11:35 Women received their dead raised to life again. Others were tortured, not accepting deliverance, that they might obtain a better resurrection. 58 11:36 And others had trial of cruel mockings and scourgings, yes, and of chains and imprisonment. 58 11:37 They were stoned, they were sawn in two, were tempted, were slain with the sword. They wandered about in sheepskins and goatskins, being destitute, afflicted, tormented; 58 11:38 of whom the world was not worthy. They wandered in deserts and in mountains, in dens and caves of the earth. 58 11:39 And all these, having obtained a good testimony through faith, did not receive the promise, 58 11:40 God having provided something better for us, that they should not be made perfect apart from us. 58 12:1 Therefore seeing we also are surrounded by so great a cloud of witnesses, let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which so easily ensnares us, and let us run with endurance the race that is set before us, 58 12:2 looking to Jesus, the author and finisher of our faith, who for the joy that was set before Him endured the cross, despising the shame, and has sat down at the right hand of the throne of God. 58 12:3 Because, consider Him who endured such hostility from sinners against Himself, lest you become weary and faint in your minds. 58 12:4 You have not yet resisted to bloodshed, striving against sin. 58 12:5 And you have forgotten the exhortation which speaks to you as to children: "My son, do not despise the chastening of the LORD, nor be discouraged when you are rebuked by Him; 58 12:6 Because, whom the Lord loves He chastens, and scourges every son whom He receives." 58 12:7 If you endure chastening, God deals with you as with sons; because what son is there whom a father does not chasten? 58 12:8 But if you are without chastening, of which all have become partakers, then you are illegitimate and not sons. 58 12:9 Furthermore, we have had human fathers who corrected us, and we gave them respect. Should we not much more readily be in subjection to the Father of spirits and live? 58 12:10 Because, they indeed for a few days chastened us as seemed best to them, but He for our profit, that we may be partakers of His holiness. 58 12:11 Now no chastening seems to be joyful for the present, but painful; nevertheless, afterward it yields the peaceable fruit of righteousness to those who have been trained by it. 58 12:12 Therefore strengthen the hands which hang down, and the feeble knees, 58 12:13 and make straight paths for your feet, so that what is lame may not be turned out of the way, but rather let it be healed. 58 12:14 Pursue peace with all people, and holiness, without which no one will see the Lord: 58 12:15 looking diligently lest anyone fall short of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up cause trouble, and by this many become defiled; 58 12:16 lest there be any fornicator or profane person like Esau, who for one morsel of food sold his birthright. 58 12:17 Because, you know that afterward, when he wanted to inherit the blessing, he was rejected, because he found no place for repentance, though he sought it diligently with tears. 58 12:18 Because, you have not come to the mountain that may be touched and that burned with fire, and to blackness and darkness and tempest, 58 12:19 and the sound of a trumpet and the voice of words, which voice those who heard it begged that the word should not be spoken to them anymore. 58 12:20 (Because, they could not endure what was commanded: "And if so much as a beast touches the mountain, it shall be stoned or shot with an arrow." 58 12:21 And so terrifying was the sight that Moses said, "I am exceedingly afraid and trembling.") 58 12:22 But you have come to Mount Zion and to the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, to an innumerable company of angels, 58 12:23 to the general assembly and church of the firstborn who are written in heaven, to God the Judge of all, to the spirits of just men made perfect, 58 12:24 to Jesus the Mediator of the new covenant, and to the blood of sprinkling that speaks better things than that of Abel. 58 12:25 See that you do not refuse Him who speaks. Because, if they did not escape who refused Him who spoke on earth, much more will we not escape if we turn away from Him who speaks from heaven, 58 12:26 whose voice then shook the earth; but now He has promised, saying, "Yet once more I shake not only the earth, but also heaven." 58 12:27 Now this phrase, "Yet once more," indicates the removal of those things that are being shaken, as of things that are made, that the things which cannot be shaken may remain. 58 12:28 Therefore, since we are receiving a kingdom which cannot be shaken, let us have grace, by which we may serve God acceptably with respect and godly reverence. 58 12:29 Because our God is a consuming fire. 58 13:1 Let brotherly love continue. 58 13:2 Do not forget to entertain strangers, because by doing so some have unknowingly entertained angels. 58 13:3 Remember the prisoners as if chained with them, and those who suffer adversity, since you yourselves are in the same body. 58 13:4 Marriage is honorable among all, and the bed undefiled; but fornicators and adulterers God will judge. 58 13:5 Let your conduct be without covetousness; and be content with such things as you have. Because He Himself has said, "I will never leave you nor forsake you." 58 13:6 So that we may boldly say: "The LORD is my helper, and I will not fear what man shall do to me!" 58 13:7 Remember your leaders, who have spoken the word of God to you, whose faith follow, considering the outcome of their conduct. 58 13:8 Jesus Christ, the same yesterday, today, and forever. 58 13:9 Do not be carried about with various and strange doctrines. Because, it is good that the heart be established with grace, not with foods which have not profited those who have been occupied with them. 58 13:10 We have an altar from which those who serve the tabernacle have no right to eat. 58 13:11 Because, the bodies of those animals, whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest for sin, are burned outside the camp. 58 13:12 Therefore Jesus also, that He might sanctify the people with His own blood, suffered outside the gate. 58 13:13 Therefore let us go forth to Him, outside the camp, bearing His reproach. 58 13:14 Because, here we have no continuing city, but we seek the one to come. 58 13:15 Therefore by Him let us continually offer the sacrifice of praise to God, that is, the fruit of our lips, giving thanks to His name. 58 13:16 But do not forget to do good and to share, because with such sacrifices God is well pleased. 58 13:17 Obey those who lead you, and be submissive, because they watch out for your souls, as those who must give account. Let them do so with joy and not with grief, because that is unprofitable for you. 58 13:18 Pray for us; because, we are confident that we have a good conscience in all things, desiring to live honorably. 58 13:19 But I especially urge you to do this, that I may be restored to you the sooner. 58 13:20 Now may the God of peace who brought up our Lord Jesus from the dead, that great Shepherd of the sheep, through the blood of the everlasting covenant, 58 13:21 make you complete in every good work to do His will, working in you what is well pleasing in His sight, through Jesus Christ, to whom be glory forever and ever. Amen. 58 13:22 And I urge you, brethren, bear with the word of exhortation, because I have written to you in few words. 58 13:23 Know that our brother Timothy has been set free, with whom I shall see you if he comes shortly. 58 13:24 Greet all those who rule over you, and all the saints. Those from Italy greet you. 58 13:25 Grace be with you all. Amen. 59 1:1 James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad: Greetings. 59 1:2 My brethren, count it all joy when you fall into various trials, 59 1:3 knowing this, that the testing of your faith produces perseverance. 59 1:4 But let perseverance have her perfect work, that you may be perfect and complete, lacking nothing. 59 1:5 If any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask of God, who gives to all people liberally and without reproach, and it will be given to him. 59 1:6 But let him ask in faith, nothing wavering, because, he who wavers is like a wave of the sea driven and tossed by the wind. 59 1:7 Because, do not let that man think that he will receive anything from the Lord; 59 1:8 a double minded man is unstable in all his ways. 59 1:9 Let the lowly brother rejoice in his exaltation, 59 1:10 but the rich in his humiliation, because as a flower of the field he will pass away. 59 1:11 Because, no sooner has the sun risen with a burning heat than it withers the grass; its flower falls, and its beautiful appearance perishes. So the rich man likewise will fade away in his ways. 59 1:12 Blessed is the man who endures temptation; because, when he has been approved, he will receive the crown of life which the Lord has promised to those who love Him. 59 1:13 Let no one say when he is tempted, "I am tempted by God"; because, God cannot be tempted by evil, nor does He tempt anyone. 59 1:14 But each one is tempted when he is drawn away by his own lust and enticed. 59 1:15 Then, when lust has conceived, it brings forth sin; and sin, when it is finished, brings forth death. 59 1:16 Do not be deceived, my beloved brethren. 59 1:17 Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, and comes down from the Father of lights, with whom there is no variation or shadow of turning. 59 1:18 Of His own will He begot us by the word of truth, that we might be a type of firstfruits of His creatures. 59 1:19 So then, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath; 59 1:20 because, the wrath of man does not produce the righteousness of God. 59 1:21 Therefore lay aside all filthiness and overflow of wickedness, and receive with meekness the implanted word, which is able to save your souls. 59 1:22 But be doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving yourselves. 59 1:23 because, if anyone is a hearer of the word and not a doer, he is like a man observing his natural face in a mirror; 59 1:24 because, he observes himself, goes away, and immediately forgets what kind of man he was. 59 1:25 But he who looks into the perfect law of liberty and continues in it, and is not a forgetful hearer but a doer of the work, this one will be blessed in what he does. 59 1:26 If anyone among you seems to be religious, and does not bridle his tongue but deceives his own heart, this one's religion is vain. 59 1:27 Pure and undefiled religion before God and the Father is this: to visit orphans and widows in their affliction, and to keep oneself unspotted from the world. 59 2:1 My brethren, do not hold the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Lord of glory, with personal favoritism. 59 2:2 Because, if there should come into your assembly a man with a gold ring, in fine apparel, and there should also come in a poor man in filthy clothes, 59 2:3 and you have respect to the one wearing the fine clothes and say to him, "You sit here in a good place," and say to the poor person, "You stand there," or, "Sit here at my footstool," 59 2:4 have you not shown personal favoritism among yourselves, and have become judges with evil thoughts? 59 2:5 Listen, my beloved brethren: Has not God also chosen the poor of this world to be rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom which He promised to those who love Him? 59 2:6 But you have despised the poor. Do not also the rich oppress you and drag you before the courts? 59 2:7 Do they not blaspheme that worthy name by which you are called? 59 2:8 If you fulfill the royal law according to the Scripture, "You shall love your neighbor as yourself," you do well; 59 2:9 but if you show personal favoritism, you commit sin, and are convicted by the law as transgressors. 59 2:10 Because, whoever shall keep the entire law, and yet stumble in one point, he is guilty of all. 59 2:11 Because, He who said, "Do not commit adultery," also said, "Do not murder." Now if you do not commit adultery, but you do murder, you have become a transgressor of the law. 59 2:12 So speak and so do as those who will be judged by the law of liberty. 59 2:13 Because, judgment is without mercy to the one who has shown no mercy. And mercy triumphs over judgment. 59 2:14 What does it profit, my brethren, if someone says he has faith but does not have works? Can faith save him? 59 2:15 If a brother or sister is naked and destitute of daily food, 59 2:16 and one of you says to them, "Depart in peace, be warmed and filled," but you do not give them the things which are needed for the body, what does it profit? 59 2:17 So likewise faith by itself, if it does not have works, is dead. 59 2:18 Yes, someone may say, "You have faith, and I have works." Show me your faith without your works, and I will show you my faith by my works. 59 2:19 You believe that there is one God. You do well. Even the demons believe, and tremble! 59 2:20 But do you want to know, O vain man, that faith without works is dead? 59 2:21 Was not Abraham our father justified by works when he offered Isaac his son upon the altar? 59 2:22 Do you see that faith was working together with his works, and by works faith was made perfect? 59 2:23 And the Scripture was fulfilled which says, "Abraham believed God, and it was imputed to him for righteousness." And he was called the Friend of God. 59 2:24 You see then how that a man is justified by works, and not by faith only. 59 2:25 Likewise, was not Rahab the harlot also justified by works when she received the messengers and sent them out another way? 59 2:26 Because, as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead also. 59 3:1 My brethren, do not let many of you be teachers, knowing that we will receive a stricter judgment. 59 3:2 Because, we all offend in many things. If anyone does not offend in word, he is a perfect man, and able also to bridle the whole body. 59 3:3 Behold, we put bits in horses' mouths that they may obey us, and we turn their entire body. 59 3:4 Look also at ships: although they are so large and are driven by fierce winds, yet they are turned about by a very small rudder wherever the pilot desires. 59 3:5 Even so the tongue is a little member and boasts great things. See how large an object a little fire kindles! 59 3:6 And the tongue is a fire, a world of iniquity. The tongue is so set among our members that it defiles the entire body, and sets on fire the course of nature; and it is set on fire by hell. 59 3:7 Because, every kind of beast and bird, of reptile and things in the sea, is tamed and has been tamed by mankind. 59 3:8 But no man can tame the tongue. It is an unruly evil, full of deadly poison. 59 3:9 With it we bless our God and Father, and with it we curse men, who have been made in the similitude of God. 59 3:10 Out of the same mouth proceed blessing and cursing. My brethren, these things ought not to be so. 59 3:11 Does a spring send forth fresh water and bitter from the same opening? 59 3:12 Can a fig tree, my brethren, bear olives, or a grapevine bear figs? Thus no spring yields both salt water and fresh. 59 3:13 Who is wise and knowledgeable among you? Let him show by good conduct that his works are done in the meekness of wisdom. 59 3:14 But if you have bitter envy and selfish ambition in your hearts, do not boast and lie against the truth. 59 3:15 This wisdom does not descend from above, but is earthly, sensual, demonic. 59 3:16 Because, where envy and selfish ambition exist, confusion and every evil thing are there. 59 3:17 But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, and willing to yield, full of mercy and good fruits, without personal favoritism and without hypocrisy. 59 3:18 And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace by those who make peace. 59 4:1 Where do wars and fights come from among you? Do they not come from your lust for pleasure that war in your members? 59 4:2 You lust and do not have. You murder and covet and cannot obtain. You fight and war. Yet you do not have because you do not ask. 59 4:3 You ask and do not receive, because you ask amiss, that you may spend it on your pleasures. 59 4:4 You adulterers and adulteresses! Do you not know that friendship with the world is enmity with God? Whoever therefore wants to be a friend of the world is the enemy of God. 59 4:5 Or do you think that the Scripture says in vain, "The Spirit who dwells in us yearns jealously"? 59 4:6 But He gives more grace. Therefore He says: "God resists the proud, but gives grace to the humble." 59 4:7 Therefore submit to God. Resist the devil and he will flee from you. 59 4:8 Draw near to God and He will draw near to you. Cleanse your hands, you sinners; and purify your hearts, you double minded. 59 4:9 Lament and mourn and weep! Let your laughter be turned to mourning and your joy to gloom. 59 4:10 Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and He will lift you up. 59 4:11 Do not speak evil of one another, brethren. He who speaks evil of his brother and judges his brother, speaks evil of the law and judges the law. But if you judge the law, you are not a doer of the law but a judge. 59 4:12 There is one Lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy. Who are you to judge another? 59 4:13 Come now, you who say, "Today or tomorrow we will go to such and such a city, spend a year there, buy and sell, and make a profit"; 59 4:14 whereas you do not know what will happen tomorrow. Because what is your life? It is even a vapor that appears for a little time and then vanishes away. 59 4:15 Instead you ought to say, "If the Lord wills, we shall live and do this or that." 59 4:16 But now you boast in your arrogance. All such boasting is evil. 59 4:17 Therefore, to him who knows to do good and does not do it, to him it is sin. 59 5:1 Come now, you rich men, weep and howl for your miseries that will come upon you! 59 5:2 Your riches are corrupted, and your clothes are moth eaten. 59 5:3 Your gold and silver are corroded, and their corrosion will be a witness against you and will eat your flesh like it was fire. You have heaped up treasure in the last days. 59 5:4 Behold, the wages of the laborers who harvested your fields, which you kept back by fraud, cries out; and the outcry of the reapers have reached the ears of the Lord of Sabaoth. 59 5:5 You have lived on the earth in pleasure and luxury; you have fattened your hearts as in a day of slaughter. 59 5:6 You have condemned and murdered the just; and he does not resist you. 59 5:7 Therefore be patient, brethren, until the coming of the Lord. See how the farmer waits for the precious fruit of the earth, and waits patiently for it until he receives the early and latter rain. 59 5:8 You also be patient. Establish your hearts, for the coming of the Lord draws near. 59 5:9 Do not hold a grudge against one another, brethren, lest you be condemned. Behold, the Judge is standing at the door! 59 5:10 My brethren, take the prophets, who have spoken in the name of the Lord, as an example of suffering affliction and of patience. 59 5:11 Behold, we count them blessed who endure. You have heard of the perseverance of Job and seen the end intended by the Lord, that the Lord is very compassionate and merciful. 59 5:12 But above all, my brethren, do not swear, either by heaven or by earth or with any other oath. But let your "Yes" be "Yes," and your "No," "No," lest you fall into condemnation. 59 5:13 Is anyone among you afflicted? Let him pray. Is anyone cheerful? Let him sing psalms. 59 5:14 Is anyone among you sick? Let him call for the elders of the church, and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord. 59 5:15 And the prayer of faith will save the sick, and the Lord will raise him up. And if he has committed sins, he will be forgiven. 59 5:16 Confess your faults to one another, and pray for one another, that you may be healed. The effective, fervent prayer of a righteous man avails much. 59 5:17 Elijah was a man subject to passions as we are, and he prayed earnestly that it would not rain; and it did not rain on the land for three years and six months. 59 5:18 And he prayed again, and the heaven gave rain, and the earth produced her fruit. 59 5:19 Brethren, if any of you wanders from the truth, and someone converts him 59 5:20 let him know that he who converts a sinner from the error of his way will save a soul from death and cover a multitude of sins. 60 1:1 Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the pilgrims scattered throughout Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia, 60 1:2 elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, through sanctification of the Spirit to obedience, and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace be multiplied. 60 1:3 Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who according to His abundant mercy has begotten us again to a living hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead, 60 1:4 to an inheritance incorruptible, undefiled, and that does not fade away, reserved in heaven for you, 60 1:5 who are kept by the power of God through faith for salvation ready to be revealed in the last time. 60 1:6 In this you greatly rejoice, though now for a season, if need be, you are in heaviness through various trials, 60 1:7 that the genuineness of your faith, being much more precious than gold that perishes, though it be tested by fire, may be found to praise, honor, and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ, 60 1:8 whom having not seen, you love. In whom, though now you do not see Him, yet believing, you rejoice with unspeakable joy, and full of glory, 60 1:9 receiving the end of your faith, even the salvation of your souls. 60 1:10 Of this salvation, the prophets inquired and searched diligently, who prophesied of this grace that would come to you; 60 1:11 searching for what, or which particular time, the Spirit of Christ who was in them signified when He testified beforehand of the sufferings of Christ and the glory that would follow. 60 1:12 To them it was revealed that, not to themselves, but to us they ministered the things that are now reported to you by those who have preached the gospel to you by the Holy Spirit sent down from heaven, things which the angels desire to look into. 60 1:13 Therefore gird up the loins of your mind, be sober, and hope until the end for the grace that is to be brought to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ; 60 1:14 as obedient children, not conforming yourselves according to the former lusts, as in your ignorance, 60 1:15 but just as He who has called you is holy, you also be holy in all your conduct, 60 1:16 because it is written, "Be holy, because I am holy." 60 1:17 And if you call on the Father, who without personal favoritism judges according to each one's work, pass the time of your pilgrimage here in reverence; 60 1:18 knowing that you were not redeemed with corruptible things, like silver or gold, from your vain conduct received by tradition from your fathers, 60 1:19 but with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot. 60 1:20 He indeed was foreordained before the foundation of the world, but was manifest in these last times for you 60 1:21 who now by Him believe in God, who raised Him up from the dead and gave Him glory, so that your faith and hope might be in God. 60 1:22 Seeing you have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit in sincere love of the brethren, see that you love one another fervently with a pure heart, 60 1:23 having been born again, not of corruptible seed, but of incorruptible, by the word of God which lives and abides forever. 60 1:24 because, "All flesh is like grass, and all the glory of man like the flower of the grass. The grass withers, and its flower falls away, 60 1:25 but the word of the LORD endures forever." Now this is the word which by the gospel is preached to you. 60 2:1 Therefore laying aside all malice, all deceit, hypocrisy, envy, and all evil speaking, 60 2:2 as newborn babes, desire the pure milk of the word, that you may grow thereby, 60 2:3 if indeed you have tasted that the Lord is gracious. 60 2:4 Coming to Him as to a living stone, rejected indeed by men, but chosen by God and precious, 60 2:5 you also, as living stones, are built up as a spiritual house, a holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God by Jesus Christ. 60 2:6 Therefore it is also contained in the scripture, "Behold, I lay in Zion a chief cornerstone, elect, precious, and he who believes on Him will not be put to shame." 60 2:7 Therefore, to you who believe, He is precious; but to those who are disobedient, "The stone which the builders rejected, has become the head cornerstone," 60 2:8 and "A stone of stumbling and a rock of offense," which is to those who stumble at the word, being disobedient, to which they are also appointed. 60 2:9 But you are a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a special people, that you may proclaim the praises of Him who has called you out of darkness into His marvelous light; 60 2:10 who once were not a people, but are now the people of God, who had not obtained mercy, but now have obtained mercy. 60 2:11 Beloved, I urge you as foreigners and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul, 60 2:12 having your conduct honorable among the Gentiles, that while they speak against you as evildoers, they may, by your good works which they observe, glorify God in the day of visitation. 60 2:13 Submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord's sake, whether it be to the king as supreme, 60 2:14 or to governors, as to those who are sent by him for the punishment of evildoers and for the praise of those who do good. 60 2:15 Because, this is the will of God, that by doing good you may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men, 60 2:16 as free, yet not using your liberty as a cover for maliciousness, but as the servants of God. 60 2:17 Honor all people. Love the brotherhood. Reverence God. Honor the king. 60 2:18 Servants, be submissive to your masters with all reverence, not only to the good and gentle, but also to the harsh. 60 2:19 Because, this is admirable, if because of conscience toward God a person endures grief, suffering wrongfully. 60 2:20 Because, what glory is it if, when you are punished for your faults, you take it patiently? But when you do good and suffer for it, if you take it patiently, this is acceptable before God. 60 2:21 Because, to this were you called, because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that you should follow His steps: 60 2:22 "Who did no sin, nor was deceit found in His mouth"; 60 2:23 who, when He was reviled, did not revile in return; when He suffered, He did not threaten, but committed Himself to Him who judges righteously; 60 2:24 who Himself bore our sins in His own body on the tree, that we, being dead to sins, should live for righteousness, by whose stripes you were healed. 60 2:25 Because, you were like sheep going astray, but have now returned to the Shepherd and Overseer of your souls. 60 3:1 Likewise, wives, be in subjection to your own husbands, so that if any do not obey the word, they also without the word may be won by the conduct of their wives, 60 3:2 when they observe your chaste conduct accompanied with reverence. 60 3:3 Do not let your adornment be only an outward appearance, arranging the hair, wearing gold, or putting on of clothes, 60 3:4 but let it be the hidden person of the heart, with that which is incorruptible, even the adornment of a meek and quiet spirit, which is of great value in the sight of God. 60 3:5 Because, in this manner, in old times, the holy women who trusted in God also adorned themselves, being in submission to their own husbands, 60 3:6 just as Sarah obeyed Abraham, calling him lord, whose daughters you are if you do good and are not afraid with any terror. 60 3:7 Husbands, likewise, dwell with them according to knowledge, giving honor to the wife, as to the weaker vessel, and as being heirs together of the grace of life, that your prayers may not be hindered. 60 3:8 Finally, all of you be of one mind, having compassion for one another; love as brethren, be tenderhearted, be courteous; 60 3:9 not returning evil for evil or reviling for reviling, but on the contrary blessing, knowing that you are called to this, that you should inherit a blessing. 60 3:10 Because, "He who would love life and see good days, let him refrain his tongue from evil, and his lips from speaking deceit. 60 3:11 Let him turn away from evil, and do good; let him seek peace and pursue it. 60 3:12 Because, the eyes of the LORD are on the righteous, and His ears are open to their prayers; but the face of the LORD is against those who do evil." 60 3:13 And who is he who will harm you if you be followers of that which is good? 60 3:14 But even if you suffer for righteousness' sake, you are blessed. "And do not be afraid of their threats, nor be troubled." 60 3:15 But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts, and always be ready to give an answer to everyone who asks you a reason for the hope that is in you, with meekness and reverence; 60 3:16 having a good conscience, that when they defame you as evildoers, those who falsely accuse your good conduct in Christ may be ashamed. 60 3:17 Because, it is better, if it is the will of God, that you suffer for doing good than for doing evil. 60 3:18 Because, Christ also suffered once for sins, the just for the unjust, that He might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh but made alive by the Spirit, 60 3:19 by whom also He went and preached to the spirits in prison, 60 3:20 who formerly were disobedient, when once the longsuffering of God waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was being prepared, in which a few, that is, eight souls, were saved by water. 60 3:21 This is also figurative of that which also now saves us, even baptism (not the removal of the filth of the flesh, but the answer of a good conscience toward God), by the resurrection of Jesus Christ, 60 3:22 who has gone into heaven and is on the right hand of God, angels and authorities and powers having been made subject to Him. 60 4:1 Therefore, since Christ suffered for us in the flesh, arm yourselves likewise with the same mind, because, he who has suffered in the flesh has ceased from sin, 60 4:2 that he no longer should live the rest of his time in the flesh for the lusts of men, but for the will of God. 60 4:3 Because, we spent enough of our former life in doing the will of the Gentiles, when we walked in lustfulness, desires, drunkenness, partying, drinking parties, and abominable idolatries, 60 4:4 in concerning these things they think it is strange that you do not run with them in the same excessive wastefulness, speaking evil of you, 60 4:5 who will give an account to Him who is ready to judge the living and the dead. 60 4:6 Because, for this reason was the gospel also preached to those who are dead, that they might be judged according to men in the flesh, but live according to God in the spirit. 60 4:7 But the end of all things is at hand; therefore be sober and watchful in prayer. 60 4:8 And above all things have fervent love among yourselves, because "love will cover the multitude of sins." 60 4:9 Be hospitable to one another without grumbling. 60 4:10 As each one has received the gift, even so also minister the same to one another, as good stewards of the manifold grace of God. 60 4:11 If anyone speaks, let him speak as the oracles of God. If anyone ministers, let him do it as with the ability which God gives, that in all things God may be glorified through Jesus Christ, to whom be the praise and dominion forever and ever. Amen. 60 4:12 Beloved, do not think it strange concerning the fiery trial which is to test you, as though some strange thing happened to you; 60 4:13 but rejoice to the degree that you participate in Christ's sufferings, that when His glory will be revealed , you may also be glad with exceeding joy. 60 4:14 If you are reproached for the name of Christ, you are blessed, because the Spirit of glory and of God rests upon you. On their part He is blasphemed, but on your part He is glorified. 60 4:15 But let none of you suffer as a murderer, as a thief, as an evildoer, or as a busybody in other people's matters. 60 4:16 Yet if anyone suffers as a Christian, let him not be ashamed, but let him glorify God in this matter. 60 4:17 Because, the time has come that judgment must begin at the house of God; and if it begins with us first, what will be the end of those who do not obey the gospel of God? 60 4:18 Now "if the righteous are scarcely saved, where will the ungodly and the sinner appear?" 60 4:19 Therefore let those who suffer according to the will of God commit the preservation of their souls to Him in doing good, as to a faithful Creator. 60 5:1 The elders who are among you I exhort, who am also an elder and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and also a partaker of the glory that will be revealed: 60 5:2 Feed the flock of God which is among you, serving as overseers, not by obligation but willingly, not for dishonest gain, but with an eager mind; 60 5:3 nor as being lords over God's heritage, but being examples to the flock; 60 5:4 and when the Chief Shepherd will appear, you will receive a crown of glory that does not fade away. 60 5:5 Likewise you younger ones, submit yourselves to the elders. Yes, all of you be submissive to one another, and be clothed with humility, because, "God resists the proud, but gives grace to the humble." 60 5:6 Therefore humble yourselves under the mighty hand of God, that He may exalt you in due time, 60 5:7 casting all your burdens upon Him, because He cares for you. 60 5:8 Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil walks about like a roaring lion, seeking whom he may devour. 60 5:9 Resist him steadfast in the faith, knowing that the same afflictions are experienced by your brethren who are in the world. 60 5:10 But may the God of all grace, who has called us to His eternal glory by Christ Jesus, after you have suffered a while, perfect, establish, strengthen, and settle you. 60 5:11 To Him be glory and dominion forever and ever. Amen. 60 5:12 By Silvanus, a faithful brother to you as I consider him, I have written to you briefly, exhorting and testifying that this is the true grace of God in which you stand. 60 5:13 The church who is in Babylon, elect together with you, greets you; and so does Mark my son. 60 5:14 Greet one another with a kiss of love. Peace be to you all who are in Christ Jesus. Amen. 61 1:1 Simon Peter, a servant and an apostle of Jesus Christ, to those who have obtained like precious faith with us through the righteousness of God even our Savior Jesus Christ: 61 1:2 Grace and peace be multiplied to you through the knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord, 61 1:3 in the same way as His divine power has given to us all things that pertain to life and godliness, through the knowledge of Him who has called us to glory and virtue, 61 1:4 by which are given to us exceedingly great and precious promises, that by these you might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust. 61 1:5 And beside this, giving all diligence, add to your faith virtue, and to virtue knowledge, 61 1:6 and to knowledge self control, and to self control perseverance, and to perseverance godliness, 61 1:7 And to godliness brotherly kindness, and to brotherly kindness love. 61 1:8 Because, if these things are in you and abound, they make you that you will be neither barren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ. 61 1:9 But he who lacks these things is short sighted and blind, and has forgotten that he was cleansed from his old sins. 61 1:10 Therefore instead brethren, be diligent to make your calling and election certain, because if you do these things you will never fall; 61 1:11 because, then an entrance will be provided for you abundantly into the everlasting kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. 61 1:12 Therefore I will not be negligent to constantly remind you of these things, though you know them and are established in the present truth. 61 1:13 Yes, I think it is right, as long as I am in this tent, to stir you up by reminding you, 61 1:14 knowing that shortly I must put off my tent, just as our Lord Jesus Christ has shown me. 61 1:15 Moreover I will endeavor that after my decease you may be able to have these things in remembrance. 61 1:16 Because, we did not follow cunningly devised fables when we made known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but were eyewitnesses of His majesty. 61 1:17 Because, He received from God the Father honor and glory when a voice came to Him from the Excellent Glory: "This is My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased." 61 1:18 And we heard this voice which came from heaven when we were with Him on the holy mountain. 61 1:19 We also have an additional confirmed word of prophecy, which you do well to observe as a light that shines in a dark place, until the day dawns and the day star rises in your hearts; 61 1:20 knowing this first, that no prophecy of Scripture is of any private interpretation. 61 1:21 because, the prophecy in old times did not come by the will of man, but holy men of God spoke as they were moved by the Holy Spirit. 61 2:1 But there were false prophets also among the people, even as there will be false teachers among you, who will secretly bring in damnable heresies, even denying the Lord who bought them, and bring upon themselves swift destruction. 61 2:2 And many will follow their destructive ways, because of whom the way of truth will be blasphemed. 61 2:3 And through covetousness they will exploit you with deceptive words for profit; for a long time their judgment has not been idle, and their damnation does not slumber. 61 2:4 Because, if God did not spare the angels who sinned, but cast them down to hell and delivered them into chains of darkness, to be reserved for judgment; 61 2:5 and did not spare the old world, but saved Noah one of eight people, a preacher of righteousness, bringing in the flood upon the world of the ungodly; 61 2:6 and turning the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah into ashes, condemned them with destruction, making them an example to those who afterward would live ungodly; 61 2:7 and delivered righteous Lot, who was oppressed with the filthy conduct of the wicked 61 2:8 (because, that righteous man, dwelling among them, tormented his righteous soul from day to day by seeing and hearing their lawless deeds). 61 2:9 The Lord knows how to deliver the godly out of temptations and to reserve the unjust for the day of judgment to be punished, 61 2:10 but especially those who walk according to the flesh in the lust of uncleanness and despise authority. They are presumptuous, self willed, they are not afraid to speak evil of dignitaries, 61 2:11 whereas angels, who are greater in power and might, do not bring a reviling accusation against them before the Lord. 61 2:12 But these, like natural brute beasts, made to be captured and destroyed, speak evil of the things that they do not understand, and will utterly perish in their own corruption, 61 2:13 and will receive the wages of unrighteousness, as those who count it pleasure to indulge in the daytime. They are spots and blemishes, delighting themselves with their own deceptions while they feast with you, 61 2:14 having eyes full of adultery, and that cannot cease from sin, enticing unstable souls. They have a heart trained with covetous practices, and are cursed children. 61 2:15 They have forsaken the right way and have gone astray, following the way of Balaam the son of Beor, who loved the wages of unrighteousness; 61 2:16 but was rebuked for his iniquity: the mute donkey speaking with a man's voice restrained the madness of the prophet. 61 2:17 These are wells without water, clouds that are carried by a tempest, for whom is reserved the blackness of darkness forever. 61 2:18 Because, when they speak great swelling words of emptiness, they allure through the lusts of the flesh, through unrestrained lusts, those who had completely escaped from those who live in error. 61 2:19 While they promise them liberty, they themselves are the servants of corruption; because by whom a person is overcome, by him also is he brought in bondage. 61 2:20 Because if, after they have escaped the pollutions of the world through the knowledge of the Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, they are again entangled in them and overcome, the latter end is worse for them than the beginning. 61 2:21 because, it would have been better for them not to have known the way of righteousness, than after having known it, to turn from the holy commandment delivered to them. 61 2:22 But it has happened to them according to the true proverb: "The dog returned to his own vomit again," and, "a sow, having washed, to her wallowing in the mire." 61 3:1 Beloved, I now write to you this second epistle, in both which I stir up your pure minds by the method of remembrance, 61 3:2 that you may be mindful of the words which were spoken beforehand by the holy prophets, and of the commandment of us, the apostles of the Lord and Savior, 61 3:3 knowing this first, that scoffers will come in the last days, walking according to their own lusts, 61 3:4 and saying, "Where is the promise of His coming? Because, since the fathers fell asleep, all things continue as they were from the beginning of creation." 61 3:5 Because, they are willfully ignorant of this: that by the word of God the heavens were of old, and the earth standing out of water and in the water, 61 3:6 by which the world that then existed perished, being flooded with water. 61 3:7 But the heavens and the earth which are now preserved by the same word, are reserved for fire until the day of judgment and perdition of ungodly men. 61 3:8 But, beloved, do not be ignorant of this one thing, that with the Lord one day is as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day. 61 3:9 The Lord is not slack concerning His promise, as some count slackness, but is longsuffering toward us, not willing that any should perish but that all should come to repentance. 61 3:10 But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night, in which the heavens will pass away with a great noise, and the elements will melt with fervent heat; both the earth and the works that are in it will be burned up. 61 3:11 Seeing then that all these things will be dissolved, what manner of persons ought you to be in all holy conduct and godliness, 61 3:12 looking for and hastening to the coming of the day of God, in which the heavens will be dissolved, being on fire, and the elements will melt with fervent heat? 61 3:13 Nevertheless we, according to His promise, look for new heavens and a new earth in which righteousness dwells. 61 3:14 Therefore, beloved, seeing that you look for such things, be diligent to be found by Him in peace, without spot and blameless; 61 3:15 and consider that the longsuffering of our Lord is salvation, just as also our beloved brother Paul, according to the wisdom given to him, has written to you, 61 3:16 as also in all his epistles, speaking in them of these things, in which are some things which are hard to understand, which unlearned and unstable people twist, as they do also the other Scriptures, to their own destruction. 61 3:17 You therefore, beloved, since you know this beforehand, beware lest you also fall from your own steadfastness, being led away with the error of the wicked; 61 3:18 but grow in grace and in the knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To Him be glory both now and forever. Amen. 62 1:1 That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have looked upon, and our hands have handled, concerning the Word of life; 62 1:2 (because, the life was manifested, and we have seen it, and bear witness, and show to you that eternal life, which was with the Father, and was manifested to us:) 62 1:3 that which we have seen and heard we declare to you, that you also may have fellowship with us; and truly our fellowship is with the Father and with His Son Jesus Christ. 62 1:4 And these things we write to you that your joy may be full. 62 1:5 This then is the message which we have heard from Him and declare to you, that God is light and in Him is no darkness at all. 62 1:6 If we say that we have fellowship with Him, and walk in darkness, we lie and do not practice the truth. 62 1:7 But if we walk in the light as He is in the light, we have fellowship one with another, and the blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanses us from all sin. 62 1:8 If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us. 62 1:9 If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness. 62 1:10 If we say that we have not sinned, we make Him a liar, and His word is not in us. 62 2:1 My little children, these things I write to you, so that you do not sin. And if anyone sins, we have an Advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous. 62 2:2 And He is the propitiation for our sins, and not for ours only but also for the sins of the entire world. 62 2:3 Now by this we know that we know Him, if we keep His commandments. 62 2:4 He who says, "I know Him," and does not keep His commandments, is a liar, and the truth is not in him. 62 2:5 But whoever keeps His word, truly the love of God is perfected in him. By this we know that we are in Him. 62 2:6 He who says he abides in Him should also himself so walk just as He walked. 62 2:7 Brethren, I write no new commandment to you, but an old commandment which you have had from the beginning. The old commandment is the word which you heard from the beginning. 62 2:8 Again, a new commandment I write to you, which thing is true in Him and in you, because the darkness has passed away, and the true light now shines. 62 2:9 He who says he is in the light, and hates his brother, is in darkness until now. 62 2:10 He who loves his brother abides in the light, and there is no cause for stumbling in him. 62 2:11 But he who hates his brother is in darkness, and walks in darkness, and does not know where he is going, because that darkness has blinded his eyes. 62 2:12 I write to you, little children, because your sins are forgiven you for His name's sake. 62 2:13 I write to you, fathers, because you have known Him who is from the beginning. I write to you, young men, because you have overcome the wicked one. I write to you, little children, because you have known the Father. 62 2:14 I have written to you, fathers, because you have known Him who is from the beginning. I have written to you, young men, because you are strong, and the word of God abides in you, and you have overcome the wicked one. 62 2:15 Do not love the world or the things that are in the world. If anyone loves the world, the love of the Father is not in him. 62 2:16 Because, everything that is in the world, the lust of the flesh, the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life, is not of the Father, but is of the world. 62 2:17 And the world is passing away, and the lust of it; but he who does the will of God abides forever. 62 2:18 Little children, it is the last time; and as you have heard the Antichrist is coming, even now there are many antichrists, by whom we know that it is the last time. 62 2:19 They went out from us, but they were not of us; because, if they had been of us, no doubt they would have continued with us ; but they went out that they might be made manifest, that they were not all of us. 62 2:20 But you have an anointing from the Holy One, and you know all things. 62 2:21 I have not written to you because you do not know the truth, but because you know it, and that no lie is of the truth. 62 2:22 Who is a liar but he who denies that Jesus is the Christ? He is antichrist who denies the Father and the Son. 62 2:23 Whoever denies the Son, the same does not have the Father: but he who acknowledges the Son has the Father also. 62 2:24 Therefore let that abide in you which you have heard from the beginning. If what you heard from the beginning remains in you, you also will continue in the Son and in the Father. 62 2:25 And this is the promise that He has promised us, even eternal life. 62 2:26 These things I have written to you concerning those who seduce you. 62 2:27 But the anointing which you have received from Him abides in you, and you do not need that anyone teach you; but as the same anointing teaches you concerning all things, and is true, and is not a lie, and just as it has taught you, you shall abide in Him. 62 2:28 And now, little children, abide in Him; that when He appears, we may have confidence and not be ashamed before Him at His coming. 62 2:29 If you know that He is righteous, you know that everyone who practices righteousness is born of Him. 62 3:1 Behold what manner of love the Father has given to us, that we should be called the sons of God! Therefore the world does not know us, because it did not know Him. 62 3:2 Beloved, now we are the sons of God, and it has not yet been revealed what we will be, but we know that when He appears, we will be like Him, because we will see Him as He is. 62 3:3 And everyone who has this hope in Him purifies himself, just as He is pure. 62 3:4 Whoever commits sin also transgresses the law, because sin is the transgression of the law. 62 3:5 And you know that He was manifested to take away our sins, and in Him is no sin. 62 3:6 Whoever abides in Him does not sin. Whoever sins has neither seen Him nor known Him. 62 3:7 Little children, let no one deceive you. He who does righteousness is righteous, just as He is righteous. 62 3:8 He who commits sin is of the devil, because the devil has sinned from the beginning. For this purpose the Son of God was manifested, that He might destroy the works of the devil. 62 3:9 Whoever is born of God does not commit sin, because, His seed remains in him; and he cannot sin, because he is born of God. 62 3:10 In this the children of God and the children of the devil are revealed: whosoever does not practice righteousness is not of God, nor he who does not love his brother. 62 3:11 Because, this is the message that you heard from the beginning, that we should love one another, 62 3:12 not as Cain who was of that wicked one and murdered his brother. And why did he kill him? Because his own works were evil and his brother's righteous. 62 3:13 Do not marvel, my brethren, if the world hates you. 62 3:14 We know that we have passed from death to life, because we love the brethren. He who does not love his brother abides in death. 62 3:15 Whoever hates his brother is a murderer, and you know that no murderer has eternal life abiding in him. 62 3:16 By this we perceive the love of God, because He laid down His life for us. And we also should lay down our lives for the brethren. 62 3:17 But whoever has this world's goods, and sees his brother in need, and shuts up his heart of compassion from him, how does the love of God abide in him? 62 3:18 My little children, let us not love in word or in tongue, but in deed and in truth. 62 3:19 And by this we know that we are of the truth, and will assure our hearts before Him. 62 3:20 Because, if our heart condemns us, God is greater than our heart, and knows all things. 62 3:21 Beloved, if our heart does not condemn us, then have we confidence toward God. 62 3:22 And whatever we ask we receive from Him, because we keep His commandments and do those things that are pleasing in His sight. 62 3:23 And this is His commandment: that we should believe on the name of His Son Jesus Christ and love one another, as He gave us commandment. 62 3:24 Now he who keeps His commandments abides in Him, and He in him. And by this we know that He abides in us, by the Spirit whom He has given us. 62 4:1 Beloved, do not believe every spirit, but test the spirits whether they are of God; because many false prophets have gone out into the world. 62 4:2 By this you know the Spirit of God: Every spirit that confesses that Jesus Christ came in the flesh is of God, 62 4:3 and every spirit that does not confess that Jesus Christ came in the flesh is not of God. And this is that spirit of antichrist, which you have heard was coming and even now it is already in the world. 62 4:4 You are of God, little children, and have overcome them, because greater is He who is in you than he who is in the world. 62 4:5 They are of the world. Therefore they speak from the world, and the world hears them. 62 4:6 We are of God. He who knows God hears us; he who is not of God does not hear us. By this we know the spirit of truth and the spirit of error. 62 4:7 Beloved, let us love one another, because love is of God; and everyone who loves is born of God and knows God. 62 4:8 He who does not love does not know God, because God is love. 62 4:9 In this the love of God was manifested toward us, in that God sent His only begotten Son into the world, that we might live through Him. 62 4:10 In this is love, not that we loved God, but that He loved us and sent His Son to be the propitiation for our sins. 62 4:11 Beloved, if God loved us so much, we also should love one another. 62 4:12 No one has seen God at any time. If we love one another, God abides in us, and His love is perfected in us. 62 4:13 By this we know that we abide in Him, and He in us, because He has given us of His Spirit. 62 4:14 And we have seen and do testify that the Father has sent the Son to be the Savior of the world. 62 4:15 Whoever confesses that Jesus is the Son of God, God abides in him, and he in God. 62 4:16 And we have known and believed the love that God has toward us. God is love, and he who abides in love abides in God, and God in him. 62 4:17 By this is our love perfected, that we may have boldness in the day of judgment; because as He is, so are we in this world. 62 4:18 There is no fear in love; but perfect love casts out fear, because fear involves torment. He who fears has not been made perfect in love. 62 4:19 We love Him because He first loved us. 62 4:20 If anyone says, "I love God," and yet hates his brother, he is a liar; because, he who does not love his brother whom he has seen, how can he love God whom he has not seen? 62 4:21 And this commandment we have from Him: that he who loves God should love his brother also. 62 5:1 Whoever believes that Jesus is the Christ is born of God, and everyone who loves Him who begot also loves him who is begotten of Him. 62 5:2 By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God and keep His commandments. 62 5:3 Because, this is the love of God, that we keep His commandments. And His commandments are not burdensome. 62 5:4 Because, whatever is born of God overcomes the world. And this is the victory that overcomes the world, even our faith. 62 5:5 Who is he who overcomes the world, but he who believes that Jesus is the Son of God? 62 5:6 This is He who came by water and blood, even Jesus Christ; not only by water, but by water and blood. And it is the Spirit who bears witness, because the Spirit is truth. 62 5:7 Because there are three that bear record in heaven, the Father, the Word, and the Holy Spirit; and these three are one. 62 5:8 And there are three that bear witness on earth, the Spirit, the water, and the blood; and these three agree in one. 62 5:9 If we receive the witness of men, the witness of God is greater; because this is the witness of God which He has testified of His Son. 62 5:10 He who believes on the Son of God has the witness in himself; he who does not believe God has made Him a liar, because he does not believe the record that God gave of His Son. 62 5:11 And this is the record: that God has given to us eternal life, and this life is in His Son. 62 5:12 He who has the Son has life; and he who does not have the Son of God does not have life. 62 5:13 These things I have written to you who believe on the name of the Son of God, that you may know that you have eternal life, and that you may believe on the name of the Son of God. 62 5:14 Now this is the confidence that we have in Him, that if we ask anything according to His will, He hears us. 62 5:15 And if we know that He hears us, whatever we ask, we know that we have the petitions that we desired from Him. 62 5:16 If anyone sees his brother sin a sin which is not leading to death, he shall ask, and He will give him life for those who commit sin not leading to death. There is a sin leading to death. I do not say that he should pray for that. 62 5:17 All unrighteousness is sin, and there is a sin not leading to death. 62 5:18 We know that whoever is born of God does not sin; but he who has been begotten of God keeps himself, and that wicked one does not touch him. 62 5:19 And we know that we are of God, and the entire world lies in wickedness. 62 5:20 And we know that the Son of God came, and has given us an understanding, that we may know Him who is true; and we are in Him who is true, even in His Son Jesus Christ. This is the true God and eternal life. 62 5:21 Little children, keep yourselves from idols. Amen. 63 1:1 The elder to the elect lady and her children, whom I love in the truth, and not I only, but also all those who have known the truth, 63 1:2 for the truth's sake which abides in us, and will be with us forever: 63 1:3 Grace be with you, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ, the Son of the Father in truth and love. 63 1:4 I rejoiced greatly that I found some of your children walking in truth, as we have received a commandment from the Father. 63 1:5 And now I urge you, lady, not as though I wrote a new commandment to you, but that which we had from the beginning: that we love one another. 63 1:6 And this is love, that we walk according to His commandments. This is the commandment, that as you have heard from the beginning, you should walk in it. 63 1:7 Because, many deceivers have entered into the world who do not confess that Jesus Christ came in the flesh. This is a deceiver and an antichrist. 63 1:8 Look to yourselves, that we do not lose those things which we have worked for, but that we receive a full reward. 63 1:9 Whoever transgresses and does not abide in the doctrine of Christ does not have God. He who abides in the doctrine of Christ, he has both the Father and the Son. 63 1:10 If anyone comes to you, and does not bring this doctrine, do not receive him into your house, neither greet him with a blessing: 63 1:11 Because, he who greets him with a blessing shares in his evil deeds. 63 1:12 Having many things to write to you, I did not wish to write with paper and ink; but I hope to come to you and speak face to face, that our joy may be full. 63 1:13 The children of your elect sister greet you. Amen. 64 1:1 The elder to the well beloved Gaius, whom I love in the truth: 64 1:2 Beloved, I wish above all things that you may prosper and be in health, just as your soul prospers. 64 1:3 Because, I rejoiced greatly, when the brethren came and testified of the truth that is in you, just as you walk in the truth. 64 1:4 I have no greater joy than to hear that my children walk in truth. 64 1:5 Beloved, you do faithfully whatever you do for the brethren, and for strangers, 64 1:6 who have borne witness of your love before the church; whom if you send them forward on their journey in a manner worthy of God, you will do well, 64 1:7 because, they went forth for His name's sake, taking nothing from the Gentiles. 64 1:8 We therefore ought to receive such, that we may become fellow workers for the truth. 64 1:9 I wrote to the church, but Diotrephes, who loves to have the preeminence among them, does not receive us. 64 1:10 Therefore, if I come, I will remember his deeds which he does, prating against us with malicious words. And not satisfied with that, he himself does not receive the brethren, and forbids those who want to, throwing them out of the church. 64 1:11 Beloved, do not follow that which is evil, but that which is good. He who does good is of God, but he who does evil has not seen God. 64 1:12 Demetrius has a good testimony from all men, and from the truth itself. Yes, and we also bear witness, and you know that our record is true. 64 1:13 I had many things to write, but I will not write to you with pen and ink; 64 1:14 but I hope I shall see you shortly, and we will speak face to face. Peace be to you. Our friends greet you. Greet the friends by name. 65 1:1 Jude, a servant of Jesus Christ, and brother of James, to those who are sanctified by God the Father, and preserved in Jesus Christ, and called: 65 1:2 Mercy to you, and peace, and love, be multiplied. 65 1:3 Beloved, while I was very diligent to write to you about the common salvation, it was necessary for me to write to you, and urge you that you should contend earnestly for the faith which was once for all delivered to the saints. 65 1:4 Because, there are certain men who crept in unnoticed, who long ago were ordained to this condemnation, ungodly men, turning the grace of our God into lustfulness and denying the only Lord God and our Lord Jesus Christ. 65 1:5 Therefore I want to remind you, although you once knew this, that the Lord, having saved the people out of the land of Egypt, afterward destroyed those who did not believe. 65 1:6 And the angels who did not keep their first domain, but left their own habitat, He has reserved in everlasting chains under darkness for the judgment of the great day. 65 1:7 Likewise, Sodom and Gomorrah, and the cities about them in the same manner, giving themselves over to sexual immorality and going after other flesh, are set forth as an example, suffering the vengeance of eternal fire. 65 1:8 Likewise also these filthy dreamers defile the flesh, despise authority, and speak evil of those highly esteemed. 65 1:9 Yet Michael the archangel, while contending with the devil, when he disputed about the body of Moses, dared not bring against him a railing accusation, but said, "The Lord rebuke you!" 65 1:10 But these speak evil of those things they know nothing of; but what they know naturally, like brute beasts, in these things they corrupt themselves. 65 1:11 Woe to them! Because, they have gone in the way of Cain, have run greedily in the error of Balaam for profit, and perished in the rebellion of Korah. 65 1:12 These are spots in your love feasts, while they feast with you, feeding themselves without reverence. They are clouds without water, carried about by winds; trees whose fruit withers, without fruit, twice dead, pulled up by the roots; 65 1:13 raging waves of the sea, foaming out their own shame; wandering stars for whom is reserved the blackness of darkness forever. 65 1:14 Now Enoch, the seventh from Adam, also prophesied about these men, saying, "Behold, the Lord comes with ten thousands of His saints, 65 1:15 to execute judgment upon all, to convict all who are ungodly among them of all their ungodly deeds which they have committed in an ungodly manner, and of all their harsh words which ungodly sinners have spoken against Him." 65 1:16 These are grumblers, complainers, walking according to their own lusts; and their mouth speaks great swelling words, flattering people to gain advantage. 65 1:17 But you, beloved, remember the words which were spoken beforehand by the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ: 65 1:18 how that they told you there would be mockers in the last time who would walk according to their own ungodly lusts. 65 1:19 These are those who separate themselves, sensual, not having the Spirit. 65 1:20 But you, beloved, building yourselves up on your most holy faith, praying in the Holy Spirit, 65 1:21 keep yourselves in the love of God, looking for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ to eternal life. 65 1:22 And on some have compassion, making a distinction; 65 1:23 but others save with fear, pulling them out of the fire, hating even the clothing defiled by the flesh. 65 1:24 Now to Him who is able to keep you from falling, and to present you faultless before the presence of His glory with exceeding joy, 65 1:25 To the only wise God our Savior, be glory and majesty, dominion and power, both now and forever. Amen. 66 1:1 The Revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave to Him to show to His servants, thing that will come to pass suddenly. And He sent and signified it by His angel to His servant John, 66 1:2 who bore record to the word of God, and of the testimony of Jesus Christ, and of everything that he saw. 66 1:3 Blessed is he who reads and those who hear the words of this prophecy, and keep those things which are written in it; because the time is at hand. 66 1:4 John, to the seven churches which are in Asia: Grace be to you and peace from Him who is and who was and who is to come, and from the seven Spirits who are before His throne, 66 1:5 and from Jesus Christ, who is the faithful witness, the firstborn from the dead, and the ruler of the kings of the earth. To Him who loved us and washed us from our sins in His own blood, 66 1:6 and has made us kings and priests to God and His Father, to Him be glory and dominion forever and ever. Amen. 66 1:7 Behold, He is coming with clouds, and every eye will see Him, and also those who pierced Him. And all tribes of the earth will mourn because of Him. Even so, Amen. 66 1:8 "I am Alpha and Omega, the Beginning and the End," says the Lord, "who is and who was and who is to come, the Almighty." 66 1:9 I John, who am also your brother and companion in tribulation and in the kingdom and patience of Jesus Christ, was on the island that is called Patmos for the word of God and for the testimony of Jesus Christ. 66 1:10 I was in the Spirit on the Lord's day, and heard behind me a loud voice, as of a trumpet, 66 1:11 saying, "I am Alpha and Omega, the First and the Last," and, "What you see, write in a book and send it to the seven churches which are in Asia: to Ephesus, to Smyrna, to Pergamos, to Thyatira, to Sardis, to Philadelphia, and to Laodicea." 66 1:12 Then I turned to see the voice that spoke with me. And having turned I saw seven golden lampstands, 66 1:13 and in the midst of the seven lampstands One like the Son of Man, clothed with a garment down to the feet and wrapped about the chest with a golden band. 66 1:14 His head and his hair were white like wool, as white as snow, and His eyes were like a flame of fire; 66 1:15 His feet were like fine brass, as if refined in a furnace, and His voice as the sound of many waters; 66 1:16 And He had in His right hand seven stars, out of His mouth went a sharp two edged sword, and His countenance was like the sun shining in its strength. 66 1:17 And when I saw Him, I fell at His feet as dead.
